text: As they went out , behold , they brought to him a dumb man possessed with a devil .
text2: Nchi etzkutaqjo ayej moẍqetaq , tej tul qˈiˈn juntl ichin , a mibˈin yolin te Jesús , quˈn tokxtaq jun taqˈnil tajaw il toj tanmin .

text: And when the devil was cast out , the dumb spake : and the multitudes marvelled , saying , It was never so seen in Israel .
text2: Ex ikyxjo , ex bˈeˈx etz tlajoˈn Jesús taqˈnil tajaw il toj tanmin , ex bˈeˈx bˈantkux tej xjal tyolin . Jotxjo jniˈ xjal bˈeˈx i bˈaj jaw kaˈylajx kywutz ikyjo , ex kyqˈma : Bˈajxpetzin qlaˈyix toj tkyaqil txˈotxˈ te Israel jun tiˈ tzeˈnku lo .

text: But the Pharisees said , He casteth out devils through the prince of the devils .
text2: Me ayetzin kyeˈ Parisey , bˈeˈx jaw kyikyˈin kyeˈ , ex kyqˈma : Axte tajaw il ma tzaj qˈonte toklin ichin lo , tuˈn kyetz taqˈnil tuˈn toj kyanminxjal , chi chiˈ .

text: And Jesus went about all the cities and villages , teaching in their synagogues , and preaching the gospel of the kingdom , and healing every sickness and every disease among the people .
text2: Nxnaqˈtzintaq Jesús tiˈj Tkawbˈil Dios ex tiˈj Tbˈanil Tqanil kyojile jniˈ muˈẍ ja te kynabˈl Judiy Dios . Kyojile jniˈ tnam ex kojbˈil nqˈanintaq tkyaqil wiq yabˈil kyiˈj xjal ex tkyaqil wiq kyixkˈoj .

text: But when he saw the multitudes , he was moved with compassion on them , because they fainted , and were scattered abroad , as sheep having no shepherd .
text2: Tzaj qˈaqˈinx tkˈuˈj Jesús tiˈj kyten xjal , quˈn ikyqe tzeˈn jun chˈuq rit , mix aˈl kyikˈlelkye , ex ntiˈ tumil kybˈe , tzeˈn tuˈn kyxaˈye .

text: Then saith he unto his disciples , The harvest truly is plenteous , but the labourers are few ;
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , tzaj tqˈmaˈn Jesús qeˈy , awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin : Kxel nqˈmaˈn qa atziˈn kytenxjal lo twutz Dios , ikytziˈn tzeˈn tqan awal , ex nya ilaˈ aqˈnil tiˈj .

text: Pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest , that he will send forth labourers into his harvest .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , kyqanixa te qMan Dios , a tAjaw awal , tuˈn kytzaj tsmaˈn aqˈnil tiˈj awal .

text: And when he had called unto him his twelve disciples , he gave them power against unclean spirits , to cast them out , and to heal all manner of sickness and all manner of disease .
text2: O tzaj ttxkoˈn Jesús , a awoˈy kabˈlajaj t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , ex tzaj tqˈoˈn qokliˈn tuˈn kyetz qlajoˈn taqˈnil tajaw il toj kyanminxjal , ex tuˈn tkubˈ qqˈaniˈn tkyaqil wiq yabˈil ex kyixkˈoj .

text: Now the names of the twelve apostles are these ; The first , Simon , who is called Peter , and Andrew his brother ; James the son of Zebedee , and John his brother ;
text2: Ex atzin qbˈiˈy kabˈlajaj t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin : Tnejil Simun , a Pegr tbˈi ; ex Andrés , a titzˈin ; Santyaw ex Juan , kyitzˈin kyibˈ , ayeˈ tkˈwal Zebedey ;

text: Philip , and Bartholomew ; Thomas , and Matthew the publican ; James the son of Alphaeus , and Lebbaeus , whose surname was Thaddaeus ;
text2: Lip ; Bartolomey ; Tmas ; ex ayiˈn , Matey , a peyil pwaqtaq ; Jacob , a tkˈwal Alpey ; Tadey ;

text: Simon the Canaanite , and Judas Iscariot , who also betrayed him .
text2: Simun , a toktaqljo qˈolbˈin te te Celote ; ex Judas Iscariot , a ok meltzˈaj kˈayil te Jesús .

text: These twelve Jesus sent forth , and commanded them , saying , Go not into the way of the Gentiles , and into any city of the Samaritans enter ye not :
text2: Ex bˈeˈx o xi tsmaˈn Jesús tukˈa jun nukˈbˈil kyjaluˈn : Mi cheˈxa toj kytanim nya aj Judiyqe ; ex mi chi okxa toj kytanim aj Samaria .

text: But go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel .
text2: Qalaˈ antza kˈaˈ cheˈxiˈy kyxol aj Judiy , quˈn najnin iteˈ tzeˈnku rit toj kˈul ntiˈ kyikˈlelkye .

text: And as ye go , preach , saying , The kingdom of heaven is at hand .
text2: Ku kyxiˈy yolil Tbˈanil Tqanil Tkawbˈil Dios at toj kyaˈj , a ma tzaj laqˈe jaˈlin .

text: Heal the sick , cleanse the lepers , raise the dead , cast out devils : freely ye have received , freely give .
text2: Kyqˈaninqekujiˈy yabˈ ; kˈaˈ chi jaw kyanqˈsiˈn kyimnin juntl majl ; kyqˈaninqekujiˈy yabˈqe tuˈn nim txˈaˈk ; ex kylajomilqexjiˈy taqˈnil tajaw il toj kyanminxjal . Noq ma txi oyitjo kyokliˈn lo noq kukxjo , ex mi txi kyqanin twiˈ kykˈuˈja tiˈjjo kbˈantil kyuˈn tukˈa .

text: Provide neither gold , nor silver , nor brass in your purses ,
text2: Mi txi kyiˈn qˈanpwaq , saqpwaq mo tzeˈn juntl pwaq toj kybˈeˈy .

text: Nor scrip for your journey , neither two coats , neither shoes , nor yet staves : for the workman is worthy of his meat .
text2: Ex mi txi kyiˈn jun tal kychuˈẍa ; ex mi txi kyiˈn kyxbˈaliˈn te txˈixpil kyiˈja ; nixpe juntl muj kyxjabˈa , ex nipe jun kytzeˈy . Nya tiquˈnil , quˈn jun aqˈnil il tiˈj tuˈn ttzaj qˈoˈn twa .

text: And into whatsoever city or town ye shall enter , inquire who in it is worthy ; and there abide till ye go thence .
text2: Aj kykaniˈn toj jun tnam mo jun tal kojbˈil , kyjyoma tja jun xjal wen , tuˈn tok qe kykˈuˈja tiˈj . Ex ku kynajaˈn tukˈa toj tja , ajxi tpon qˈij tuˈn kyikyˈa .

text: And when ye come into an house , salute it .
text2: Aj kykaniˈn tja , chi qˈolbˈiˈn tukˈa mutxbˈil kyeˈ najleqe antza tukˈa tnukˈbˈil Dios .

text: And if the house be worthy , let your peace come upon it : but if it be not worthy , let your peace return to you .
text2: Qa ikytaqku kyaj xjaljo , bˈaˈntzintz ; me qa mina , ex qa bˈeˈxtaqku xja kyikyˈin , me atzin a kyajtaqa kyukˈa , noq ma tzˈel naj .

text: And whosoever shall not receive you , nor hear your words , when ye depart out of that house or city , shake off the dust of your feet .
text2: Exsin qa bˈeˈx ẍi jaw lipin kyiˈja , ex qa mi xkubˈ kybˈiˈn kyyola , ku kyetza tojjo ja mo tojjo tnam anetziˈn . Kychtomila quq tiˈj kyqaˈn te jun yekˈbˈil kye , qa kykyˈeˈx tiˈj Tyol Dios .

text: Verily I say unto you , It shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment , than for that city .
text2: Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , qa toj tqˈijil paˈbˈin twutz Dios , kujxixtljo tkawbˈil Dios ktzajil kyibˈaj , tzeˈnku tzaj kyibˈajjo xjal ojtxe kyojjo tnam Sodoma ex Gomorra , tej kybˈaj tuˈn qˈaqˈ .

text: Behold , I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves : be ye therefore wise as serpents , and harmless as doves .
text2: ¡ Kaˈn ! Kchi xel nsmaˈn tzeˈnqekuˈ rit kyxol xoˈj . Me chi okxixa ẍtij tzeˈnku jun kan , ex bˈuninxix tzeˈnku jun tal palom .

text: But beware of men : for they will deliver you up to the councils , and they will scourge you in their synagogues ;
text2: Bˈaˈnqexa , quˈn kchi xeˈl qˈoˈn kyuˈn toj kyqˈobˈ kawil , ex kchi okil lipin kyiˈja kyojjo muˈẍ ja te kynaˈbˈlxjal Dios .

text: And ye shall be brought before governors and kings for my sake , for a testimony against them and the Gentiles .
text2: Ex okpe kchi xel qˈiˈn kywutz nejinel ex nmaq kawil , noq tuˈn npaja , quˈn ikytzin k ‑ elile kynikyˈtzajiljiˈy kyuˈn nejinel ex kyuˈn jniˈ nya nimil , qa nimilqiˈy wiˈja .

text: But when they deliver you up , take no thought how or what ye shall speak : for it shall be given you in that same hour what ye shall speak .
text2: Me ajtzin kyxi qˈoˈn toj kyqˈobˈ aj kawil , mina chi jaw bˈisiˈn tiˈ kxel kyqˈmaˈn , ex tzeˈn tuˈn tbˈant kyyoliˈn . Quˈn ajtzin kyok ten yolil , ax Dios ktzajil qˈoˈnte ttxolil kyyola .

text: For it is not ye that speak , but the Spirit of your Father which speaketh in you .
text2: Quˈn nyaqe kyeˈ kchi yolil , qalaˈ ate Xewbˈaj Xjan , a T ‑ xew kyMaˈn , k ‑ yolil kyiˈja .

text: And the brother shall deliver up the brother to death , and the father the child : and the children shall rise up against their parents , and cause them to be put to death .
text2: Quˈn kyxol xjal nya nimil , ayex itzˈinbˈaj kchi kˈwel bˈyonte itzikybˈaj , mo ayeˈ itzikybˈaj kyiˈj itzˈinbˈaj . Ayex chi xel qˈonte kykˈwal toj kyimin , ex ikyqex kˈwalbˈajjo ayex chi okil meltzˈaj kyiˈj kytata , ex chi xel kyqˈoˈn tuˈn kykyim .

text: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name ' s sake : but he that endureth to the end shall be saved .
text2: Ex chi elil iˈjliˈn kyuˈnxjal , noq tuˈn tpajjo nimilqiˈy wiˈja . Me ankye teˈ kweˈbˈil twutz tkyaqiljo lo , ajxi tjapin bˈaj tkyaqil , okpin kletil teˈ te jun majx .

text: But when they persecute you in this city , flee ye into another : for verily I say unto you , Ye shall not have gone over the cities of Israel , till the Son of man be come .
text2: Me ajtzin kyok weˈxjal lajol kyeˈy toj jun tnam , liweyx cheˈxa toj juntl . Quˈn twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , naˈmtaqx kyelpin bˈaj kykyaqil tnam toj Israel tuˈn kybˈetintiˈy , aj wula juntl majl , ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin .

text: The disciple is not above his master , nor the servant above his lord .
text2: Quˈn a nxnaqˈtzin tibˈ nlay jawjo toklin tibˈajjo nxnaqˈtzinte . Ex nlay jaw toklin aqˈnil tibˈaj tajaw aqˈuntl .

text: It is enough for the disciple that he be as his master , and the servant as his lord . If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub , how much more shall they call them of his household ?
text2: Quˈn qa ma tzikyˈx te xnaqˈtzil tuˈn ¿ Tzeˈntzin tteˈntz tuˈn mi tzikyˈxa kyuˈn nchi xnaqˈtzin kyibˈ ? Ex ikyxjo te aqˈnil tukˈa tajaw aqˈuntl . Xi nqˈmaˈn ikyjo , quˈn ikyqintzin wejiˈy tzeˈnku jun manbˈaj toj ja . Quˈn mape tzˈok kyqˈmaˈn kyexjal weˈy qa tajaw ilqiˈn , a Beelzebú ; ¿ Yajtzilaˈ kyetza ?

text: Fear them not therefore : for there is nothing covered , that shall not be revealed ; and hid , that shall not be known .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , mi chi tzaj xobˈ kyeˈ . Quˈn ntiˈ jun tiˈ aku tzˈewit te jun majx , a mit tzˈel tnikyˈtzajil . Ex ntiˈ jun tiˈ ewin , a mit tzˈel tqanil .

text: What I tell you in darkness , that speak ye in light : and what ye hear in the ear , that preach ye upon the housetops .
text2: Atziˈn kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , kyqˈmanxa kye kykyaqil . Ex ankyeˈ noq kxel njaskˈiˈn kyeˈy jaˈlin , kyẍchˈinxa tzmax toj twiˈ ja , tuˈntzin tbˈijte kyuˈn kykyaqilxjal .

text: And fear not them which kill the body , but are not able to kill the soul : but rather fear him which is able to destroy both soul and body in hell .
text2: Ex mi chi xobˈa kye aku kubˈ bˈyonte kyxmilila , quˈn me kye kyanmin nlay kyim kyuˈn . Qalaˈ kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , antza chi xobˈa kyeˈ te Dios , quˈn nya noq kyxmilila aku kyim tuˈn , qalaˈ ikytzin majx kyanmiˈn . Ex nya noq oˈkxjo , qalaˈ ikytzin ajxi kykyim tuˈn , aku cheˈx tqˈoˈn toj qˈaqˈ te jun majx .

text: Are not two sparrows sold for a farthing ? and one of them shall not fall on the ground without your Father .
text2: ¿ Jteˈtzila kywiˈ kabˈe tal pichˈ ? ¿ Nyapela noq jun tal muˈẍ pwaq ? Me kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , nixpela jun tal pichˈ aku kyim , qa nya taj qMan Dios .

text: But the very hairs of your head are all numbered .
text2: ¿ Yajtzilaˈ kyeˈ ? Quˈn nimxixtl kyokliˈn tzeˈnqekuˈ pichˈ ; ex noq tuˈn tqˈaqˈbˈil tkˈuˈj Dios majqexpe tsmal kywiˈy chebˈe ajlanqe tuˈn . Tuˈnpetziˈn , mi chi xobˈa .

text: Whosoever therefore shall confess me before men , him will I confess also before my Father which is in heaven .
text2: Ankye teˈ mi kubˈ tewin kywutzxjal , qa nimil wiˈja , ex ikyx wejiˈy mi kubˈ wewiˈn twutz nMaˈn , a at toj kyaˈj .

text: But whosoever shall deny me before men , him will I also deny before my Father which is in heaven .
text2: Me anteˈ kˈwel ewinte kywutzxjal qa ojtzqiˈnqiˈn tuˈn , ex ikyx wejiˈy , kˈwel wewiˈn twutz nMaˈn , a at toj kyaˈj .

text: Think not that I am come to send peace on earth : I came not to send peace , but a sword .
text2: ¿ Tzeˈntzintz toj kywutza ? ¿ Ma man chin kˈuˈl wetza noq tuˈn kytzalajxjal tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ ? ¡ Me twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , aj qa mina ! Qalaˈ ma chin kˈuˈl weˈ noq tuˈn nqˈoˈn qˈoj kyxolxjal .

text: For I am come to set a man at variance against his father , and the daughter against her mother , and the daughter in law against her mother in law .
text2: Quˈn ma chin ula qˈol paˈbˈl kyxolxjal tzeˈnku tzˈibˈin toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios : Jun kˈwalbˈaj ichin kjyol qˈoj tiˈjx tman , ex jun kˈwalbˈaj qya kjyol qˈoj tiˈjx ttxu . Ex ilibˈj tiˈj ilibˈilte .

text: And a man ' s foes shall be they of his own household .
text2: Ikytziˈn , teyile junjun at qˈoj kyiˈj tojx tja .

text: He that loveth father or mother more than me is not worthy of me : and he that loveth son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me .
text2: Quˈn ankye teˈ k ‑ okil tkˈuˈjlin ttata ex tnana nimxixtl tzeˈnku weˈ , ntiˈ toklin tuˈn tok te weˈy . Ex ankye teˈ k ‑ okil tkˈuˈjlin tkˈwal qˈa mo qa txin nimxixtl tzeˈnku weˈ , ntiˈ toklin tuˈn tok te weˈy .

text: And he that taketh not his cross , and followeth after me , is not worthy of me .
text2: Ex alkye tkyˈeˈ tuˈn t ‑ xi lipe wiˈja toj tkyaqil , exla qa tuˈn tkyim tzeˈnqekuˈ xjal xi kyiqin kycruz te kyimin , ntiˈ toklin tuˈn tok te weˈy .

text: He that findeth his life shall lose it : and he that loseth his life for my sake shall find it .
text2: Ankye teˈ k ‑ okil tkˈuˈjlin tchwinqil tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , ok knajil teˈ te jun majx . Me ankye teˈ k ‑ elil tiˈjlin tkyaqiljo achbˈil te twutz txˈotxˈ noq tuˈn npaja , okpin knetil teˈ tchwinqil tuˈn te jun majx .

text: He that receiveth you receiveth me , and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me .
text2: Ex ankyeˈ ok kˈwel xkˈamin kyeˈy , ayiˈn chin kˈwel t ‑ xkˈaˈmin . Ex ankyejo ma kˈmon weˈy , a Dios ma kˈmet tuˈn , a saj smaˈn weˈy .

text: He that receiveth a prophet in the name of a prophet shall receive a prophet ' s reward ; and he that receiveth a righteous man in the name of a righteous man shall receive a righteous man ' s reward .
text2: Ex ankye teˈ kˈwel t ‑ xkˈaˈmin jun yolil Tyol Dios , quˈn ax Dios saj smaˈnte , ok ktzajil ttzyuˈn jun oyaj toj kyaˈj , tzeˈnku jun oyaj ntzaj qˈoˈn te jun yolil Tyol Dios . Ex ankyeˈ kˈwel t ‑ xkˈaˈmin jun ichin wen , ok ktzajil ttzyuˈn jun oyaj toj kyaˈj , a ikyxjo tzeˈnku oyaj ktzajil qˈoˈn te ichin wen .

text: And whosoever shall give to drink unto one of these little ones a cup of cold water only in the name of a disciple , verily I say unto you , he shall in no wise lose his reward .
text2: Ex ankye teˈ kxel qˈonte jun tal vas cheˈwe te jun tal kˈwal , noq tuˈn ma tzˈok lipe wiˈja , ex twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , at jun oyaj tiˈjjo lo te jun majx toj kyaˈj .

text: And it came to pass , when Jesus had made an end of commanding his twelve disciples , he departed thence to teach and to preach in their cities .
text2: Tej tbˈaj tnikˈuˈn Jesús qeˈy , awoˈy kabˈlajaj t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , bˈeˈx xiˈ kyojjo tnam toj txˈotxˈ te Galiley xnaqˈtzil ex yolil Tyol Dios .

text: Now when John had heard in the prison the works of Christ , he sent two of his disciples ,
text2: Tkuˈxtaq Juan , a Jawsil Aˈ , toj tze , me tej tbˈin teˈ jniˈtaqjo nbˈant tuˈn Crist , bˈeˈx i xi tchqˈoˈn kabˈe t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin lolte .

text: And said unto him , Art thou he that should come , or do we look for another ?
text2: Tej kykanin tukˈa , xi kyqanin te : ¿ Atzinjiy a Crist , a attaq tulil , mo qa at juntl , tuˈn tkubˈ qyoˈn ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , Go and shew John again those things which ye do hear and see :
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Kux cheˈxa , ex kyqˈmanxa te Juan ajo ma kyliˈy , exsiˈn ma kybˈiˈy , ikyxjo tzeˈnku kyij tzˈibˈit wiˈja toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios . Chiˈ kyjaluˈn :

text: The blind receive their sight , and the lame walk , the lepers are cleansed , and the deaf hear , the dead are raised up , and the poor have the gospel preached to them .
text2: Aye moẍtaq ma chi kˈant kywutz , aye koxtaq ma chi bˈet , exqetziˈn yabˈqetaq tuˈn nim txˈaˈk , ma chi qˈanit ; exqetziˈn ẍoˈrqetaq , ma chi bˈin ; exqetziˈn otaq chi kyim , ma chi jaw anqˈin juntl majl . Ex jniˈ kye yaj ma pon Tbˈanil Tqanil kolbˈil kye .

text: And blessed is he , whosoever shall not be offended in me .
text2: Kyˈiwlinqexixjo a mi njawje kykˈuˈj wiˈja .

text: And as they departed , Jesus began to say unto the multitudes concerning John , What went ye out into the wilderness to see ? A reed shaken with the wind ?
text2: Tej kymeltzˈajjo t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin Juan , bˈeˈx ok ten Jesús yolil tiˈj Juan kyukˈaxjal . Xi tqˈmaˈn kye kyjaluˈn : Tej kyxiˈy lolte Juan toj tzqij txˈotxˈ , ¿ Tiˈtaqtzin wiq ichin kyajtaqa tuˈn kylontiˈy ? ¿ Ma noqpe jun ichin kabˈe tkˈuˈj , tzeˈnku jun ajlaj meltzˈaje tuˈn kyqˈiqˈ ?

text: But what went ye out for to see ? A man clothed in soft raiment ? behold , they that wear soft clothing are in kings ' houses .
text2: Qa mina , ¿ Tiˈtaqtzin kyajtza tuˈn kylontiˈy ? ¿ Moj qa jun ichin manyor tbˈanilx t ‑ xbˈalin tok ? ¿ Ma mitzin bˈiˈn kyuˈn qa aye xjal , tbˈanilx kyxbˈalin tok , antza iteˈye kyeˈ toj kyja nmaq kawil ?

text: But what went ye out for to see ? A prophet ? yea , I say unto you , and more than a prophet .
text2: ¿ Tzeˈntzintz tiˈtzin chi txaˈjtza lolte ? ¿ Bˈalaqa jun yolil Tyol Dios ? ¡ Ikytziˈn ! Me ante Juan nimxixtl toklin kyibˈajjo yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe .

text: For this is he , of whom it is written , Behold , I send my messenger before thy face , which shall prepare thy way before thee .
text2: Quˈn ikytzin tqˈmaˈn Dios tiˈj toj Tuˈjil Tyol kyjaluˈn : Kxel nchqˈoˈn weˈ nsan twutza qˈmalte tqanil tulila , tuˈn tkubˈ kybˈinchinxjal kyibˈ twutza .

text: Verily I say unto you , Among them that are born of women there hath not risen a greater than John the Baptist : notwithstanding he that is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he .
text2: Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn , qa kyxol kykyaqilxjal twutz txˈotxˈ , mix aˈl jun nimxixtl toklin tzeˈnku te Juan , a Jawsil Aˈ . Me ankye teˈ , a noq tal chˈin toklin toj Tkawbˈil Dios toj kyaˈj , nimxixtl toklin tzeˈnku te Juan .

text: And from the days of John the Baptist until now the kingdom of heaven suffereth violence , and the violent take it by force .
text2: Quˈn tukˈaxiˈ tulil Juan , a Jawsil Aˈ , ex tzmax tzaluˈn , nimxjal tok tilil kyuˈn , tuˈn tchˈiy Tkawbˈil Dios , a tzajnin toj kyaˈj . Ex nimxjal tok tilil kyuˈn , tuˈn tkubˈ bˈaj .

text: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John .
text2: Tkyaqiljo jniˈ t ‑ xilin kyxnaqˈtzbˈil yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe exsin ojtxe kawbˈil , noq jun tqanil tiˈjjo Tkawbˈil Dios , a tuˈntaq tul , tzeˈnku ma tzul Juan chikyˈbˈilte .

text: And if ye will receive it , this is Elias , which was for to come .
text2: Qa kyaja tuˈn t ‑ xi kynimiˈn , kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy qa a Juan , a Elías , a iltaq tiˈj tuˈn tul , tzeˈnku qˈumj toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios .

text: He that hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Qa at kywiˈy te bˈilte , kybˈinkujiˈy tkyaqiljo nxi nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy .

text: But whereunto shall I liken this generation ? It is like unto children sitting in the markets , and calling unto their fellows ,
text2: Kˈwel nqˈoˈn jun techil tzeˈnqe xjal jaˈlin : Ikyqetziˈn tzeˈnqekuˈ tal kˈwal nchi kubˈ qe saqchal toj kˈaybˈil . Ex nxi kyẍchˈin te kyukˈa , tuˈn kysaqchaˈn junx , ex nxi kyqˈmaˈn :

text: And saying , We have piped unto you , and ye have not danced ; we have mourned unto you , and ye have not lamented .
text2: Ma qo chinbˈiˈn kyukˈa xux , tuˈntzintla qsaqchan , ex tuˈn kytzalaja , ex tuˈn kybˈixiˈn , me mi ẍi bˈixiˈn . Tuˈnpetziˈn , ma txi qbˈitziˈn bˈitz te bˈisbˈajil , tuˈntzintla qsaqchan , ex tuˈn kyoqˈa , me mix aˈl s ‑ oqˈ . ¿ Tiˈxsin kyajtza ? chi chiˈ .

text: For John came neither eating nor drinking , and they say , He hath a devil .
text2: Ikytzin kyejiˈy , chi Jesús . Quˈn tej tul Juan , a mix waˈn ex mix kˈwane kyukˈa txqantl , tuˈn ikyjo kyqˈmaˈy tiˈj , qa attaq taqˈnil tajaw il toj tanmin .

text: The Son of man came eating and drinking , and they say , Behold a man gluttonous , and a winebibber , a friend of publicans and sinners . But wisdom is justified of her children .
text2: Ex ma chin ula , ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin jaˈlin , a nchin waˈn ex nchin kˈwan kyukˈa noq tiˈchaqku xjal , me nkyqˈmaˈnla wiˈja qa loˈlqin weˈ , ex jun kyukˈa peyil pwaq ex kyukˈa aj il . Ex ayetzin kyeˈ , ¿ Tiˈxsila kyajtza ? Kxel nqˈmaˈn qa atzin k ‑ elile kynikyˈa tiˈjjo nabˈl ntzaj tuˈn Dios tiˈjjo qbˈinchbˈiˈn .

text: Then began he to upbraid the cities wherein most of his mighty works were done , because they repented not :
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , ok ten Jesús kawil kyeˈ xjal kyojjo tnam , a jaˈ otaq kubˈ tbˈinchin nimku yekˈbˈil tipin , quˈn aye xjal antza kykyˈeˈxtaq tuˈn tajtz tiˈj kyanmin , ex tuˈn ttxˈixpit kychwinqil . Xi tqˈmaˈn kyjaluˈn :

text: Woe unto thee , Chorazin ! woe unto thee , Bethsaida ! for if the mighty works , which were done in you , had been done in Tyre and Sidon , they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes .
text2: ¡ Ay ! Nimx bˈisbˈajil kyeˈy , a ayiˈy aj tnam Corazín exsin aj Betsaida . Noqit kyojjo tnam Tiro ex Sidón ma chi bˈant teˈ yekˈbˈil wipiˈn , a ma chi bˈant kyxola , ojtxetla tzˈajtz tiˈj kyanminxjal , ex matla kubˈ kyyekˈin jun txˈixpibˈl toj kychwinqil , noq tuˈn tok kyqˈoˈn kyxbˈalin te bˈisbˈajil , noq tuˈn tpaj kyil , ex tuˈn tjaw kychtoˈn tzaˈj toj kywiˈ , te jun yekˈbˈil qa ma tzˈajtz tiˈj kyanmin .

text: But I say unto you , It shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the day of judgment , than for you .
text2: Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , toj tqˈijil paˈbˈin twutz Dios , kujxixtl kye tkawbˈil Dios tzul kyibˈaj , tzeˈnkuj kye aj Tiro ex Sidón .

text: And thou , Capernaum , which art exalted unto heaven , shalt be brought down to hell : for if the mighty works , which have been done in thee , had been done in Sodom , it would have remained until this day .
text2: Ikyxjo kyeˈ aj tnam Capernaum ; ¿ Chila , qa chi japin kyeˈ toj kyaˈj ? ¡ Me mina ! Quˈn ayexixpe kyeˈ kchi xeˈl tojjo ma tij jul , a jaˈla taˈye t ‑ xele . Quˈn noqit tojjo tnam Sodoma ma bˈant teˈ jniˈ yekˈbˈil wipiˈn , a ma bˈant kyxola , mipetla xyuchˈj te tnam anetziˈn ; atxpetla teˈ jaˈlin .

text: But I say unto you , That it shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom in the day of judgment , than for thee .
text2: Ex kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , qa toj tqˈijil paˈbˈin twutz Dios , kujxixtl kyeˈ tkawbˈil Dios tzul kyibˈaj , tzeˈnkuj kye xjal tojjo txˈotxˈ te Sodoma .

text: At that time Jesus answered and said , I thank thee , O Father , Lord of heaven and earth , because thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent , and hast revealed them unto babes .
text2: Kyojjo qˈij anetziˈn , xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kyjaluˈn : Taa , Ay tAjaw kyaˈj ex Ay tAjaw txˈotxˈ ; loqiˈn nchin nimsin Tbˈiy jaˈlin , quˈn tuˈn ma kubˈ tewin tejiy t ‑ xilin tumil kolbˈil kyeˈ xjal , a ẍtijqe ex nim kynabˈl toj kywutz , exsin ma kubˈ tchikyˈbˈintza kywutzjo xjal , a qˈoˈnk kyoklin te ntiˈ bˈaˈn kyuˈn .

text: Even so , Father : for so it seemed good in thy sight .
text2: Ikytziˈn Tata , quˈn ikytzin tejiy taj .

text: All things are delivered unto me of my Father : and no man knoweth the Son , but the Father ; neither knoweth any man the Father , save the Son , and he to whomsoever the Son will reveal him .
text2: Quˈn ma tzaj tqˈoˈn nMaˈn tkyaqil weˈy . Ex mix aˈl jun ojtzqil weˈy , qalaˈ oˈkx nMaˈn , quˈn ayiˈn Tkˈwal . Ex mix aˈl jun ojtzqil te nMaˈn , qalaˈ oˈkqinxa . Ex alqe wajiˈy tuˈn t ‑ xi nyekˈiˈn nMaˈn , kxel nyekˈiˈn .

text: Come unto me , all ye that labour and are heavy laden , and I will give you rest .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , ku kytzaja wukˈiy , ayiˈy sikytlin iteˈy , ex ayiˈy ma chi yajxa tojjo kychwinqila . Ex kxel nqˈoˈn ajlabˈl kyeˈy te jun majx .

text: Take my yoke upon you , and learn of me ; for I am meek and lowly in heart : and ye shall find rest unto your souls .
text2: Kykˈmonxjiˈy nnukˈbˈila kxel nqˈoˈn kyeˈy ; ex kykaˈyimila wiˈja , quˈn manyor wenqinxa ex manyor cheˈwxjo wanmiˈn . Ex ktenbˈil ajlabˈl toj kychwinqila te jun majx wukˈiy .

text: For my yoke is easy , and my burden is light .
text2: Quˈn ajo nnukˈbˈila kxel nqˈoˈn kyeˈy nya kujxix tuˈn tbˈant kyuˈn , ex ajo iqtz kxel nqˈoˈn tuˈn tjapin bˈaj kyuˈn , nyaxix al .

text: At that time Jesus went on the sabbath day through the corn ; and his disciples were an hungred , and began to pluck the ears of corn , and to eat .
text2: Kyojjo qˈij anetziˈn , toj jun qˈij te ajlabˈl , nqo bˈettaqa tukˈa Jesús toj jun bˈe n ‑ extaq toj triy . Tzaj qˈaqˈin qkˈuˈja , o ok teˈn xbˈoqil triy , exsin el qxqˈuchin te qwaˈy .

text: But when the Pharisees saw it , they said unto him , Behold , thy disciples do that which is not lawful to do upon the sabbath day .
text2: Atzaj teˈ tok kykaˈyin Parisey ikyjo , xi kyqˈmaˈn te Jesús : Kaˈyinqektzinjiy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈiˈn , a nchi bˈinchin jun tiˈ , a nya wen tuˈn tkubˈ bˈinchit toj qˈij te ajlabˈl .

text: But he said unto them , Have ye not read what David did , when he was an hungred , and they that were with him ;
text2: Me xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : ¿ Ma naˈmtzin tkux kyuˈjin kyejiˈy bˈant jun maj tuˈn qtzan David , a nimx toklin , tej ttzaj waˈyaj tiˈj kyukˈa tukˈa ?

text: How he entered into the house of God , and did eat the shewbread , which was not lawful for him to eat , neither for them which were with him , but only for the priests ?
text2: Bˈeˈx i okx toj ojtxe tja Dios , exsin i etz tiˈn wabˈj , a otaq chi kubˈ kyˈiwlit te oyaj twutz Dios . Ex i xi twaˈn , exsin xi tqˈoˈntz kye tukˈa , a ntiˈtaq kyoklin tiˈj tuˈn t ‑ xi kywaˈn , qalaˈ oˈkqextaq pale .

text: Or have ye not read in the law , how that on the sabbath days the priests in the temple profane the sabbath , and are blameless ?
text2: Mo ¿ Ma naˈmtzin tkux kyuˈjiˈn toj ojtxe tkawbˈil Moisés , qa aye pale toj tnejil ja te kˈulbˈil , mi nchi ajlantaq toj qˈij te ajlabˈl , qalaˈ nchi aqˈnintaq ? ¿ Ma i bˈinchintzintz il tuˈn ikyjo ?

text: But I say unto you , That in this place is one greater than the temple .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , qa atx juntl tumil nimxixtl toklin tzeˈnku tumil tiˈjjo tnejil ja te kˈulbˈil .

text: But if ye had known what this meaneth , I will have mercy , and not sacrifice , ye would not have condemned the guiltless .
text2: Noq naˈm tel kynikyˈa te , a tiˈ ntqˈmaˈn Tuˈjil Tyol Dios : Atzin wajiˈy , tuˈn tten kyqˈaqˈbˈil kykˈuˈja kyxolxa , ex nya noq tuˈn kyok teˈn patil kychibˈjil aluˈmj te chojbˈil kyila . Quˈn noqit ma tzˈel kynikyˈa te , mitla nchi bˈaj yolbˈiˈn kyiˈj nxnaqˈtzbˈiˈn , ayeˈ mi nchi bˈinchin il .

text: For the Son of man is Lord even of the sabbath day .
text2: Tzeˈnku nteˈn , ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , chqˈonqintza tuˈn Dios kyxola ; ex ayiˈn at wokliˈn tibˈajjo qˈij te ajlabˈl , ex ayiˈn kchin qˈmalte qa wen tuˈn tkubˈ bˈinchit jun tiˈ mo qa minaj .

text: And when he was departed thence , he went into their synagogue :
text2: Bˈeˈx ikyˈ Jesús antza , ex okx toj jun muˈẍ ja te naˈbˈl Dios ,

text: And , behold , there was a man which had his hand withered . And they asked him , saying , Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath days ? that they might accuse him .
text2: jaˈ attaq jun ichin ntiˈtaq tanmin jun tqˈobˈ . Me tzunxtaq njoyle tumil kyuˈn junjun tzeˈn tten tuˈn tjaw stzˈimin jun tiˈ tiˈj Jesús , ex tuˈn tkubˈ tzˈaq toj jun il kyuˈn . Xi kyqanin te Jesús : ¿ Tziyintzin toj ojtxe kawbˈil , tuˈn tqˈanit jun xjal tojjo qˈij te ajlabˈl ?

text: And he said unto them , What man shall there be among you , that shall have one sheep , and if it fall into a pit on the sabbath day , will he not lay hold on it , and lift it out ?
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Ankye jun kyeˈ , qa akux xi tzˈaq jun trit toj jun jul toj jun qˈij te ajlabˈl , ¿ Ma nlaypela aku jatz kyiˈn ? ¿ Ma atpela kyila tiˈjjo ikyjo ?

text: How much then is a man better than a sheep ? Wherefore it is lawful to do well on the sabbath days .
text2: ¿ Ma nyatzin nimxixtl toklin jun ichin twutz jun rit ? Tuˈnpetziˈn , bˈaˈn tuˈn tkubˈ qbˈinchin qejiˈy a bˈaˈn toj tqˈijil ajlabˈl .

text: Then saith he to the man , Stretch forth thine hand . And he stretched it forth ; and it was restored whole , like as the other .
text2: Ex xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús te yabˈ : Nuqpinx tqˈobˈa . Bˈeˈx nuqpajkux tqˈobˈjo tal yabˈ , ex bˈeˈx bˈant tzeˈnkuxjo juntl .

text: Then the Pharisees went out , and held a council against him , how they might destroy him .
text2: Me ayetzin kyeˈ Parisey , bˈeˈx i ok ten jyol tumil tzeˈn tuˈn tkubˈe kybˈyoˈne Jesús .

text: But when Jesus knew it , he withdrew himself from thence : and great multitudes followed him , and he healed them all ;
text2: Tej tbˈinte Jesús ikyjo , bˈeˈx ikyˈ antza , ex i xi lipe txqan xjal tiˈj . Ex nqˈaninxi kyiˈj yabˈ toj bˈe .

text: And charged them that they should not make him known :
text2: Ex xi tqˈmaˈnxix Jesús , tuˈn mi chi yoline tiˈj kywutzxjal .

text: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet , saying ,
text2: Nyatzin tiqeˈ ikyjo noq tuˈn tjapinkuˈ Tyol Dios , a kyij ttzˈibˈin yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe , a Isaías , tej tqˈma :

text: Behold my servant , whom I have chosen ; my beloved , in whom my soul is well pleased : I will put my spirit upon him , and he shall shew judgment to the Gentiles .
text2: Atzin wejiˈy waqˈnil , a skˈoˈnxix , ex kˈuˈjlinxix wuˈn , ex nchin tzalaja tiˈj . Kˈwel nqˈoˈn nXewa toj tanmin . Ex ok k ‑ yolil tiˈj Nkawbˈila toj tkyaqil twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: He shall not strive , nor cry ; neither shall any man hear his voice in the streets .
text2: Mi qˈojle , ex mi jaw ẍchˈin , tuˈntzintla mix aˈl kxel bˈinte tqˈajqˈojil twiˈ kyoj tbˈeyil tnam .

text: A bruised reed shall he not break , and smoking flax shall he not quench , till he send forth judgment unto victory .
text2: Ex mi chi el tikyˈin ayejo numjninqe . Tuˈnpetziˈn , mi kubˈ twaqˈin jun tal tqan ptzˈan tal kox , ex mi kubˈ tyupin jun tal ttzaj yaj , a noqx tal chˈin nsbˈen , tzmaxiˈ aj t ‑ xi tqˈoˈn kyoklin , aj tkubˈ tqˈoˈn Tkawbˈil , a tzˈaqlexix .

text: And in his name shall the Gentiles trust .
text2: Ex tojjo qˈij anetziˈn , tkyaqil xjal twutz txˈotxˈ kqebˈil kykˈuˈj tiˈj .

text: Then was brought unto him one possessed with a devil , blind , and dumb : and he healed him , insomuch that the blind and dumb both spake and saw .
text2: Kyojjo qˈij anetziˈn , xi kyiˈnxjal jun ichin twutz Jesús , a tokxtaq jun taqˈnil tajaw il toj tanmin ; ex otaq chi jpet twutz , ex mibˈintaq yolin . Me bˈeˈx el weˈ tuˈn Jesús , quˈn bˈeˈx bˈant tkaˈyin , ex bˈant tyolin .

text: And all the people were amazed , and said , Is not this the son of David ?
text2: Kykyaqilxjal bˈaj jaw kaˈylaj , ex i jaw yolin kyxolx : ¿ Apela tyajil Davidjo lo , a skˈoˈnxix tuˈn Dios te Kolil ?

text: But when the Pharisees heard it , they said , This fellow doth not cast out devils , but by Beelzebub the prince of the devils .
text2: Me tej kybˈinte Pariseyjo ikyjo , ex kyqˈma : Mina , chi chiˈ . Nchi etz teˈ xjal taqˈnil tajaw il tuˈn , quˈn tuˈn a te Beelzebú , a tajaw il , o txi qˈonte tipin .

text: And Jesus knew their thoughts , and said unto them , Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation ; and every city or house divided against itself shall not stand :
text2: Me bˈeˈx el tnikyˈ Jesús te kyyol , ex xi tqˈmaˈn kye : Qa paˈn kyten xjal toj jun nim tnam , ex qa kyajqˈoj kyibˈ , noqx aku chi kubˈ naj tuˈn qˈoj . Ex ikyxjo toj jun muˈẍ tnam , mo toj jun ja xjal . Qa kyajqˈoj kyibˈ , nlay chi el wen .

text: And if Satan cast out Satan , he is divided against himself ; how shall then his kingdom stand ?
text2: Ikytzin taˈye te satanásjo , a tajaw il . Qa ax s ‑ etz lajonte tibˈ toj kyanminxjal , ax n ‑ ok meltzˈaj tiˈjx ikyjo , ex atzin tkawbˈil nlay chˈiy . ¿ Ma man kubˈ numjjo tipintz ?

text: And if I by Beelzebub cast out devils , by whom do your children cast them out ? therefore they shall be your judges .
text2: Ex noqit ikyjo tzeˈnku nkyqˈmaˈn , qa tuˈn tipin Beelzebú nchi etze taqˈnil tajaw il toj kyanminxjal wuˈn , ¿ Altzila kye ntzaj qˈoˈnte kyipin aye lipcheqek kyiˈja , tuˈn tetz taqˈnil tajaw il toj kyanminxjal kyuˈn , qa nya ax Dios ? Tuˈnpetziˈn , ayexjo kyukˈiy kchi qˈmalte qa nya toj tumil kyyola tiˈjjo lo .

text: But if I cast out devils by the Spirit of God , then the kingdom of God is come unto you .
text2: Me metzin weˈ noq tuˈn tipin Xewbˈaj Xjan , a T ‑ xew Dios , nchi etze taqˈnil tajaw il wuˈn toj kyanminxjal ; atzin jun yekˈbˈiljo qa ma tzul Tkawbˈil Dios kyxola .

text: Or else how can one enter into a strong man ' s house , and spoil his goods , except he first bind the strong man ? and then he will spoil his house .
text2: Ex at juntl tumil : Qa at jun ileqˈ taj tuˈn telqˈin toj tja jun xjal nim tipin , ¿ Ma akutzin bˈant telqˈin , qa nya nej , xkubˈ tkˈloˈn tajaw ja ? Ikytzin te tajaw iljo tzeˈnku tajaw ja , quˈn a nim tipin . Me ma chin kanbˈin tiˈj , quˈn ma chi etz nlajoˈn taqˈnil toj kyanminxjal .

text: He that is not with me is against me ; and he that gathereth not with me scattereth abroad .
text2: Ankyeˈ nya wukˈiy taˈ , noq njaw , tuˈn tqˈoj wiˈja . Ex ankyeˈ tkyˈeˈ mojin wukˈiy tuˈn tjaw chmet twutz awal , kyja n ‑ ok tene chtolte .

text: Wherefore I say unto you , All manner of sin and blasphemy shall be forgiven unto men : but the blasphemy against the Holy Ghost shall not be forgiven unto men .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy : Kykyaqiljo wiq il , ex jniˈ noq tiˈchaqku tiˈ nkyqˈmaˈnxjal aku najsit . Me qa ma tzˈok kyyisoˈn Xewbˈaj Xjan , nlaypen kubˈ najsit te il anetziˈn .

text: And whosoever speaketh a word against the Son of man , it shall be forgiven him : but whosoever speaketh against the Holy Ghost , it shall not be forgiven him , neither in this world , neither in the world to come .
text2: Ikytziˈn , qa at jun xyolbˈin wiˈja , a ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , aku najsit teˈ til . Me qa at jun xyolbˈin tiˈj Xewbˈaj Xjan , nlayxpen najsit teˈ til tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ ex toj kyaˈj .

text: Either make the tree good , and his fruit good ; or else make the tree corrupt , and his fruit corrupt : for the tree is known by his fruit .
text2: Ikyqetzin kyejiˈy tzeˈnku jun tze . Qa ma tzˈok kaˈyit wen , tbˈanil k ‑ elile twutz wen . Ex qa mina , nya tbˈanil twutz k ‑ elil . Tuˈnpetziˈn , k ‑ elile tnikyˈtzajil tiˈjjo tze , noq tuˈnjo twutz .

text: O generation of vipers , how can ye , being evil , speak good things ? for out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaketh .
text2: Ayetzin kyeˈ manyor tyajil kanqiˈy ; ntiˈx kyajbˈiˈn . ¿ Ma akutzin bˈant kyyoliˈn jun yol toj tumil , a ayekuy nya wenqe ? Quˈn atziˈn nya bˈaˈn at toj kyanmiˈn , atzin nkyqˈmanjiˈy .

text: A good man out of the good treasure of the heart bringeth forth good things : and an evil man out of the evil treasure bringeth forth evil things .
text2: Me anteˈ xjal , a tbˈanil tanmin , tbˈanilxjo ntqˈmaˈn , quˈn toj tanmin njatze tkyaqiljo wen . Ex anteˈ xjal , a nya wen tanmin , tkyaqiljo ntqˈmaˈn nya wen .

text: But I say unto you , That every idle word that men shall speak , they shall give account thereof in the day of judgment .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy ; qa toj tqˈijil paˈbˈin twutz Dios , teyile junjun k ‑ okil toj xjelbˈil tiˈj tkyaqiljo yol nkyqˈmaˈn jaˈlin , a nya wen .

text: For by thy words thou shalt be justified , and by thy words thou shalt be condemned .
text2: Quˈn noq tiˈjjo bˈaˈn kyyola , kchi tzaqpajiliˈy tjaqˈ tkawbˈil Dios kujxix wen ; me qatzin qa mina , ok kychjaˈbˈilxa tuˈn .

text: Then certain of the scribes and of the Pharisees answered , saying , Master , we would see a sign from thee .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , xi kyqanin junjun Parisey , exqetziˈn xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil te Jesús : Xnaqˈtzil , qaja tuˈn qlontiˈy jun techil tipiˈn , a tbˈanilxix .

text: But he answered and said unto them , An evil and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign ; and there shall no sign be given to it , but the sign of the prophet Jonas :
text2: I xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Ayetziˈn xjal nya wenqe ex aj il nchi qanin jun techil wipiˈn . Me nlay txi yekˈiˈt kye ; qalaˈ oˈkxjo techil tiˈjjo bˈaj tiˈj Jonás , a yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe .

text: For as Jonas was three days and three nights in the whale ' s belly ; so shall the Son of man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth .
text2: Quˈn luˈtziˈn te Jonás ten oxe qˈij ex oxe qnikyˈin toj tkˈuˈj jun tij kyiẍ ; ex ikyx wejiˈy , ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , chin kˈwelix muquˈn toj txˈotxˈ oxe qˈij ex oxe qnikyˈin .

text: The men of Nineveh shall rise in judgment with this generation , and shall condemn it : because they repented at the preaching of Jonas ; and , behold , a greater than Jonas is here .
text2: Ex ikyqex kyeˈ xjal toj tnam Nínive kyojjo qˈij te Jonás kchi jawil weˈks toj tqˈijil paˈbˈin , aj kyokxjal toj xjelbˈil twutz Dios , ayeˈ iteˈ kyojjo qˈij jaˈlin , tuˈn kykubˈ tzˈaq toj kyil kyuˈn . Quˈn ayetziˈn xjal toj Nínive bˈeˈx ajtz tiˈj kyanmin , tej t ‑ xi tqˈmaˈn Jonás Tbˈanil Tqanil Dios kye . Ex ajo Tbˈanil Tqanil wiˈja jaˈlin nimxixtl toklin tzeˈnku toj tqˈijil Jonás .

text: The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with this generation , and shall condemn it : for she came from the uttermost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon ; and , behold , a greater than Solomon is here .
text2: Ok kjawil weˈks ajo qya , a nmaq kawil tzajnin te najchaq te twutz txˈotxˈ , tuˈn kykubˈ tzˈaqxjal toj kyil tuˈn , ayeˈ iteˈ kyojjo qˈij jaˈlin . Quˈn ajo qya anetziˈn bˈeˈx xiˈ bˈilte tnabˈlxix qtzan Salomón . Me ajo t ‑ xilin naˈbˈl wiˈja jaˈlin , nimxixtl toklin tzeˈnku te Salomón .

text: When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man , he walketh through dry places , seeking rest , and findeth none .
text2: Aj tetz jun taqˈnil tajaw il toj tanmin jun xjal , a nya nimil , bˈeˈx nxiku jyolte tojjo tzqij txˈotxˈ , jaˈ tuˈn ttene . Exsin qa mix xjyet tuˈn , kˈwel t ‑ ximin :

text: Then he saith , I will return into my house from whence I came out ; and when he is come , he findeth it empty , swept , and garnished .
text2: Kchin meltzˈajil weˈ juntl majl tojjo njaˈy , jaˈ ẍin etziˈych . Ex ajtzin tkanin juntl majl tkˈatzjo xjal , knetiljo xjal tuˈn , tzeˈnku jun ja , mix aˈl najalte , ex chebˈe misoˈn ex nikˈuˈn wen .

text: Then goeth he , and taketh with himself seven other spirits more wicked than himself , and they enter in and dwell there : and the last state of that man is worse than the first . Even so shall it be also unto this wicked generation .
text2: Bˈeˈxsin k ‑ okixtz toj tanmin xjal me nya tjunalx jaˈlin ; qalaˈ kyukˈa wuql tukˈa xininqexix toj il tzeˈnku a . Ex kykyaqilx kchi najal toj tanminjo xjal jaˈlin . Atzaj xjal noqx kyja kxeˈlix toj il tzeˈnkuˈ ttentaq te tnejil . Ikytzin kbˈajiljo kyukˈa xjal jaˈlin , a nya nimilqe .

text: While he yet talked to the people , behold , his mother and his brethren stood without , desiring to speak with him .
text2: Tzmataq nyolin Jesús kyukˈaxjal , tej kykanin tnana kyukˈax titzˈin . I kubˈ weˈ twiˈ peˈn , me kyajtaq tuˈn kyyolin tukˈa Jesús .

text: Then one said unto him , Behold , thy mother and thy brethren stand without , desiring to speak with thee .
text2: Bˈeˈx xi qˈmaˈn te Jesús : Lu tnaniy exqetziˈn titzˈiˈn iteˈ peˈn , ex kyaj tuˈn kyyolin tukˈiy .

text: But he answered and said unto him that told him , Who is my mother ? and who are my brethren ?
text2: Me ante Jesús xi tqˈmaˈn te a xi qˈmante ikyjo : ¿ Ankyeqe weˈ nnana , ex ankyeqe weˈ witzˈin ?

text: And he stretched forth his hand toward his disciples , and said , Behold my mother and my brethren !
text2: I tzaj tyekˈin tukˈa tqˈobˈ qibˈaja , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , ex xi tqˈmaˈn : Ayetzin wejiˈy nnana ex witzˈin lo .

text: For whosoever shall do the will of my Father which is in heaven , the same is my brother , and sister , and mother .
text2: Ayeˈ chi kˈwel bˈinchin teˈ taj nMaˈn , a at toj kyaˈj , ayetzin wejiˈy witzˈin , ex wanebˈ ex nnaniy .

text: The same day went Jesus out of the house , and sat by the sea side .
text2: Ax qˈijjo tetz Jesús tojjo ja , ex kubˈ qe ttzi nijabˈ .

text: And great multitudes were gathered together unto him , so that he went into a ship , and sat ; and the whole multitude stood on the shore .
text2: Tej tok tkaˈyin kypon txqan xjal tkˈatz , bˈeˈx okx toj jun tal bark , ex kubˈ qe toj . Ayetzin kyeˈ jniˈ xjal i bˈaj kyij ten ttzi aˈ .

text: And he spake many things unto them in parables , saying , Behold , a sower went forth to sow ;
text2: Ok ten xnaqˈtzil nimku tumil noq kyukˈa techil , ex tqˈma : Jun maj , xiˈ jun xjal awal triy .

text: And when he sowed , some seeds fell by the way side , and the fowls came and devoured them up :
text2: Atzin teˈ tok tchtoˈn , at pon chitj toj bˈe . I tzaj pichˈ , ex bˈeˈx jaw kyskˈoˈn .

text: Some fell upon stony places , where they had not much earth : and forthwith they sprung up , because they had no deepness of earth :
text2: Ex at pon chitj kyxol abˈj , me quˈn tuˈn ntiˈxix twutz txˈotxˈ antza , liwey ul twiˈ .

text: And when the sun was up , they were scorched ; and because they had no root , they withered away .
text2: Me atzaj teˈ tok qˈijil , bˈeˈx jaw tzqij , quˈn nya nim xaˈye tlokˈ .

text: And some fell among thorns ; and the thorns sprung up , and choked them :
text2: Ex at pon chitj kyxol txˈiˈx . Me atzin txˈiˈx jun paqx tchˈiy ; atzin te triy noq jaw xkyˈiˈsix .

text: But other fell into good ground , and brought forth fruit , some an hundredfold , some sixtyfold , some thirtyfold .
text2: Me anteˈ pon chitj toj tbˈanil txˈotxˈ , tbˈanilx ele toj . At junjun tqan el jweˈ kˈal twutz , ex junjuntl el ox kˈal , ex junjuntl el lajaj toj kaˈwnaq .

text: Who hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Ankye taj tuˈn tkubˈ tbˈiˈn nyola , in tkubˈ tbˈiˈntz , tuˈntzintla tkubˈ tbˈinchin .

text: And the disciples came , and said unto him , Why speakest thou unto them in parables ?
text2: O ul laqˈeˈy awoˈy , a t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , tkˈatz , ex xi qqaniˈn te : ¿ Tiquˈn nyoliˈn kyukˈaxjal noq kyukˈa techil ?

text: He answered and said unto them , Because it is given unto you to know the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven , but to them it is not given .
text2: Tzaj ttzaqˈwin Jesús qeˈy : Ma tzaj tyekˈin Diosjo tumil kyeˈy , tuˈn tel kynikyˈa tiˈjjo a ewintaq ojtxe tiˈjjo Tkawbˈil Dios , a at toj kyaˈj ; quˈn metziˈn kyexjal nlay tzˈel kynikyˈ te .

text: For whosoever hath , to him shall be given , and he shall have more abundance : but whosoever hath not , from him shall be taken away even that he hath .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , ankyeˈ xjal at tnimbˈil wiˈja , ktzajil qˈoˈn txqantl , tuˈntzin tchˈiyxixjo tnimbˈil . Ex ankyeˈ xjal noq nkaˈmin tkˈuˈj tiˈj tnimbˈil , kyjaˈpe k ‑ elil qˈiˈne teˈ chˈin at .

text: Therefore speak I to them in parables : because they seeing see not ; and hearing they hear not , neither do they understand .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , nchin yoliˈn kyukˈa techil kyukˈaxjal . Quˈn nchi kaˈyin kywutz , me mi n ‑ el kynikyˈ weˈy . Ex ntbˈiˈn kyẍkyin , me mi n ‑ okx toj kywiˈ .

text: And in them is fulfilled the prophecy of Esaias , which saith , By hearing ye shall hear , and shall not understand ; and seeing ye shall see , and shall not perceive :
text2: Quˈn ikytzin kbˈajiljo tzeˈn tqˈma Isaías , a yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe , tej tqˈma : Mix tuˈn tzˈok kybˈin , mi n ‑ okx toj kywiˈ . Mix tuˈn tzˈok kykaˈyin , mi n ‑ el kynikyˈ te .

text: For this people ' s heart is waxed gross , and their ears are dull of hearing , and their eyes they have closed ; lest at any time they should see with their eyes , and hear with their ears , and should understand with their heart , and should be converted , and I should heal them .
text2: Quˈn noqx ma tzˈok naj kynabˈljo xjal luˈn ; jpuˈnqe kyẍkyin , tuˈn mi tzˈokx toj kywiˈ , jpuˈnqe kywutz , tuˈn mi tzˈele kynikyˈ te tbˈanil . Tuˈntzin ikyjo , mi nchi tzaj laqˈe nkˈatza , tuˈn kykubˈ nqˈaninch .

text: But blessed are your eyes , for they see : and your ears , for they hear .
text2: Me kyˈiwlinqexix kyeˈ , tuˈn nchi kaˈyiˈn kywutza , ex n ‑ el kynikyˈa te ; ex nchi bˈin kyẍkyiˈn , ex n ‑ okx toj kywiˈy .

text: For verily I say unto you , That many prophets and righteous men have desired to see those things which ye see , and have not seen them ; and to hear those things which ye hear , and have not heard them .
text2: Quˈn twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , qa nimjo yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe , ex nim xjal wen kyajtaq tuˈn kylon teˈ a kyeˈ ma kyli jaˈlin , ex tuˈn kybˈin teˈ a kyeˈ ma kybˈi jaˈlin , me mix bˈaje ikyjo .

text: Hear ye therefore the parable of the sower .
text2: Kybˈintzjiˈy tiˈ t ‑ xilin tiˈjjo jun xjal xiˈ awal .

text: When any one heareth the word of the kingdom , and understandeth it not , then cometh the wicked one , and catcheth away that which was sown in his heart . This is he which received seed by the way side .
text2: Quˈn ayetziˈn nxi kybˈiˈn Tbˈanil Tqanil tiˈj Tkawbˈil Dios , me mi n ‑ el kynikyˈ te , ikyqetziˈn tzeˈnku ijaj i kubˈ tzˈaq toj bˈe . Jun paqx tzul tajaw il , tzeˈnku jun pichˈ , ex k ‑ elil tiˈn Tbˈanil Tqanil , a kux awet toj kyanmin .

text: But he that received the seed into stony places , the same is he that heareth the word , and anon with joy receiveth it ;
text2: Ex atzin ijaj , a kubˈ tzˈaq kyxol abˈj , ikyqetziˈn tzeˈnqe xjal jun paqx nxi kynimin Tyol Dios ex tukˈa tzaljbˈil .

text: Yet hath he not root in himself , but dureth for a while : for when tribulation or persecution ariseth because of the word , by and by he is offended .
text2: Me quˈn tuˈn ntiˈxix kykˈuˈj tiˈj , mi nchi kujix toj kynimbˈil . Qa akux saj jun tiˈ toj kychwinqil , mo qa akux ẍi ok lipinxjal kyiˈj noq tuˈn tpajjo nyola , bˈeˈx kchi kˈwel tzˈaq toj kynimbˈil .

text: He also that received seed among the thorns is he that heareth the word ; and the care of this world , and the deceitfulness of riches , choke the word , and he becometh unfruitful .
text2: Atzin ijajjo pon tzˈaq toj txˈiˈx , ikytziˈn tzeˈn jun xjal n ‑ ok tbˈiˈn nyola . Me oˈkx nchi bˈisin tiˈj tkyaqiljo tkubˈ twutz txˈotxˈ . Ex kyaj tuˈn tten tkyaqil tiˈchaqku tiˈ kye ex jniˈ kyqˈinmil . Tuˈntzintzjo anetziˈn , n ‑ el naje kynimbˈil tiˈj Dios , ikyxsin tzeˈnku triy njaw chˈiy toj txˈiˈx . Noq n ‑ el xkyˈiˈsix ex ntiˈ toj n ‑ el .

text: But he that received seed into the good ground is he that heareth the word , and understandeth it ; which also beareth fruit , and bringeth forth , some an hundredfold , some sixty , some thirty .
text2: Me atziˈn ijaj , a kux awet toj tbˈanil txˈotxˈ , ikytziˈn tzeˈnqe xjal nxi kynimin nyola , ex nkubˈ kybˈinchin tzeˈnku nqˈmaˈn . Nchi chˈiy toj kynimbˈil , tzeˈnku triy , a s ‑ el jweˈ kˈal twutz junjun , ex junjuntl el ox kˈal , ex junjuntl el lajaj toj kaˈwnaq .

text: Another parable put he forth unto them , saying , The kingdom of heaven is likened unto a man which sowed good seed in his field :
text2: Ex xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús juntl techil . Chiˈ kyjaluˈn : A Tkawbˈil Dios , a at toj kyaˈj , ikytziˈn tzeˈnku jun ichin xiˈ awal triy toj ttxˈotxˈ .

text: But while men slept , his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat , and went his way .
text2: Tej tok bˈaj , bˈeˈx ajtz . Me tej qok yupj , ul jun ajqˈoj , ex xi tchtoˈntl jun wiq kˈul toj triy , ex bˈeˈx oq .

text: But when the blade was sprung up , and brought forth fruit , then appeared the tares also .
text2: Me atzaj teˈ chˈiy triy , ex tbˈaj weˈje tunin , antza ele tnikyˈtzajiltz qa attaq juntl wiq kˈul toj .

text: So the servants of the householder came and said unto him , Sir , didst not thou sow good seed in thy field ? from whence then hath it tares ?
text2: Ayetziˈn taqˈniljo tajaw awal bˈeˈx i xiˈ qˈmalte , ex xi kyqˈmaˈn : Tata , ¿ Mixsin ja tskˈoˈn toj tijaja , tej tok tawaˈn ? Quˈn ¿ Jaˈtzin saje jun wiq kˈul toj ikyjo tzeˈnku triy ?

text: He said unto them , An enemy hath done this . The servants said unto him , Wilt thou then that we go and gather them up ?
text2: Atzin te tajaw aqˈuntl xi tqˈmaˈn : Atla jun ajqˈoj xkubˈ bˈinchin teˈ ikyjo wiˈja . Xi kyqˈmaˈn taqˈnil te : ¿ Mej qa ma qoˈxa xbˈoqil teˈ maˈ kˈul toj triy ? chi chiˈ .

text: But he said , Nay ; lest while ye gather up the tares , ye root up also the wheat with them .
text2: Me ante tajaw aqˈuntl xi tqˈmaˈn : Mina , quˈn qa ma jatz xbˈoqitjo nya wen kˈul jaˈlin , aku jatz lipe triy tiˈj .

text: Let both grow together until the harvest : and in the time of harvest I will say to the reapers , Gather ye together first the tares , and bind them in bundles to burn them : but gather the wheat into my barn .
text2: Qalaˈ kyqˈonkja ax tzqijkuj junx tukˈa triy , tzmaxi kˈaˈ jatz skˈetjo , aj tjaw joyit . Atzin te triy kxel kˈuˈyit teˈ toj txˈutxˈ . Atzin teˈ maˈ kˈul , kjawil kˈlet , exsin kˈwel patit tuˈn qˈaqˈ .

text: Another parable put he forth unto them , saying , The kingdom of heaven is like to a grain of mustard seed , which a man took , and sowed in his field :
text2: Ex kubˈ tqˈoˈn Jesús juntl techil kyjaluˈn : A Tkawbˈil Dios toj kyaˈj , ikytziˈn t ‑ xilin tzeˈnku jun tal twutz mistas , aj tkux tawaˈn jun xjal toj txˈotxˈ .

text: Which indeed is the least of all seeds : but when it is grown , it is the greatest among herbs , and becometh a tree , so that the birds of the air come and lodge in the branches thereof .
text2: Quˈn twutzxix a tal netzˈxix kywutzjo txqantl twutz ijaj , me ajtzin tchˈiy , jun tijx n ‑ oke kywutzjo txqantl . Chˈime njapin tzeˈnku jun tze , a jaˈ n ‑ okxi kybˈinchin pichˈ kypaqbˈil kyxol tqˈobˈ .

text: Another parable spake he unto them ; The kingdom of heaven is like unto leaven , which a woman took , and hid in three measures of meal , till the whole was leavened .
text2: Ex kubˈ tqˈoˈn Jesús juntl techil kyjaluˈn : A Tkawbˈil Dios toj kyaˈj , ikytziˈn tzeˈnkuˈ ttxˈamil wabˈj , a nkux tqˈoˈn jun qya toj oxe malbˈil jarin . Ex ajtzin tbˈaj tsmoˈn , tkyaqiljo tqˈotjil wabˈj ktxˈamixil , ex nchˈiy wen .

text: All these things spake Jesus unto the multitude in parables ; and without a parable spake he not unto them :
text2: Bˈaj tqˈmaˈn Jesús tkyaqiljo lo kyexjal , noq kyukˈa techil . Quˈn ntiˈtaq jun tiˈ bˈaj tqˈmaˈn , qa nya tukˈa techil .

text: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet , saying , I will open my mouth in parables ; I will utter things which have been kept secret from the foundation of the world .
text2: Bˈajjo ikyjo , tuˈntzin tjapiˈn a qˈumj tuˈn yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe , tej tkubˈ ttzˈibˈin : Kchin yolila noq kyukˈa techil . Ex kxel nqˈmaˈn nimku tiˈ , a ewintaq , atxix teˈ tkubˈku tbˈinchin Dios twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: Then Jesus sent the multitude away , and went into the house : and his disciples came unto him , saying , Declare unto us the parable of the tares of the field .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , bˈeˈx i aj tchqˈoˈn Jesús xjal kyja . Ex okx tuja , a jaˈ o tzaja laqˈeˈy tkˈatz , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , ex xi qqˈmaˈn te : Chikyˈbˈintzjiy techil tiˈjjo kˈul nya wen toj triy .

text: He answered and said unto them , He that soweth the good seed is the Son of man ;
text2: Ex tzaj ttzaqˈwin Jesús qeˈy : Atziˈn awal triy , ayin wejiˈy , a Tkˈwal Ichin .

text: The field is the world ; the good seed are the children of the kingdom ; but the tares are the children of the wicked one ;
text2: Ante txˈotxˈ ayetziˈn xjal tkyaqil . Atzin triy , ayetziˈn nimil tiˈj Tyol Dios . Ex atziˈn kˈul , ayetziˈn xjal nya nimil , ayeˈ ncheˈx lipe tiˈj tajaw il .

text: The enemy that sowed them is the devil ; the harvest is the end of the world ; and the reapers are the angels .
text2: Ex atzin te ajqˈoj , a xi chtonte tyajil kˈul toj triy , ax tajaw il . Atzin teˈ joˈj triy , atzin teˈ aj tbˈaj twutz txˈotxˈ te jun majx . Ex ayetziˈn aqˈnil mo joˈl triy , ayetziˈn t ‑ angel Dios .

text: As therefore the tares are gathered and burned in the fire ; so shall it be in the end of this world .
text2: Ikytziˈn tzeˈn kˈul aj tjaw noq tuˈn tokx toj qˈaqˈ tuˈn ttzˈeˈy , ikytzin kbˈajiljo , aj tbˈaj tkyaqil twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: The Son of man shall send forth his angels , and they shall gather out of his kingdom all things that offend , and them which do iniquity ;
text2: Ex ayiˈn , a Tkˈwal Ichin , chi xel nchqˈoˈn n ‑ angela , tuˈn kyetz xbˈoqitjo toj Tkawbˈil Dios kykyaqiljo nchi bˈinchin il , ex ayeˈ nchi xmoxin kyiˈj junjuntl tuˈn tkubˈ kybˈinchin il .

text: And shall cast them into a furnace of fire : there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth .
text2: Ex kchi okix toj jun patbˈil ma tij , ja njuline qˈaqˈ wen , ex antza okx chi juˈchˈilx kyste tuˈn kyixkˈoj , a mix kbˈajilx .

text: Then shall the righteous shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father . Who hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Me ayetzin kyeˈ , a kubˈ kybˈinchin tzeˈnkuxjo ntqˈmaˈn Dios , ok kchi qoptzˈajiyil kye tzeˈnku tqan qˈij toj Tkawbˈil Dios , a kyTata . Ankyeˈ at tẍkyiˈn tuˈn tok tbˈiˈn , in tok tbˈiˈn , ex in tkubˈ tbˈinchin tzeˈnkuxjo ntqˈmaˈn .

text: Again , the kingdom of heaven is like unto treasure hid in a field ; the which when a man hath found , he hideth , and for joy thereof goeth and selleth all that he hath , and buyeth that field .
text2: A Tkawbˈil Dios , a at toj kyaˈj , ikytziˈn tzeˈnku jun qˈinimil ewin toj jun txˈotxˈ . Jun ichin , qa ma knetjo qˈinimil tuˈn , bˈeˈx aku meltzˈaj ewilte axsa . Maˈx tzeˈjix tiˈj wen , ex noq tuˈn ttzyetkuˈ txˈotxˈ tuˈn anetziˈn , kbˈaj xel tkˈayin tkyaqiljo at te , tuˈn ttzaj tlaqˈoˈn .

text: Again , the kingdom of heaven is like unto a merchant man , seeking goodly pearls :
text2: Ex ikyxjo , a Tkawbˈil Dios , a at toj kyaˈj , tzeˈnku jun kˈayil njyoˈn tiˈj jun tal abˈj tbˈanilxix .

text: Who , when he had found one pearl of great price , went and sold all that he had , and bought it .
text2: Ajtzin tknet jun tuˈn , a wiˈyilxix wen , kbˈaj xel tkˈayin tkyaqiljo at te , noq tuˈn tlaqˈetku tal abˈj tuˈn .

text: Again , the kingdom of heaven is like unto a net , that was cast into the sea , and gathered of every kind :
text2: Ex ikyxjo , a Tkawbˈil Dios , a at toj kyaˈj , tzeˈnku jun pa te tzuybˈil kyiẍ . Aj t ‑ xi xoˈyit toj aˈ , tkyaqil wiq kyiẍ ntzyet tuˈn .

text: Which , when it was full , they drew to shore , and sat down , and gathered the good into vessels , but cast the bad away .
text2: Ajtzin tnoj , aye kyiẍil kjawitz kyiˈn tzma ttzi aˈ . Antza , kchi kˈwele qeye skˈol teˈ kyiẍ . Ayetziˈn wen , kchi xel kˈuˈyit toj chiˈl ; ex ayetziˈn mina , chi xel kyxoˈn .

text: So shall it be at the end of the world : the angels shall come forth , and sever the wicked from among the just ,
text2: Ikytzin kbˈajiljo , aj tjapin bˈaj tkyaqil twutz txˈotxˈ . Kchi elitz t ‑ angel Dios paˈl kyeˈ nya wenqe kyiˈjjo a wen .

text: And shall cast them into the furnace of fire : there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth .
text2: Ayetziˈn nya wenqe kchi xel xoˈyit toj jun tij kˈachbˈil qˈaqˈ , a mixla kbˈajilx , jaˈ kchi oqˈile , ex kchi juˈchˈile kyste tuˈn kyixkˈoj .

text: Jesus saith unto them , Have ye understood all these things ? They say unto him , Yea , Lord .
text2: Tzaj tqanin Jesús qeˈy , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin : ¿ Tzuntzin n ‑ el kynikyˈa tiˈj tkyaqiljo lo ? chiˈ . Exsin xi qtzaqˈwiˈn : Tzun , qAjaw , qo chijiˈy .

text: Then said he unto them , Therefore every scribe which is instructed unto the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man that is an householder , which bringeth forth out of his treasure things new and old .
text2: Ex tzaj tqˈmaˈnl Jesús qeˈy : Tuˈnpetziˈn , jun xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil , aj qa ma txi lipe tiˈjjo Tkawbˈil Dios , a at toj kyaˈj , k ‑ okil tzeˈnku jun tajaw ja , a at kabˈe wiq tqˈinimil , jun ojtxe qˈinimil ex jun akˈaj .

text: And it came to pass , that when Jesus had finished these parables , he departed thence .
text2: Tej kybˈaj tqˈmaˈn Jesús kykyaqiljo techil , bˈeˈx xiˈ

text: And when he was come into his own country , he taught them in their synagogue , insomuch that they were astonished , and said , Whence hath this man this wisdom , and these mighty works ?
text2: tzma toj ttanim . Antza xi xkye tuˈn t ‑ xnaqˈtzin kyoj muˈẍ ja te kˈulbˈil . Ex tkyaqilxjal bˈaj jaw kaˈylaj , ex kyqˈma : ¿ Jaˈtzila xbˈaje t ‑ xnaqˈtzin xjaljo tkyaqiljo bˈaˈn tuˈn ? ¿ Ex tzeˈntzin tten nbˈantjo tbˈanil techil tipin tuˈn ikyjo ?

text: Is not this the carpenter ' s son ? is not his mother called Mary ? and his brethren , James , and Joses , and Simon , and Judas ?
text2: ¿ Ma nyapetzila a ttata , a jsol tzˈlan ? ¿ Ma nya tnana , a Mariy ? ¿ Ma nyaqetzin titzˈin Santyaw , Jse , Simun , ex Judas ?

text: And his sisters , are they not all with us ? Whence then hath this man all these things ?
text2: ¿ Ma nyaqetzin tanebˈjo najleqe qxol ? ¿ Jaˈtzin xbˈante tkyaqiljo luˈn tuˈn ? chi chiˈ .

text: And they were offended in him . But Jesus said unto them , A prophet is not without honour , save in his own country , and in his own house .
text2: Quˈn tuˈn kyojtzqiˈntaq , mix xi kynimine . Me xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye : Jaˈchaqx taˈ jun yolil Tyol Dios twutz txˈotxˈ , nxi qˈoˈnx toklin . Me qa tojx ttxˈotxˈ ex tojx tja ntiˈx toklin .

text: And he did not many mighty works there because of their unbelief .
text2: Nya nimku yekˈbˈil tipin bˈant kyxol t ‑ xjalil , quˈn tuˈn mix xi kynimine Tyol .

text: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard of the fame of Jesus ,
text2: Kyojjo qˈij anetziˈn , bˈijte tqanil Jesús tuˈn Herodes , a tnejil kawil toj txˈotxˈ te Galiley .

text: And said unto his servants , This is John the Baptist ; he is risen from the dead ; and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , xi tqˈmaˈn Herodes kye taqˈnil : Ala te Juan luˈn , ma jatz anqˈin kyxol kyimnin . Quˈn tiˈjkutziˈn , tbˈanilx tipin tuˈn tbˈant txqan tbˈanil techil tuˈn .

text: For Herod had laid hold on John , and bound him , and put him in prison for Herodias ' sake , his brother Philip ' s wife .
text2: Otaq kux tjpuˈn Herodes Juan toj tze , kˈloˈntaq wen tukˈa kxbˈil , noq tuˈn tpaj Herodías , a t ‑ xuˈjil , a t ‑ xuˈjlbˈin Lip , a titzˈin ,

text: For John said unto him , It is not lawful for thee to have her .
text2: quˈn tuˈn xi tqˈmaˈn Juan te Herodes : Nya wen tuˈn tok mejeˈy tukˈa t ‑ xuˈjil titzˈiˈnch .

text: And when he would have put him to death , he feared the multitude , because they counted him as a prophet .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , tajtaq Herodes tuˈn tkubˈ tbˈyoˈn Juan , me tzaj t ‑ xobˈil kyexjal , quˈn tuˈn otaq tzˈok kyqˈonxjal Juan te yolil Tyol Dios .

text: But when Herod ' s birthday was kept , the daughter of Herodias danced before them , and pleased Herod .
text2: Tej tel tabˈqˈe Herodes , kubˈ ikyˈsit jun nintz qˈij , ex atzin tal Herodías etz bˈixil kywutz kykyaqiljo txokenj .

text: Whereupon he promised with an oath to give her whatsoever she would ask .
text2: Ex bˈeˈx pon tkˈuˈj Herodes tiˈj , ex kubˈ tqˈmaˈn tbˈi Dios tiˈj tyol : Qanintza weˈy noq alkye taja , chiˈ te txin .

text: And she , being before instructed of her mother , said , Give me here John Baptist ' s head in a charger .
text2: Me a tnana xi qˈmante te , tiˈtaqjo tuˈn t ‑ xi tqanin : Qˈontzjiy twiˈ Juan , a Jawsil Aˈ , weˈy toj jun laq jaˈlinxix .

text: And the king was sorry : nevertheless for the oath ' s sake , and them which sat with him at meat , he commanded it to be given her .
text2: Tej tbˈinte Herodes ikyjo , bˈeˈx jaw bˈisin . Me quˈn tuˈn otaq kubˈ tqˈmaˈn tbˈi Dios tiˈj tyol , ex kywutz kykyaqiljo txokenj , qa akutaq txi tqˈoˈn noq alkyetaqjo tajjo txin , kubˈ t ‑ ximin qa iltaq tiˈj tuˈn tbˈajjo tyol .

text: And he sent , and beheaded John in the prison .
text2: Ex bˈeˈx xi tqˈmaˈn , tuˈn tel kˈuẍpit twiˈ Juan toj tze .

text: And his head was brought in a charger , and given to the damsel : and she brought it to her mother .
text2: Exsin xi tqˈoˈntz twiˈ Juan toj jun laq te txin , tzeˈnkuxtaq otaq tqanin . Ex anteˈ txin bˈeˈx xi tqˈoˈn te tnana .

text: And his disciples came , and took up the body , and buried it , and went and told Jesus .
text2: Me ayetziˈn t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin Juan i pon , ex xi kyiˈn t ‑ xmilil , tuˈn tkux muqet . Ex bˈeˈx i xiˈ qˈmalte te Jesús .

text: When Jesus heard of it , he departed thence by ship into a desert place apart : and when the people had heard thereof , they followed him on foot out of the cities .
text2: Tej tbˈiˈnte Jesús ikyjo , bˈeˈx o okxa toj jun bark toj ewajil , tuˈn qkaniˈn toj jun najbˈil ja ntiˈyetaq xjal . Me bˈeˈx kybˈin texjal tojile junjun tnam , ex bˈeˈx bˈaj xi lipe qiˈja tuˈn kyqan , quˈn kyajtaq tuˈn kynej qwutza .

text: And Jesus went forth , and saw a great multitude , and was moved with compassion toward them , and he healed their sick .
text2: Tej tetz Jesús toj bark , xi tkaˈyin txqan xjal attaq , ex bˈeˈx tzaj qˈaqˈin tkˈuˈj kyiˈj , ex bˈeˈx i bˈaj tqˈanin junjun , a yabˈqetaq .

text: And when it was evening , his disciples came to him , saying , This is a desert place , and the time is now past ; send the multitude away , that they may go into the villages , and buy themselves victuals .
text2: Tej chˈixtaq qok yupj , awotziˈn , a t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , o tzaj laqˈeˈy tkˈatz , ex xi qqˈmaˈn te : Ma qoqixte jaˈlin , ex mix aˈl jun najle tzaluˈn . Qˈmanxa kye jniˈ xjal tuˈn kybˈaj xiˈ toj junjun kojbˈil , tuˈn kyxiˈ jyol kywa , qape at kˈaẍjil .

text: But Jesus said unto them , They need not depart ; give ye them to eat .
text2: Me tzaj tqˈmaˈn Jesús qeˈy : Nya il tiˈj tuˈn kyxiˈ jyol jun tiˈ . Qalaˈ kyqˈonxa kywa .

text: And they say unto him , We have here but five loaves , and two fishes .
text2: Me atzin qeˈ xi qqˈmaˈn : Ntiˈ qe wabˈj qˈiˈn quˈn . Noq tal jweˈ wabˈj , ex kabˈe tal netzˈ kyiẍ .

text: He said , Bring them hither to me .
text2: Me tzaj tqˈmaˈn Jesús qeˈy : Kyiˈnqetza tzaluˈn .

text: And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the grass , and took the five loaves , and the two fishes , and looking up to heaven , he blessed , and brake , and gave the loaves to his disciples , and the disciples to the multitude .
text2: Ex xi tqˈmaˈn kye jniˈ xjal , tuˈn kybˈaj kubˈ qe tibˈaj kˈul . Ex i jaw ttzyuˈn jweˈ tal wabˈj exqetziˈn kabˈe tal kyiẍ , ex jaw tkaˈyin twutz kyaˈj , ex xi tqˈoˈn chjonte te Dios kyiˈj . Ex i bˈaj tpiẍiˈn tal wabˈj , ex tzaj tqˈoˈn qeˈy , ex xi qsipiˈn kyexjal .

text: And they did all eat , and were filled : and they took up of the fragments that remained twelve baskets full .
text2: Kykyaqilxjal i bˈaj waˈn , ex bˈaj noj kykˈuˈj wen . Atzaj teˈ kybˈaj waˈn , jaw qskˈoˈn jniˈ tbˈuchil , ex jaw noj kabˈlajaj chiˈl .

text: And they that had eaten were about five thousand men , beside women and children .
text2: Ayetziˈn i waˈn , jweˈ mil ichin , me nya telqetziˈn qya exqetziˈn kˈwal i ok te tajlal .

text: And straightway Jesus constrained his disciples to get into a ship , and to go before him unto the other side , while he sent the multitudes away .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , o jax tchqˈoˈn Jesús awoˈy , a t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , toj bark , tuˈn qikyˈxa tjlajxi nijabˈ . Otaq qo neja tuˈn qikyˈxa jlajxi ; kyij Jesús qˈolbˈil kyexjal .

text: And when he had sent the multitudes away , he went up into a mountain apart to pray : and when the evening was come , he was there alone .
text2: Tej kybˈaj tqˈolbˈin Jesús xjal , jax twiˈ jun wutz naˈl Dios tjunalx . Tej qok yupj , ex tjunalxtaq Jesús at .

text: But the ship was now in the midst of the sea , tossed with waves : for the wind was contrary .
text2: Me noqx nnikyˈjinku nijabˈ tuˈn bark , tej ttzaj txqan kyqˈiqˈ , ex bˈeˈx okx piqˈj txqan aˈ toj .

text: And in the fourth watch of the night Jesus went unto them , walking on the sea .
text2: Tej chˈixtaq qsqix , tzaj laqˈe Jesús qkˈatza ; nbˈet tibˈaj aˈ .

text: And when the disciples saw him walking on the sea , they were troubled , saying , It is a spirit ; and they cried out for fear .
text2: Tej t ‑ xi qkaˈyiˈn te nbˈettaq tibˈaj aˈ , bˈeˈx o jaw ẍchˈin wen tuˈn qxobˈila : Jun ma tij klelin , qo chijiˈy .

text: But straightway Jesus spake unto them , saying , Be of good cheer ; it is I ; be not afraid .
text2: Me jun paqx tzaj tqˈmaˈn Jesús qeˈy : ¡ Kykujsinx kykˈuˈja ! ¡ Ayin wejiˈy ! Mi chi xobˈach .

text: And Peter answered him and said , Lord , if it be thou , bid me come unto thee on the water .
text2: Me ante Pegr xi ttzaqˈwin : WAjaw , qa ajiy , qˈmantza tuˈn nxiˈy tkˈatza tibˈaj aˈ .

text: And he said , Come . And when Peter was come down out of the ship , he walked on the water , to go to Jesus .
text2: Ku tzaja , chi Jesús . Ex jun paqx , tkuˈtz Pegr toj bark , ex xi bˈet tibˈaj aˈ , tuˈn tpon tkˈatz Jesús .

text: But when he saw the wind boisterous , he was afraid ; and beginning to sink , he cried , saying , Lord , save me .
text2: Me atzaj teˈ tnaˈnte txqan tipin kyqˈiqˈ , bˈeˈx tzaj xobˈ , ex kyjaˈtaq txi mulqˈaj toj aˈ . Bˈeˈx jaw ẍchˈin tuˈn t ‑ xobˈil : Chin tkloma , wAjawch .

text: And immediately Jesus stretched forth his hand , and caught him , and said unto him , O thou of little faith , wherefore didst thou doubt ?
text2: Ex jun paqx jaw tjkˈuˈn Jesús tukˈa tqˈobˈ , ex xi tqˈmaˈn te : Ay , noq tal chˈin tnimbˈila wiˈja . ¿ Tiquˈn xjaw kaˈmin tkˈuˈja ?

text: And when they were come into the ship , the wind ceased .
text2: Me atzaj teˈ kyjax toj bark , bˈeˈx kubˈ qen tej kyqˈiqˈ .

text: Then they that were in the ship came and worshipped him , saying , Of a truth thou art the Son of God .
text2: Ex awotzin qe , a otokxtaqa toj bark , bˈeˈx o kubˈ mejey twutz Jesús , ex o nimsin tbˈi kyjaluˈn : Twutzxix Tkˈwal Diosx te .

text: And when they were gone over , they came into the land of Gennesaret .
text2: Me atzaj teˈ qjlajinxa tjlajxi nijabˈ , o pon toj txˈotxˈ te Genesaret .

text: And when the men of that place had knowledge of him , they sent out into all that country round about , and brought unto him all that were diseased ;
text2: Ex ayetziˈn xjal antza , bˈeˈx el kynikyˈ te Jesús . Bˈeˈx el tqanil toj tkyaqil txˈotxˈ , ex bˈeˈx i bˈaj xi kyinxjal kyyabˈ te , tuˈn kykubˈ tqˈanin .

text: And besought him that they might only touch the hem of his garment : and as many as touched were made perfectly whole .
text2: Ex i kubˈsin kywutz te , tuˈn t ‑ xi ttziyin Jesús , noq tuˈn tok kymekoˈnxjal iˈchaqxitla noq tal ttxaˈn t ‑ xbˈalintz . Ex kykyaqiljo , ayeˈ i ok mekonte ttxaˈn t ‑ xbˈalin , bˈeˈx bˈajel weˈ .

text: Then came to Jesus scribes and Pharisees , which were of Jerusalem , saying ,
text2: I tzaj laqˈe junjun Parisey , junx kyukˈa junjun xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil tkˈatz Jesús , aye otaq chi kanin Jerusalén . Ex xi kyqanin te :

text: Why do thy disciples transgress the tradition of the elders ? for they wash not their hands when they eat bread .
text2: ¿ Tzeˈntzin kyten kyeˈ t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈiˈn mi nkubˈ kynimin a kyij yekˈin qe kyuˈn qtzan qtaˈẍ ? Quˈn mi njapin techil kyuˈn , a tzeˈnku nbˈanttaq kyuˈn qtzan qtaˈẍ , tzeˈnku qe , a tuˈn tel kytxjon kyqˈobˈ tukˈa tumil , aj kyaqˈe waˈl .

text: But he answered and said unto them , Why do ye also transgress the commandment of God by your tradition ?
text2: Ex xi tqanin Jesús kye : Ex ikyxjo kyeˈ . ¿ Tiquˈn n ‑ el kyiˈjlinjiˈy Tkawbˈil Dios , noq tuˈn kyokku lipeˈy tiˈjjo xnaqˈtzbˈil xkyij kyqˈoˈn qtzan qtaˈẍ ?

text: For God commanded , saying , Honour thy father and mother : and , He that curseth father or mother , let him die the death .
text2: Quˈn chte Diosjo kyjaluˈn : Kyniminku kytatiy , ex kynaniy , ex ankye teˈ k ‑ elil tzaqpaj ttzi te ttata ex te tnana , il tiˈj tuˈn tkyim .

text: But ye say , Whosoever shall say to his father or his mother , It is a gift , by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me ;
text2: Me ayetzin kyeˈ nchi qˈmante , qa bˈaˈn tuˈn t ‑ xi qqˈmaˈn te qtata mo te qnana kyjaluˈn : Matla txi nmojiˈn , noqit nya tkyaqiljo at weˈy jaˈlin , ma txi nqˈoˈn te Dios , tuˈn tajbˈin te , aj nkyima . Tuˈnpetziˈn , ntiˈx tuˈn nmojiˈn tiˈja , exla qa at tajbˈin teˈy . Ex bˈaˈnjo lo toj kywutza .

text: And honour not his father or his mother , he shall be free . Thus have ye made the commandment of God of none effect by your tradition .
text2: Quˈn qa ikyjo , nlayxpen bˈanttz tuˈn tmojin tiˈj ttata ex tiˈj tnana , chi chijiˈy . Quˈn ma kyij kytzaqpinjiˈy Tkawbˈil Dios , noq tuˈn kyxi lipekuy tiˈjjo kyeˈ kyxnaqˈtzbˈin .

text: Ye hypocrites , well did Esaias prophesy of you , saying ,
text2: Xmiletzˈqiˈy . Quˈn twutzx tej tyol qtzan yolil Tyol Dios te , a Isaías , tej tyolin tiˈj kyxmiletzˈila :

text: This people draweth nigh unto me with their mouth , and honoureth me with their lips ; but their heart is far from me .
text2: Ayetziˈn xjal tzaluˈn , nchin kubˈ kynimiˈn , me noq tukˈa kytzi . Me atzin kyanmin najchaq taˈ wiˈja .

text: But in vain they do worship me , teaching for doctrines the commandments of men .
text2: Ntiˈx tajbˈiˈn a nchi kˈulin nwutza , quˈn noqx tiˈjjo kyxnaqˈtzbˈilxjal lipcheqeke .

text: And he called the multitude , and said unto them , Hear , and understand :
text2: I xi ttxkoˈn Jesús jniˈ xjal tkˈatz , ex xi tqˈmaˈn kye : Chin kybˈintziˈn , ex tzˈelku kynikyˈa te :

text: Not that which goeth into the mouth defileth a man ; but that which cometh out of the mouth , this defileth a man .
text2: Nya teˈ tiˈchaqku tiˈ nbˈaj tuˈn jun xjal , nxi qˈonte toj il , qalaˈ ikytzin a teˈ n ‑ etz toj ttzi .

text: Then came his disciples , and said unto him , Knowest thou that the Pharisees were offended , after they heard this saying ?
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , bˈeˈx o bˈaj tzaj laqˈeˈy , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin tkˈatz , ex xi qqˈmaˈn te : ¿ Ma man tzˈel tnikyˈa te , qa bˈeˈx saj kyqˈoj Parisey , tej xkybˈin teˈ a xbˈaj tqˈmaˈn ?

text: But he answered and said , Every plant , which my heavenly Father hath not planted , shall be rooted up .
text2: Me ante Jesús tzaj ttzaqˈwin qeˈy : Tkyaqil kyxnaqˈtzbˈil Parisey ikyjo tzeˈnku jun wiˈ kˈul , a qa nya nTatiˈy tokx toj kyaˈj , xkux awante . Okla kjawitz xbˈoqit te jun majx tukˈa tkyaqil tlokˈ .

text: Let them alone : they be blind leaders of the blind . And if the blind lead the blind , both shall fall into the ditch .
text2: Ex chi tenkuj , quˈn jpuˈn kynabˈl . Nchi kubˈ nej kywutz junjun ikyx kyten tzeˈnku aye . Ikyqetziˈn tzeˈn kabˈe moẍ nxi kyxkoˈn kyibˈ ; me qa aku ẍi ex twiˈ xaq , kykabˈilx kchi xeˈl tolpaj .

text: Then answered Peter and said unto him , Declare unto us this parable .
text2: Me ante Pegr xi tqˈmaˈn te Jesús : Chikyˈbˈintza qeˈy tiˈjjo xbˈaj tqˈmaˈn .

text: And Jesus said , Are ye also yet without understanding ?
text2: Tzaj ttzaqˈwin Jesús qeˈy : Ex ikyx kyejiˈy , ¿ Mi s ‑ el pjet toj kynabˈla ?

text: Do not ye yet understand , that whatsoever entereth in at the mouth goeth into the belly , and is cast out into the draught ?
text2: ¿ Ma mitzin n ‑ el kynikyˈa te , qa tkyaqiljo nbˈaj tuˈn jun xjal , toj tkˈuˈj kupine , ex majx k ‑ elil tiˈj ?

text: But those things which proceed out of the mouth come forth from the heart ; and they defile the man .
text2: Me atziˈn n ‑ etz toj ttzi , toj tanminx ntzaje anqˈine . Apente iljo ,

text: For out of the heart proceed evil thoughts , murders , adulteries , fornications , thefts , false witness , blasphemies :
text2: quˈn toj tanminxjal ntzaje jniˈ t ‑ xim nya bˈaˈn , jniˈ bˈiˈyin , jniˈ kyˈaˈjin , ex jniˈ aj pajil , jniˈ elqˈin , jniˈ sbˈubˈl , exsin tkyaqil yasin ,

text: These are the things which defile a man : but to eat with unwashen hands defileth not a man .
text2: tuˈn kxel toj najin te jun majx . Me teˈ , tuˈn kywaˈnxjal , a noq tuˈn mi tzˈele txjet tqˈobˈ jun xjal tzeˈnku kye , aj txi waˈl , ntiˈ te najin noq tuˈn tpajjo ikyjo , quˈn noq xnaqˈtzbˈil kye qtzan qtaˈẍ .

text: Then Jesus went thence , and departed into the coasts of Tyre and Sidon .
text2: Tej tetz Jesús antza , bˈeˈx xiˈ toj txˈotxˈ te Tiro ex te Sidón .

text: And , behold , a woman of Canaan came out of the same coasts , and cried unto him , saying , Have mercy on me , O Lord , thou Son of David ; my daughter is grievously vexed with a devil .
text2: Ex attaq jun qya aj Canaán najletaq tojjo txˈotxˈ antza , a nya Judiytaq . Tzaj laqˈe tkˈatz Jesús , ex nẍchˈintaq wen : Tata , ay Tyajil qtzan nmaq kawil David , qˈaqˈintz tkˈuˈja wiˈja ; at jun wala , at jun taqˈnil tajaw il toj tanmin .

text: But he answered her not a word . And his disciples came and besought him , saying , Send her away ; for she crieth after us .
text2: Me mix xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús jun tyol . Tuˈnpetziˈn , o tzaj laqˈeˈy , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin tkˈatz , ex o kubˈsin qwutza te : Qalaˈ , qˈmanxa te qya tuˈn taj tja , quˈn luˈ tzunx nẍchˈinx wen , ex luˈtz lipchek qiˈj .

text: But he answered and said , I am not sent but unto the lost sheep of the house of Israel .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús te : Ma chin tzaj tchqˈon weˈ Dios noq kyukˈa xjal aj Judiy , ayeˈ najnin iteˈye tzeˈnku jun chˈuq rit .

text: Then came she and worshipped him , saying , Lord , help me .
text2: Me anteˈ qya kubˈ meje twutz Jesús , ex xi tqˈmaˈn : ¡ Tata , chin tonima !

text: But he answered and said , It is not meet to take the children ' s bread , and to cast it to dogs .
text2: Me ante Jesús xi tqˈmaˈn te : Yonkuy nej , tuˈn kyxi nmojinjiˈy nxjalila , quˈn nya wen tuˈn tel kywaˈ tal kˈwal , exsin tuˈn t ‑ xiˈ kye chit , quˈn nej tuˈn kybˈaj waˈn tal kˈwal , exsin kxel xiljo kye chittz . Ikyqintzin wejiˈy kyukˈa nxjalila ; nej chi okil nkaˈyiˈn , ex kxel nqˈoˈnjiˈy a ntiˈ at kye .

text: And she said , Truth , Lord : yet the dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters ' table .
text2: Ex xi ttzaqˈwin qya : Ikyx te tten , Tata . Me kaˈnqetzin kyejiˈy tal chit nchi waˈn kye tjaqˈ meẍ tiˈjjo tbˈuchil wabˈj nbˈajel tzˈaq kyuˈn kyajaw . Ikyqintzintlaˈ wejiˈy , qˈontz chˈin weˈ tiˈjjo nxi tqˈoˈn kye t ‑ xjalila .

text: Then Jesus answered and said unto her , O woman , great is thy faith : be it unto thee even as thou wilt . And her daughter was made whole from that very hour .
text2: Tuˈntziˈn tyoljo qya ikyjo , xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús te : Ay qya , nimxixjo tnimbˈila wiˈja . Kxel nqˈoˈn tzeˈnku taja . Atzaj taljo qya , jun paqx tel weˈ .

text: And Jesus departed from thence , and came nigh unto the sea of Galilee ; and went up into a mountain , and sat down there .
text2: Tej tetz Jesús antza , pon tzma ttzi Nijabˈ te Galiley . Ex bˈeˈx jax twiˈ jun wutz , ex kubˈ qe antza .

text: And great multitudes came unto him , having with them those that were lame , blind , dumb , maimed , and many others , and cast them down at Jesus ' feet ; and he healed them :
text2: Ex nimxjal bˈaj chmet jaˈ taˈyetaq . Ex qˈimila junjun kox kyuˈn , junjun moẍ , ex ilaˈkul mibˈintaq chi bˈet ex mibˈintaq chi yolin , ex nimku txqantl yabˈ bˈaj xi qˈiˈn twutz Jesús . Ex bˈeˈx i kubˈ tqˈanin .

text: Insomuch that the multitude wondered , when they saw the dumb to speak , the maimed to be whole , the lame to walk , and the blind to see : and they glorified the God of Israel .
text2: Ex ayetziˈn xjal bˈeˈx i bˈaj jaw kaˈylaj , tej tok kykaˈyin tbˈant kyyoliˈn a mibˈintaq chi yolin ; ex otaq bˈant kybˈetjo a mibˈintaq chi bˈet ; ex otaq jqet kyẍkyin a mibˈintaq chi bˈin ; ex otaq chi el weˈ kox , ex otaq kˈant kywutzjo moẍqetaq . Jotxjo jniˈ xjal i bˈaj ok ten nimsil tbˈi Dios , a kyDios aj Israel .

text: Then Jesus called his disciples unto him , and said , I have compassion on the multitude , because they continue with me now three days , and have nothing to eat : and I will not send them away fasting , lest they faint in the way .
text2: O tzaj ttxkoˈn Jesús a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , ex tzaj tqˈmaˈn qeˈy : Nchyoˈn nkˈuˈja kyiˈjjo xjal lo , quˈn ma bˈant ‑ xi oxe qˈij kytenbˈile qukˈa , ex ntiˈx chˈin o txi kywaˈn . Ex nkyˈeˈy tuˈn kyaj nchqˈoˈn kyja kukxjo , quˈn aku chi kubˈ numj toj bˈe tuˈn waˈyaj .

text: And his disciples say unto him , Whence should we have so much bread in the wilderness , as to fill so great a multitude ?
text2: Ex xi qqˈmaˈn : ¿ Me jaˈ aku tzaje kywa txqan xjal quˈn ? Mix yaˈ ntiˈx jun xjal najle tzaluˈn , qo chijiˈy .

text: And Jesus saith unto them , How many loaves have ye ? And they said , Seven , and a few little fishes .
text2: Me tzaj tqanin Jesús qeˈy : ¿ Jteˈ wabˈj qˈiˈn kyuˈn ? Noq tal wuq , ex jun tal jteˈbˈin netzˈ kyiẍ , qo chijiˈy .

text: And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground .
text2: Ex xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye jniˈ xjal , tuˈn kybˈaj kubˈ qe twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: And he took the seven loaves and the fishes , and gave thanks , and brake them , and gave to his disciples , and the disciples to the multitude .
text2: Ex i jaw ttzyuˈn wuq wabˈj , exqetziˈn tal netzˈ kyiẍ , ex xi tqˈoˈn chjonte te Dios kyiˈj , i kubˈ tpiẍin , ex tzaj tqˈoˈn qeˈy , tuˈn t ‑ xi qsipiˈn kye jniˈ xjal .

text: And they did all eat , and were filled : and they took up of the broken meat that was left seven baskets full .
text2: Kykyaqilxjal noqx jniˈ i bˈaj waˈn . Tej kybˈaj waˈn , jaw chmetjo jniˈ tbˈuchil wabˈj tkyaqil , ex atzin tej tbˈaj chmet , bˈant wuq chiˈl .

text: And they that did eat were four thousand men , beside women and children .
text2: Ayetziˈn ichin , ayeˈ i bˈaj waˈn , kyaje mil , me mix ok ajletjo qya exqetziˈn kˈwal .

text: And he sent away the multitude , and took ship , and came into the coasts of Magdala ,
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , bˈeˈx i aj tchqˈoˈn Jesúsjo xjal kyja , ex bˈeˈx o okxa toj bark , tuˈn kyxiˈy toj txˈotxˈ te Magadán .

text: The Pharisees also with the Sadducees came , and tempting desired him that he would shew them a sign from heaven .
text2: Juntl majl , i bˈaj pon chmet Parisey kaˈyil tiˈj Jesús junx kyukˈa junjun Sadusey . Noq tuˈn tkubˈ tzˈaq kyuˈn toj til , xi kyqanin te , tuˈn tkubˈ tbˈinchin jun tbˈanil techil tipin twutz kyaˈj , tuˈn tyekˈin qa te Dios tzajnin .

text: He answered and said unto them , When it is evening , ye say , It will be fair weather : for the sky is red .
text2: Me xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús kye : ¿ Tzeˈntzin tten n ‑ el kynikyˈa tiˈjjo qˈij ? Quˈn qa manyor chikyˈx twutz kyaˈj qale , nkyqˈmaˈn qa tbˈanilx qˈij nchiˈj .

text: And in the morning , It will be foul weather to day : for the sky is red and lowring . O ye hypocrites , ye can discern the face of the sky ; but can ye not discern the signs of the times ?
text2: Ex qa qlixje , nya wen k ‑ elixe qˈij jaˈlin , chi chijiˈy , quˈn manyor chikyˈx twutz kyaˈj , ex manyor qˈaq mujilx . Qa n ‑ el kynikyˈa tiˈjjo techil te twutz kyaˈj , ¿ Tzeˈntzin tten mi n ‑ el kynikyˈtza tiˈjjo tzeˈntzin t ‑ xilin techiljo tqˈijil jaˈlin ?

text: A wicked and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign ; and there shall no sign be given unto it , but the sign of the prophet Jonas . And he left them , and departed .
text2: Ayeˈ xjal tzaluˈn manyor aj ilqex ex aj pajilqe . Nkyqanin tuˈn tkubˈ nbˈinchiˈn jun tbˈanil techil wipiˈn kywutz , me mixla kbˈantil ; oˈkxjo tzeˈn bˈaj tiˈj qtzan Jonás ojtxe . Ex bˈeˈx i kyij ttzaqpiˈn antza .

text: And when his disciples were come to the other side , they had forgotten to take bread .
text2: Tej qjlajinxa tjlajxi nijabˈ , bˈeˈx el naj toj qkˈuˈja tuˈn t ‑ xi qiˈn qwaˈy .

text: Then Jesus said unto them , Take heed and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees .
text2: Tzaj tqˈmaˈn Jesús qeˈy : Bˈaˈnqexa . Kykaˈyink kyibˈa noq cheˈxa tiˈjjo ttxˈamsbˈil kywa Parisey ex Sadusey .

text: And they reasoned among themselves , saying , It is because we have taken no bread .
text2: Me bˈeˈx o bˈaj jaw yolin awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin qxolxa , ex qqˈmaˈy : Ma tzaj tqˈmaˈn qe , tuˈn tok qkaˈyin qibˈ , bˈalaqa tuˈn mi saj qiˈn qwa ; yaj qa saj kyqˈoˈnku Parisey qwa , exsin qa tiˈku xi kyqˈoˈn toj .

text: Which when Jesus perceived , he said unto them , O ye of little faith , why reason ye among yourselves , because ye have brought no bread ?
text2: Ex bˈeˈx el tnikyˈ Jesús teˈ qbˈisa , ex tzaj tqˈmaˈn qeˈy : ¿ Tiquˈn nkubˈ kybˈisiˈn qa ntiˈ kywaˈy qˈiˈn ? Ntiˈxla chˈin kyeˈ tqˈuqbˈil kykˈuˈj wiˈja .

text: Do ye not yet understand , neither remember the five loaves of the five thousand , and how many baskets ye took up ?
text2: Naˈmxsin tel kynikyˈa te . ¿ Ma mitzin naˈn kyuˈn kyiˈj jweˈ wabˈj , ayej i kubˈ nsipiˈn kyxoljo jweˈ mil xjal ? ¿ Jteˈn chiˈl jaw chmet , tej kybˈaj waˈnxjal ?

text: Neither the seven loaves of the four thousand , and how many baskets ye took up ?
text2: Ex ¿ Ma mitzin naˈn kyuˈn kyiˈjjo wuq wabˈj , ayej i kubˈ nsipiˈn kyxoljo kyaje mil xjal ? ¿ Jteˈxsin chiˈljo jaw chmet , tej kybˈaj waˈnxjal ?

text: How is it that ye do not understand that I spake it not to you concerning bread , that ye should beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees ?
