text2: ¿ Yajtzin qetz , ma nlan qo waˈntz wuˈn qkyaqilx ? Qalaˈ nya tiˈjjo wabˈj te twutz txˈotxˈ nchin yoline weˈ , tej xi nqˈmaˈn : Kykaˈyink kyibˈa tiˈjjo ttxˈamsbˈil kywa Parisey ex Sadusey .

text: Then understood they how that he bade them not beware of the leaven of bread , but of the doctrine of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees .
text2: Tzmaxitzin el qnikyˈjiˈy tiˈj , qa mi nyolintaq Jesús tiˈjjo juntl txˈamsbˈil wabˈj , qalaˈ tiˈjjo kyxnaqˈtzbˈil Parisey exqetziˈn Sadusey .

text: When Jesus came into the coasts of Caesarea Philippi , he asked his disciples , saying , Whom do men say that I the Son of man am ?
text2: Atzaj teˈ qkaniˈn toj txˈotxˈ te Cesarea te Filipo , tzaj tqanin Jesús qeˈy : ¿ Ankyeqiˈn , a Tkˈwal Ichin , toj kywutzjo xjal ?

text: And they said , Some say that thou art John the Baptist : some , Elias ; and others , Jeremias , or one of the prophets .
text2: Xi qtzaqˈwiˈn : At junjun nqˈmante qa ajiy qtzan Juan , a Jawsil Aˈ , ma jaw anqˈintl , ex junjuntl nqˈmante qa ajiy Elías , moj qa ajiy Jeremías , mo juntl yolil Tyol Dios .

text: He saith unto them , But whom say ye that I am ?
text2: ¿ Yajtzin kye toj kywutz ? ¿ Ankyeqiˈn ? chi Jesús .

text: And Simon Peter answered and said , Thou art the Christ , the Son of the living God .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Pegr : Atejiy Crist , a Tkˈwaljo Dios itzˈ te jun majx , a skˈoˈnxix tuˈn , tuˈn tul tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto him , Blessed art thou , Simon Barjona : for flesh and blood hath not revealed it unto thee , but my Father which is in heaven .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Kyˈiwlinxix te , ay Simun , a tkˈwal Jonás ; quˈn mix aˈl jun xjal saj qˈmante tey , qalaˈ a nMaˈn , a at toj kyaˈj .

text: And I say also unto thee , That thou art Peter , and upon this rock I will build my church ; and the gates of hell shall not prevail against it .
text2: Ex kxel nqˈmaˈn tey , qa a tbˈiy Pegr , a abˈj tzˈelpine . Ex tibˈajjo abˈj lo kjawile nbˈinchiˈn Ntanima . Ex nlayx kubˈ tiˈj tuˈn tkyaqil tipin kyimin .

text: And I will give unto thee the keys of the kingdom of heaven : and whatsoever thou shalt bind on earth shall be bound in heaven : and whatsoever thou shalt loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven .
text2: Ex kxel woqxeninjiˈy Nxnaqtzbˈila tey nyakutlaj jun tal tal tjpel ja , tuˈntzintla noq tiˈj ktqˈmaˈbˈila , tzˈele kynikyˈxjal tiˈjjo Tbˈanil Tqanil Tkawbˈil Dios . Ex qa ma kotpitjo xjal tuˈn toj kyil , noq tuˈn ktqˈmaˈbˈila tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , ex aj kyok toj paˈbˈin twutz Dios toj kyaˈj , kchi kotpajil te jun majx . Ex qa mi xi kynimin a ktqˈmaˈbˈila , ma chi kˈlet tuˈn kyil tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , ex aj kyok toj paˈbˈin twutz Dios toj kyaˈj , chi xel toj najin te jun majx .

text: Then charged he his disciples that they should tell no man that he was Jesus the Christ .
text2: Ex xi toqxenin Jesús qeˈy , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , tuˈn mi qo ok teˈn qˈmalte kye jniˈ xjal , qa ataq Jesúsjo Crist , a Kolil , quˈn naˈmxtaq tul tqˈijil .

text: From that time forth began Jesus to shew unto his disciples , how that he must go unto Jerusalem , and suffer many things of the elders and chief priests and scribes , and be killed , and be raised again the third day .
text2: Axsa , oke ten Jesús xnaqˈtzil qeˈy , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , qa iltaq tiˈj tuˈn t ‑ xiˈ toj Jerusalén , ex iltaq tiˈj tuˈn tikyˈx tuˈn antza kyuˈn kynejil xjal ex kyuˈn kynejil pale junx kyukˈa xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil . Ex tzaj tqˈmaˈn qeˈy , qa iltaq tiˈj tuˈn tkubˈ bˈyoˈn kyuˈn . Me toj toxin qˈij , bˈeˈxtaq tuˈn tjatz anqˈin juntl majl .

text: Then Peter took him , and began to rebuke him , saying , Be it far from thee , Lord : this shall not be unto thee .
text2: Me bˈeˈx ex telsin Pegr tjunalx , ex ok tentz qˈol tumil te Jesús : WAjaw , nlay taqˈ te Diosjo ikyjo . Nlay bˈajte ikyjo tiˈjach .

text: But he turned , and said unto Peter , Get thee behind me , Satan : thou art an offence unto me : for thou savourest not the things that be of God , but those that be of men .
text2: Me bˈeˈx ajtz meltzˈaj Jesús tiˈj Pegr , ex xi tqˈmaˈn te : ¡ Pegr ! Ayetziˈn tyola ikyjo , tyol tajaw il , quˈn a taj tajaw iljo tuˈn tbˈantjo kyaj xjal , ex nya a taj Dios . ¡ Laqˈemila nkˈatza , tajaw il ! Quˈn ma tzˈoka te jun tolsbˈil , tuˈn nkubˈ tzˈaqach .

text: Then said Jesus unto his disciples , If any man will come after me , let him deny himself , and take up his cross , and follow me .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , tzaj tqˈmaˈn Jesús qeˈy , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin : Ankye jun taj tuˈn tok te nxnaqˈtzbˈiˈn , il tiˈj tuˈn tel tiˈn toj tkˈuˈj tkyaqil tajbˈil , ex tuˈn t ‑ xi tqˈoˈn tibˈ , tuˈn t ‑ xi lipe wiˈja toj tkyaqil , exla qa ma kyim twutz cruz .

text: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it : and whosoever will lose his life for my sake shall find it .
text2: Ikytziˈn , ankyeˈ taj noq tuˈn tkubˈ tbˈinchin tajbˈil tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , kxeˈl toj najin te jun majx . Ex ankyeˈ kˈwel ttzyuˈn tibˈ tiˈj tkyaqiljo at tajbˈin kyexjal tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , noq tuˈn npaja , ktenbˈil tchwinqil te jun majx .

text: For what is a man profited , if he shall gain the whole world , and lose his own soul ? or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul ?
text2: Quˈn ¿ tiˈxsila tajbˈin tuˈn tkanbˈit tkyaqiljo ajbˈil tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , exsin tuˈn tnaj tanmin ? ¿ Ma akutzin tzˈok tkyaqil tqˈinimil te klol tanmin ?

text: For the Son of man shall come in the glory of his Father with his angels ; and then he shall reward every man according to his works .
text2: Quˈn tzul kanin jun qˈij tuˈn wula , ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , tukˈa tkyaqil tqoptzˈajiyil nMaˈn ex kyukˈa jniˈ angel . Ex kxel nqˈoˈn chojbˈil teyile junjun , tzeˈnkuxjo ntqanin kybˈinchbˈin .

text: Verily I say unto you , There be some standing here , which shall not taste of death , till they see the Son of man coming in his kingdom .
text2: Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , at junjun iteˈ tzaluˈn wukˈiy , mi kyli kyimin , tzmaxiˈ aj kylonte aj wula , a ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , kawil tibˈaj tkyaqil .

text: And after six days Jesus taketh Peter , James , and John his brother , and bringeth them up into an high mountain apart ,
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ qaq qˈij , xi tkˈleˈn Jesús Pegr tukˈa Santyaw ex Juan , a kyitzˈin kyibˈ , exsin i xiˈtz tzma twiˈ jun ma tij wutz .

text: And was transfigured before them : and his face did shine as the sun , and his raiment was white as the light .
text2: Antza kywutzxjo t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , txˈixpit kaˈyin Jesús . Ox qoptzˈajx wen tzeˈnku qˈij , exsin t ‑ xbˈalin manyor sjanin wen , tzeˈnku tqan tzaj ntilkˈaj wen .

text: And , behold , there appeared unto them Moses and Elias talking with him .
text2: Texjo paq anetziˈn , xi kykaˈyin Moisés ex Elías nchi yolintaq tukˈa Jesús .

text: Then answered Peter , and said unto Jesus , Lord , it is good for us to be here : if thou wilt , let us make here three tabernacles ; one for thee , and one for Moses , and one for Elias .
text2: Xi tqˈmante Pegr te Jesús : WAjaw , tbˈanilx teˈ otoˈ tzaluˈn . Qa taja tuˈn tkubˈ nbˈinchiˈn oxe tal pach ; jun te , ex jun te Moisés , ex jun te Elías .

text: While he yet spake , behold , a bright cloud overshadowed them : and behold a voice out of the cloud , which said , This is my beloved Son , in whom I am well pleased ; hear ye him .
text2: Tzmataq nyolin Pegr , tej tkubˈ juktzˈaj jun muj ntilkˈaj wen kyibˈaj . Ex tojjo muj etz yolin jun tqˈajqˈojil , ex tqˈma : Axixpen wejiˈy Nkˈwal lo kˈuˈjlinxix wuˈn , a o jaw nskˈoˈn . ¡ Kybˈinkujiˈy Tyol !

text: And when the disciples heard it , they fell on their face , and were sore afraid .
text2: Tej kybˈin teˈ t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin ikyjo , bˈeˈx i bˈaj kubˈ mutzqˈaj twutz txˈotxˈ tuˈn kyxobˈil .

text: And Jesus came and touched them , and said , Arise , and be not afraid .
text2: Me tzaj laqˈe Jesús kykˈatz , ex i ok tyekin , ex xi tqˈmaˈn kye : Chi weˈksa . Mi chi xobˈa .

text: And when they had lifted up their eyes , they saw no man , save Jesus only .
text2: Atzaj teˈ kyjaw kaˈyin oˈkxtaql Jesús attaql , mixtaq aˈl juntl at tukˈa .

text: And as they came down from the mountain , Jesus charged them , saying , Tell the vision to no man , until the Son of man be risen again from the dead .
text2: Kyjaˈtaq kykuˈtz twiˈ wutz , xi tqˈmaˈnxix Jesús kye : Mix aˈl qe kxele kyqˈmaˈnjiˈy , a ma kyliˈy , tzmaxiˈ aj njatz anqˈiˈn , a ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , kyxol kyimnin , chiˈ .

text: And his disciples asked him , saying , Why then say the scribes that Elias must first come ?
text2: Me xi kyqanin t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin te Jesús : ¿ Tzeˈntzin ttentz nkyqˈmaˈn xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil , qa ataq Elías tuˈn tul nej twutza ? ¿ Nyapela tiˈjjo lo nchi yolinetaq , a ma qliˈy ?

text: And Jesus answered and said unto them , Elias truly shall first come , and restore all things .
text2: Me xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Twutzx teˈ . Ate Elías tuˈntaq tul nej , tuˈntzintla noq bˈinchil kytenxjal , aj wula .

text: But I say unto you , That Elias is come already , and they knew him not , but have done unto him whatsoever they listed . Likewise shall also the Son of man suffer of them .
text2: Me kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , o tzul te Elías , me mi s ‑ el kynikyˈxjal te . Ex ma tzikyˈx tuˈn , tzeˈnkuxtaq kyajxjal tiˈj . Exsin ikyx wejiˈy , a ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , nimx kkyˈelix wuˈn toj kyqˈobˈxjal .

text: Then the disciples understood that he spake unto them of John the Baptist .
text2: Bˈeˈxsin el kynikyˈtzjo t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin te , qa tiˈjtaq Juan , a Jawsil Aˈ , nyoline Jesús .

text: And when they were come to the multitude , there came to him a certain man , kneeling down to him , and saying ,
text2: Tej kymeltzˈaj twiˈ wutz , i pon jaˈ iteˈtaq txqan xjal . Ex tzaj laqˈe jun ichin tkˈatz Jesús , ex kubˈ meje twutz , ex xi tqˈmaˈn te :

text: Lord , have mercy on my son : for he is lunatick , and sore vexed : for ofttimes he falleth into the fire , and oft into the water .
text2: Tata , qˈaqˈintz tkˈuˈja tiˈj nkˈwala . Quˈn atku ntzaj luˈlin tiˈj , tuˈn jun taqˈnil tajaw il , ex nimx kyixkˈoj ma tzikyˈx tuˈn . Ilaˈku maj o txi lankˈaj tuˈn toj qˈaqˈ ex toj aˈ .

text: And I brought him to thy disciples , and they could not cure him .
text2: Ma tzul win wetza kywutz t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈiˈn , me mi ma qˈanit ‑ x kyuˈn .

text: Then Jesus answered and said , O faithless and perverse generation , how long shall I be with you ? how long shall I suffer you ? bring him hither to me .
text2: Me tzaj ttzaqˈwin Jesús qeˈy , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin : ¡ Ay ! tal xjal ntiˈx kynimbˈila , ex ntiˈx kyumila . ¿ Jteˈxsin qˈij nkubˈlin teˈn kyxola ? ¿ Ex jteˈxsin qˈij kkyˈelix wuˈn kyukˈiy ? Kyintzinjiˈy qˈa tzaluˈn , chiˈ .

text: And Jesus rebuked the devil ; and he departed out of him : and the child was cured from that very hour .
text2: Bˈeˈxsin ok tilin Jesúsjo taqˈnil tajaw il , ex bˈeˈx etz tlajoˈn toj tanminjo qˈa , ex texjo tqan tel weˈ .

text: Then came the disciples to Jesus apart , and said , Why could not we cast him out ?
text2: Atzaj teˈ tok qchmon qibˈa qjunalxa , exsin xi qqanintza te Jesús : ¿ Tiquˈn mi xbˈant qe qlajoˈn teˈ taqˈnil tajaw il toj tanminjo qˈa ?

text: And Jesus said unto them , Because of your unbelief : for verily I say unto you , If ye have faith as a grain of mustard seed , ye shall say unto this mountain , Remove hence to yonder place ; and it shall remove ; and nothing shall be impossible unto you .
text2: Tzaj ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Quˈn tuˈntziˈn noq chˈin kynimbˈila wiˈja . Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , noqit at kynimbˈila wiˈja iˈchaqxpetla kyintzjo tzeˈnku jun tal twutz mistas , akutla txi kyqˈmaˈn te wutz lo : Ku tela tzaluˈn , ex ku txiˈy tzachiˈn . Ex bˈeˈxitla aku tzikyˈ . Quˈn ntiˈxitla jun tiˈ nlay bˈant kyuˈn , noqit at kynimbˈila wiˈja .

text: Howbeit this kind goeth not out but by prayer and fasting .
text2: Me aye wiq taqˈnil tajaw il lo nlay chi ex noq tuˈn kukxjo , qalaˈ il tiˈj tuˈn tkubˈ kypaˈn waˈyaj toj naˈj Dios .

text: And while they abode in Galilee , Jesus said unto them , The Son of man shall be betrayed into the hands of men :
text2: Qikyˈlinxiˈy antza , ex nqo bˈettaqa junx toj txˈotxˈ te Galiley , tzaj tqˈmaˈn Jesús qeˈy : Ayiˈn , a Tkˈwal Ichin , kchin xel kˈayiˈn kyexjal

text: And they shall kill him , and the third day he shall be raised again . And they were exceeding sorry .
text2: tuˈn nkubˈ bˈyoˈn . Me tbˈajlinxi oxe qˈij nkyimliˈn , kchin jawil anqˈiˈn juntl majla kyxol kyimnin . Tej qbˈintiy tqanil ikyjo , bˈeˈx o jaw bˈisiˈn .

text: And when they were come to Capernaum , they that received tribute money came to Peter , and said , Doth not your master pay tribute ?
text2: Atzaj teˈ qkaniˈn junx tukˈa Jesús toj tnam Capernaum , ayetziˈn peyil pwaq te ja te naˈbˈl Dios i tzaj laqˈe tkˈatz Pegr , ex xi kyqanin te : ¿ Ma mitzin nchojiˈn t ‑ xnaqˈtzila pwaq te mojbˈil toj qja te naˈbˈl Dios ?

text: He saith , Yes . And when he was come into the house , Jesus prevented him , saying , What thinkest thou , Simon ? of whom do the kings of the earth take custom or tribute ? of their own children , or of strangers ?
text2: Tzun , chi Pegr . Atzaj teˈ tokx Pegr tuja , jaˈ taˈtaq Jesús , ok tyolin Jesús nej , ex xi tqanin te : Ay Simun , ¿ Tiˈtzin chˈin te ntqˈmaˈn ? Aye kawil tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ kukx nchi peyin pwaq te mojbˈil . ¿ Me altzila kye qe nchi chojin ? ¿ Ayepelaˈ kykˈwalku , mo qa ayeˈ noq xjalqexa ?

text: Peter saith unto him , Of strangers . Jesus saith unto him , Then are the children free .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Pegr : Ayeˈ jniˈ noq xjalqexa , chi Pegr . Ex xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús te : ¡ Ikytziˈn ! Quˈn ayetziˈn kˈwalbˈaj ntiˈ kykˈas twutz kawil . Ikytzintlaˈ qetz ntiˈtla tuˈn qchojinqe pwaq te mojbˈil tiˈj ja te naˈbˈl Dios , quˈn Tkˈwal Diosqo .

text: Notwithstanding , lest we should offend them , go thou to the sea , and cast an hook , and take up the fish that first cometh up ; and when thou hast opened his mouth , thou shalt find a piece of money : that take , and give unto them for me and thee .
text2: Me noq tuˈn mi tzajeku kyqˈoj , okla qo chojil . Tuˈnpetziˈn , ku txiˈy toj nijabˈ . Kˈaˈ kux t ‑ xonjiˈy bˈaq te tzuybˈil kyiẍ . Atzin tnejil kyiẍ ktzyetil tuˈn , kˈaˈ kux tjyoˈn toj ttzi , ex kjyetil jun pwaq tuˈn antza . Kˈaˈ txi tiˈn te chojbˈil te weˈ ex tey , quˈn atzin pwaq kˈaˈ tzˈajbˈin te qkabˈil .

text: At the same time came the disciples unto Jesus , saying , Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven ?
text2: Tojxjo maj anetziˈn , o tzaj laqˈeˈy , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , tkˈatz Jesús , ex xi qqaniˈn te : ¿ Ankyexixtl nim toklin toj Tkawbˈil Dios toj kyaˈj ?

text: And Jesus called a little child unto him , and set him in the midst of them ,
text2: Tzaj ttxkoˈn Jesús jun tal kˈwal , ex kubˈ twaˈbˈin qxola ,

text: And said , Verily I say unto you , Except ye be converted , and become as little children , ye shall not enter into the kingdom of heaven .
text2: ex tzaj tqˈmaˈn : Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , qa mi s ‑ ok kyanmiˈn tzeˈn tanminjo tal kˈwal lo , a manyor tal mutxin , nlayxpen chi okxtza toj Tkawbˈil Dios toj kyaˈj .

text: Whosoever therefore shall humble himself as this little child , the same is greatest in the kingdom of heaven .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , atzin te nim tokliˈn toj Tkawbˈil Dios , a kˈwel tmutxsin tibˈ tzeˈnku tal kˈwal lo .

text: And whoso shall receive one such little child in my name receiveth me .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , ankye kxel kˈmonte jun tal kˈwal tzeˈnku lo , noq tuˈn tnimbˈil tiˈj nbˈiˈy , nyakuj ayiˈn kchin xel tkˈmoˈn .

text: But whoso shall offend one of these little ones which believe in me , it were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck , and that he were drowned in the depth of the sea .
text2: Noq alkye jun xjal ntjyoˈn tumil tzeˈn tten , tuˈn tel tpaˈn jun tal kˈwal tibˈ tiˈj tnimbˈil wiˈja , junxpetla tzˈele te te , tuˈn tok kˈlet jun ma tij abˈj te chebˈl triy tiˈj tqul , ex tuˈn t ‑ xi t ‑ xoˈn tibˈ toj aˈ , tuˈn tkyim te jun majx , tzeˈnkuljo tuˈn tokx toj paˈbˈin twutz Dios tukˈaˈ til ikyjo .

text: Woe unto the world because of offences ! for it must needs be that offences come ; but woe to that man by whom the offence cometh !
text2: ¡ Ay ! Ntiˈx kyajbˈin xjal aj il twutz txˈotxˈ , a ipbˈilxix iteˈke tuˈn kykubˈ tzˈaq txqantl toj il . Kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , kukx at te iljo tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , me nim bˈisbˈajil texjal , a tzunx nlabˈte kyiˈjjo txqantl , tuˈn kykubˈ tzˈaq toj il .

text: Wherefore if thy hand or thy foot offend thee , cut them off , and cast them from thee : it is better for thee to enter into life halt or maimed , rather than having two hands or two feet to be cast into everlasting fire .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , qa noq tuˈn tpaj jun tqˈobˈa mo jun tqan , aku kubˈ tzˈaqiy toj il , bˈantla tuˈn tel ttxˈemiˈn , ex qˈimila toj tkˈuˈja te jun majx . Quˈn wenitla tuˈn tokxa toj kyaˈj noq tukˈa jun tqˈobˈa mo jun tqan , tzeˈnkul teˈ , tuˈn t ‑ xiˈy kyukˈa kykabˈil toj qˈaqˈ .

text: And if thine eye offend thee , pluck it out , and cast it from thee : it is better for thee to enter into life with one eye , rather than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire .
text2: Ex qa noq tuˈn tpaj tbˈaqˈ twutza aku kubˈ tzˈaqiy toj il , qˈimitza , ex qˈimila toj tkˈuˈja te jun majx . Quˈn bˈantla tuˈn tokxa toj kyaˈj noq tukˈa jun twutza , tzeˈnkul teˈ , tuˈn txiˈy kyukˈa kykabˈil toj qˈaqˈ , a mixla k ‑ yupjilx .

text: Take heed that ye despise not one of these little ones ; for I say unto you , That in heaven their angels do always behold the face of my Father which is in heaven .
text2: Mi chi el kyikyˈinjiˈy tal muchˈqe lo . Quˈn twutzx kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , loqe ky ‑ angel majx iteˈ yolil kyiˈj twutz nMaˈn toj kyaˈj .

text: For the Son of man is come to save that which was lost .
text2: Ex ayiˈn , a Tkˈwal Ichin , skˈoˈnxix tuˈn Dios , ma chin ula kolil kyiˈjjo tal kˈwal , ex kyiˈjjo a otaq chi naj toj il .

text: How think ye ? if a man have an hundred sheep , and one of them be gone astray , doth he not leave the ninety and nine , and goeth into the mountains , and seeketh that which is gone astray ?
text2: ¿ Tzeˈntzin chˈin kye toj kywutz ? Qa at jun xjal at jweˈ kˈal trit , ex qa ma kyij naj jun , ¿ Ma nyapela kchi kyjel tqˈoˈn bˈeljajlajaj toj jweˈ kˈal twiˈ wutz , exsin kxeˈltz jyol teˈ a otaq kyij naj ?

text: And if so be that he find it , verily I say unto you , he rejoiceth more of that sheep , than of the ninety and nine which went not astray .
text2: Exsin qa aku xknet tuˈn , twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , maˈxla tzalajx tiˈjjo jun tzeˈnqekuljo bˈeljajlajaj toj jweˈ kˈal , a mi ẍi kyij naj .

text: Even so it is not the will of your Father which is in heaven , that one of these little ones should perish .
text2: Ikytziˈn te kyTatajiˈy , a at toj kyaˈj . Nya taj tuˈn tnaj jun kyeˈ , exla qa jun tal muchˈ kˈwal tzeˈnku lo .

text: Moreover if thy brother shall trespass against thee , go and tell him his fault between thee and him alone : if he shall hear thee , thou hast gained thy brother .
text2: Qa ma kubˈ tbˈinchin jun nimil jun tiˈ tiˈja , a nya bˈaˈn , ku txiˈy yolil tukˈa tjunalx . Qˈmanxa te , tiˈ xbˈajte tiˈja . Qatzin qa ma kubˈ tbˈiˈntz , atpenl kymujbˈil kyibˈtza tukˈa juntl majl .

text: But if he will not hear thee , then take with thee one or two more , that in the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established .
text2: Me qatzin qa mi xkubˈ tbˈiˈnxtz , kˈleˈnx juntl tukˈiy mo kabˈetl , tuˈntzin kyok te tstiyil , quˈn ikyxjo ntqˈmaˈn toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios , qa il tiˈj tuˈn kyok kabˈe mo oxe tstiyil , tuˈntzin kywutzku kbˈajileˈ yol .

text: And if he shall neglect to hear them , tell it unto the church : but if he neglect to hear the church , let him be unto thee as an heathen man and a publican .
text2: Qatzin ikyxl xbˈantjo tuˈn , qˈmaˈnxa te tkyaqil Ttanim Dios . Ex qa mi xkubˈ tbˈiˈnx kyyol tkyaqil Ttanim Dios , kyqˈonka tzeˈnku jun nya nimil , mo tzeˈnku jun peyil pwaq , a iˈjlemil kyuˈnxjal .

text: Verily I say unto you , Whatsoever ye shall bind on earth shall be bound in heaven : and whatsoever ye shall loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven .
text2: Ex twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , qa ma kotpitjo xjal tuˈn toj kyil , noq tuˈn ktqˈmaˈbˈila tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , ex aj kyok toj paˈbˈin twutz Dios toj kyaˈj , kchi kotpajil te jun majx . Ex qa mi xi kynimin a ktqˈmaˈbˈila , ma chi kˈlet tuˈn kyil tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , ex aj kyok toj paˈbˈin twutz Dios toj kyaˈj , kchi xel toj najin te jun majx .

text: Again I say unto you , That if two of you shall agree on earth as touching any thing that they shall ask , it shall be done for them of my Father which is in heaven .
text2: Ex ikyxjo kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , qa at kabˈe kye tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , xbˈant tiˈj tuˈn , tuˈn t ‑ xi kyqanin te nTatiˈy toj naˈj Dios jun tiˈ , aˈlchaqx kye kyajtza , ex ktzajil qˈoˈn kyeˈy tuˈn .

text: For where two or three are gathered together in my name , there am I in the midst of them .
text2: Quˈn jaˈ nkychmome kabˈe mo oxej kyibˈ tiˈj tumil nbˈiˈy , loqiˈn intin kyxol , chi Jesús .

text: Then came Peter to him , and said , Lord , how oft shall my brother sin against me , and I forgive him ? till seven times ?
text2: Atzin te Pegr xi laqˈe , ex xi tqanin te Jesús : WAjaw , ¿ Jteˈ maj kˈwel nnajsin til jun wukˈiy , qa ma kubˈ tbˈinchin jun nya wen wiˈja ? ¿ Ma noqpela wuq maj ?

text: Jesus saith unto him , I say not unto thee , Until seven times : but , Until seventy times seven .
text2: Me xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús te : Nya noq oˈkxjo wuq maj , qalaˈ wuq majjo lajaj toj jun mutxˈ .

text: Therefore is the kingdom of heaven likened unto a certain king , which would take account of his servants .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , a Tkawbˈil Dios toj kyaˈj , ikytziˈn tzeˈnku jun kawil tajtaq tuˈn tpeyin kykˈas taqˈnil .

text: And when he had begun to reckon , one was brought unto him , which owed him ten thousand talents .
text2: Atzaj teˈ tok ten bˈinchilte lo , attaq jun , ma ninxtaq txqan tkˈas .

text: But forasmuch as he had not to pay , his lord commanded him to be sold , and his wife , and children , and all that he had , and payment to be made .
text2: Me ntiˈtaqx tumil tzeˈn tten tuˈn tchjet tuˈn . Atziˈn kubˈ tbˈisin tajaw kˈas , tuˈn t ‑ xi kˈayit te aqˈnil te jun majx kyexjal , me tukˈax t ‑ xuˈjil ex kyukˈax tkˈwal ex tkyaqiljo jniˈ attaq te , tuˈntzintla tchjetjo tkˈas .

text: The servant therefore fell down , and worshipped him , saying , Lord , have patience with me , and I will pay thee all .
text2: Me atziˈn aqˈnil kubˈ meje twutz kawil , ex ja kubˈsin twutz te : Tata , qˈaqˈintz tkˈuˈja wiˈja . Ok chjetil weˈ wuˈn tkyaqilx , noq tuˈn chebˈeku .

text: Then the lord of that servant was moved with compassion , and loosed him , and forgave him the debt .
text2: Bˈeˈx tzaj qˈaqˈin tkˈuˈj kawil tiˈj , ex bˈeˈx kubˈ tnajsin tkˈas te jun majx ; ex bˈeˈx xi ttzaqpiˈn .

text: But the same servant went out , and found one of his fellowservants , which owed him an hundred pence : and he laid hands on him , and took him by the throat , saying , Pay me that thou owest .
text2: Me aˈkxtaq tetzjo aqˈnil , tej tel knet jun tukˈa tuˈn , a kˈasbˈinintaq twutz noq jun tal jteˈbˈin pwaq . Me tzaj ttzyuˈn tukˈa tqul , ex ok tẍpoˈn , ex xi tqˈmaˈn te : Chjomjiy tkˈasa weˈy .

text: And his fellowservant fell down at his feet , and besought him , saying , Have patience with me , and I will pay thee all .
text2: Me antej kˈasbˈine kubˈ meje , ex ja kubˈsin twutz te : Qˈaqˈintz tkˈuˈja wiˈja . Ok chjetil weˈ wuˈn tkyaqilx , noq tuˈn chebˈeku .

text: And he would not : but went and cast him into prison , till he should pay the debt .
text2: Me mix ttziye ikyjo . Bˈeˈx xiku tiˈn , tuˈn tkux jpet toj tze , tzmaxi tuˈn tjatzjo , ajxi tchjet tuˈn tkyaqil .

text: So when his fellowservants saw what was done , they were very sorry , and came and told unto their lord all that was done .
text2: Tej tok kykaˈyin txqantl aqˈnil ikyjo , bˈeˈx tzaj chyoˈn kyanmin tiˈj . Bˈeˈx i xiˈ qˈmalte te kawil tkyaqiljo otaq bˈaj .

text: Then his lord , after that he had called him , said unto him , O thou wicked servant , I forgave thee all that debt , because thou desiredst me :
text2: Bˈeˈxsin xi tqˈmaˈn kawil , tuˈn ttzaj txketjo tnejil aqˈnil , ex xi tqˈmaˈn te : Ay aqˈnil manyor aj ilxa . Ma kubˈ nnajsin weˈ tkyaqil tkˈasa , noq tuˈn xkubˈ mejey nwutza .

text: Shouldest not thou also have had compassion on thy fellowservant , even as I had pity on thee ?
text2: Ikytzintla tejiy matla tzaj qˈaqˈin tkˈuˈja tiˈj tukˈiy , tzeˈnku weˈ saj qˈaqˈin nkˈuˈja tiˈja .

text: And his lord was wroth , and delivered him to the tormentors , till he should pay all that was due unto him .
text2: Bˈeˈx tzajx txqan tqˈojjo kawil tiˈj , ex xi tqˈmaˈn , tuˈn t ‑ xi qˈoˈn toj kyqˈobˈjo xqˈuqil tze , ex tuˈn tbˈaj bˈyoˈn , ex tzmaxi tuˈn tjatzjo , aj tchjet tkˈas tkyaqil .

text: So likewise shall my heavenly Father do also unto you , if ye from your hearts forgive not every one his brother their trespasses .
text2: Atzaj teˈ tbˈaj yolin Jesús tiˈjjo techil lo , xi tqˈmaˈn : Ikytziˈn kchi tenbˈilajiˈy tuˈn nTatiˈy toj kyaˈj , qa mina xkubˈ kynajsiˈn til jun kyukˈiy tukˈa tkyaqil kyanmiˈn .

text: And it came to pass , that when Jesus had finished these sayings , he departed from Galilee , and came into the coasts of Judaea beyond Jordan ;
text2: Tej tbˈaj tqˈmaˈn Jesúsjo yol lo , bˈeˈx etz toj txˈotxˈ Galiley , tuˈn tkanin toj txˈotxˈ Judey , jlajxi Nim Aˈ Jordán .

text: And great multitudes followed him ; and he healed them there .
text2: Nimku xjal ok lipe tiˈj , ex antza i qˈanite nim yabˈ tuˈn .

text: The Pharisees also came unto him , tempting him , and saying unto him , Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife for every cause ?
text2: Ex at junjun Parisey tzaj laqˈe tkˈatz Jesús , noq tuˈn tkubˈ tzˈaq kyuˈn toj til . Xi kyqanin te : ¿ Wenpetzila tuˈn tkubˈ tpaˈn jun ichin tibˈ tukˈa t ‑ xuˈjil , qa noq tiˈ s ‑ etza til ?

text: And he answered and said unto them , Have ye not read , that he which made them at the beginning made them male and female ,
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : ¿ Ma naˈmxsin tkux kyuˈjiˈn toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios , qa te tnejil , kubˈ tbˈinchin Dios ichin ex qya ?

text: And said , For this cause shall a man leave father and mother , and shall cleave to his wife : and they twain shall be one flesh ?
text2: Ex ikyxjo tqˈma : Tuˈnpetziˈn , kyjel ttzaqpiˈn te ichin ttata ex tnana , noq tuˈn tok meje tukˈa t ‑ xuˈjil . Ex kykabˈilx kchi okil te junchˈin .

text: Wherefore they are no more twain , but one flesh . What therefore God hath joined together , let not man put asunder .
text2: Nya kabˈel kyten , qalaˈ junchˈin . Tuˈnpetziˈn , nlay tzˈel tpaˈn te xjaljo , a s ‑ ok tmujbˈin Dios .

text: They say unto him , Why did Moses then command to give a writing of divorcement , and to put her away ?
text2: Xi kyqanin juntl majl : ¿ Tzeˈntzin tten te Moiséstz ttziye , tuˈn t ‑ xiˈ jun uˈj te qya , jaˈ ntqˈmaˈne qa o paˈyit tukˈa tchmil ?

text: He saith unto them , Moses because of the hardness of your hearts suffered you to put away your wives : but from the beginning it was not so .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Noq tuˈn tpajjo manyor kujx kyanmiˈn ja xi ttziyin Moisés , tuˈn tkubˈ tpaˈn ichin tibˈ tukˈa t ‑ xuˈjil . Me me teˈ te tnejil , nya iky teˈ tten .

text: And I say unto you , Whosoever shall put away his wife , except it be for fornication , and shall marry another , committeth adultery : and whoso marrieth her which is put away doth commit adultery .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , qa ma kubˈ tpaˈn ichin tibˈ tukˈa t ‑ xuˈjil , qa nya noq tuˈn tpaj kyˈaˈjin tuˈn qya , exsin qa ma tzˈok meje tukˈa juntl , ma tzˈok aj kyˈaˈjil . Ex ankye k ‑ okil meje tukˈa qya , a o tzˈel lajoˈn tuˈn tchmil , ex ikyxjo , k ‑ okil aj kyˈaˈjil .

text: His disciples say unto him , If the case of the man be so with his wife , it is not good to marry .
text2: Me awotzin qeˈ , a t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin xi qqˈmaˈn : Qa iky tten jun ichin tukˈa t ‑ xuˈjiltz , bˈaˈnpetlatz tuˈn mi mejeye ichin .

text: But he said unto them , All men cannot receive this saying , save they to whom it is given .
text2: Me ante Jesús tzaj tqˈmaˈn qeˈy : Nya tkyaqilx ma tzaj qˈoˈn toklin tuˈn mi mejeye ; qalaˈ oˈkqexjo ma tzaj tqˈoˈn Dios kyoklin ikyjo .

text: For there are some eunuchs , which were so born from their mother ' s womb : and there are some eunuchs , which were made eunuchs of men : and there be eunuchs , which have made themselves eunuchs for the kingdom of heaven ' s sake . He that is able to receive it , let him receive it .
text2: Quˈn ilaˈku tumil , tiquˈn nlay meje jun ichin : At junjun , titzˈjlinxjo ikyjo ; at junjuntl noq kyuˈnxjal ; ex at junjuntl ma txi kyqˈoˈn kyibˈ , tuˈn mi chi mejeye noq tuˈn tpajjo ma txi kyqˈoˈnx kyibˈ tukˈa tkyaqil kyanmin toj aqˈuntl te Tkawbˈil Dios , a at toj kyaˈj . Qa at jun aku bˈantjo ikyjo tuˈn , bˈaˈn tuˈn tkubˈ tbˈinchin .

text: Then were there brought unto him little children , that he should put his hands on them , and pray : and the disciples rebuked them .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , i bˈaj tzaj kyiˈnxjal junjun tal kˈwal tkˈatz Jesús , tuˈn tkubˈ tqˈoˈn tqˈobˈ kyibˈaj tuˈn kykubˈ tkyˈiwlin , ex tuˈn tnaˈn Dios kyiˈj . Me awotzin qeˈ , a t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , o ok teˈn yisol kyeˈ , a i tzaj qˈiˈn kyeˈ tal kˈwal .

text: But Jesus said , Suffer little children , and forbid them not , to come unto me : for of such is the kingdom of heaven .
text2: Me tzaj tqˈmaˈn Jesús qeˈy : Kytzaqpinqetzjiˈy tal kˈwal , tuˈn kybˈaj tzaj laqˈe nkˈatza . Mi chi kubˈ kymeqoˈn , quˈn kykyaqiljo kˈwel kymutxsin kyibˈ tzeˈnqe tal kˈwal lo , ayepen kye kchi okixjo toj Tkawbˈil Dios .

text: And he laid his hands on them , and departed thence .
text2: Tej tbˈaj tkyˈiwlin Jesúsjo tal kˈwal , bˈeˈx ex tojjo txˈotxˈ antza .

text: And , behold , one came and said unto him , Good Master , what good thing shall I do , that I may have eternal life ?
text2: Tej t ‑ xiˈ Jesús qukˈiy , ul kanin jun kuˈxin tkˈatz , ex xi tqanin te : Ay , xnaqˈtzil wenxixa , ¿ Tiˈn kˈwel nbˈinchiˈn , tuˈn nkanbˈintejiy chwinqil te jun majx ?

text: And he said unto him , Why callest thou me good ? there is none good but one , that is , God : but if thou wilt enter into life , keep the commandments .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : ¿ Tiquˈn ntzaj tqˈmaˈn qa wenqiˈn ? Ntiˈx jun te xjal wen tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , qalaˈ oˈkx te Dios . Me qa taja tuˈn tten tchwinqila te jun majx , niminqekutzinjiy ojtxe kawbˈil .

text: He saith unto him , Which ? Jesus said , Thou shalt do no murder , Thou shalt not commit adultery , Thou shalt not steal , Thou shalt not bear false witness ,
text2: Ex xi ttzaqˈwin qˈinin : ¿ Me ankyeqe kawbˈil ? Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús te : Mi bˈiyin . Mi kyˈaˈjin . Mi tzˈelqˈin . Mi jaw bˈant yol tiˈj jun aˈla noq kukxjo .

text: Honour thy father and thy mother : and , Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself .
text2: Niminkujiy ttatiy ex tnaniy . Ex kˈuˈjlinqekjiy tukˈiy tzeˈnkuxjo ntkˈuˈjlin te tibˈ .

text: The young man saith unto him , All these things have I kept from my youth up : what lack I yet ?
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn kuˈxin : Tkyaqilx teˈ anetziˈn o bˈant wuˈn . ¿ Tiˈtzin atx taj tuˈn tkubˈ nbˈinchiˈn ?

text: Jesus said unto him , If thou wilt be perfect , go and sell that thou hast , and give to the poor , and thou shalt have treasure in heaven : and come and follow me .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús te : Qa taja tuˈn toka tzˈaqlexix , ku txiˈy , ex kˈayinxjiy jniˈ at tey , ex oyinxjiy tpwaqa kye yaj . Ikytzin ktenbˈile tqˈinimiljiy toj kyaˈj . Exsin lipektza wiˈja .

text: But when the young man heard that saying , he went away sorrowful : for he had great possessions .
text2: Me atzaj teˈ tbˈinte kuˈxin ikyjo , jaw bˈisinx , quˈn tuˈn manyor qˈininxtaq ; ex bˈeˈx aj tja .

text: Then said Jesus unto his disciples , Verily I say unto you , That a rich man shall hardly enter into the kingdom of heaven .
text2: Ante Jesús tzaj tqˈmaˈn qeˈy : Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy : Kujx teˈ , tuˈn tokx jun qˈinin toj Tkawbˈil Dios .

text: And again I say unto you , It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle , than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Kxel nqˈmaˈn juntl majl kyeˈy : Jun paqxla aku tzˈex jun chej toj toyajil jun bˈaq te slepbˈil bˈuˈẍ , tzeˈnkul teˈ tuˈn tokx jun qˈinin toj Tkawbˈil Dios .

text: When his disciples heard it , they were exceedingly amazed , saying , Who then can be saved ?
text2: Atzaj teˈ qbˈintiy ikyjo , bˈeˈx o jaw kaˈylaja , ex xi qqaniˈn te : Qa nlay chi okx qˈinin toj kyaˈj , ¿ Yajtzilaˈ qetza ? ¿ Altzila kye k ‑ okixtz ?

text: But Jesus beheld them , and said unto them , With men this is impossible ; but with God all things are possible .
text2: O tzaj tkaˈyiˈn Jesús , ex tzaj tqˈmaˈn qeˈy : Nlay bˈant tuˈn kyklet ‑ xjal kyuˈnx kyibˈx . Me mete Dios kbˈantil teˈ tuˈn tkyaqil .

text: Then answered Peter and said unto him , Behold , we have forsaken all , and followed thee ; what shall we have therefore ?
text2: Me xi tqˈmaˈn Pegr te : Ma kyij qtzaqpiˈn qeˈ tkyaqiljo attaq qeˈy , ex ma qo ok lipeˈy tiˈja . ¿ Tiˈtzila qetza qkanbˈe ?

text: And Jesus said unto them , Verily I say unto you , That ye which have followed me , in the regeneration when the Son of man shall sit in the throne of his glory , ye also shall sit upon twelve thrones , judging the twelve tribes of Israel .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús : Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , toj tqˈijil , a jaˈ ktxˈixpitile tkyaqil , aj nkubˈ qey ayiˈn , a Tkˈwal Ichin , tibˈaj nqˈuqbˈila , tukˈa tkyaqil nqoptzˈajiyila , ex ayetzin kyeˈ , tuˈn ma chi ok lipeˈy wiˈja , ex kchi kˈwel qey kyibˈaj kabˈlajaj qˈuqbˈil , tuˈn kykawiˈn kyibˈaj kabˈlajaj chˈuq xjal te tyajil Israel .

text: And every one that hath forsaken houses , or brethren , or sisters , or father , or mother , or wife , or children , or lands , for my name ' s sake , shall receive an hundredfold , and shall inherit everlasting life .
text2: Ex kykyaqilxjo jniˈ ma kyij kytzaqpiˈn kyja , kyitzˈin , kyanebˈ , kytata , kynana , kyxuˈjil , mo kykˈwal , mo qa kytxˈotxˈj , noq tuˈn npaja , okpin kykanbˈil kyeˈ jweˈ kˈal maj kyxel tibˈaj tkyaqiljo anetziˈn , ex jun chwinqil te jun majx toj kyaˈj .

text: But many that are first shall be last ; and the last shall be first .
text2: Me nimx jaˈlin iteˈk te tnejil tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , me kchi kyjel te tchˈibˈil , qa ntiˈ kynimbˈil . Ex nimx ntiˈ kyoklin tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ jaˈlin , me kchi okil te tnejil noq tuˈn kynimbˈil .

text: For the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man that is an householder , which went out early in the morning to hire labourers into his vineyard .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús : A Tkawbˈil Dios toj kyaˈj , ikytziˈn tzeˈnku jun tajaw aqˈuntl ; xiˈ qlixje wen toj plas jyol taqˈnil , tuˈn kyxiˈ aqˈnil toj tqan uv .

text: And when he had agreed with the labourers for a penny a day , he sent them into his vineyard .
text2: I kyijku bˈant kyukˈa , tuˈn t ‑ xi chjet jun pwaq twiˈ kykˈuˈj junjun qˈij , exsin i xi tchqˈoˈntz tzma toj ttxˈotxˈ , tuˈn kyaqˈnin .

text: And he went out about the third hour , and saw others standing idle in the marketplace ,
text2: Tej t ‑ xiˈ tajaw aqˈuntl juntl majl , otaq tzˈok bˈeljaj or te qlixje , ex i ok tkaˈyin txqantl xjal iteˈtaq toj plas , ntiˈtaq kyaqˈin .

text: And said unto them ; Go ye also into the vineyard , and whatsoever is right I will give you . And they went their way .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn kye : Ikyqex kyejiˈy , ku kyxiˈy aqˈnil toj tqan wawala , ex kxel nchjoˈn twiˈ kykˈuˈja toj tumil tzˈaqle .

text: Again he went out about the sixth and ninth hour , and did likewise .
text2: Ex bˈeˈx i xiˈ kyej xjal aqˈnil . Ante tajaw aqˈuntl xiˈ juntl majl , te tok nikyˈjin qˈij , ex teˈ tok oxe or te qale , ex i bˈaj xi tchqˈoˈn txqantl aqˈnil toj aqˈuntl .

text: And about the eleventh hour he went out , and found others standing idle , and saith unto them , Why stand ye here all the day idle ?
text2: Atzaj teˈ tok jweˈ or te qale , xiˈ juntl majl toj plas . I knet junjuntl tuˈn antza , ntiˈ kyaqˈin , ex xi tqˈmaˈn kye : ¿ Tiquˈn iteˈy tzaluˈn , a ma tzˈex qˈij , ex ntiˈ chˈin ma chi aqˈniˈn ?

text: They say unto him , Because no man hath hired us . He saith unto them , Go ye also into the vineyard ; and whatsoever is right , that shall ye receive .
text2: Me ankyeˈ xjal xi kyqˈmaˈn : Quˈn mix aˈl jun ma tzaj qˈmante qaqˈiˈn . Ex xi tqˈmaˈn ichin kye : Ku kyxiˈy aqˈnil toj wawala , ex kˈaˈ txi nchjoˈn twiˈ kykˈuˈja toj tumil tzˈaqle .

text: So when even was come , the lord of the vineyard saith unto his steward , Call the labourers , and give them their hire , beginning from the last unto the first .
text2: Atzaj teˈ qok yupj , xi tqˈmaˈn tajaw aqˈuntl te nejinel kye aqˈnil : Txkonqetzjiy aqˈnil jaˈlin , ex chjonxa twiˈ kykˈuˈj . Antza xi xkyeye kyukˈa i pon qalexi , tuˈn tpon bˈaj kyukˈa i bˈaj kanin qlixje .

text: And when they came that were hired about the eleventh hour , they received every man a penny .
text2: I bˈaj tzaj laqˈe aye , a oˈkx jun or i aqˈnin , ex teyile junjun xi ttzyuˈn jun pwaq te twiˈ kykˈuˈj , nyakutlaj otaq tzˈex kyqˈij tuˈn kyaqˈnin .

text: But when the first came , they supposed that they should have received more ; and they likewise received every man a penny .
text2: Tej kybˈaj pon chojbˈaj kyeˈ , a bˈeˈx i bˈaj okx aqˈnin qlixje , kubˈ kybˈisin qa nimxixtaq chˈintl kypwaq tuˈn ttzaj kytzyuˈn , quˈn tuˈn bˈeˈx i okx aqˈnil liwey .

text: And when they had received it , they murmured against the goodman of the house ,
text2: Me atzaj teˈ tok kykaˈyin kyinxljo tzeˈnqekul kyeˈ , ayeˈ i ok aqˈnil yaj , bˈeˈx i bˈaj ja yolin kyxolile , ex xi kyqanin te tajaw aqˈuntl :

text: Saying , These last have wrought but one hour , and thou hast made them equal unto us , which have borne the burden and heat of the day .
text2: ¿ Tiˈn quˈn kyinx kyeˈ ẍi bˈaj ok aqˈnil yaj twiˈ kykˈuˈj s ‑ ex tzeˈnkuljo qe , exsin bˈeˈx xqo ok qeˈ qlixje , ex ma tzikyˈx aqˈuntl ex tqan qˈij quˈn ?

text: But he answered one of them , and said , Friend , I do thee no wrong : didst not thou agree with me for a penny ?
text2: Me ante tajaw aqˈuntl xi ttzaqˈwin : Ay , wukˈa , me ntiˈ jun weˈ nya bˈaˈn ma kubˈ nbˈinchiˈn kyiˈja . Quˈn ma qo kyijku kyukˈiy , tuˈn kyaqˈniˈn wukˈiy tuˈn jun tal pwaq jun qˈij .

text: Take that thine is , and go thy way : I will give unto this last , even as unto thee .
text2: Qalaˈ kytzyuˈnxjiˈy kypwaqa , ex kux chi ajxiy , quˈn waja tuˈn kyok nchjoˈnjiˈy ayeˈ yaj ẍi ul aqˈnil kyinxjo tzeˈnku kyeˈ .

text: Is it not lawful for me to do what I will with mine own ? Is thine eye evil , because I am good ?
text2: ¿ Ma ntiˈtzin weˈ woklin tiˈj npwaqa , tuˈn tkubˈ nbˈinchiˈn noq alqe wajiˈy ? ¿ Mo qa nloˈchj kyeˈ kykˈuˈj , tuˈn soˈjqiˈn ?

text: So the last shall be first , and the first last : for many be called , but few chosen .
text2: Ex xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús : Quˈn ikytziˈn , ayetziˈn ntiˈ kyoklin kywutzxjal tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , kchi okil te tnejil . Ex ayetziˈn iteˈk te tnejil jaˈlin , kchi okil te tchˈibˈil .

text: And Jesus going up to Jerusalem took the twelve disciples apart in the way , and said unto them ,
text2: Tej t ‑ xiˈ Jesús toj tbˈe tzma Jerusalén , o xi tkˈleˈn a awoˈy kabˈlajaj t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin qjunalxa , ex tzaj tqˈmaˈn qeˈy :

text: Behold , we go up to Jerusalem ; and the Son of man shall be betrayed unto the chief priests and unto the scribes , and they shall condemn him to death ,
text2: Ikytziˈn tzeˈnku n ‑ ok kykaˈyiˈn , chˈix qjapin Jerusalén , a jaˈ ayiˈn , a Tkˈwal Ichin , kchin xel kˈayiˈn kyeˈ kynejil kypale Judiy exsin kyeˈ xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil . Kyqˈmaˈbˈil qa ayiˈn at npaja , noq tuˈn nkubˈ bˈyoˈn .

text: And shall deliver him to the Gentiles to mock , and to scourge , and to crucify him : and the third day he shall rise again .
text2: Kchin kxel kyqˈoˈn toj kyqˈobˈjo nya aj Judiy , tuˈn wok xmayiˈn kyuˈn , tuˈn wok kylankˈiˈn , ex kchin kˈwel kybˈyoˈn twutz cruz . Me toj toxin qˈij , kchin jawil anqˈiˈntla .

text: Then came to him the mother of Zebedee ' s children with her sons , worshipping him , and desiring a certain thing of him .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , tzaj laqˈe tnana Santyaw ex Juan , ayeˈ tkˈwal Zebedey , tkˈatz Jesús junx kyukˈa tal , ex i kubˈ meje twutz , ex xi tqanin jun bˈaˈn kyiˈj tal .

text: And he said unto her , What wilt thou ? She saith unto him , Grant that these my two sons may sit , the one on thy right hand , and the other on the left , in thy kingdom .
text2: Xi tqanin Jesús te : ¿ Tiˈtzin tajach ? Ante qya xi ttzaqˈwin : Wajatlaˈy , tuˈn kykubˈ tqˈuqbˈin wala toj Tkawbˈila toj tman qˈobˈa ex juntl toj tẍnayaja kawil tukˈiy .

text: But Jesus answered and said , Ye know not what ye ask . Are ye able to drink of the cup that I shall drink of , and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with ? They say unto him , We are able .
text2: Me ante Jesús xi ttzaqˈwin : Mi n ‑ el kynikyˈa teˈ ntzaj kyqaniˈn weˈy . ¿ Ma akutzin tzikyˈx kyeˈ kyuˈn , tkyaqiljo jniˈ kkyˈelix wuˈn ? Ex xi kyqˈmaˈn Santyaw tukˈax Juan te : Ok kkyˈelix qe quˈn .

text: And he saith unto them , Ye shall drink indeed of my cup , and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with : but to sit on my right hand , and on my left , is not mine to give , but it shall be given to them for whom it is prepared of my Father .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwinl Jesús kye : Twutzx teˈ , akula tzikyˈx kye kyuˈn tzeˈnku weˈ kkyˈelix wuˈn , me atzin tuˈn tkubˈ qe jun kyeˈ toj nman qˈobˈa ex juntl toj nẍnayaja kawil wukˈiy , nyaqin weˈ tiˈj teˈ ; qalaˈ a nMaˈn , quˈn oˈkxte ojtzqilte ex bˈilte alqe kxele tqˈoˈne .

text: And when the ten heard it , they were moved with indignation against the two brethren .
text2: Atzaj teˈ qbˈintiy , awoˈy lajajtl t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin ikyjo , bˈeˈx tzaj qqˈoja kyiˈjjo kabˈel kyitzˈin kyibˈ .

text: But Jesus called them unto him , and said , Ye know that the princes of the Gentiles exercise dominion over them , and they that are great exercise authority upon them .
text2: Me o xi ttxkoˈn Jesús , ex tzaj tqˈmaˈn qeˈy : Ojtzqiˈnl kyeˈ kyuˈn tzeˈn kytenxjal nya nimil ; quˈn ayetziˈn tnejil kawil , qa tiˈx jun tiˈ , manyor txˈuˈjqex tukˈa kykawbˈil , quˈn nyakuj etzinqe kyuˈn .

text: But it shall not be so among you : but whosoever will be great among you , let him be your minister ;
text2: Me atzin kyxola , nya iky teˈ . Qalaˈ ankye teˈ taj tuˈn tok te nim toklin kyxola , il tiˈj tuˈn tajbˈin kye txqantl .

text: And whosoever will be chief among you , let him be your servant :
text2: Ex ankye taj tuˈn tok te tnejil , il tiˈj tuˈn tok tzeˈnku jun aqˈnil te jun majx kye txqantl .

text: Even as the Son of man came not to be ministered unto , but to minister , and to give his life a ransom for many .
text2: Quˈn ikytziˈn tzeˈnku weˈ , ayiˈn , a Tkˈwal Ichin , mi ẍin ul weˈ tuˈn kyajbˈinxjal weˈy ; qalaˈ ayin weˈ tuˈn wajbˈiˈn kye txqantl , ex tuˈn t ‑ xi nqˈoˈn nchwinqila te kyxel , tuˈn kyklet te jun majx .

text: And as they departed from Jericho , a great multitude followed him .
text2: Atzaj teˈ kyjaˈtaq qetza tukˈa Jesús toj tnam Jericó , nimku xjal ok lipe qiˈja .

text: And , behold , two blind men sitting by the way side , when they heard that Jesus passed by , cried out , saying , Have mercy on us , O Lord , thou Son of David .
text2: Ex attaq kabˈe moẍ qˈuqleqetaq ttzi bˈe . Tej kybˈinte tikyˈ Jesús antza , i jaw ẍchˈin : Tata , ay tyajil qtzan nmaq kawil David , qˈaqˈintz tkˈuˈja qiˈja , chi chiˈ .

text: And the multitude rebuked them , because they should hold their peace : but they cried the more , saying , Have mercy on us , O Lord , thou Son of David .
text2: Me bˈeˈx i ok iˈlin kyuˈn jniˈ xjal , tuˈn nchi ẍchˈin . Me ayetzin kyeˈ moẍ , noqx kyja i jawe ẍchˈin kujxix : Tata , ay tyajil qtzan nmaq kawil David , qˈaqˈintz tkˈuˈja qiˈja .

text: And Jesus stood still , and called them , and said , What will ye that I shall do unto you ?
text2: Bˈeˈx kubˈ weˈ Jesús , i tzaj ttxkoˈn moẍ , ex xi tqanin kye : ¿ Tiˈn kyaja tuˈn tok nbˈinchiˈn kyiˈja ?

text: They say unto him , Lord , that our eyes may be opened .
text2: Tzaj kytzaqˈwin moẍ te : Ay , Tata , qaja tuˈn kykaˈyiˈn qwutza , chi chiˈ .

text: So Jesus had compassion on them , and touched their eyes : and immediately their eyes received sight , and they followed him .
text2: Bˈeˈx tzaj qˈaqˈin tkˈuˈj Jesús kyiˈj , ex ok tmikoˈn kywutz . Ex texjo paq , tjqet kyej moẍ kywutz , ex bˈeˈx i ok lipe tiˈj Jesús .

text: And when they drew nigh unto Jerusalem , and were come to Bethphage , unto the mount of Olives , then sent Jesus two disciples ,
text2: Tej qkaniˈn tukˈa Jesús nqayin tkˈatz Jerusalén , o poˈn ttxaˈn jun kojbˈil Betfagé tbˈi , nqayin t ‑ xe wutz Olivos . Xi tchqˈoˈn Jesús kabˈe qxola ,

text: Saying unto them , Go into the village over against you , and straightway ye shall find an ass tied , and a colt with her : loose them , and bring them unto me .
text2: ex xi tqˈmaˈn kye : Ku kyxiˈy tojjo tal kojbˈil jlajxi . Antza kjyetila jun tal bur kyuˈn , kˈloˈn tukˈa tal tal . ¡ Kypjumila , exsin kyintza tzaluˈn !

text: And if any man say ought unto you , ye shall say , The Lord hath need of them ; and straightway he will send them .
text2: Ex qa at jun saj qaninte jun tiˈ kyeˈy : At tajbˈin te qAjaw , me jaˈlinx tzul quˈn , chichkujiˈy .

text: All this was done , that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet , saying ,
text2: Bˈajjo ikyjo , quˈn iltaq tiˈj tuˈn tjapin yol kyij ttzˈibˈin yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe , tej tqˈma :

text: Tell ye the daughter of Sion , Behold , thy King cometh unto thee , meek , and sitting upon an ass , and a colt the foal of an ass .
text2: Kyqˈmanxa kye xjal toj tnam Sion : Kykaˈyinxjiˈy Nmaq kyKawila tzul ; mutxin tten , ex qˈuqlekx tibˈaj jun tal bur , kˈleˈn tal tal .

text: And the disciples went , and did as Jesus commanded them ,
text2: Ayetziˈn t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin kubˈ kybˈinchin tzeˈnku xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye .

text: And brought the ass , and the colt , and put on them their clothes , and they set him thereon .
text2: Tzaj kyiˈn bur tukˈaxjo tal tal , bˈaj jax kyqˈoˈn kytxoˈw tibˈaj , exsin jax qe Jesús tibˈaj .

text: And a very great multitude spread their garments in the way ; others cut down branches from the trees , and strawed them in the way .
text2: Ex bˈaj kubˈ kylikyˈin xjal kytxoˈw toj tbˈe , ex txqantl tzaj toqinte t ‑ xaq tze , a palma tbˈi , ex bˈaj kubˈ kylikyˈin toj tbˈe tuˈn kytzaljbˈil .

text: And the multitudes that went before , and that followed , cried , saying , Hosanna to the Son of David : Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord ; Hosanna in the highest .
text2: Ex ayetziˈn jniˈ xjal nejninqetaq exqetziˈn lipcheqektaq tiˈj , i ok ten ẍchˈil : Nimxit tbˈiy , ay Tyajil qtzan nmaq kawil David . Kyˈiwlinxita a ay ma tzula toj tbˈi tAjaw Tkyaqil . Nimxitjo toklin tbˈiy toj tnajbˈila .

text: And when he was come into Jerusalem , all the city was moved , saying , Who is this ?
text2: Atzaj teˈ tokx Jesús toj Jerusalén , bˈeˈx i bˈaj jaw najxjal , ex nimx qˈmante : ¿ Ankye teˈ xjal lo ?

text: And the multitude said , This is Jesus the prophet of Nazareth of Galilee .
text2: Me xi kytzaqˈwin txqantl : Antej yolil Tyol Dios , a Jesús aj Nazaret , toj txˈotxˈ te Galiley .

text: And Jesus went into the temple of God , and cast out all them that sold and bought in the temple , and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers , and the seats of them that sold doves ,
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , okx Jesús toj tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , ex i bˈajetz tlajoˈn kykyaqiljo jniˈqe nchi bˈaj kˈayintaq exqetziˈn nchi bˈaj loqˈintaq antza . Ex i bˈaj jaw tpichˈkin jniˈ kymeẍjo jniˈqe nchi bˈaj txˈexbˈintaq kypwaqxjal , ex kykˈaybˈiljo jniˈqe nchi bˈaj kˈayintaq palom .

text: And said unto them , It is written , My house shall be called the house of prayer ; but ye have made it a den of thieves .
text2: Ex xi tqˈmaˈn kye : Tzˈibˈinl teˈ toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios : Atzin njaˈy k ‑ okil te ja te naˈbˈl Dios , me ayetzin kyeˈ ma tzˈok kyqˈoˈn te kyja ileqˈch .

text: And the blind and the lame came to him in the temple ; and he healed them .
text2: Ex tojxjo tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , i bˈaj tzaj laqˈe junjun moẍ ex kox tkˈatz Jesús , ex bˈeˈx i bˈaj kubˈ tqˈanin .

text: And when the chief priests and scribes saw the wonderful things that he did , and the children crying in the temple , and saying , Hosanna to the Son of David ; they were sore displeased ,
text2: Me tej tok kykaˈyiˈn nejinel kyxol pale , exqetziˈn jniˈ xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil , a jniˈ nimku techil tipin Jesús otaq bˈant , ex teˈ tok kybˈiˈn jniˈqe kˈwal nchi ẍchˈin toj tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios : Nimxit tbˈiy , ay Tyajil qtzan nmaq kawil David , bˈeˈx tzaj kyqˈoj ,

text: And said unto him , Hearest thou what these say ? And Jesus saith unto them , Yea ; have ye never read , Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings thou hast perfected praise ?
text2: ex xi kyqˈmaˈn te Jesús : ¿ Ma tzuntzin tbˈiˈnjiy nkyqˈmaˈn maˈ kˈwal tiˈja ? chi chiˈ . Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Tzuntzin . ¿ Ma naˈmxsin tkux kyuˈjiˈn toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios , a ntqˈmaˈn tiˈjjo lo kyjaluˈn : Ma tzaj tqˈmaˈn , tuˈn tjaw nimsin tbˈiy , tuˈn kybˈitzjo tal kˈwal , majxpe kyuˈn tzma qe nchi miˈẍin ?

text: And he left them , and went out of the city into Bethany ; and he lodged there .
text2: Ex bˈeˈx ex Jesús , i bˈaj kyij ttzaqpiˈn , ex xiˈ toj kojbˈil Betania , jaˈ ikyˈxi qnikyˈin tuˈn .

text: Now in the morning as he returned into the city , he hungered .
text2: Toj juntl qlixje , kyjaˈtaq qxiˈy Jerusalén , tzaj waˈyaj tiˈj Jesús .

text: And when he saw a fig tree in the way , he came to it , and found nothing thereon , but leaves only , and said unto it , Let no fruit grow on thee henceforward for ever . And presently the fig tree withered away .
text2: Ok tkaˈyin jun tqan iw ttzi bˈe , ex bˈeˈx xiˈ t ‑ xe tqan . Me ntiˈx jun twutzjo tze knet tuˈn , noq txqan t ‑ xaq . Tuˈntziˈn ikyjo , xi tqˈmaˈn te tqan iw : Mixla jtojx tuˈn tel twutza te kyloˈxjal . Ex antej tqan iw jun paqx jaw tzqij .

text: And when the disciples saw it , they marvelled , saying , How soon is the fig tree withered away !
text2: Atzaj teˈ tok qkaˈyiˈn noq tzqijl tej tze , xi qqaniˈn te Jesús : ¿ Tzeˈntzin tten teˈ tze jun paqx xjaw tzqij ? qo chijiˈy .

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , Verily I say unto you , If ye have faith , and doubt not , ye shall not only do this which is done to the fig tree , but also if ye shall say unto this mountain , Be thou removed , and be thou cast into the sea ; it shall be done .
text2: Tzaj ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , noqit at ‑ xix kynimbˈila , ex noqit mi njawje kykˈuˈja , nya noq oˈkxjo luˈn aku bˈant kyuˈn , tzeˈnku xbˈant wuˈn tiˈjjo tqan iw , qalaˈ noqit txi kyqˈmaˈn te wutz luˈn : Ku tela tzaluˈn , ex ku txiˈy toj ttxuyil aˈ , ex akula tzikyˈ .

text: And all things , whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer , believing , ye shall receive .
text2: Quˈn tkyaqiljo kxel kyqanin toj naˈj Dios tukˈa kynimbˈila , ok ktzajil qˈoˈn .

text: And when he was come into the temple , the chief priests and the elders of the people came unto him as he was teaching , and said , By what authority doest thou these things ? and who gave thee this authority ?
text2: Tej tokx Jesús toj tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , i pon laqˈe kynejil pale exqetziˈn kynejinel kyxolxjal aj Judiy , a tzmataq nxnaqˈtzintaq . Xi kyqanin te : ¿ Tiˈn tokiy tuˈn tbˈinchinjiy jniˈ lo , a nkubˈ tbˈinchiˈn ? ¿ Ex ankye saj qˈoˈnte tokliˈn ? chi chiˈ .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto them , I also will ask you one thing , which if ye tell me , I in like wise will tell you by what authority I do these things .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Ex ikyx wejiˈy , kxel nqaniˈn jun nxjelbˈitza kyeˈy .

text: The baptism of John , whence was it ? from heaven , or of men ? And they reasoned with themselves , saying , If we shall say , From heaven ; he will say unto us , Why did ye not then believe him ?
text2: ¿ Ankye tzaj chqˈoˈnte qtzan Juan tuˈn kykuˈxxjal tuˈn toj aˈ te jawsbˈil aˈ ? ¿ Apela Dios , mo noq ayexjal ? Bˈeˈx i bˈaj jaw yolin kyxolx , ex kyqˈma : Qa ma txi qqˈmaˈn a Dios , bˈeˈx ktzajil tqˈmaˈn qe , ¿ Tin quˈn mi nxi kynimintza ? chilaˈ .

text: But if we shall say , Of men ; we fear the people ; for all hold John as a prophet .
text2: Ex qa ma txi qqˈmaˈn qa xjal , at qxobˈil . ¿ Ma nyatzin kykyaqil xjaltz qˈmante qa a Juan jun yolil Tyol Dios ?

text: And they answered Jesus , and said , We cannot tell . And he said unto them , Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , xi kyqˈmaˈn : Mi bˈiˈn qe quˈn , chi chiˈ . I xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Exsin ikyx wejiˈy , nlay txi nqˈmaˈn weˈ , alkye saj qˈoˈnte wokliˈn tuˈn tkubˈ nbˈinchiˈn tkyaqiljo lo .

text: But what think ye ? A certain man had two sons ; and he came to the first , and said , Son , go work to day in my vineyard .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús : ¿ Tzeˈntzin chˈin kyeˈ toj kywutz ? Attaq jun ichin attaq kabˈe tkˈwal . Xi tqˈmaˈn te jun : Nkˈwal , maˈ txiˈy aqˈnil jaˈlin toj tqan uvch .

text: He answered and said , I will not : but afterward he repented , and went .
text2: Me mina , chi kˈwal . Me jun paqx tja tmeltzˈin tnabˈl , ex bˈeˈx xiˈl aqˈnil .

text: And he came to the second , and said likewise . And he answered and said , I go , sir : and went not .
text2: Atzaj teˈ t ‑ xiˈ lol teˈ juntl , ex ikyx xi tqˈmaˈn te : Kutzin tata . Kˈaˈ chiˈn chinaj teˈ , exsin mix xaˈyiltz .

text: Whether of them twain did the will of his father ? They say unto him , The first . Jesus saith unto them , Verily I say unto you , That the publicans and the harlots go into the kingdom of God before you .
text2: ¿ Ankyeˈ kubˈ nimin teˈ tajtaq manbˈaj kyxoljo kabˈe kˈwal lo ? Xi kyqˈmaˈn : A tnejil , chi chiˈ . Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye : Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy ; ayepe kyeˈ peyiltaq pwaq , ayeˈ iˈjlin kyuˈnxjal , exqetziˈn aj kyˈaˈjilqetaq kchi okix toj Tkawbˈil Dios toj kyaˈj , tuˈn kynimbˈil . ¿ Yajtzin kyetza ?

text: For John came unto you in the way of righteousness , and ye believed him not : but the publicans and the harlots believed him : and ye , when ye had seen it , repented not afterward , that ye might believe him .
text2: Quˈn tej tul Juan , a Jawsil Aˈ , qˈmalte tumil kyeˈy tzeˈn tuˈn kybˈetiˈy tzˈaqle , me mix xi kynimiˈn . Me ayetzinl kyeˈ , aye peyil pwaq exqetziˈn aj kyˈaˈjil ma txi kynimin . Me qalatzin kyeˈ , nixpela tuˈn ma kyliˈy tkyaqiljo lo , me mi s ‑ ajtz koˈpjx kyanmiˈn tuˈn txi kynimiˈn .

text: Hear another parable : There was a certain householder , which planted a vineyard , and hedged it round about , and digged a winepress in it , and built a tower , and let it out to husbandmen , and went into a far country :
text2: Ex xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús : Kybˈinkujiˈy juntl techil lo : Attaq jun tajaw txˈotxˈ ok tawin tqan uv . Ok tqˈoˈn jun chˈlaj tiˈjile , kubˈ tbˈinchin jun bˈinchbˈil taˈl uv , ex jaw twaˈbˈin jun xkyaqˈte te tzajbˈilte . I kyij bˈant kyukˈa jteˈbˈin aqˈnil tuˈn kymanin tiˈj , exsin xiˈtz toj jun tbˈe najchaq wen .

text: And when the time of the fruit drew near , he sent his servants to the husbandmen , that they might receive the fruits of it .
text2: Me atzaj teˈ tpon tqˈijil , jaˈ tuˈn tok chmete twutz awal , i xi tchqˈoˈn junjun taqˈnil qanil teˈ manbˈil ttxˈotxˈ .

text: And the husbandmen took his servants , and beat one , and killed another , and stoned another .
text2: Me ayetziˈn manil txˈotxˈ i ok lipin kyiˈjjo taqˈnil tajaw txˈotxˈ . Jun teˈ noq bˈaj kylankˈin , jun teˈ bˈeˈx kyim , ex jun teˈ noqx techx kyˈixbˈe tuˈn abˈj .

text: Again , he sent other servants more than the first : and they did unto them likewise .
text2: Tuˈn ikyjo , bˈeˈx i xi tchqˈoˈn txqantl taqˈnil tzeˈnku te tnejil . Me ikyx bˈajjo kyiˈj , tzeˈnkuˈ bˈaj kyiˈjjo tnejil kyuˈn manil txˈotxˈ .

text: But last of all he sent unto them his son , saying , They will reverence my son .
text2: Me kubˈ tbˈisin tajaw txˈotxˈ tuˈn t ‑ xi tchqˈoˈn a tkˈwalkuxix , quˈn kubˈ t ‑ ximin , nyapela kˈwel kynimin nkˈwalach .

text: But when the husbandmen saw the son , they said among themselves , This is the heir ; come , let us kill him , and let us seize on his inheritance .
text2: Me atzaj teˈ t ‑ xi kykaˈyiˈn manil txˈotxˈ , teˈ ttzaj kˈwalbˈaj , bˈeˈx i bˈaj ja yolin kyxolile : Ate luˈn kyjel te tajaw txˈotxˈ . Qalaˈ qbˈyonku , tuˈntzin qkyij te tajaw , chi chiˈ .

text: And they caught him , and cast him out of the vineyard , and slew him .
text2: Bˈeˈx tzaj kytzyuˈn , ex kyiˈn tzma ttxaˈn txˈotxˈ tuˈn tkubˈ kybˈyoˈn .

text: When the lord therefore of the vineyard cometh , what will he do unto those husbandmen ?
text2: Tuˈntzintzjo , xi tqanin Jesús kye : ¿ Yajtzilaˈ ? Aj tuljo tajaw txˈotxˈ , ¿ Tiˈtzila kbˈajil kyiˈjjo manil txˈotxˈ ?

text: They say unto him , He will miserably destroy those wicked men , and will let out his vineyard unto other husbandmen , which shall render him the fruits in their seasons .
text2: Ex xi kytzaqˈwin : Bˈalaqa kchi kˈwel tbˈyoˈn te jun majx . Ex bˈalaqa kxel tqˈoˈn ttxˈotxˈ te kymajin txqantl taqˈnil , ayeˈ chi chojil manbˈil txˈotxˈ tojxix tqˈijil .

text: Jesus saith unto them , Did ye never read in the scriptures , The stone which the builders rejected , the same is become the head of the corner : this is the Lord ' s doing , and it is marvellous in our eyes ?
text2: Ex xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús kye : ¿ Ma naˈmtzin tkux kyuˈjiˈn toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios , jaˈ ntqˈmaˈne kyjaluˈn : A abˈj , a xi kyxoˈn bˈinchil ja , a nyakuj ntiˈtaq tajbˈin , me axixpente abˈjjo ma tzˈokin te tqˈuqil tẍkyin ja , a nimxix toklin . Atziˈn tbˈanilxjo ma tzaj tqˈoˈn tAjaw Tkyaqil qe , ex ma qo jaw kaˈylajx tiˈj ?

text: Therefore say I unto you , The kingdom of God shall be taken from you , and given to a nation bringing forth the fruits thereof .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , k ‑ elil qˈiˈn Tkawbˈil Dios kyeˈy , ex kxel tqˈoˈn kyexjal , ayeˈ kˈwel kyyekˈiˈn tiˈj Tkawbˈil Dios toj kychwinqil .

text: And whosoever shall fall on this stone shall be broken : but on whomsoever it shall fall , it will grind him to powder .
text2: Ex atzin abˈj jun techil wiˈja . Ankye teˈ kˈwel t ‑ xoˈn tibˈ tibˈajjo abˈj , tuˈn tyuchˈj tuˈn ; axte kˈwel tyuchˈin tibˈ tibˈaj . Ex qa a abˈj xkubˈ tzˈaq tibˈaj jun aˈla te kawbˈil kujxix , bˈeˈx kˈwel quqix te jun majx .

text: And when the chief priests and Pharisees had heard his parables , they perceived that he spake of them .
text2: Me atzaj teˈ kybˈinte kynejil pale exqetziˈn Parisey , jniˈ techil bˈaj kubˈ tqˈoˈn Jesús , ex qa kyiˈjxtaq nyoline ,

text: But when they sought to lay hands on him , they feared the multitude , because they took him for a prophet .
text2: oktaq kytzyuˈn toj kywutz . Me bˈeˈx i tzaj xobˈ kyexjal , quˈn tuˈn otaq tzˈel kynikyˈxjal te qa a Jesús jun yolil Tyol Dios .

text: And Jesus answered and spake unto them again by parables , and said ,
text2: Ok tenl Jesús yolil juntl majl tukˈa techil , ex xi tqˈmaˈn :

text: The kingdom of heaven is like unto a certain king , which made a marriage for his son ,
text2: Atzin Tkawbˈil Dios toj kyaˈj , ikytziˈn tzeˈnku jun nmaq kawil kubˈ tikyˈsin jun nintz qˈij , tej tmeje tkˈwal .

text: And sent forth his servants to call them that were bidden to the wedding : and they would not come .
text2: I xi tsmaˈn taqˈnil txkolkye txqan txokenj . Me ayetzin kyeˈ xjal luˈn , mix i tzaje .

text: Again , he sent forth other servants , saying , Tell them which are bidden , Behold , I have prepared my dinner : my oxen and my fatlings are killed , and all things are ready : come unto the marriage .
text2: I xi tsmaˈn txqantl taqˈnil , ex xi tqˈmaˈn kye : Kyqˈmanxa kyeˈ txokenj , tuˈn kytzaj jaˈlinxix , quˈn ma bˈant te wabˈj : Ma chi kubˈ nbˈyoˈn nwakixa , ex ayeˈ waliˈn tbˈanilqex . Ex jotx noqx tkubˈ tkyaqil . Kux chi tzaja toj mejebˈlin , chichkujiˈy .

text: But they made light of it , and went their ways , one to his farm , another to his merchandise :
text2: Me ayetzin kyeˈ txokenj , mix xi kytziyine tuˈn kyxiˈ toj mejebˈlin . Jun teˈ bˈeˈx xiˈ lol ttxˈotxˈ ; juntl bˈeˈx xiˈ lol tkˈaẍjil .

text: And the remnant took his servants , and entreated them spitefully , and slew them .
text2: Ayetziˈn txqantl i bˈaj ok ten bˈyol kye taqˈnil nmaq kawil , ex majxpe i kubˈ kybˈyoˈn .

text: But when the king heard thereof , he was wroth : and he sent forth his armies , and destroyed those murderers , and burned up their city .
text2: Me bˈeˈx tzajx tqˈoj nmaq kawil , ex bˈeˈx bˈaj xi tchqˈoˈn xoˈl qˈaqˈ bˈyol kyeˈ bˈiyil , ex majx ok qˈoˈn tqˈaqˈiljo kytanim .

text: Then saith he to his servants , The wedding is ready , but they which were bidden were not worthy .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , xi tqˈmaˈn kye taqˈnil : Tkyaqilx noq tkubˈl . Me ayetzin kyeˈ txokenj kykyˈeˈ tuˈn kytzaj .

text: Go ye therefore into the highways , and as many as ye shall find , bid to the marriage .
text2: Ku kyxiˈ toj xkyˈich bˈe , ex kyojileˈ jniˈ nim bˈe toj tnam , ex kytxkonqetza aˈlchaqx kye xjaltz jaˈlin , tuˈn kytzaj toj mejebˈlin .

text: So those servants went out into the highways , and gathered together all as many as they found , both bad and good : and the wedding was furnished with guests .
text2: Bˈeˈxsin i bˈaj xiˈ aqˈniltz chmol kyeˈ jniˈ xjal kyojile jniˈ nim bˈe , tzeˈnchaqextz , exla qa wen , mo minaj , tzmaxitzin noj teˈ ma tij ja kyuˈn xjal .

text: And when the king came in to see the guests , he saw there a man which had not on a wedding garment :
text2: Me atzaj teˈ tokx te nmaq kawil kaˈyil kye txokenj , ok kyim tiˈj jun ichin , a tokxtaq , ntiˈtaq t ‑ xbˈalin iteˈk tzeˈnku toj jun mejebˈlin , tzeˈnqeku kyeˈ txqantl .

text: And he saith unto him , Friend , how camest thou in hither not having a wedding garment ? And he was speechless .
text2: Ex xi tqˈmaˈn te : Wukˈa , ¿ Tzeˈn tten s ‑ oktza tzaluˈn , kyukˈa t ‑ xbˈalin ikyjo ? chiˈ . Me ante xjal mix xaˈye yekche , noq tuˈn t ‑ xobˈil te nmaq kawil .

text: Then said the king to the servants , Bind him hand and foot , and take him away , and cast him into outer darkness ; there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth .
text2: Bˈeˈx xi tqˈmaˈn kawil kye aqˈnil nchi bˈaj bˈinchintaq meẍ te wabˈl : Kykˈlonqekuy tqan ex tqˈobˈ , ex kyqˈomixa tzma toj qxopin peˈn , a jaˈ okx k ‑ oqˈile , ex kchi juˈchˈile tste tuˈn nim kyixkˈoj .

text: For many are called , but few are chosen .
text2: Quˈn nimxte txokenj tojjo kolbˈil , me noqx jteˈbˈin kjawil skˈet , chi Jesús .

text: Then went the Pharisees , and took counsel how they might entangle him in his talk .
text2: Ayetziˈn Parisey i jaw yolin kyxolx tzeˈnxtaq jun tumil tuˈn tkubˈ tzˈaq Jesús kyuˈn toj til .

text: And they sent out unto him their disciples with the Herodians , saying , Master , we know that thou art true , and teachest the way of God in truth , neither carest thou for any man : for thou regardest not the person of men .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , xi kychqˈoˈn junjun kyukˈa , junx kyukˈa junjun xjal , ayeˈ lipcheqektaq tiˈj Herodes , exsin xi kyqˈmaˈntz te Jesús : Ay , xnaqˈtzil , noq samiˈy , bˈiˈn qe quˈn , qa nyolin te twutzxix , ex nxnaqˈtziˈn noq tiˈjjo tbˈeyil chwinqil tuˈn qxiˈ tukˈa qMan Dios . Ex nya noq lipcheka tiˈjjo nkyqˈmanxjal , ex mi nchi kubˈ tniminjiy aye nim kyoklin , quˈn toj twutza , junx kyoklinxjal kykyaqil .

text: Tell us therefore , What thinkest thou ? Is it lawful to give tribute unto Caesar , or not ?
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , ¿ Tzeˈntzin chˈin te toj twutz ? ¿ Wenpela tuˈn t ‑ xi qchjonjiˈy kˈaybˈil te kawil te Rom , mo minaj ? Xi kyqanin ikyjo quˈn kykyˈeˈtaq Parisey tuˈn t ‑ xi chjet kˈaybˈil , me ayetziˈn kyukˈa Herodes , kyajtaq . Ikytziˈn , iltaq tiˈj tuˈn tkubˈ tzˈaq Jesús kyuˈn toj til kywutzjo jun chˈuq xjal lo .

text: But Jesus perceived their wickedness , and said , Why tempt ye me , ye hypocrites ?
text2: Ex bˈeˈx el te Jesús tnikyˈ tiˈjjo kybˈis , qa nya bˈaˈntaq . Tuˈntziˈn , xi tqˈmaˈn kyjaluˈn : ¡ Xmiletzˈ ! N ‑ el we nikyˈa te kyaja . Kyaja tuˈn nkubˈ tzˈaqa tiˈjjo nxnaqˈtzbˈila .

text: Shew me the tribute money . And they brought unto him a penny .
text2: Kyyekˈintzin jun pwaq weˈy , a n ‑ ajbˈin te chojbˈil kˈaybˈil te kawil te Rom . Ex tzaj kyiˈn jun pwaq .

text: And he saith unto them , Whose is this image and superscription ?
text2: Atzaj teˈ tok tkaˈyin Jesús , xi tqanin kye : ¿ An qwutzbˈiyiljo lo , ex an qbˈi tzˈibˈink twutz ?

text: They say unto him , Caesar ' s . Then saith he unto them , Render therefore unto Caesar the things which are Caesar ' s ; and unto God the things that are God ' s .
text2: Xi kytzˈaqwinxjal : Te nmaq kawil te Rom , chi chiˈ . Ex xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye : Tuˈnpetziˈn , kyqˈoˈnx kyejiˈy a ntqanin nmaq kawil te Rom , ex kyqˈoˈnxjiˈy a te Dios ntqanin .

text: When they had heard these words , they marvelled , and left him , and went their way .
text2: Tej kybˈinte ikyjo , noq i bˈaj jaw kaˈylaj , ex bˈeˈx kyij kytzaqpiˈn .

text: The same day came to him the Sadducees , which say that there is no resurrection , and asked him ,
text2: Tojxjo qˈij anetziˈn , at junjun Sadusey ul kanin tkˈatz Jesús tukˈa jun kyxjelbˈitz . Toj kywutz nlay chi jatz anqˈintl juntl majl kyimnin . Tuˈnpetziˈn , xi kyqanin te Jesús :

text: Saying , Master , Moses said , If a man die , having no children , his brother shall marry his wife , and raise up seed unto his brother .
text2: Kyij tyolin Moisés , qa ma kyim jun ichin , ex qa ntiˈ jun tkˈwal xkyij tukˈa t ‑ xuˈjil , il tiˈj tuˈn tjaw meje tukˈa titzˈin mo tukˈa ttziky qtzan tchmil , tuˈntzin aj tuljo tnejil kyal , te tkˈwaljo qtzan tchmil tuˈn toke .

text: Now there were with us seven brethren : and the first , when he had married a wife , deceased , and , having no issue , left his wife unto his brother :
text2: Quˈn ikytzin qejiˈy qxol , attaq wuq ichin kyitzˈimile kyibˈ . Atziˈn kytziky knet t ‑ xuˈjil , me ntiˈ jun tkˈwal kyij , teˈ tkyim . Atzin t ‑ xuˈjil kyij , bˈeˈx jaw meje tukˈa titzˈin .

text: Likewise the second also , and the third , unto the seventh .
text2: Me ikyxl bˈajjo tukˈa tkabˈ ; ntiˈ jun tkˈwal kyij , teˈ tkyim . Ikyxljo tukˈa toxin . Kywuqilx i ok meje tukˈa , me ntiˈ jun kykˈwal kyij , teˈ kykyim .

text: And last of all the woman died also .
text2: Ex bˈeˈx kyimljo qya .

text: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife shall she be of the seven ? for they all had her .
text2: Me atzin jaˈlin , ¿ Tzeˈntzila tteˈn tuˈn kyjaw anqˈintl kyimnin ? Quˈn , qa ikyjo , aj kyjaw itzˈje juntl majl , ¿ Tiˈtzila kbˈajiltz ? ¿ Altzila kye k ‑ okil te tchmiljo qya kyxoljo wuq ichin , quˈn kykyaqilx i ok meje tukˈa ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , Ye do err , not knowing the scriptures , nor the power of God .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús kye : Najninx iteˈ kyeˈ . ¿ Naˈmxsin tel kynikyˈa te Tyol Dios , ex te jniˈ tipin ?

text: For in the resurrection they neither marry , nor are given in marriage , but are as the angels of God in heaven .
text2: Ajtzin kybˈaj jaw itzˈje juntl majljo kyimnin , mikyxil teˈ chwinqil tzeˈnku luˈn . Ayetziˈn ichin exqetziˈn qya mina chi bˈaj jaw meje juntl majl . Iky kchi bˈaj okileˈ tzeˈnqekuˈ angel toj kyaˈj .

text: But as touching the resurrection of the dead , have ye not read that which was spoken unto you by God , saying ,
text2: Me tiˈjtziˈn tuˈn kyjatz anqˈintl kyimnin , ¿ Ma naˈmtzin tkux kyuˈjiˈn , a aku Dios qˈmante kyjaluˈn :

text: I am the God of Abraham , and the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob ? God is not the God of the dead , but of the living .
text2: Ayin wejiˈy tDios Abraham , te Isaac ex te Jacob ? Mix tqˈma qa ayintaq wejiˈy , qalaˈ ayin wejiˈych . Ikytziˈn , ate Dios nya kyDios kyimnin , qalaˈ kyDios itzˈ , exla qa o chi kyim tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , quˈn toj twutz Dios , itzˈqe kykyaqilx .

text: And when the multitude heard this , they were astonished at his doctrine .
text2: Atzaj teˈ kybˈinte xjaljo ikyjo , kykyaqilx i bˈaj jaw kaˈylaj tiˈjjo t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈil .

text: But when the Pharisees had heard that he had put the Sadducees to silence , they were gathered together .
text2: Atzaj teˈ tok kybˈiˈn Parisey , qa otaq kubˈ kyiˈj Sadusey tuˈn Jesús , jaw kychmoˈn kyibˈ .

text: Then one of them , which was a lawyer , asked him a question , tempting him , and saying ,
text2: Me attaq jun kyxol xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil , tajtaq tuˈn tkubˈ tzˈaq toj til tuˈn . Xi tqanin te :

text: Master , which is the great commandment in the law ?
text2: Xnaqˈtzil , ¿ Ankyeˈ tkawbˈil Dios nimxixtl toklin txoljo txqantl ?

text: Jesus said unto him , Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart , and with all thy soul , and with all thy mind .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : An tnejiljo luˈn : Kˈuˈjlinkxixa Dios tukˈa tkyaqil tanmiˈn , ex tukˈa tkyaqil tkˈuˈja , ex tukˈa tkyaqil tnabˈla .

text: This is the first and great commandment .
text2: Atzin tnejil kawbˈiljo ex nimxix toklin .

text: And the second is like unto it , Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself .
text2: Ex atzin tkabˈ chˈime ikyxjo tzeˈnku tnejil , tuˈn tok tkˈuˈjlin t ‑ xjalila , tzeˈnkux n ‑ ok tkˈuˈjlin tibˈa .

text: On these two commandments hang all the law and the prophets .
text2: Ayetzin kabˈe kawbˈiljo lo , ayetziˈn tqˈuqil tkyaqil t ‑ xilin kawbˈil ex jniˈ t ‑ xilin kyxnaqˈtzbˈil yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe .

text: While the Pharisees were gathered together , Jesus asked them ,
text2: Chˈuqleqextaq Parisey ,

text: Saying , What think ye of Christ ? whose son is he ? They say unto him , The Son of David .
text2: xi tqanin Jesús kye : ¿ Tiˈtzin chˈin kye nkyximiˈn tiˈjjo Crist , a Kolil ? ¿ Jaˈtzila tzajnin tyajil ? Tyajil David , chi chiˈ .

text: He saith unto them , How then doth David in spirit call him Lord , saying ,
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : A qa ikyjo , ¿ Tzeˈntzin tten te Davidtz , tuˈn tipin Xewbˈaj Xjan , ok tqˈoˈn te tAjaw , exsiˈn naˈmtaq tul itzˈje Crist , a Tajaw Tkyakil ? Quˈn ikytzin tqˈma Davidjo :

text: The LORD said unto my Lord , Sit thou on my right hand , till I make thine enemies thy footstool ?
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn qMan Dios te wAjawa : Qekuy toj nman qˈobˈa kawil wukˈiy , ex kˈwel kyiˈjjo tajqˈoja wuˈn .

text: If David then call him Lord , how is he his son ?
text2: Twutzx teˈ qa a Crist tyajil David . ¿ Me tzeˈntzin ttentz o yolin te David tiˈj Crist , a naˈmtaq titzˈje , ex ok tqˈoˈn te tAjaw ?

text: And no man was able to answer him a word , neither durst any man from that day forth ask him any more questions .
text2: Ex mix aˈl jun bˈant ttzaqˈwin teˈ yol lo . Atxixsiˈn , mix aˈl juntl ul toj tkˈuˈj tuˈn tokx tlimoˈn tibˈ qanil juntl tiˈ .

text: Then spake Jesus to the multitude , and to his disciples ,
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , ok ten Jesús yolil kyukˈaxjal ex qukˈiy , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin . Chiˈ kyjaluˈn :

text: Saying , The scribes and the Pharisees sit in Moses ' seat :
text2: Ayetziˈn xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil exqetziˈn Parisey n ‑ ok kyqˈoˈn kyibˈ , tuˈn tel pjet , ex tuˈn kyxnaqˈtzin tiˈj tkawbˈil Moisés .

text: All therefore whatsoever they bid you observe , that observe and do ; but do not ye after their works : for they say , and do not .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , kyniminqekuy , ex kybˈinchinkuy tkyaqiljo ktzajil kyqˈmaˈn kyeˈy . Me mi kubˈ kybˈinchinjiˈy a nbˈant kyuˈn , quˈn xmiletzˈqe ; nkyqˈmaˈn tumil tzeˈn tuˈn toke , me junxil nkubˈ kybˈinchin .

text: For they bind heavy burdens and grievous to be borne , and lay them on men ' s shoulders ; but they themselves will not move them with one of their fingers .
text2: Ax txqan nukˈbˈil nbˈaj xi kyqˈoˈn , manyor kujqex wen , ikytziˈn tzeˈn junjun tij iqtz , a mix aˈl aku kyˈisje tuˈn . Noq iteˈk qˈmalte kyexjal , tuˈn tjaw kyiqin , me ayetzin kyetz noqittzin aku jaw kyonin chˈin , iˈchaqxpetla noq jun twiˈ kyqˈobˈ xi aqˈle tiˈj .

text: But all their works they do for to be seen of men : they make broad their phylacteries , and enlarge the borders of their garments ,
text2: Tkyaqilxjo jniˈ nbˈant kyuˈn , noq tuˈn kyjawku iqin kyuˈnxjal . Ex kyajxix tzˈok kyqˈoˈn tiˈj kyplaj mo tiˈj kyqˈobˈ junjun tnej Tyol Dios tzˈibˈink twutz tzˈuˈn ma nmaq twutz , me noq tuˈn kynimsin kyibˈ kywutzxjal . Ex nbˈaj ok kyqˈoˈn kyxbˈalin manyor xqerx wen , noq tuˈn kyokku kaˈyin kyuˈnxjal .

text: And love the uppermost rooms at feasts , and the chief seats in the synagogues ,
text2: Ex kyaj tuˈn kyok qe kyiˈj tnejil meẍ te wabˈl toj kyjaxjal ex kyoj muˈẍ ja te naˈbˈl Dios .

text: And greetings in the markets , and to be called of men , Rabbi , Rabbi .
text2: Ex kyaj tuˈn tkubˈ kymutxbˈinxjal kywiˈ kywutz , aj kyok qˈolbˈin noq jaˈ toj bˈe , ex tuˈn kyok qˈolbˈin te xnaqˈtzil .

text: But be not ye called Rabbi : for one is your Master , even Christ ; and all ye are brethren .
text2: Me metzin kyeˈ , mi chi tiliˈn tuˈn tok qˈoˈn kybˈiy te xnaqˈtzil kyuˈnxjal te kynimsbˈil kyibˈa . Quˈn junx kyokliˈn , quˈn junchˈin kyMaˈn , ex junxchˈin Xnaqˈtzil kyeˈy , a ayiˈn , a Crist .

text: And call no man your father upon the earth : for one is your Father , which is in heaven .
text2: Ex mi tzˈok kyqˈoˈn toklin jun aˈla te manbˈaj tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , quˈn oˈkx te Manbˈajjo junchˈin at toj kyaˈj .

text: Neither be ye called masters : for one is your Master , even Christ .
text2: Ex mi chi tiliˈn tuˈn tok qˈoˈn kyokliˈn te nejinel , quˈn ayin weˈ Crist , nejinel kywutza .

text: But he that is greatest among you shall be your servant .
text2: Ex ankye teˈ nim toklin kyxola , il tiˈj tuˈn tajbˈin kye txqantl .

text: And whosoever shall exalt himself shall be abased ; and he that shall humble himself shall be exalted .
text2: Quˈn ankye teˈ kjawil tnimsin tibˈ , kˈwel mutxsin teˈ tuˈn Dios kywutzxjal . Me anteˈ kˈwel tmutxsin tibˈ , poˈn qˈij jaˈ kjawile nimsin teˈ tuˈn Dios .

text: But woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye shut up the kingdom of heaven against men : for ye neither go in yourselves , neither suffer ye them that are entering to go in .
text2: Bˈisbˈajilxla kyeˈy , ayiˈy xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil exqetziˈn Parisey xmiletzˈ . Quˈn n ‑ ok kyjpunjiˈy kynabˈljo xjal , tuˈn mi chi okxa tojjo Tkawbˈil Dios toj kyaˈj , ex ayeku kyeˈ mi chi okxa . Ex mi nkytziyiˈn tuˈn kyokxjo ayeˈ kyaj tuˈn kyokx .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye devour widows ' houses , and for a pretence make long prayer : therefore ye shall receive the greater damnation .
text2: Bˈisbˈajilxla kyeˈy , ayiˈy xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil exqetziˈn Parisey xmiletzˈ . Quˈn n ‑ el kyinjiˈy kyja tal qya , a o kyim kychmil , ex noq tuˈn kyjaw niminkuy kyuˈnxjal , nchi naˈnnaja Dios kyiˈj nimxix tqan , tuˈn tmojin ex tuˈn tkolin kyiˈj , ex otaq tzˈel kyiˈn tal kyja . Tuˈn ikyjo nimxix tkawbˈil Dios kˈwel kyibˈaja kujxix wen .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye compass sea and land to make one proselyte , and when he is made , ye make him twofold more the child of hell than yourselves .
text2: Bˈisbˈajilxla kyeˈy , ayiˈy xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil exqetziˈn Parisey xmiletzˈ . Quˈn nchi bˈaj bˈetjiˈy tkyaqil twutz txˈotxˈ xmoxil kyexjal tuˈn kynimin kyukˈiy tiˈjjo kynimbˈila . Ex ajtzin tkubˈ jun xjal kyuˈn , ma txi kyqˈoˈn toj il , tuˈn t ‑ xiˈ toj qˈaqˈ te jun majx tzeˈnku kyeˈ .

text: Woe unto you , ye blind guides , which say , Whosoever shall swear by the temple , it is nothing ; but whosoever shall swear by the gold of the temple , he is a debtor !
text2: Bˈisbˈajilxla kyeˈy , ayiˈy xkol moẍ . Quˈn nkyqˈmaˈn qa at jun xjal xkubˈ tqˈmaˈn jun tyol , exsin ma kubˈ tqˈmaˈn tbˈi tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios tiˈj , nyaxix il tiˈj tuˈn tjapin bˈaj tyol tzeˈnkux tqˈma . Me qa ma kubˈ tqˈmaˈn jun tyol , exsin xkubˈ tqˈmaˈn tbˈi qˈanpwaq toj tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios tiˈj , ilxixpen teˈ tiˈj tuˈn tjapin bˈaj , chi chijiˈy .

text: Ye fools and blind : for whether is greater , the gold , or the temple that sanctifieth the gold ?
text2: ¡ Ntiˈ kynabˈla , ex moẍqiˈy ! ¿ Ankyeˈ nimxixtl toklin ? ¿ Apela qˈanpwaq , mo qa a tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , a s ‑ ok qˈonte toklin pwaq te xjanxix toj taqˈin Dios ?

text: And , Whosoever shall swear by the altar , it is nothing ; but whosoever sweareth by the gift that is upon it , he is guilty .
text2: Ex nkyqˈmaˈn , qa ma kubˈ tqˈmaˈn jun tyol , exsin ma kubˈ tqˈmaˈn tbˈi t ‑ altar Dios toj tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios tiˈj , nyaxix il tiˈj tuˈn tjapin tyol . Me qa at jun kubˈ tqˈmaˈn jun tyol , exsin xkubˈ tqˈmaˈn tbˈi oyaj , a tkubˈ tibˈaj t ‑ altar Dios tiˈj , axixpente yoljo , il tiˈj tuˈn tjapin , chi chijiˈy .

text: Ye fools and blind : for whether is greater , the gift , or the altar that sanctifieth the gift ?
text2: ¡ Ntiˈ kynabˈla , ex moẍqiˈy ! ¿ Ankyeˈ nimxixtl toklin ? ¿ Ma apela oyaj , mo qa a t ‑ altar Dios , a s ‑ ok qˈonte oyaj te xjanxix twutz ? Kxel nqˈmaˈn qa junx kyoklin kykabˈil .

text: Whoso therefore shall swear by the altar , sweareth by it , and by all things thereon .
text2: Quˈn alkye ma kubˈ tqˈmaˈn tbˈi t ‑ altar Dios toj tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios tiˈj tyol , nya noq tiˈj tbˈi t ‑ altar ma kubˈe tqˈmaˈne tyol , qalaˈ majx tiˈj tkyaqiljo tkubˈ tibˈaj .

text: And whoso shall swear by the temple , sweareth by it , and by him that dwelleth therein .
text2: Ex ankyeˈ kˈwel tqˈmaˈn tbˈi tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios tiˈj tyol , nya noq tiˈjjo tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios ma kubˈe tqˈmaˈne , qalaˈ majx tiˈj Dios , a najle toj .

text: And he that shall swear by heaven , sweareth by the throne of God , and by him that sitteth thereon .
text2: Ex alkye ma kubˈ tqˈmaˈn jun tyol tiˈj kyaˈj , nya noq tiˈj kyaˈj ma kubˈe tqˈmaˈne , qalaˈ majx tiˈj tkyaqil tqˈuqbˈil Dios , ex tiˈjku Dios , a qˈuqle toj .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye pay tithe of mint and anise and cummin , and have omitted the weightier matters of the law , judgment , mercy , and faith : these ought ye to have done , and not to leave the other undone .
text2: Bˈisbˈajilxla kyeˈy , ayiˈy xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil exqetziˈn Parisey xmiletzˈ . Quˈn nxi kyqˈoˈn twutz tlajajin tnej menta , anís , ex kominis , tzeˈnkuˈ ntqˈmaˈn toj ojtxe kawbˈil . Me mi n ‑ ok kybˈinjiˈy xnaqˈtzbˈil , a nimxixtl toklin toj kawbˈil : A tuˈn kynajaˈn tzˈaqle , ex tuˈn tten tqˈaqˈbˈil kykˈuˈja kyiˈj txqantl , ex tuˈn tten kynimbˈila tiˈj Dios . Atzin tuˈn tkubˈ kybˈinchinjiˈy , ex tuˈn mi kyij kytzaqpinjiˈy txqantl .

text: Ye blind guides , which strain at a gnat , and swallow a camel .
text2: Ayiˈy xkol moẍ , quˈn ikytzin nbˈantjo kyuˈn tzeˈnku tuˈn tel xkˈamit jun tal netzˈ us toj kˈwabˈj , me mi nkynaˈn aj t ‑ xi kykˈulpinjiˈy jun ma tij chej . Quˈn kyaja tuˈn tjapiˈn tal netzˈ tnukˈbˈil kawbˈil kyuˈn , me atzin a nimxixtl toklin toj kawbˈil , mi nkubˈ kybˈinchiˈn .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye make clean the outside of the cup and of the platter , but within they are full of extortion and excess .
text2: Bˈisbˈajilxla kyeˈy , ayiˈy xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil exqetziˈn Parisey xmiletzˈ . Quˈn ikyqetzinjiˈy tzeˈnku jun tkˈwel kˈwabˈj ex jun laq , a chebˈe txjoˈn tiˈj , me atzin tojxi , manyor tzˈil : Nojnin tukˈa jniˈ kyelaqˈa ex tukˈa jniˈ kyachbˈila .

text: Thou blind Pharisee , cleanse first that which is within the cup and platter , that the outside of them may be clean also .
text2: Ayiˈy Parisey moẍqiˈy , kytxjonktzjiˈy tojxi tkˈwel kˈwabˈj nej ex tojxi laq . Quˈn ikytzin kyjela saqixjo tiˈjxi .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye are like unto whited sepulchres , which indeed appear beautiful outward , but are within full of dead men ' s bones , and of all uncleanness .
text2: Bˈisbˈajilxla kyeˈy , ayiˈy xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil exqetziˈn Parisey xmiletzˈ . Quˈn ikyqejiˈy tzeˈnku jun tja kyimnin tbˈanilx tkaˈyajtzjo tiˈjxi , me atziˈn tojxi nojnin tukˈa tbˈaqil kyimnin ex manyor tzuˈjx .

text: Even so ye also outwardly appear righteous unto men , but within ye are full of hypocrisy and iniquity .
text2: Ikyqetzinjiˈy , quˈn tbˈanilx nbˈant kyuˈn kywutzxjal , me toj kyanmiˈn , nojnin taˈye tukˈa ttzˈilil ex tkyaqil wiq il .
