text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! because ye build the tombs of the prophets , and garnish the sepulchres of the righteous ,
text2: Bˈisbˈajilxla kyeˈy , ayiˈy xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil exqetziˈn Parisey xmiletzˈ . Quˈn chebˈe njaw kybˈinchiˈn kyja qtzan yolil Tyol Dios , ayeˈ i kˈmonte Tyol ojtxe , ex nbˈaj kubˈ kytxoliˈn t ‑ xmakil kˈul tiˈjile kyjulil qtzan wen xjal .

text: And say , If we had been in the days of our fathers , we would not have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets .
text2: Ex nkyqˈmaˈn : Noqit otaq qo itzˈje tojjo kyqˈijil qtzan qchman ojtxe , nyajinqotla xqo mojin tuˈn kybˈyetjo yolil Tyol Dios .

text: Wherefore ye be witnesses unto yourselves , that ye are the children of them which killed the prophets .
text2: Antza aku tzˈele kynikyˈa kye qa antza tzajnin kyyajila kyiˈjjo ayeˈ ẍi kubˈ bˈyonkye yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe , quˈn ayexa nchi qˈmante .

text: Fill ye up then the measure of your fathers .
text2: Ex qa kykyˈeˈy tuˈn kyok lipeˈy wiˈja , in tjapin bˈaj kyuˈn , tzeˈnkuxjo kyij yekˈin kyeˈy kyuˈn qtzan kychmaˈn ojtxe , aye bˈyol xjal . Me bˈiˈnku kyuˈn qa japin jun qˈij , tuˈn tul kawbˈil kyibˈaja kujxix wen tiˈj tkyaqiljo lo .

text: Ye serpents , ye generation of vipers , how can ye escape the damnation of hell ?
text2: ¡ Maˈ kan , ex maˈ tyajil qˈantinqiˈy ! ¿ Tzeˈntzin tten tuˈn kyel oqa twutzjo kawbˈil tzul , a qˈaqˈ , a tzunx njulinx wen ?

text: Wherefore , behold , I send unto you prophets , and wise men , and scribes : and some of them ye shall kill and crucify ; and some of them shall ye scourge in your synagogues , and persecute them from city to city :
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , kchi tzajil nsmaˈn weˈ yolil Tyol Dios , exqetziˈn aj nabˈl , ex xnaqˈtzil . Me kchi kˈwel kybˈyoˈn junjun , ex kchi jawil kypejkˈiˈn junjuntl twutz cruz tuˈn kykyim , ex kchi bˈajil kybˈyoˈn junjuntl toj ja te naˈbˈl Dios , exsin kchi okil teˈn lajolkye tojile junjun tnam .

text: That upon you may come all the righteous blood shed upon the earth , from the blood of righteous Abel unto the blood of Zacharias son of Barachias , whom ye slew between the temple and the altar .
text2: Me ktzajil tkawbˈil Dios kyibˈaja kujxix wen , noq tuˈn tpaj kychkyˈeljo qtzan xjal tzˈaqleqe , ayeˈ i kubˈ bˈyoˈn atxix tiˈj Abel , a tzˈaqle , ex Zakariy , a tkˈwal Berequías , a kubˈ kybˈyoˈn , ayiˈy Judiy , tojx tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios ex twutz t ‑ altar qMan .

text: Verily I say unto you , All these things shall come upon this generation .
text2: Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , noq tuˈn tpaj tkyaqiljo lo , kˈwel tzˈaq tkawbˈil Dios kujxix wen kyibˈajjo xjal jaˈlin .

text: O Jerusalem , Jerusalem , thou that killest the prophets , and stonest them which are sent unto thee , how often would I have gathered thy children together , even as a hen gathereth her chickens under her wings , and ye would not !
text2: Ex chi Jesúsjo kyjaluˈn kyeˈ xjal te Jerusalén : ¡ Ay ! Jerusalén , Jerusalén , ay bˈiyil kyiˈj yolil Tyol Dios , ex nchi ok kyxoˈnjiˈy tsan qMan tukˈa abˈj ; jteˈlixla majxla ẍin bˈaj labˈtiˈy kyiˈja , tuˈn kytzaj laqˈeˈy nkˈatza , tzeˈnku jun ttxu ekyˈ nchi kubˈ tpaqin tal tal tjaqˈ t ‑ xikyˈ , me mi xkytziyiy ikyjo .

text: Behold , your house is left unto you desolate .
text2: Kykaˈyinktzinjiˈy kynajbˈila kyjel naj te jun majx .

text: For I say unto you , Ye shall not see me henceforth , till ye shall say , Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord .
text2: Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , texjo qˈij jaˈlin , mixla chin kylaˈbˈilxa jun majla , qa nya ajxi tpon tqˈijil aj kyqˈmantiˈy : Kyˈiwlinxix teˈ , a tzul toj tbˈi qAjaw .

text: And Jesus went out , and departed from the temple : and his disciples came to him for to shew him the buildings of the temple .
text2: Tej tetz Jesús toj tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , kyjaˈtaq t ‑ xiˈ , bˈeˈx o tzaj laqˈeˈy , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin tkˈatz , ex xi qqˈmaˈn te : Kanqex kyejiˈy junjun tij ja te naˈbˈl Dios , tbˈanilqex wen , qo chijiˈy .

text: And Jesus said unto them , See ye not all these things ? verily I say unto you , There shall not be left here one stone upon another , that shall not be thrown down .
text2: Tzaj ttzaqˈwin Jesús qeˈy : Tbˈanilqex kye junjun tij ja nchi ok kykaˈyiˈn , me twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , qa tkyaqilx kchi kˈwel yuchˈj , ex ntiˈx jun abˈj kyjel tibˈaj juntl , aj tpon tqˈijil .

text: And as he sat upon the mount of Olives , the disciples came unto him privately , saying , Tell us , when shall these things be ? and what shall be the sign of thy coming , and of the end of the world ?
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , bˈeˈx o xiˈy tzma twiˈ wutz Olivos . Tej tkubˈ qe Jesús , bˈeˈx o xi laqˈeˈy tkˈatz qjunalxa , ex xi qqaniˈn te : QAjaw , qˈmantza qeˈy . ¿ Jtojtzila bˈaˈn tbˈajjo ikyjo ? ¿ Ex tiˈtzila techil kqlaˈbˈila , aj chˈixtaq tula , ex a chˈixtaq tjapin bˈaj tkyaqil twutz txˈotxˈ ?

text: And Jesus answered and said unto them , Take heed that no man deceive you .
text2: Tzaj tqˈmaˈn Jesús : Kykaˈyink kyibˈa , tuˈn mix aˈl jun kubˈ sbˈun kyeˈy .

text: For many shall come in my name , saying , I am Christ ; and shall deceive many .
text2: Quˈn ma nintz te tzul tiˈj nbˈiˈy , ex ok kyqˈmaˈbˈil : Ayiˈn weˈ Crist , chichkulaˈ . Ex ma nintzxjal kˈwel kysbˈuˈn , tuˈn kyxi lipe kyiˈj .

text: And ye shall hear of wars and rumours of wars : see that ye be not troubled : for all these things must come to pass , but the end is not yet .
text2: Aj tok kybˈiˈn tqanil qˈoj ex aj kybˈaj ok qˈoj kyojile junjuntl tnam najchaq , mi chi tzaj xobˈa , quˈn ikytzin ilx tiˈj tuˈn tbˈajjo ikyjo . Me naˈmtaqx tpon qˈij tuˈn tjapin bˈaj tkyaqil .

text: For nation shall rise against nation , and kingdom against kingdom : and there shall be famines , and pestilences , and earthquakes , in divers places .
text2: Quˈn il tiˈj tuˈn tok qˈoj kyxolile junjun chˈuq xjal , ex kyojile junjun ma tij tnam . Ex waˈyaj tzul , ex jniˈ yabˈil ex kyaqnajnabˈ noq jaˈchaqku .

text: All these are the beginning of sorrows .
text2: Me tkyaqiljo kbˈajil ikyjo , ikytziˈn tzeˈnku tnejil tchyoˈn tkˈuˈj jun qya tukˈa tal .

text: Then shall they deliver you up to be afflicted , and shall kill you : and ye shall be hated of all nations for my name ' s sake .
text2: Quˈn ex kchi xel qˈoˈn toj kyqˈobˈ kawil , tuˈn kybˈaj jubˈchiˈn kyuˈn , ex okpe kchi kˈwel bˈyoˈn junjun kyeˈ kyuˈn . Ex kykyaqilxjal kchi elil ikyˈin kyeˈ tuˈn npaja .

text: And then shall many be offended , and shall betray one another , and shall hate one another .
text2: Kyojjo qˈij anetziˈn , nimxte kyjel ttzaqpiˈn kynimbˈil , ex kbˈajil kyikyˈin kyibˈ , ex kchi bˈaj okil meltzˈaj kyiˈjx .

text: And many false prophets shall rise , and shall deceive many .
text2: Ex kchi ul xjal sbˈul , a kbˈaj okil kyqˈoˈn kyibˈ qa chqˈonqe tuˈn Dios . Ex nimxxjal kˈwel kysbˈuˈn .

text: And because iniquity shall abound , the love of many shall wax cold .
text2: Noq tuˈn tpajjo ikyjo , ex tuˈn nimku il kbˈantil , nimxlaxjal k ‑ elil tqˈaqˈbˈil tkˈuˈj tiˈj juntl .

text: But he that shall endure unto the end , the same shall be saved .
text2: Me ankye teˈ kweˈbˈilx wen , ajxi tpon tqˈijil , apente kletiljo .

text: And this gospel of the kingdom shall be preached in all the world for a witness unto all nations ; and then shall the end come .
text2: Aj telpin bˈaj tyolajtzjo Tbˈanil Tqanil Tkawbˈil Dios tkyaqil twutz txˈotxˈ , tuˈntzin ntiˈx jun chˈuqxjal , a mit tzˈel tnikyˈ tiˈj . Atzin qˈijjo japin bˈaj tqˈijil tkyaqil .

text: When ye therefore shall see the abomination of desolation , spoken of by Daniel the prophet , stand in the holy place , ( whoso readeth , let him understand : )
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , k ‑ okil kykaˈyiˈn tzeˈnkuˈ kubˈ ttzˈibˈin Daniel , a yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe , tiˈj jun ichin , a kˈwel tbˈinchin tkyaqil , me tixqex toj Najbˈil Xjanxix toj tnejil ja te kynaˈbˈl Judiy Dios ( aj tkux kyujinjiˈy luˈn , tzˈelku kynikyˈa te ) .

text: Then let them which be in Judaea flee into the mountains :
text2: Aj tok kykaˈyiˈn jniˈjo lo , tkyaqilxjal iteˈ toj txˈotxˈ te Judey , bˈeˈx chi xel oq toj kˈul .

text: Let him which is on the housetop not come down to take any thing out of his house :
text2: Ex atzin xjal , a tokxtaq twiˈja , nlay taqˈ ambˈil tuˈn tkuˈtz qˈilte jun tiˈ te tuja .

text: Neither let him which is in the field return back to take his clothes .
text2: Ex ikyxljo , a tzmataq n ‑ aqˈnin toj ttxˈotxˈ , mi taqˈ ambˈil tuˈn tul qˈilkye t ‑ xbˈalin tja .

text: And woe unto them that are with child , and to them that give suck in those days !
text2: ¡ Ayexjo tal qya , ayeˈ chˈixtaq kykubˈ tzˈaq , ex ayeˈ tzmataq nbˈaj miˈẍin kyal !

text: But pray ye that your flight be not in the winter , neither on the sabbath day :
text2: Chi naˈn Dios , noqit nya toj jbˈalilku , mo tojku jun qˈij te ajlabˈl kubˈ tzˈaqe ikyjo .

text: For then shall be great tribulation , such as was not since the beginning of the world to this time , no , nor ever shall be .
text2: Quˈn nimkux jun kyixkˈoj kkyˈelix kyuˈnxjal , a bˈajxi kylaˈye tukˈaxjo tzajlin xkye twutz txˈotxˈ , ex mixla kqlaˈbˈil juntl majl , aj tjapin bˈaj tkyaqil .

text: And except those days should be shortened , there should no flesh be saved : but for the elect ' s sake those days shall be shortened .
text2: Quˈn noqit mi tzˈajtz tajsin Dios kyiˈjjo qˈij anetziˈn , mixitla aˈlx jun aku kyij anqˈin . Me ok ajitz tajsin Dios , noq tuˈn tqˈaqˈbˈil tkˈuˈj kyiˈjjo o chi jaw tskˈoˈn .

text: Then if any man shall say unto you , Lo , here is Christ , or there ; believe it not .
text2: Qa at jun saj qˈmante kyeˈy kyojjo qˈij anetziˈn : Lu Crist lo , mo qa : Luˈ at tzachiˈn , qa chiˈ , mi txi kynimiˈn .

text: For there shall arise false Christs , and false prophets , and shall shew great signs and wonders ; insomuch that , if it were possible , they shall deceive the very elect .
text2: Quˈn chi ul sbˈul k ‑ okil kyqˈoˈn kyibˈ te Crist , mo te jun xjal tzeˈnku jun yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe . Ex okpe kˈwel kybˈinchin nim techil kyipin , noq tuˈn kysbˈetkuxjal kyuˈn . Ex okpela k ‑ okil kynikyˈin tuˈn kykubˈjo skˈoˈnqe tuˈn Dios , me nlay chi kubˈ .

text: Behold , I have told you before .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , ma txi nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy naˈmtaq tuˈn tul kanin ikyjo .

text: Wherefore if they shall say unto you , Behold , he is in the desert ; go not forth : behold , he is in the secret chambers ; believe it not .
text2: Ex qa ma tzaj qˈmaˈn kyeˈy : Lu at toj kˈul , qa chiˈ , mi cheˈxa lolte . Ex qa ma tzaj kyqˈmaˈn : Ku kytzaja . Lu at tuja , qa chiˈ , mi txi kynimiˈn .

text: For as the lightning cometh out of the east , and shineth even unto the west ; so shall also the coming of the Son of man be .
text2: Quˈn ikytzin k ‑ ikyˈile tzeˈnku jun xloqˈlin kyaˈj qˈanchaˈl toj tkyaqil twutz kyaˈj ; ktzajil qoptzˈaj toj tjawitz qˈij ex toj telix qˈij . Ex tkyaqil xjal kxel kaˈyin weˈy , ayiˈn , a Tkˈwal Ichin , aj wula .

text: For wheresoever the carcase is , there will the eagles be gathered together .
text2: Jun paqx k ‑ elil tqanil , ikyxjo tzeˈnku tqanil jun kyimnin n ‑ el kyxol kˈutz .

text: Immediately after the tribulation of those days shall the sun be darkened , and the moon shall not give her light , and the stars shall fall from heaven , and the powers of the heavens shall be shaken :
text2: Noqx aj kybˈajjo qˈij ikyjo te yajbˈil , k ‑ okil qloljix twutz qˈij , ex mi kˈantl yaye . Ex jniˈ qeˈ cheˈw kchi kˈwelitz tzˈaq twutz txˈotxˈ . Ex tkyaqiljo jniˈ at twutz kyaˈj okx chi luˈlilx .

text: And then shall appear the sign of the Son of man in heaven : and then shall all the tribes of the earth mourn , and they shall see the Son of man coming in the clouds of heaven with power and great glory .
text2: Ex kylaˈbˈila twutz kyaˈj a techiljo ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , aj wula . Tkyaqil xjal twutz txˈotxˈ kchi bˈaj jawil oqˈ , aj nxi kykaˈyin a ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , aj ntzaja toj muj twutz kyaˈj tukˈa tkyaqil wipiˈn ex jniˈ nqoptzˈajiyila .

text: And he shall send his angels with a great sound of a trumpet , and they shall gather together his elect from the four winds , from one end of heaven to the other .
text2: Ex tukˈa tkyaqil tqˈajqˈojil chun , kchi tzajil nsmaˈn n ‑ angela , tuˈn kyok chmetjo jniˈ skˈoˈnqe wuˈn toj tkyaqil twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: Now learn a parable of the fig tree ; When his branch is yet tender , and putteth forth leaves , ye know that summer is nigh :
text2: Kykaˈyinkjiˈy techil tiˈj tqan iw : Aj ttzaj xulin tal tqˈobˈ , ex aj tzaj poqˈle t ‑ xaq , antza k ‑ elile kynikyˈa te , qa chˈix tul kanin tqˈijil .

text: So likewise ye , when ye shall see all these things , know that it is near , even at the doors .
text2: Ikyxsintzjo , aj tok kykaˈyiˈn tkyaqiljo luˈn , tzˈelku kynikyˈa te , qa chˈix tpon tqˈijil tuˈn wula juntl majl .

text: Verily I say unto you , This generation shall not pass , till all these things be fulfilled .
text2: Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , a naˈmxtaq kybˈaj kyimxjal , a iteˈ tojjo tqˈijil jaˈlin , aj t ‑ xi xkyejo jniˈ luˈn .

text: Heaven and earth shall pass away , but my words shall not pass away .
text2: A kyaˈj ex txˈotxˈ ok kchi bˈajil , me mex weˈ Nyol nlayx chi kyijx kyeˈ , tuˈn mi chi japin bˈaje .

text: But of that day and hour knoweth no man , no , not the angels of heaven , but my Father only .
text2: Me alkye qˈij ex alkye or chin ula , mix aˈl teˈ bˈilte , mixpe aye angel toj kyaˈj , mixpe ayinkuy , a Kˈwalbˈaj te Dios ; qalaˈ oˈkx te nMan bˈilte .

text: But as the days of Noe were , so shall also the coming of the Son of man be .
text2: Quˈn ikytziˈn tzeˈnkuj bˈaj kyojjo qˈij te Noé , ex ikytzin kbˈajiljo , aj wula , ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin .

text: For as in the days that were before the flood they were eating and drinking , marrying and giving in marriage , until the day that Noe entered into the ark ,
text2: Quˈn ikytziˈn tzeˈnqej qˈij , tej naˈmtaq ttzaj qˈaqabˈil ; kykyaqil xjal twutz txˈotxˈ nchi bˈaj waˈntaq , ex nchi bˈaj txˈujtetaq , ex nchi bˈaj mejetaq , ex nchi bˈaj xi kyqˈoˈntaq kykˈwal toj mejebˈlin , tzmaxi teˈ kyokx Noé toj ma tij bark .

text: And knew not until the flood came , and took them all away ; so shall also the coming of the Son of man be .
text2: Me ntiˈx bˈiˈn kyuˈn , teˈ ttzaj qˈaqabˈil kyibˈaj , ex bˈeˈx bˈajxi mulqˈaj toj aˈ kykyaqilx . Ikytzin kbˈajiljo , aj wula ayiˈn , a Tkˈwal Ichin .

text: Then shall two be in the field ; the one shall be taken , and the other left .
text2: Tojjo qˈij anetziˈn , kabˈe ichin nchi aqˈnintaq toj kytxˈotxˈ . Jun teˈ kxel qˈiˈn , ex jun teˈ kyjel .

text: Two women shall be grinding at the mill ; the one shall be taken , and the other left .
text2: Ex kabˈe qya nchi cheˈn junx tiˈj kyka . Ex ikyxjo , jun teˈ kxel qˈiˈn , ex jun teˈ kyjel .

text: Watch therefore : for ye know not what hour your Lord doth come .
text2: Kyutzˈlinku kyibˈa toj kynimbˈila . Quˈn mi bˈiˈn kyuˈn alkye or kchin ula , a ayiˈn kyAjawiˈy .

text: But know this , that if the goodman of the house had known in what watch the thief would come , he would have watched , and would not have suffered his house to be broken up .
text2: Tzˈeltzin kynikyˈa te : Noqit bˈiˈn tuˈn jun tajaw ja , jniˈ or tuˈn tkanin ileqˈ qnikyˈin , matla kubˈ tutzˈlin tibˈ , tuˈn mi tzˈokxi ileqˈ elqˈil toj tja .

text: Therefore be ye also ready : for in such an hour as ye think not the Son of man cometh .
text2: Tuˈntzintzjo ikyjo , kybˈinchinku kyibˈa , quˈn ntiˈkux toj kynabˈla aj wula , ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin .

text: Who then is a faithful and wise servant , whom his lord hath made ruler over his household , to give them meat in due season ?
text2: ¿ Ankye teˈ aqˈnil tzˈaqle ex sakˈ ? Ok kyjel qˈoˈn teˈ tuˈn tajaw ja , aj t ‑ xiˈ toj jun tbˈe , te nejinel kyxoljo txqantl , tuˈn t ‑ xi tqˈoˈn kywa noqx aj tpoˈn ambˈil te wabˈj .

text: Blessed is that servant , whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing .
text2: Kyˈiwlinxix teˈ aqˈnil , qa nbˈinchintaq tiˈjjo taqˈin toj tumil , aj tuljo tajaw ja .

text: Verily I say unto you , That he shall make him ruler over all his goods .
text2: Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , bˈeˈx kxel tqˈoˈn tajaw ja toklin te nejinel tibˈaj tkyaqiljo at te .

text: But and if that evil servant shall say in his heart , My lord delayeth his coming ;
text2: Me qa nya wenjo aqˈnil , exsin qa chiˈ kyjaluˈn toj tanmin : Yajla tzul tajaw ja .

text: And shall begin to smite his fellowservants , and to eat and drink with the drunken ;
text2: Exsin tzˈok tentz bˈyol kyeˈ tukˈa , ex tzˈok tukˈlin tibˈ loˈl ex txˈujtil kyukˈa txˈujtinel .

text: The lord of that servant shall come in a day when he looketh not for him , and in an hour that he is not aware of ,
text2: Me ntiˈkux toj tnabˈl , tej tpon tajaw ja , quˈn ntiˈxtaq bˈiˈn tuˈn .

text: And shall cut him asunder , and appoint him his portion with the hypocrites : there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth .
text2: Ex kˈwel kawin kujxix wen , majx kxel smaˈn toj qˈaqˈ te jun majx , junx kyukˈa xmiletzˈ , jaˈ k ‑ oqˈile , ex kchi juˈchˈile tste tuˈn kyixkˈoj .

text: Then shall the kingdom of heaven be likened unto ten virgins , which took their lamps , and went forth to meet the bridegroom .
text2: Kyojjo qˈij anetziˈn , a Tkawbˈil Dios toj kyaˈj , ikyxjo tzeˈnku lajaj txin , i xiˈ toj jun mejebˈlin . Xi kynojsin kytzaj tukˈa aseyt , tej kyxiˈ yolte qˈa .

text: And five of them were wise , and five were foolish .
text2: Kyxoljo txin , attaq jweˈ ntiˈ kynabˈl , ex ayetziˈn jweˈtl manyor ẍtijqe .

text: They that were foolish took their lamps , and took no oil with them :
text2: Ayetziˈn ntiˈ kynabˈl xi kyiˈn kytzaj , me mi xi kyiˈne chˈintl kyaseyt .

text: But the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps .
text2: Me ayetziˈn ẍtij , xi kynojsinl tkˈwel kyaseyt , ex xi kyiˈn junx tukˈa kytzaj .

text: While the bridegroom tarried , they all slumbered and slept .
text2: Me mix jaˈ pone tej qˈa liwey , ex bˈeˈx bˈaj tzaj kywatl kykyaqilx , ex bˈeˈx i xiˈ ktal .

text: And at midnight there was a cry made , Behold , the bridegroom cometh ; go ye out to meet him .
text2: Me atzaj teˈ tnikyˈjin aqˈwil , xi kybˈiˈn jun aˈla tjaw ẍchˈin : ¡ Luˈ qˈa tzul ! ¡ Ku kytzaja kˈlelte ! chiˈ .

text: Then all those virgins arose , and trimmed their lamps .
text2: I bˈaj jaw weˈksjo txin kykyaqilx , ex i bˈaj ok ten txqol kytzaj .

text: And the foolish said unto the wise , Give us of your oil ; for our lamps are gone out .
text2: Me ayetzin kyeˈ jweˈtl ntiˈ kynabˈl xi kyqˈmaˈn kye ẍtij : Kyqˈontz chˈin qeˈ qaseyt tiˈjjo kyeˈ , quˈn chˈix tkubˈ yupj qtzaja , chi chiˈ .

text: But the wise answered , saying , Not so ; lest there be not enough for us and you : but go ye rather to them that sell , and buy for yourselves .
text2: Me ayetzin kye txin ẍtij xi kyqˈmaˈn kye : ¡ Mina ! Quˈn nlaypela kanin qe . ¿ Yajtzilaˈ tuˈn t ‑ xi qqˈoˈntza chˈin kyeˈ ? Qalaˈ ku kyxiˈy jaˈ nkˈayajtze , ex kˈaˈ tzaj kylaqˈoˈn chˈintla .

text: And while they went to buy , the bridegroom came ; and they that were ready went in with him to the marriage : and the door was shut .
text2: Me noqx ncheˈxku kyej jweˈ txin , a ntiˈ kynabˈl , laqˈol kyaseyt , teˈ tkaniˈn qˈa . Ayetzin kyeˈ jweˈ txin , quˈn mix ele bˈete kyeˈ , bˈeˈx i okx tuja toj mejebˈlin , ex bˈeˈx etz kyjpuˈn ja .

text: Afterward came also the other virgins , saying , Lord , Lord , open to us .
text2: Maˈytaq chˈintl , tej kykanin kyej jweˈ , ex i okx qˈolbˈin : Tata , tata , jqonkxjiy ja qeˈy , chi chiˈ .

text: But he answered and said , Verily I say unto you , I know you not .
text2: Me atziˈn xi tqˈmaˈn tajaw ja kye : Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , ntiˈ kyokliˈn tuˈn kyoktza , chiˈ .

text: Watch therefore , for ye know neither the day nor the hour wherein the Son of man cometh .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye : Noq tzaj kywatla toj kynimbˈila , quˈn mi bˈiˈn kyuˈn tiˈ qˈijil mo alkye or chin ula , ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , chiˈ .

text: For the kingdom of heaven is as a man travelling into a far country , who called his own servants , and delivered unto them his goods .
text2: Ex ikyxjo , a Tkawbˈil Dios toj kyaˈj , tzeˈnku jun xjal , tuˈntaq t ‑ xiˈ toj jun tbˈe najchaq . I tzaj ttxkoˈn taqˈnil , ex xi toqxenin tpwaq kye .

text: And unto one he gave five talents , to another two , and to another one ; to every man according to his several ability ; and straightway took his journey .
text2: Te jun , xi tqˈoˈn jweˈ mil ; te juntl kabˈe mil , ex te juntl , noq jun mil , teyile junjun xi tqˈoˈn tzeˈnkux kynabˈl . Ex bˈeˈxsin xiˈtz toj tbˈe .

text: Then he that had received the five talents went and traded with the same , and made them other five talents .
text2: Me ante aqˈnil , a xi ttzyuˈn jweˈ mil pwaq , bˈeˈx kubˈ tqˈoˈn tkˈaẍjil , tuˈn tchˈiy pwaq . Ex bˈeˈx tkanbˈe jweˈtl mil .

text: And likewise he that had received two , he also gained other two .
text2: Ex ikyx tene tuˈn , a xi ttzyuˈn kabˈe mil ; ex tkanbˈe jun kabˈetl tibˈaj .

text: But he that had received one went and digged in the earth , and hid his lord ' s money .
text2: Me anteˈ xi tzyuˈnte jun mil , bˈeˈx xiˈ ewil teˈ tpwaq tajaw toj jun jul , ex kux tmiquˈn toj txˈotxˈ .

text: After a long time the lord of those servants cometh , and reckoneth with them .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ jun jteˈbˈin abˈqˈe , meltzˈajljo xjal , a kyajawjo aqˈnil , ex bˈaj xi tqanin tpwaq teyile junjun tukˈaxjo taˈl .

text: And so he that had received five talents came and brought other five talents , saying , Lord , thou deliveredst unto me five talents : behold , I have gained beside them five talents more .
text2: Nejxix xi xkye tukˈaˈ xi tzyuˈnte jweˈ mil , ex xi tqˈoˈn jweˈ mil te tajaw tukˈaxjo juntl jweˈ miltl , a otaq kanbˈit tuˈn . Ex xi tqˈmaˈn te : Taa , jweˈ mil tzaj tqˈoˈn weˈy . Me luˈ juntl jweˈ miltl , ma nkanbˈiy tukˈa .

text: His lord said unto him , Well done , thou good and faithful servant : thou hast been faithful over a few things , I will make thee ruler over many things : enter thou into the joy of thy lord .
text2: Me antej tajaw pwaq xi tqˈmaˈn : Chjontiy . Jun aqˈnil , a tbˈanilx wen ex tzˈaqlexix . Atzin jaˈlin , quˈn tuˈn nimx xbˈant tuˈn tukˈa tal chˈin , nimxixtl kxel nqˈoˈn tey . Ku toktza ex ku ttzalaja wukˈiy .

text: He also that had received two talents came and said , Lord , thou deliveredst unto me two talents : behold , I have gained two other talents beside them .
text2: Atzaj teˈ tkanin juntl aqˈnil , a xi ttzyuˈn teˈ kabˈe mil pwaq , xi tqˈmaˈn : Taa , kabˈe mil tzaj tqˈoˈn weˈy . Me luˈ juntl kabˈe miltl lo , ma nkanbˈiy tukˈa .

text: His lord said unto him , Well done , good and faithful servant ; thou hast been faithful over a few things , I will make thee ruler over many things : enter thou into the joy of thy lord .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn tajaw pwaq te : Chjontiy . Jun aqˈnil , a tbˈanilx wen ex tzˈaqlexix . Atzin jaˈlin , quˈn tuˈn nimx xbˈant tuˈn tukˈa tal chˈin , nimxixtl kxel nqˈoˈn tey . Ku toktza ex ku ttzalaja wukˈiy .

text: Then he which had received the one talent came and said , Lord , I knew thee that thou art an hard man , reaping where thou hast not sown , and gathering where thou hast not strawed :
text2: Atzaj teˈ tkanin aqˈnil , a xi tzyuˈnte jun mil , xi tqˈmaˈn te tajaw : Taa , bˈiˈn wuˈn qa ay jun xjal kuj , ex qa njyet jun tpwaqa noq tuˈn taqˈnbˈin juntl , ex at tey , me mi n ‑ aqˈniˈn .

text: And I was afraid , and went and hid thy talent in the earth : lo , there thou hast that is thine .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , bˈeˈx in tzaj xobˈa tey , qa xnajku pwaq wuˈn . Tuˈnpetziˈn bˈeˈx xkux nmiquˈn toj txˈotxˈ . Ex luˈ tpwaqa lo .

text: His lord answered and said unto him , Thou wicked and slothful servant , thou knewest that I reap where I sowed not , and gather where I have not strawed :
text2: Atzin xi tqˈmaˈn tajaw pwaq te : Jun aqˈnil , a nya bˈaˈn , ex manyor kyˈajxa . Qa bˈiˈntaq tuˈn , qa at npwaqa noq tuˈn taqˈnbˈin juntl , ex qa at weˈy , tuˈn mi nchin aqˈniˈn ;

text: Thou oughtest therefore to have put my money to the exchangers , and then at my coming I should have received mine own with usury .
text2: tuˈnpetziˈn , noqit bˈeˈx s ‑ okx tqˈonjiy npwaqa toj nim ja te kˈuˈbˈl pwaq , tuˈntzintla , tej ẍin ula jaˈlin , matla tzˈetz wiˈn weˈ npwaq , ex matla tkanbˈe manbˈilte .

text: Take therefore the talent from him , and give it unto him which hath ten talents .
text2: Ex xi tqˈmaˈn kyeˈ iteˈtaq antza : Kyimiljiˈy ajo mil pwaq te , ex kyqˈonxa te a at lajaj mil tukˈa .

text: For unto every one that hath shall be given , and he shall have abundance : but from him that hath not shall be taken away even that which he hath .
text2: Quˈn ankyeˈ at nim te , ex kyjaˈ kxele txqantl teˈ , tuˈn mi bˈajix . Me anteˈ , a ntiˈ at te , majxpeˈ tal chˈinl at te , k ‑ elil qˈiyit .

text: And cast ye the unprofitable servant into outer darkness : there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth .
text2: Ex atziˈn aqˈnil ntiˈ tajbˈin , kyqˈomixa tzma peˈn toj qxopin kyukˈa jniˈ nya nimil , a jaˈ kchi oqˈile ex jaˈ kchi juˈchˈile kyste tuˈn kyixkˈoj .

text: When the Son of man shall come in his glory , and all the holy angels with him , then shall he sit upon the throne of his glory :
text2: Ok tenl Jesús qˈmalte : Aj wula , a ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , kchin ula tukˈa nim nqoptzˈajiyila ex kyukˈa kykyaqil n ‑ angela wukˈiy . Ex kchin kˈwel qeˈy tibˈaj nqˈuqbˈila kawil kyibˈaj kykyaqil tukˈa tkyaqil nqoptzˈajiyila .

text: And before him shall be gathered all nations : and he shall separate them one from another , as a shepherd divideth his sheep from the goats :
text2: Ex tkyaqil xjal toj tkyaqil twutz txˈotxˈ kchi ul chmet nwutza , ex kchi elil npaˈnjiˈy xjal jun tukˈa juntl , tzeˈnku jun kyikˈlel nchi el tpaˈn rit kyxol chiv .

text: And he shall set the sheep on his right hand , but the goats on the left .
text2: Kchi kˈwel nqˈoˈnjiˈy aye wen xjal , ayeˈ tzeˈnqekuˈ rit , toj nman qˈobˈa , ex ayetziˈn nya wen , ayeˈ tzeˈnqekuˈ chiv , toj nẍnayaja .

text: Then shall the King say unto them on his right hand , Come , ye blessed of my Father , inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world :
text2: Ex kxel nqˈmaˈn ayiˈn , a Nmaq Kawil , kye ayeˈ iteˈ toj nman qˈobˈa : Ku kytzaja , ayiˈy ma chi kubˈ kyˈiwliˈn tuˈn nMaˈn . Kyetzinxjiˈy kyokliˈn tiˈjjo tbˈanilxix Tkawbˈil nMaˈn , a bˈinchin te kyeˈy , atxix teˈ tkubˈku xkye twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: For I was an hungred , and ye gave me meat : I was thirsty , and ye gave me drink : I was a stranger , and ye took me in :
text2: Quˈn tej ttzaj qˈaqˈin nkˈuˈja , tzaj kyqˈoˈn nwaˈy . Ex tej ttzaj kˈwaj wiˈja , tzaj kyqˈoˈn nkˈwaˈy . Tej woka bˈetin xjal , tzaj kyqˈoˈn nwatbˈila .

text: Naked , and ye clothed me : I was sick , and ye visited me : I was in prison , and ye came unto me .
text2: Ex tej tel bˈaj nxbˈaliˈn , ma chin ok kyktxuˈn . Ex tej nyabˈtiˈy , chi txaˈja qˈolbˈil weˈy . Ex tej nkuˈxa toj tze , chi txaˈja lol weˈy .

text: Then shall the righteous answer him , saying , Lord , when saw we thee an hungred , and fed thee ? or thirsty , and gave thee drink ?
text2: Ex ayetziˈn tzˈaqleqe kchi xel qaninte te : QAjaw , ¿ Jtojetzin xqliˈy ay tukˈa waˈyaj , ex ma txi qqˈoˈn twaˈy ? ¿ Jtojetzin xqliˈy ay tukˈa kˈwaj , ex ma txi qqˈoˈn tkˈwaˈy ?

text: When saw we thee a stranger , and took thee in ? or naked , and clothed thee ?
text2: ¿ Jtojetzin xqliˈy ay ma tzˈoka te bˈetin xjal , ex matla txi qqˈoˈn twatbˈila ; ex jaˈtzin xqlaˈyiˈy ay ntiˈt t ‑ xbˈaliˈn tok , ex matla txi qqˈoˈn ?

text: Or when saw we thee sick , or in prison , and came unto thee ?
text2: ¿ Ex jtojetzin xqliˈy tuˈn tyabˈtiy mo qa tkuxa toj tze , ex o xtajatlaˈy loltiˈy ?

text: And the King shall answer and say unto them , Verily I say unto you , Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my brethren , ye have done it unto me .
text2: Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn ayiˈn , a nmaq kawil , kyeˈy : Ex okxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , tkyaqilxjo xkubˈ kybˈinchiˈn tiˈj jun tal yaj mo tiˈj jun aˈla , a kˈuˈjlinkxix wuˈn , toj twutz Dios , wiˈja s ‑ oke kybˈinchiniˈy .

text: Then shall he say also unto them on the left hand , Depart from me , ye cursed , into everlasting fire , prepared for the devil and his angels :
text2: Ex ikyxjo kxel nqˈmaˈn kye iteˈ toj nẍnayaja : Ku kyela nkˈatza , quˈn ma chi kyija tjaqˈ tqanbˈil nMaˈn . Ku kyxiˈy toj qˈaqˈ , a mixla k ‑ yupjilx , bˈinchinl te kawbˈil kujxix te tajaw il exqetziˈn jniˈ taqˈnil .

text: For I was an hungred , and ye gave me no meat : I was thirsty , and ye gave me no drink :
text2: Quˈn tej tqˈaqˈin nkˈuˈja , mix tzaje kyqˈoˈn nwaˈy . Ex tej ttzaj kˈwaj wiˈja , mix tzaje kyqˈoˈn nkˈwaˈy .

text: I was a stranger , and ye took me not in : naked , and ye clothed me not : sick , and in prison , and ye visited me not .
text2: Tej woka bˈetin xjal , mix tzaja kyqˈoˈn nwatbˈila . Ex tej tel bˈaj nxbˈaliˈn , mix in oka kyktxuˈn . Ex tej nyabˈtiˈy , mix i xtajiˈy qˈolbˈil weˈy . Ex tej nkuˈxa toj tze , mix i xtajiˈy lol weˈy .

text: Then shall they also answer him , saying , Lord , when saw we thee an hungred , or athirst , or a stranger , or naked , or sick , or in prison , and did not minister unto thee ?
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , kxel kyqanin : Tata , ¿ Jtojetzin xqlontiˈy tukˈa waˈyaj mo qa tukˈa kˈwaj , ex tzeˈn jun bˈetin xjal , mo qa ntiˈ t ‑ xbˈalinja , ex qa yabˈja mo qa toj tze , ex mix qo mojiˈn tiˈja ?

text: Then shall he answer them , saying , Verily I say unto you , Inasmuch as ye did it not to one of the least of these , ye did it not to me .
text2: Me kxel ntzaqˈwiˈn : Okxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , tkyaqilxjo mi s ‑ ok kybˈinchiˈn kyiˈjjo tal yaj , mo tiˈj jun aˈlaj , ayeˈ kˈuˈjlinqexix wuˈn ; toj twutz Dios , wiˈja mi s ‑ oke kybˈinchiniˈy .

text: And these shall go away into everlasting punishment : but the righteous into life eternal .
text2: Ayetziˈn xjal luˈn kchi xeˈl toj najin te jun majx . Me ayetziˈn tzˈaqleqe , kchi xeˈl toj tkabˈ kychwinqil , a nlayx bˈaj .

text: And it came to pass , when Jesus had finished all these sayings , he said unto his disciples ,
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ tyolin Jesúsjo yol lo , tzaj tqˈmaˈn qeˈy , awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin :

text: Ye know that after two days is the feast of the passover , and the Son of man is betrayed to be crucified .
text2: Ikytziˈn tzeˈnku bˈiˈn kyuˈn , noq kabˈe qˈij chˈintl , tuˈn tbˈajjo nintz qˈij te Xjan Qˈij , ex ayintzin weˈ , a Tkˈwal Ichin , kchin xel qˈoˈn toj kyqˈobˈxjal , tuˈn nkubˈ kybˈyoˈn twutz cruz , chi Jesús .

text: Then assembled together the chief priests , and the scribes , and the elders of the people , unto the palace of the high priest , who was called Caiaphas ,
text2: Kyojjo qˈij anetziˈn , aye kynejil pale exqetziˈn xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil ex jniˈ nejinel kyxol aj Judiy ma bˈaj kychmoˈn kyibˈ tojjo tja tnejilxix pale , a Caifás tbˈi .

text: And consulted that they might take Jesus by subtilty , and kill him .
text2: Ex ma bˈaj kyjyoˈn tumil , tzeˈn tuˈn ttzyet Jesús kyuˈn tukˈa sbˈubˈl , ex tuˈn tkubˈ kybˈyoˈn .

text: But they said , Not on the feast day , lest there be an uproar among the people .
text2: Me bˈaj kyyolin , qa nya toj nintz qˈij te Xjan Qˈij , tuˈntzintla mi bˈaj jaw tiljxjal kyiˈj .

text: Now when Jesus was in Bethany , in the house of Simon the leper ,
text2: Attaq Jesús tojjo kojbˈil Betania toj tja Simun , jun xjal otaq tzˈel weˈ tuˈn txˈaˈk .

text: There came unto him a woman having an alabaster box of very precious ointment , and poured it on his head , as he sat at meat .
text2: Antza , tzaj laqˈe jun qya qˈiˈntaq jun tal ẍunk tuˈn , bˈinchin tuˈn jun wiq abˈj tbˈanilx wen , ex nojnin tukˈa jun wiq jupsbˈil manyor wiˈyil wen , nardo tbˈi . Tzmataq qˈuqle Jesús tiˈj meẍ , tej tok tsuˈn qya jupsbˈil tiˈj twiˈ Jesús .

text: But when his disciples saw it , they had indignation , saying , To what purpose is this waste ?
text2: Me atzaj teˈ xi qkaˈyiˈn , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , bˈeˈx tzaj qqˈoja , ex o jaw yolbˈiˈn tiˈj , ex xi qqˈmaˈn : ¿ Tiˈtzila qe ma txi tyajin qya qˈanbˈil anetziˈn ?

text: For this ointment might have been sold for much , and given to the poor .
text2: Noqit noq xi tkˈayin , matla wiˈyin , ex atzintlaˈ pwaq matla txiˈ te mojbˈil kye yaj .

text: When Jesus understood it , he said unto them , Why trouble ye the woman ? for she hath wrought a good work upon me .
text2: Atzaj teˈ tok tbˈiˈn Jesús ikyjo , bˈeˈx tzaj tqˈmaˈn qeˈy : ¿ Tin qe n ‑ ok kyilinjiˈy qya lo ? Quˈn atzin ma tbˈinchin wiˈja tbˈanilx wen .

text: For ye have the poor always with you ; but me ye have not always .
text2: Quˈn bˈapeˈ kye yaj loqe kye iteˈ axsa kyxola , me metzin weˈ , mi chin tenl weˈ kyukˈiy .

text: For in that she hath poured this ointment on my body , she did it for my burial .
text2: Quˈn atziˈn ma jax tqoˈn jupsbˈil wiˈbˈaja , noq tuˈn tbˈaj tbˈinchin nxmilila , aj tkux muqet .

text: Verily I say unto you , Wheresoever this gospel shall be preached in the whole world , there shall also this , that this woman hath done , be told for a memorial of her .
text2: Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , jaˈchaqx kubˈ yolit teˈ Tbˈanil Tqanil wiˈja tkyaqil twutz txˈotxˈ , ex kˈwel yolitjo ma kubˈ tbˈinchin qya wiˈja te jun naˈbˈl tejo qya lo .

text: Then one of the twelve , called Judas Iscariot , went unto the chief priests ,
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , atzin Judas Iscariot , jun t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin Jesús , bˈeˈx xiˈ kyukˈa kynejil pale ,

text: And said unto them , What will ye give me , and I will deliver him unto you ? And they covenanted with him for thirty pieces of silver .
text2: ex xi tqanin kye : ¿ Jteˈ aku tzaj kyqˈoˈn weˈy , tuˈn t ‑ xi nqˈoˈn Jesús toj kyqˈobˈa ? Kˈaˈ txi qqˈoˈn lajaj toj kaˈwnaq saqpwaq , chi chiˈ .

text: And from that time he sought opportunity to betray him .
text2: Oktzin ten Judas jyol tumil , tzeˈn tten tuˈn t ‑ xi tqˈoˈn toj kyqˈobˈ .

text: Now the first day of the feast of unleavened bread the disciples came to Jesus , saying unto him , Where wilt thou that we prepare for thee to eat the passover ?
text2: Tojjo tnejil qˈij te Waˈj Pan , a waˈj pan ntiˈ txˈamsbˈilte nxiˈ , o xi laqˈeˈy tkˈatz Jesús , ex xi qqaniˈn te : ¿ Jaˈtzin tajiy tuˈn tkubˈ qbˈinchinjiˈy wabˈj te ikyˈsbˈil Xjan Qˈij ?

text: And he said , Go into the city to such a man , and say unto him , The Master saith , My time is at hand ; I will keep the passover at thy house with my disciples .
text2: Ex tzaj ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Ku kyxiˈy toj tnam toj tja jun ichin , ex kyqˈmanxa te : Chiˈ xnaqˈtziljo kyjaluˈn : Chˈix tpon or tuˈn nkyima . Tuˈnpetziˈn , waja tuˈn tkubˈ ikyˈsit Xjan Qˈij toj tjay junx kyukˈa nxnaqˈtzbˈiˈn chichkujiˈy .

text: And the disciples did as Jesus had appointed them ; and they made ready the passover .
text2: Ex kubˈ kybˈinchin junjun qxola , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , tzeˈnkuxjo tzaj tqˈmaˈn . Ex kubˈ kybˈinchin wabˈj te Xjan Qˈij .

text: Now when the even was come , he sat down with the twelve .
text2: Atzaj teˈ qok yupj , kubˈ qe Jesús tiˈj meẍ qukˈiy , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin .

text: And as they did eat , he said , Verily I say unto you , that one of you shall betray me .
text2: Ex tzmataq nqo waˈn , tzaj tqˈmaˈn Jesús qeˈy : Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , at jun kyeˈ kxel qˈoˈn weˈy toj kyqˈobˈxjal , chiˈ .

text: And they were exceeding sorrowful , and began every one of them to say unto him , Lord , is it I ?
text2: Tuˈntziˈn ikyjo , bˈeˈx o bˈaj jaw bˈisiˈn , ex junjunku o ok ten qanilte : WAjaw , ¿ Meqa ayiˈn ? qo chijiˈy .

text: And he answered and said , He that dippeth his hand with me in the dish , the same shall betray me .
text2: Ex tzaj ttzaqˈwin Jesús qeˈy : Atziˈn jun , a nkux tmulin twa junx wukˈiy ; atzin kxel qˈoˈn wejiˈy toj kyqˈobˈxjal .

text: The Son of man goeth as it is written of him : but woe unto that man by whom the Son of man is betrayed ! it had been good for that man if he had not been born .
text2: Okx kbˈajilx wiˈja , ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , tzeˈn ntqˈmaˈn Tyol Dios , tuˈn nxi kˈayiˈn . Me atzin kxel kˈayin weˈy , noqxpet mi s ‑ ul itzˈje twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: Then Judas , which betrayed him , answered and said , Master , is it I ? He said unto him , Thou hast said .
text2: Bˈeˈx jaw yolin Judas , a tuˈntaq t ‑ xi kˈayinte , ex xi tqˈmaˈn : Xnaqˈtzil , ¿ Mej qa ayiˈn ? Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús te : Axa ma qˈmante .

text: And as they were eating , Jesus took bread , and blessed it , and brake it , and gave it to the disciples , and said , Take , eat ; this is my body .
text2: Nqo waˈntaqa , tej tjaw ttzyuˈn Jesús jun pan , ex xi tqˈoˈn chjonte te Dios tiˈj ; ex kubˈ tpiẍin , ex xi tsipin qeˈy , awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , ex tzaj tqˈmaˈn : Kywanxjiˈy lo , quˈn atzin nxmililjiˈy .

text: And he took the cup , and gave thanks , and gave it to them , saying , Drink ye all of it ;
text2: Ex tzaj ttzyuˈn jun tkˈwel kˈwabˈj tukˈa vin , ex xi tqˈoˈn chjonte te Dios tiˈj ; xi tqˈoˈn qeˈy , ex tzaj tqˈmaˈn : Chi kˈwaˈn tojjo tkˈwel kˈwabˈj lo kykyaqilxa ,

text: For this is my blood of the new testament , which is shed for many for the remission of sins .
text2: quˈn atziˈn nchkyˈeljiˈy , jun akˈaj tumil , a bˈantnin tiˈj tuˈn Dios , tuˈn kykyijxjal toj wen tukˈa . Quˈn a nchkyˈela k ‑ elil chitj te chojbˈil kyilxjal .

text: But I say unto you , I will not drink henceforth of this fruit of the vine , until that day when I drink it new with you in my Father ' s kingdom .
text2: Me kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , mi chin kˈwaˈntla tiˈjjo kˈwabˈj luˈn tzmaxiˈ aj qkˈwan junx kyukˈiy tzma toj Tkawbˈil nMaˈn toj kyaˈj .

text: And when they had sung an hymn , they went out into the mount of Olives .
text2: Tej tbˈaj qbˈitziˈn jun bˈitz , bˈeˈx o xiˈy twiˈ wutz Olivos .

text: Then saith Jesus unto them , All ye shall be offended because of me this night : for it is written , I will smite the shepherd , and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered abroad .
text2: Teˈ qkaniˈn antza , tzaj tqˈmaˈn Jesús qeˈy : Tojjo qnikyˈin luˈn , jotqexa k ‑ elil tqˈuqbˈil kykˈuˈja wiˈja , tzeˈnkuxjo ntqˈmaˈn toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios : Kˈwel nbˈyonjiˈy kyikˈlel , ex ayetziˈn rit kchi bˈajelil tilj , chiˈ .

text: But after I am risen again , I will go before you into Galilee .
text2: Me ajtzin njaw anqˈiˈntla , kchin kˈwel neja kywutza toj Galiley .

text: Peter answered and said unto him , Though all men shall be offended because of thee , yet will I never be offended .
text2: Me ante Pegr xi ttzaqˈwin : Ex qa kykyaqilx s ‑ el kyiˈn tqˈuqbˈil kykˈuˈj tiˈja , me mina weˈ , chi Pegrjo .

text: Jesus said unto him , Verily I say unto thee , That this night , before the cock crow , thou shalt deny me thrice .
text2: Me xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús te : Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn teˈy , tojxjo qnikyˈin lo , a naˈmtaqx toqˈ tman ekyˈ , otaq chin kubˈ tewiˈn oxe maj kywutzxjal , ex kxel tqˈmaˈn kye qa nya ojtzqiˈnqiˈn tuˈnch .

text: Peter said unto him , Though I should die with thee , yet will I not deny thee . Likewise also said all the disciples .
text2: Ex xi tqˈmaˈn Pegr : Exla qa ma chin kyim weˈ tukˈiy , me nlayx kubˈ wewiˈn . Ex ikyxjo qqˈmaˈy qkyaqila .

text: Then cometh Jesus with them unto a place called Gethsemane , and saith unto the disciples , Sit ye here , while I go and pray yonder .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , bˈeˈx xiˈ Jesús qukˈiy toj jun najbˈil , Getsemaní tbˈi . Tej qkaniˈn antza , tzaj tqˈmaˈn Jesús qeˈy : Ku kykyij qeˈy tzaluˈn . Ma chinka naˈl Dios tzachiˈn .

text: And he took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee , and began to be sorrowful and very heavy .
text2: Oˈkqex Pegr i xi tkˈleˈn exqetziˈn tkˈwal Zebedey , a Juan ex Santyaw , ex tzaj txqan bˈis toj tanmin ex txqan tzqij tzibˈaj ,

text: Then saith he unto them , My soul is exceeding sorrowful , even unto death : tarry ye here , and watch with me .
text2: ex xi tqˈmaˈn kye : Ma tzajx txqan bˈis toj wanmiˈn , nyakutzaj chin kyimila . Chi tenkjtziˈn tzaluˈn , me noq tzaj kywatla .

text: And he went a little further , and fell on his face , and prayed , saying , O my Father , if it be possible , let this cup pass from me : nevertheless not as I will , but as thou wilt .
text2: Xi laqˈe Jesús najchaq chˈintl kykˈatz , ex kubˈ mutxe twutz txˈotxˈ naˈl Dios , ex chiˈ kyjaluˈn : NMaˈn , chin tklomila te tkyaqil jniˈ kkyˈelix wuˈn ; me noqit nya a tzeˈnku waja , qalaˈ atla tzeˈnkuxjo taja .

text: And he cometh unto the disciples , and findeth them asleep , and saith unto Peter , What , could ye not watch with me one hour ?
text2: Bˈeˈx meltzˈaj kykˈatz oxe t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin . Atzaj teˈ tul kykˈatz , xi tqˈmaˈn te Pegr : ¿ Ma mitzin s ‑ elx jun or kywatla wukˈiy ?

text: Watch and pray , that ye enter not into temptation : the spirit indeed is willing , but the flesh is weak .
text2: Kyimil kywatla , ex kux chi bˈaj naˈn Dios , tuˈn mina chi kubˈ tzˈaqa toj tqˈobˈ tajaw il , quˈn kyaja tuˈn tkubˈ kybˈinchinjiˈy a taj Dios , me alkyetz kuj n ‑ ele te kyeˈy tuˈn tbˈant .

text: He went away again the second time , and prayed , saying , O my Father , if this cup may not pass away from me , except I drink it , thy will be done .
text2: Xiˈ toj tkabˈ majin naˈl Dios . Chiˈ kyjaluˈn : Ay nMaˈn , qa ntiˈx tumil tuˈn mi tzikyˈx xiˈ luˈn wuˈn , bˈinchimtzinjiy a taja wukˈiy .

text: And he came and found them asleep again : for their eyes were heavy .
text2: Tej tmeltzˈaj juntl majl kykˈatzjo t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , ex ikyxljo , nchi ktantaql , teˈ kyel knetl tuˈn , quˈn mix kypaˈyix watl .

text: And he left them , and went away again , and prayed the third time , saying the same words .
text2: Ex bˈeˈx i kyij ttzaqpiˈn , ex bˈeˈx xiˈ toj tox majin naˈl Dios . Ex ayex tyoljo i xi tqˈmaˈn toj tnaˈj Dios .

text: Then cometh he to his disciples , and saith unto them , Sleep on now , and take your rest : behold , the hour is at hand , and the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners .
text2: Atzaj teˈ tmeltzˈaj jaˈ iteˈye oxe t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , xi tqˈmaˈn kye : ¿ Ma tzunxsin nchi ktaˈn , ex nchi ajlaˈn ? Ma pon or tuˈn nxi qˈoˈn ayiˈn , a Tkˈwal Ichin , toj kyqˈobˈ aj il .

text: Rise , let us be going : behold , he is at hand that doth betray me .
text2: ¡ Kux chi jaw weˈksa ! ¡ Qoˈqe ! Quˈn luˈ tzul a kxel kˈayin weˈy .

text: And while he yet spake , lo , Judas , one of the twelve , came , and with him a great multitude with swords and staves , from the chief priests and elders of the people .
text2: Tzmataq nyolin Jesús , teˈ tul Judas , a jun t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin . Ex lipcheqektaq txqan xjal tiˈj , qˈimile jniˈ kykxbˈil , a at kyste te bˈiˈybˈil , ex jniˈ kytze te kybˈujbˈil . Aye xjal luˈn otaq chi tzaj kychqˈoˈn kynejil pale ex kyuˈn nejinel kyxol aj Judiy .

text: Now he that betrayed him gave them a sign , saying , Whomsoever I shall kiss , that same is he : hold him fast .
text2: Otaq bˈaj tqˈmaˈn Judas kye , tzeˈn ttxolil tuˈn tel tnikyˈtzajil : Ankyeˈ k ‑ okil nmaˈtziˈn , atziˈn . Bˈeˈx kˈaˈ tzˈok kytzyuˈn .

text: And forthwith he came to Jesus , and said , Hail , master ; and kissed him .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , tzaj laqˈexix tkˈatz Jesús , ex xi tqˈmaˈn : Chin qˈolbˈiˈn , Xnaqˈtzil , chiˈ . Exsin el tmaˈtzin Judas Jesús .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Friend , wherefore art thou come ? Then came they , and laid hands on Jesus , and took him .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús te : ¡ Ay wukˈa ! Ankye ma tzula bˈinchilte , ¡ Bˈinchinkutziˈn ! Bˈeˈxsin i tzaj laqˈe txqantl , ex ok kytzyuˈn Jesús , ex el qititin kyuˈn .

text: And , behold , one of them which were with Jesus stretched out his hand , and drew his sword , and struck a servant of the high priest ' s , and smote off his ear .
text2: Me attaq jun tukˈa Jesús jatz tiˈn tkxbˈil toj tja , ex el tjaspin tẍkyin jun taqˈnil tnejilxix pale .

text: Then said Jesus unto him , Put up again thy sword into his place : for all they that take the sword shall perish with the sword .
text2: Me xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús : Qˈonkux tkxbˈila toj tkubˈil . Quˈn kykyaqilxjo nchi bˈujin tukˈa kxbˈil , ex tukˈa kxbˈil kchi kyimile .

text: Thinkest thou that I cannot now pray to my Father , and he shall presently give me more than twelve legions of angels ?
text2: ¿ Ma mitzin bˈiˈn tuˈn , noqit waja txi nqaniˈn te nMaˈn , tuˈn ttzaj tsmaˈn jun kabˈlajaj chˈuq angel klol weˈ , jaˈlinxitla tzaj tqˈoˈn ?

text: But how then shall the scriptures be fulfilled , that thus it must be ?
text2: Me qa ma kubˈ nbˈinchiˈn ikyjo , ¿ Tzeˈntzin ttentz tuˈn tjapiˈn a tzˈibˈiˈn toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios , qa iltaq tiˈj tuˈn tbˈaj tkyaqiljo ikyjo ?

text: In that same hour said Jesus to the multitudes , Are ye come out as against a thief with swords and staves for to take me ? I sat daily with you teaching in the temple , and ye laid no hold on me .
text2: Ex bˈeˈx xi tqanin Jesús kye jniˈ xjal : ¿ Tiquˈn ma chi ula tukˈa kykxbˈila ex jniˈ kytzeˈy , tuˈn nxi qititiˈn kyuˈn nyakuj jun ileqˈqiˈn toj kywutza ? ¿ Ma nyatzin nchin xnaqˈtziˈn kyxola toj tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios tkyaqil qˈij ? ¿ Tiquˈn mix in ele qititintza kyuˈn antza ?

text: But all this was done , that the scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled . Then all the disciples forsook him , and fled .
text2: ¡ Me nya tiquˈnil ! Quˈn tkyaqiljo lo bˈantninl tiˈj tuˈn tjapiˈn tzeˈnku kyyoleˈ yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe , ex i kubˈ tzˈibˈin tojjo Tuˈjil Tyol Dios . Ex bˈeˈx kyij qtzaqpiˈn , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , tjunalx . Bˈeˈx o bˈaj kubˈe toj bˈe .

text: And they that had laid hold on Jesus led him away to Caiaphas the high priest , where the scribes and the elders were assembled .
text2: Me ayetziˈn i xi tzyuˈnte Jesús twutz Caifás , a kynejilxix pale , a jaˈ otaq tzˈoke kychmoˈne kyibˈjo jniˈ xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil exqetziˈn nejinel kyxol aj Judiy .

text: But Peter followed him afar off unto the high priest ' s palace , and went in , and sat with the servants , to see the end .
text2: Me najchaq lipchexitaq Pegr tzma tpeˈn tja kynejilxix pale , a jaˈ otaq tzˈokxi Jesús , ex kyij qe antza kyxol xoˈl qˈaqˈ yolte tiˈtaq kbˈajil tiˈj Jesús .

text: Now the chief priests , and elders , and all the council , sought false witness against Jesus , to put him to death ;
text2: Ayetziˈn kynejil pale exqetziˈn kynejilxjal , ex kykyaqilxjo txqantl kawil nchi bˈaj jyontaq tumil exla qa nya twutz , tzeˈn tten tuˈn tkubˈtaq tzˈaq toj jun til , tuˈn tkyim .

text: But found none : yea , though many false witnesses came , yet found they none . At the last came two false witnesses ,
text2: Me mix ja knete jun til kyuˈn , exla qa ma nintzxjal o tzaj patilte . Me tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , i kaninxpen kabˈetz qˈmalte :

text: And said , This fellow said , I am able to destroy the temple of God , and to build it in three days .
text2: Atzin ichin lo o tqˈma , qa tuˈntaq tkubˈ tyuchˈin tnejil ja te qnaˈbˈl Dios , ex toj oxe qˈij noq bˈantninl t ‑ xel tuˈnch .

text: And the high priest arose , and said unto him , Answerest thou nothing ? what is it which these witness against thee ?
text2: Me anteˈ tnejilxix pale jaw weˈks , ex xi tqanin te Jesús : ¿ Tiquˈn mi ntzaj ttzaqˈwiˈn chˈin ? ¿ Tiˈxsiˈn nkyqˈmaˈnxjal tiˈja ?

text: But Jesus held his peace . And the high priest answered and said unto him , I adjure thee by the living God , that thou tell us whether thou be the Christ , the Son of God .
text2: Me ntiˈx te Jesús xi ttzaqˈwin . Me xi tqˈmaˈn tnejilxix pale te : Twutz Dios itzˈ ex tiˈj tbˈi , kxel nqaniˈn teˈy tuˈn ttzaj tqˈmaˈn , qa twutzxix qa ajiy Crist , a Tkˈwal Dios .

text: Jesus saith unto him , Thou hast said : nevertheless I say unto you , Hereafter shall ye see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of power , and coming in the clouds of heaven .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Ikytziˈn tzeˈnku ma tqˈmay . Ex ikyx wejiˈy kxel nqˈmaˈn : Ok kylaˈbˈila a ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , aj nkubˈ qeˈy toj tman qˈobˈjo Dios , a nimxix tipin , ex aj nmeltzˈaja toj muj toj kyaˈj .

text: Then the high priest rent his clothes , saying , He hath spoken blasphemy ; what further need have we of witnesses ? behold , now ye have heard his blasphemy .
text2: Teˈ tqˈmante ikyjo , noqx el kyimjo kynejilxix pale , ex bˈeˈx xi lipin laqil kye t ‑ xbˈalin tuˈn tqˈoj , ex tqˈma : Ayetziˈn tyoljo maˈ ichin luˈn noq nxoˈn yol tiˈj Dios . ¿ Tiqeˈ txqantl tstiyil qe ? A ayekuy ma chi bˈin teˈ tyol , a nya wenqe .

text: What think ye ? They answered and said , He is guilty of death .
text2: ¿ Mo tzeˈn chˈin kyeˈ toj kywutz ? Ex atzin kyexjal xi kytzaqˈwin : Axte at tpaj tiˈjx , ex toj tilx tuˈn tkyim , chi chiˈ .

text: Then did they spit in his face , and buffeted him ; and others smote him with the palms of their hands ,
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , bˈeˈx bˈaj joˈkx kytzuˈbˈin toj twutz , ex bˈaj kybˈyoˈn . Ex junjuntl bˈaj okx tzˈajchinte toj twutz ,

text: Saying , Prophesy unto us , thou Christ , Who is he that smote thee ?
text2: ex xi kyqanin te : Qa ajiy Crist , a skˈoˈnxix tuˈn Dios , pontzin tiˈj , ankyeˈ s ‑ ok tzˈajchintiy .

text: Now Peter sat without in the palace : and a damsel came unto him , saying , Thou also wast with Jesus of Galilee .
text2: Ex qˈuqletaq Pegr twiˈ peˈn , tej t ‑ xi laqˈe jun txin tkˈatz , a bˈinchil wabˈj . Ex xi tqˈmaˈn te : Ex ikyx tejiy ; ajintaq te nbˈettaq tukˈa Jesús aj Galiley .

text: But he denied before them all , saying , I know not what thou sayest .
text2: Me bˈeˈx kubˈ tewin Pegr twutz tkyaqil , ex xi tqˈmaˈn : Ntiˈ bˈiˈn wuˈn tiˈ qiˈjil nyoliniych .

text: And when he was gone out into the porch , another maid saw him , and said unto them that were there , This fellow was also with Jesus of Nazareth .
text2: Ex bˈeˈx xi laqˈe twutz tjpel ja , jaˈ iwle tuˈn juntl . Ex xi tqˈmaˈn kye txqantl : Ex ikyx teˈ luˈn nbˈettaq tukˈa Jesús aj Nazaretch .

text: And again he denied with an oath , I do not know the man .
text2: Ex bˈeˈx kubˈ tewin Pegr juntl majl : Twutzx Dios kxel nqˈmaˈn , mi ojtzqiˈn wejiˈy ichin anetziˈn .

text: And after a while came unto him they that stood by , and said to Peter , Surely thou also art one of them ; for thy speech bewrayeth thee .
text2: Me matxitaq chˈintl , jniˈ iteˈtaq antza i xi laqˈe tkˈatz Pegr , ex xi kyqˈmaˈn te : Ex ikyx tejiy ajin te kyukˈa , quˈn noq tiˈjjo yoliˈn n ‑ ele qnikyˈa tiˈj .

text: Then began he to curse and to swear , saying , I know not the man . And immediately the cock crew .
text2: Me oktzin ten Pegr qˈol qanbˈil tibˈajx , ex xi tqˈmaˈn : Twutz Dios , mi ojtzqiˈnx wejiˈy ichin wuˈn anetziˈn . Ex njawku oqˈ ekyˈ .

text: And Peter remembered the word of Jesus , which said unto him , Before the cock crow , thou shalt deny me thrice . And he went out , and wept bitterly .
text2: Ex bˈeˈx ul julkˈaj toj tkˈuˈj Pegr tiˈj tqˈma Jesús te : A naˈmxtaq toqˈ ekyˈ , ok kchin kˈwel tewiˈn oxe maj . Ex bˈeˈx etz Pegr antza , ex ox tzˈoqˈx wen .

text: When the morning was come , all the chief priests and elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put him to death :
text2: Atzaj teˈ qsqix , kykyaqiljo kynejil pale ex jniˈ nejinel kye Judiy i bˈaj kyij bˈant , tuˈn tkubˈ bˈyet Jesús .

text: And when they had bound him , they led him away , and delivered him to Pontius Pilate the governor .
text2: Ex bˈeˈx bˈaj kyjtzˈoˈn , ex xi kyiˈn , ex xi kyqˈoˈn toj tqˈobˈ Pilat , aj kawil .

text: Then Judas , which had betrayed him , when he saw that he was condemned , repented himself , and brought again the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders ,
text2: Ante Judas , a xi kˈayinte , tej tok tkaˈyin tkyij bˈant tiˈj tuˈn tkyim Jesús , ulx toj tkˈuˈj , ex bˈeˈx aj tmeltzˈin aj lajaj toj kaˈwnaq saqpwaq tzaj ttzyuˈn kye kynejil pale exsin kynejilxjal aj Judiy ,

text: Saying , I have sinned in that I have betrayed the innocent blood . And they said , What is that to us ? see thou to that .
text2: ex xi tqˈmaˈn : Ma chin bˈinchiˈn il , tuˈn xi nkˈayiˈn jun xjal , a ntiˈ til . Me ankyexjal xi kytzaqˈwin : ¿ Yajtzin qeˈ ? ¿ Tiˈn qeˈ qaj tiˈj teˈ ? Kˈaˈ tli tejiy .

text: And he cast down the pieces of silver in the temple , and departed , and went and hanged himself .
text2: Me ante Judas bˈeˈx xi t ‑ xoˈn pwaq toj tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , ex bˈeˈx xiˈ , ex bˈeˈx jaw tjtzˈoˈn tqul te jun majx .

text: And the chief priests took the silver pieces , and said , It is not lawful for to put them into the treasury , because it is the price of blood .
text2: Ayetzin kyeˈ kynejil pale , jaw kyiˈn pwaq , ex kyqˈma : Mi kux mujbˈit teˈ pwaq luˈn toj kˈuˈbˈl oyaj toj tja Dios , quˈn ma tzˈokin te loqˈbˈil jun chwinqil , chi chiˈ .

text: And they took counsel , and bought with them the potter ' s field , to bury strangers in .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , bˈeˈx kyij bˈant , tuˈn tlaqˈet jun txˈotxˈ , toktaq tbˈi te Ttxˈotxˈil Bˈinchil Kˈwil , tuˈn pwaq anetziˈn , jaˈ tuˈn kybˈaj kux muqetjo jniˈ bˈetin xjal toj Jerusalén , aj kykyim .

text: Wherefore that field was called , The field of blood , unto this day .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , bˈeˈx kyijx tbˈi txˈotxˈ anetziˈn : Ttxˈotxˈil Chikyˈ ; ax tbˈi tok jaˈlin .

text: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremy the prophet , saying , And they took the thirty pieces of silver , the price of him that was valued , whom they of the children of Israel did value ;
text2: Ikytziˈn japine bˈajjo yol , a kyij ttzˈibˈin Jeremías , a yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe , tej tqˈma : Tzaj kytzyuˈn lajaj toj kaˈwnaq saqpwaq , a twiˈ ok kyqˈoˈn aj Israel .

text: And gave them for the potter ' s field , as the Lord appointed me .
text2: Tuˈntzintzjo lo , tzaj kylaqˈoˈn jun txˈotxˈ , a ttxˈotxˈil bˈinchil kˈwil , tzeˈnkuxjo tqˈma tAjaw Tkyaqilch .

text: And Jesus stood before the governor : and the governor asked him , saying , Art thou the King of the Jews ? And Jesus said unto him , Thou sayest .
text2: Xi qˈiˈn Jesús twutz Pilat , a aj kawil , exsin xi tqanin te : ¿ Atzinjiy a nmaq kawil kye Judiych ? Axa ma qˈmante , chi Jesús .

text: And when he was accused of the chief priests and elders , he answered nothing .
text2: Ayetzin kyeˈ kynejil pale exqetziˈn jniˈ nejinel kyxolx Judiy i ok ten stzˈimil tiˈj . Me ntiˈ te Jesús xi ttzaqˈwin .

text: Then said Pilate unto him , Hearest thou not how many things they witness against thee ?
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , xi tqˈmaˈn Pilat te : ¿ Ma mitzin ntbˈinjiy tkyaqiljo nkyqˈmaˈnxjal tiˈja ?

text: And he answered him to never a word ; insomuch that the governor marvelled greatly .
text2: Me ntiˈ jun te Jesús tyol xi ttzaqˈwin . Ex noqx jaw kaˈylaj Pilat .

text: Now at that feast the governor was wont to release unto the people a prisoner , whom they would .
text2: Me ante Pilat , a aj kawil , aj tikyˈ junjun Xjan Qˈij , kukx nxi ttzaqpiˈntaq jun xjal , a tkuˈxtaq toj tze . Me nejtaq nxi tqanin alkye kyajxjal tuˈn t ‑ xi tzaqpet .

text: And they had then a notable prisoner , called Barabbas .
text2: Me kyojjo qˈij anetziˈn , attaq jun xjal tkuˈxtaq toj tze , nimxtaq tyolajtz , Barrabás tbˈi .

text: Therefore when they were gathered together , Pilate said unto them , Whom will ye that I release unto you ? Barabbas , or Jesus which is called Christ ?
text2: Atzaj teˈ tok kychmoˈnxjal kyibˈ , xi tqanin Pilat kye : ¿ Ankyeˈ kyaja tuˈn t ‑ xi ntzaqpiˈn : A Barrabás , mo a Jesúsj , a tok tbˈi te Crist ? chiˈ .

text: For he knew that for envy they had delivered him .
text2: Xi tqanin kyexjal , quˈn otaq tzˈel tnikyˈ te , qa noq tuˈn tlochˈj kykˈuˈj kynejil pale , otaq txi kyqˈoˈne Jesús tuˈn tkyim .

text: When he was set down on the judgment seat , his wife sent unto him , saying , Have thou nothing to do with that just man : for I have suffered many things this day in a dream because of him .
text2: Me tzmataq tokx Pilat toj tkawbˈil , tej t ‑ xi tsmaˈn t ‑ xuˈjil tqanil te : Mi tzˈok tqˈoˈn tibˈa tiˈj Jesús , a tzˈaqle , quˈn ma tzˈok jun nwutzikyˈa atximay qnikyˈin , me tixqex wen , noq tuˈn tpajjo ichin anetziˈn .

text: But the chief priests and elders persuaded the multitude that they should ask Barabbas , and destroy Jesus .
text2: Me ayetzin kyeˈ kynejil pale exqetziˈn nejinel kye aj Judiy , i bˈaj kyxmoxin jniˈ xjal , tuˈn t ‑ xi kyqanin tuˈn t ‑ xi ttzaqpiˈn Barrabás , ex tuˈn tkubˈ bˈyoˈn Jesús .

text: The governor answered and said unto them , Whether of the twain will ye that I release unto you ? They said , Barabbas .
text2: Me xi tqanin Pilat kye : ¿ Ankyeˈ kyaja kyxoljo kabˈe , tuˈn t ‑ xi ntzaqpiˈn ? A Barrabás , chi chiˈ .

text: Pilate saith unto them , What shall I do then with Jesus which is called Christ ? They all say unto him , Let him be crucified .
text2: Ex xi tqanin Pilat kye : ¿ Tzeˈntzin k ‑ okile Jesústz wuˈn , a tok tbˈi Crist ? Xi kytzaqˈwin kykyaqilx : Pejkˈinka twutz cruz , tuˈn tkyim .

text: And the governor said , Why , what evil hath he done ? But they cried out the more , saying , Let him be crucified .
text2: Xi tqanin Pilat kye : ¿ Tiquˈn ? ¿ Tiˈxsiˈn nya wen ma tbˈinche ? Me i jaw ẍchˈinxjal juntl majl : Pejkˈinka twutz cruz , tuˈn tkyim .

text: When Pilate saw that he could prevail nothing , but that rather a tumult was made , he took water , and washed his hands before the multitude , saying , I am innocent of the blood of this just person : see ye to it .
text2: Tej tok tkaˈyin Pilat , ntiˈxtaq tumil tuˈn tcheˈwx kywiˈxjal , qalaˈ noqx kyjaˈtaq txiˈ toj il , xi tqanin chˈin aˈ , tuˈn ttzaj qˈiˈn , exsin el ttxjoˈn tqˈobˈtz kywutzxjal te jun yekˈbˈil qa nya ajintaq tiˈj Jesús , exsin xi tqˈmaˈntz : ¡ Ntiˈx weˈ npaj tiˈj tkyimliˈn xjal lo , quˈn ntiˈx til ! ¡ Kyukˈaxlaˈy taˈye luˈn !

text: Then answered all the people , and said , His blood be on us , and on our children .
text2: Ex kykyaqilxjal xi kytzaqˈwin : Kˈaˈ qliˈy kyukˈax qkˈwala , quˈn awoˈy at qpaj tiˈjjo tkyimlin .

text: Then released he Barabbas unto them : and when he had scourged Jesus , he delivered him to be crucified .
text2: Bˈeˈxsin xi ttzaqpiˈn Pilattz a Barrabás , ex xi tqˈmaˈn tuˈn ttzyet tjubˈchajtz Jesús , ex xi tqˈoˈn , tuˈn tok kypejkˈin twutz cruz .

text: Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the common hall , and gathered unto him the whole band of soldiers .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , ayetziˈn xoˈl qˈaqˈ te kawil , xi kyiˈn Jesús toj ja te kawbˈil , ex ok kychmoˈn tkyaqil chˈuq xoˈl qˈaqˈ tiˈjile .

text: And they stripped him , and put on him a scarlet robe .
text2: Ex bˈeˈx el kyiˈn t ‑ xbˈalin , ex ok kyqˈoˈn juntl xbˈalin tiˈj , kyaq kaˈyin , tzeˈnku kyxbˈalin jun nmaq kawil .

text: And when they had platted a crown of thorns , they put it upon his head , and a reed in his right hand : and they bowed the knee before him , and mocked him , saying , Hail , King of the Jews !
text2: Jax kysiˈpin jun tqan txˈiˈx toj twiˈ tukˈax ttxˈiˈxil . Ex xi kyqˈoˈn jun tze toj tman qˈobˈ tzeˈnkuˈ kyvar nmaq kawil . Exsin i kubˈ meje twutz , me noq tuˈn kyxmayin tiˈj , ex xi kyqˈmaˈn te : Nimxit tbˈiy , ay nmaq kawil kye aj Judiy , chi chiˈ .

text: And they spit upon him , and took the reed , and smote him on the head .
text2: Ex bˈaj ok kytzuˈbˈin tiˈj , ex axjo ttze el kyiˈn , tuˈn tkux kyjemin toj twiˈ .

text: And after that they had mocked him , they took the robe off from him , and put his own raiment on him , and led him away to crucify him .
text2: Tej kybˈaj xmayin tiˈj , el kyiˈn t ‑ xbˈalin , a ok kyqˈoˈn , ex ok kyqˈoˈnljo axjo t ‑ xbˈalintaq toktaq , ex bˈeˈxsin xi kyiˈntz , tuˈn tjaw pejkˈin twutz cruz .

text: And as they came out , they found a man of Cyrene , Simon by name : him they compelled to bear his cross .
text2: Tej kyetz antza , jyet jun ichin kyuˈn aj Cirene , Simun tbˈi , ex ok kyqˈoˈn il tij tuˈn t ‑ xi tiqin tcruz Jesús ,

text: And when they were come unto a place called Golgotha , that is to say , a place of a skull ,
text2: tuˈn tpon tzma toj jun najbˈil Gólgota tbˈi , atzin tzˈelpineˈ bˈibˈaj ikyjo : Jaˈ taˈ tbˈaqil twiˈ kyimnin .

text: They gave him vinegar to drink mingled with gall : and when he had tasted thereof , he would not drink .
text2: Antza xi kyqˈoˈne vin te tkˈwa Jesús smaˈnkux tukˈa taˈl kˈul manyor kˈax wen , tuˈn mi tnaˈye kyixkˈoj . Me atzaj teˈ tkubˈ tnikyˈbˈin Jesús , mix xaˈye tuˈn .

text: And they crucified him , and parted his garments , casting lots : that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet , They parted my garments among them , and upon my vesture did they cast lots .
text2: Atzaj teˈ tbˈaj kypejkˈin twutz cruz , ayetziˈn xoˈl qˈaqˈ i bˈaj ok ten saqchal tiˈjjo t ‑ xbˈalin Jesús ; ex bˈaj jaw kyxoˈn kyxol , ex ankye tuˈn tkanbˈin tiˈj . Quˈn iltaq tiˈj tuˈn tjapiˈn a kubˈ ttzˈibˈin yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe : Kubˈ kysipin nxbˈaliˈn kyxol , ex i bˈaj saqchan tiˈjch .

text: And sitting down they watched him there ;
text2: Ex bˈeˈx i bˈaj kubˈ qe xqˈuqilte .

text: And set up over his head his accusation written , THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS .
text2: Ok kypejkˈin jun tzˈlan tibˈaj twiˈ , jaˈ tzˈibˈinke tiquˈnil kubˈ kybˈyoˈne . Chiˈ kyjaluˈn : Ate Jesúsjo , a Nmaq Kawil kye aj Judiy .

text: Then were there two thieves crucified with him , one on the right hand , and another on the left .
text2: Ex i jaw pejkˈinl kabˈe ileqˈ tukˈa twutz cruz , jun toj tman qˈobˈ ex jun toj tẍnayaj .

text: And they that passed by reviled him , wagging their heads ,
text2: Ex jniˈqe xjal nchi bˈaj ikyˈxtaq antza , noqx nchi bˈaj yasintaq tiˈj , ex noqx nja kyyekin tiˈj kywiˈ te kyxmaybˈil tiˈj ,

text: And saying , Thou that destroyest the temple , and buildest it in three days , save thyself . If thou be the Son of God , come down from the cross .
text2: ex nxi kyqˈmaˈntaq : ¿ Nyakutzin atejiy nqˈmante tuˈn tjaw yuchˈin teˈ tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , exsin tuˈn tbˈant juntl tuˈn toj oxe qˈij ? Klomiltzin tibˈa jaˈlin , ex qˈinkutz tibˈa twutz cruz , qa twutzxix qa ajiy Tkˈwal Dios .

text: Likewise also the chief priests mocking him , with the scribes and elders , said ,
text2: Ex ikyxjo , nchi bˈaj xmayintaqjo jniˈ kynejil pale exqetziˈn xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil junx kyukˈa nejinel kyxol aj Judiy , ex nkubˈ kyqˈmaˈntaq twutz Jesús , me noq tuˈn tok tbˈiˈn :

text: He saved others ; himself he cannot save . If he be the King of Israel , let him now come down from the cross , and we will believe him .
text2: ¿ Tzeˈn tten nbˈaj klettaq junjuntl xjal tuˈn , me antetz , mix klet ‑ x tuˈnx tibˈ ? ¿ Ma nyaˈtziˈn nmaq kawil qibˈaj , a awo aj Israel ? In tkuˈtz twutz cruz jaˈlin , tuˈn t ‑ xi qnimin .

text: He trusted in God ; let him deliver him now , if he will have him : for he said , I am the Son of God .
text2: Quˈn qˈuqletzila tkˈuˈjtz tiˈj Dios . In tklettz tuˈn Dios jaˈlin , qa twutzx qa taj Dios tiˈj . ¿ Ma nyatzin axtz qˈmante , qa Tkˈwal Dios ?

text: The thieves also , which were crucified with him , cast the same in his teeth .
text2: Ex majqexpe ileqˈ , ayeˈ pejkˈinqektaq tukˈa twutz cruz , i bˈaj xmayintaq tiˈj .

text: Now from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land unto the ninth hour .
text2: Teˈ tok kabˈlaj qˈij , ex tzmaxi toj oxe or te qale , bˈeˈx ok yupj twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: And about the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice , saying , Eli , Eli , lama sabachthani ? that is to say , My God , my God , why hast thou forsaken me ?
text2: Ax orjo jaw ẍchˈin Jesús kujxix wen , ex tqˈma : Eli , Eli , ¿ Lama sabactani ? Atzin tzˈelpineˈ yol lo , NMan Dios , nMan Dios , ¿ Tiˈxsin quˈn ma chin kyij ttzaqpiˈn ?

text: Some of them that stood there , when they heard that , said , This man calleth for Elias .
text2: Ayetziˈn junjun iteˈtaq antza ok kybˈiˈn , ex kyqˈma : Lu nqˈolbˈin tiˈj Elías , a yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe .

text: And straightway one of them ran , and took a spunge , and filled it with vinegar , and put it on a reed , and gave him to drink .
text2: Ex jun paqx el rinin jun jyolte chˈin bˈuˈẍ . Kux tmulin toj vin txˈam , ex ok tkˈloˈn tiˈj twiˈ jun ptzˈan , tuˈn t ‑ xi tkˈwaˈn Jesús .

text: The rest said , Let be , let us see whether Elias will come to save him .
text2: Me ayetzin kyeˈ txqantl xi kyqˈmaˈn : Ex tenkuj . Jekytzin tzul Elías klolte .

text: Jesus , when he had cried again with a loud voice , yielded up the ghost .
text2: Ex jaw ẍchˈin Jesús juntl majl kujxix wen , teˈ tel kyim .

text: And , behold , the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom ; and the earth did quake , and the rocks rent ;
text2: Atzin xbˈalin tokxtaq tojjo tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , bˈeˈx kubˈ laqj te kabˈe ; tzaj xkye tiˈjjo ttxaˈn jawl , tuˈn tkˈuˈl kanin tiˈjjo juntl ttxaˈn . Ex tzaj luˈlin txˈotxˈ , ex jniˈ abˈj bˈeˈx bˈaj kubˈ kaˈmin ,

text: And the graves were opened ; and many bodies of the saints which slept arose ,
text2: exqetziˈn jniˈ kyja kyimnin bˈeˈx bˈaj xi pax , ex ma nintzx nimil tiˈj Dios , bˈeˈx i bˈaj jatz anqˈintl .

text: And came out of the graves after his resurrection , and went into the holy city , and appeared unto many .
text2: Jniˈqe , a otaq chi etz toj muqbˈilkye , tej tjawlin xi anqˈin Jesús , bˈeˈx i bˈaj xiˈ tojjo xjan tnam Jerusalén , jaˈ i oke kaˈyin kyuˈn nimkuxjal .

text: Now when the centurion , and they that were with him , watching Jesus , saw the earthquake , and those things that were done , they feared greatly , saying , Truly this was the Son of God .
text2: Ajo kynejinel xoˈl qˈaqˈ aj Rom , exqetziˈn nchi xqˈuqintaq tiˈj Jesús , tej kynaˈnte kyaqnajnabˈ ex tkyaqiltaqjo nbˈaj , tzajxix nim kyxobˈil , ex kyqˈma : Twutzx tetz Tkˈwal Diostaq teˈ ichin lo .

text: And many women were there beholding afar off , which followed Jesus from Galilee , ministering unto him :
text2: Ex iteˈtaq txqan qya antza nchi kaˈyintztaq najchaq , ayeˈ i ok lipe tiˈj Jesús , atxix toj txˈotxˈ te Galiley , ex aye nchi mojintaq tukˈa .

text: Among which was Mary Magdalene , and Mary the mother of James and Joses , and the mother of Zebedee ' s children .
text2: Ex kyxoljo qya anetziˈn , attaq Mariy , aj Xleˈn ; exsin Mariy , a tnanataq Santyaw ex Jse ; exsin kynana tkˈwal Zebedey .

text: When the even was come , there came a rich man of Arimathaea , named Joseph , who also himself was Jesus ' disciple :
text2: Tej qok yupj , kanin Jse aj Arimatey , jun ichin qˈinin , a otaq tzˈok lipe tiˈj Jesús .

text: He went to Pilate , and begged the body of Jesus . Then Pilate commanded the body to be delivered .
text2: Xiˈ Jse tukˈa Pilat qanil t ‑ xmilil Jesús , ex xi tqˈmaˈn Pilat , tuˈn t ‑ xi kyqˈoˈn .

text: And when Joseph had taken the body , he wrapped it in a clean linen cloth ,
text2: Kuˈtz tiˈn Jse t ‑ xmilil Jesús , ex kubˈ tbˈaltzˈin toj jun iqbˈil tbˈanilx wen .

text: And laid it in his own new tomb , which he had hewn out in the rock : and he rolled a great stone to the door of the sepulchre , and departed .
text2: Ex attaq jun jul aˈkxtaq tbˈaj tbˈinchin twutz piky tuˈntaq tajbˈin te . Antza okxi tqˈoˈn t ‑ xmilil Jesús , ex ok tjpuˈn tukˈa jun ma tij abˈj , ex bˈeˈx aj .

text: And there was Mary Magdalene , and the other Mary , sitting over against the sepulchre .
text2: Me ante Mariy , aj Xleˈn , tukˈaxjo juntl Mariy i kyij qe ttzi jul .

text: Now the next day , that followed the day of the preparation , the chief priests and Pharisees came together unto Pilate ,
text2: Toj junxil qˈij , a tojjo qˈij te ajlabˈl , ayetziˈn kynejil pale kyukˈaxjo jniˈ Parisey i bˈaj xiˈ qˈolbˈilte Pilat .

text: Saying , Sir , we remember that that deceiver said , while he was yet alive , After three days I will rise again .
text2: Ex xi kyqˈmaˈn te : Tata , noq samiˈy ; ma tzul julkˈaj toj qkˈuˈja , qa aj maˈ sbˈul xjal tqˈma , tej naˈmtaq tkyim , qa oxe qˈijtaq tkyimlin , aj tjatz anqˈin juntl majl kyxol kyimnin .

text: Command therefore that the sepulchre be made sure until the third day , lest his disciples come by night , and steal him away , and say unto the people , He is risen from the dead : so the last error shall be worse than the first .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , aj tjapin oxe qˈij , kyjpunkxixjiˈy ttzi jul wen , quˈn noq chi uljo t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin qnikyˈin elqˈil teˈ t ‑ xmilil , tuˈn tkubˈ kyqˈmaˈntz kyexjal , qa ma jatz anqˈintl juntl majl . Quˈn apen sbˈubˈljo nimxixtl tzeˈnku tnejil .

text: Pilate said unto them , Ye have a watch : go your way , make it as sure as ye can .
text2: Me ante Pilat xi tqˈmaˈn : Ex iteˈ kyxoˈl qˈaqˈa . Kyqˈoˈnqekja te xqˈuqilte . Ku kyxiˈy ex noqit tzeˈn tzˈoka chˈintl tuˈn tjpet ‑ xix .

text: So they went , and made the sepulchre sure , sealing the stone , and setting a watch .
text2: Bˈeˈxsin i xiˈtz , jpulte wen , ex ok kyqˈoˈn juntl jupbˈilte , tuˈn mi yekˈjex . Ex kyij kyoqxenin kye xoˈl qˈaqˈ , tuˈn mi chi ikyˈ ktaneˈ .

text: In the end of the sabbath , as it began to dawn toward the first day of the week , came Mary Magdalene and the other Mary to see the sepulchre .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ qˈij te ajlabˈl , kyjaˈtaq qsqix toj tnejil qˈij te seman , ate Mariy , aj Xleˈn , tukˈaxjo juntl Mariy , i xiˈ tzma ttzi jul lolte .

text: And , behold , there was a great earthquake : for the angel of the Lord descended from heaven , and came and rolled back the stone from the door , and sat upon it .
text2: Texjo tqan ttzaj kyaqnajnabˈ kujxix . Ox luˈlinx txˈotxˈ , quˈn jun t ‑ angel tAjaw Tkyaqil kuˈtz toj kyaˈj , ex ul ttzi jul . El tiˈn ma tij abˈj , a toktaq te jupbˈilte , ex kubˈ qe tibˈaj .

text: His countenance was like lightning , and his raiment white as snow :
text2: Me ante angel tzunxtaq nqoptzˈajx tzeˈnku xloqˈlin kyaˈj , ex tok jun t ‑ xbˈalin manyor sjaninx wen , tzeˈnku ttxa cheˈw .

text: And for fear of him the keepers did shake , and became as dead men .
text2: Atzaj teˈ tok kykaˈyin xoˈl qˈaqˈ , bˈeˈx i jaw luˈlin , ex bˈeˈx i el kyim tuˈn kyxobˈil .

text: And the angel answered and said unto the women , Fear not ye : for I know that ye seek Jesus , which was crucified .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn angel kyeˈ qya : Mi chi xobˈa . Bˈiˈn weˈ wuˈn , qa nchi jyoˈn tiˈj Jesús , a jaw pejkˈin twutz cruz .

text: He is not here : for he is risen , as he said . Come , see the place where the Lord lay .
text2: Me ntiˈ tetz tzaluˈn jaˈlin . Qalaˈ ma jaw anqˈintl , tzeˈnkuxjo tqˈma . Ku kytzaja lolte jaˈ kubˈe qˈoˈne .

text: And go quickly , and tell his disciples that he is risen from the dead ; and , behold , he goeth before you into Galilee ; there shall ye see him : lo , I have told you .
text2: Ex jun paqx ku kyxiˈy qˈmalte kyeˈ t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , qa ma jaw anqˈintl kyxol kyimnin , ex ok knejil kywutza toj txˈotxˈ te Galiley . Ex antza k ‑ okile kykaˈyiˈn . Ataqtzin tuˈn t ‑ xi nqˈmaˈnjiˈy kyeˈy . Atzin jaˈlin , ¡ Ma kybˈiˈy !

text: And they departed quickly from the sepulchre with fear and great joy ; and did run to bring his disciples word .
text2: Ayen kyej qya jun paqx i etz rinin ttzi jul tuˈn kyxobˈil ex tuˈn kytzaljbˈil . Nchi ajqelin wen tuˈn kyxiˈ qˈmalte kye txqantl .

text: And as they went to tell his disciples , behold , Jesus met them , saying , All hail . And they came and held him by the feet , and worshipped him .
text2: Tzunxtaq nchi rinin wen , tej tkubˈ tyekˈin Jesús tibˈ kywutz , ex i ok tqˈolbˈin . Ex i xi laqˈe tkˈatz , i tzaj kychleˈn tqan , ex i kˈulin twutz .

text: Then said Jesus unto them , Be not afraid : go tell my brethren that they go into Galilee , and there shall they see me .
text2: Ex xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye : Mi chi xobˈa . Ku kyxiˈy qˈmalte kye txqantl , ayej lipcheqektaq wiˈja , tuˈn kyxiˈ tzmax toj txˈotxˈ te Galiley . Antza kchin okile kykaˈyiˈn .

text: Now when they were going , behold , some of the watch came into the city , and shewed unto the chief priests all the things that were done .
text2: Nchi bˈettaqjo qya , tej kypon xoˈl qˈaqˈ toj tnam , ex i ok ten qˈmalte kye kynejil pale tkyaqiljo otaq bˈaj .

text: And when they were assembled with the elders , and had taken counsel , they gave large money unto the soldiers ,
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , aye kynejil pale bˈeˈx ok kychmoˈn kyibˈ kyukˈa nejinel kyxol aj Judiy , tuˈn tkyij bˈant kyuˈn , tuˈn mi tzˈele tqanil . Ex xi kyqˈoˈn nim pwaq kye xoˈl qˈaqˈ ,

text: Saying , Say ye , His disciples came by night , and stole him away while we slept .
text2: tuˈn mi kubˈ kyyoline ; qalaˈ tuˈn t ‑ xi kyqˈmaˈn kyjaluˈn : Toj qnikyˈin , tej s ‑ aj chˈin qwatla , bˈeˈx ẍi uljo t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , ex ma txi kyelqˈin t ‑ xmilil Jesús .

text: And if this come to the governor ' s ears , we will persuade him , and secure you .
text2: Ex qa ma tzˈel tqanil toj twiˈ aj kawil tiˈjjo lo , ok kxmoxitil quˈn , tuˈntzin ntiˈ tuˈn tbˈaj kyiˈja .

text: So they took the money , and did as they were taught : and this saying is commonly reported among the Jews until this day .
text2: Ex ayetzin kyeˈ xoˈl qˈaqˈ xi kytzyuˈn pwaq , ex kubˈ kybˈinchin tzeˈnkuxjo xi qˈmaˈn kye . Ex atzin tqaniljo nimin kyuˈn aj Judiy tzmax toj tqˈijil jaˈlin .

text: Then the eleven disciples went away into Galilee , into a mountain where Jesus had appointed them .
text2: Awotzin qe , a junlajaj t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , bˈeˈx o xiˈy toj txˈotxˈ Galiley tzma twiˈ wutz , a jaˈ xi tqˈmaˈne Jesús .

text: And when they saw him , they worshipped him : but some doubted .
text2: Tej tok qkaˈyiˈn Jesús , o kˈuliˈn twutz , me attaq junjun qxola attaq kabˈe kykˈuˈj tiˈj .

text: And Jesus came and spake unto them , saying , All power is given unto me in heaven and in earth .
text2: Ex tzaj laqˈe Jesús qkˈatza , ex tzaj tqˈmaˈn qeˈy : Ma tzaj tqˈoˈn qMan Dios tkyaqil toklin weˈy toj kyaˈj ex twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: Go ye therefore , and teach all nations , baptizing them in the name of the Father , and of the Son , and of the Holy Ghost :
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , ku kyxiˈy kyukˈaxjal toj tkyaqil twutz txˈotxˈ xnaqˈtzilkye , tuˈn kyok te nxnaqˈtzbˈiˈn . Ex kyqˈonqekuxa toj aˈ , te jawsbˈil aˈ , toj tbˈi Manbˈaj , ex toj tbˈi Kˈwalbˈaj , ex toj tbˈi Xewbˈaj Xjan .

text: Teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I have commanded you : and , lo , I am with you alway , even unto the end of the world . Amen .
text2: Ex kyxnaqˈtzinqexa tuˈn tkubˈ kynimiˈn tkyaqiljo ma txi nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy . Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , loqiˈn intin kyukˈiy tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , tzmaxi aj tjapin bˈaj tkyaqil .

text: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ , the Son of God ;
text2: A uˈj luˈn nyolin tiˈjjo Tbˈanil Tqanil Jesucrist , a Tkˈwal Dios .

text: As it is written in the prophets , Behold , I send my messenger before thy face , which shall prepare thy way before thee .
text2: Tqˈma Dios te Tkˈwal tojjo uˈj , a kubˈ ttzˈibˈin jun yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe , Isaías tbˈi . Chiˈ kyjaluˈn : Kxel nchqˈoˈn twutz txˈotxˈ . Me nej kxel nchqˈoˈn jun nsaˈn qˈmal tqanila , ex tuˈn tkubˈ kybˈinchinxjal kyibˈ twutza .

text: The voice of one crying in the wilderness , Prepare ye the way of the Lord , make his paths straight .
text2: K ‑ yoliljo nsaˈn tojjo tzqij txˈotxˈ , jaˈ ntiˈ kynajbˈilxjal toj . Chkuˈ kyjaluˈn : Kybˈinchin kyteˈn twutz qAjaw ; kyqˈoˈnx kyanmiˈn te jikyinxix wen .

text: John did baptize in the wilderness , and preach the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins .
text2: Bˈajxsiˈn aj yol qˈumj . Ul te Juan tojjo tzqij txˈotxˈ , a jaˈ ntiˈ kynajbˈilxjal toj ; nim xjal xiˈ lolte , ex bˈeˈx i bˈaj kuˈx toj aˈ , te jawsbˈil aˈ , quˈn xi tqˈmaˈn Juan kye : Ilx tiˈj tuˈn kybˈinchinte kyteˈn twutz Dios , tuˈn kykuxa toj aˈ te jawsbˈil aˈ , ex tuˈntzin tkubˈ tnajsin Dios kyila .

text: And there went out unto him all the land of Judaea , and they of Jerusalem , and were all baptized of him in the river of Jordan , confessing their sins .
text2: Nim xjal aj Judey exsin jniˈ aj Jerusalén i bˈajetz bˈil teˈ tyol Juan . Bˈaj kubˈ kypaˈn kyil , ex i kux tqˈoˈn Juan toj jun nim aˈ , Jordán tbˈi , te jawsbˈil aˈ . Atzin teˈ kyjatz toj aˈ , kubˈ kyyekˈiˈn kynimbˈil tiˈj Dios .

text: And John was clothed with camel ' s hair , and with a girdle of a skin about his loins ; and he did eat locusts and wild honey ;
text2: Atzin t ‑ xbˈalin Juan noq tsmal txuk , tukˈa jun tkˈalbˈil tzˈuˈn , tzeˈnku kyxbˈalin yaj . Atzin twa n ‑ oktaq noq txuk tzeˈnqekuˈ txanin , ex taˈl aq toj kˈul .

text: And preached , saying , There cometh one mightier than I after me , the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to stoop down and unloose .
text2: Ex ntqˈmaˈntaq Juan : Loqin weˈ nchin yolin kyxola tiˈj Tyol Dios . Me atx juntl tetz lipchetz wiˈja nimxixtl toklin tzeˈnku weˈ . Bˈinchil Tkyaqil ex nimxjo tkawbˈil . Ayintzin weˈ ntiˈx wokliˈn nipe tuˈn woka te taqˈnil .

text: I indeed have baptized you with water : but he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost .
text2: Ma chi kuˈxa toj aˈ wuˈn , te jawsbˈil aˈ , me anteˈ tzul nya noq oˈkx tuˈn kykuˈxa toj aˈ tuˈn , te jawsbˈil aˈ , qalaˈ kxel tqˈoˈn Xewbˈaj Xjan toj kyanmiˈn te jun majx .

text: And it came to pass in those days , that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee , and was baptized of John in Jordan .
text2: Kyojjo qˈij anetziˈn , tzuntaq nchi kux tqˈoˈn Juan xjal toj Nim Aˈ Jordan te jawsbˈil aˈ , teˈ tpon Jesús kykˈatz , tzajnin toj tnam Nazaret , toj ttxˈotxˈ Galiley . Bˈeˈxsin kux tqˈoˈn Juan Jesús toj Nim Aˈ Jordán te jawsbˈil aˈ .

text: And straightway coming up out of the water , he saw the heavens opened , and the Spirit like a dove descending upon him :
text2: Texjo paq , teˈ tjatz Jesús toj aˈ , xi tkaˈyin kyaˈj , teˈ t ‑ xi jaqpaj , ex xi tkaˈyin Xewbˈaj Xjan , teˈ ttzaj toj kyaˈj tibˈaj , tzeˈnku jun palom .

text: And there came a voice from heaven , saying , Thou art my beloved Son , in whom I am well pleased .
text2: Ex qˈajqˈojin jun yol toj kyaˈj , ex tqˈma : Axixpen te nkˈwala , kˈuˈjlinxix wuˈn , a o jaw nskˈoˈn .

text: And immediately the Spirit driveth him into the wilderness .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , bˈeˈx xiˈ Jesús tuˈn tkujiljo Xewbˈaj Xjan tojjo tzqij txˈotxˈ , jaˈ ntiˈye kynajbˈilxjal toj .

text: And he was there in the wilderness forty days , tempted of Satan ; and was with the wild beasts ; and the angels ministered unto him .
text2: Kaˈwnaq qˈij ten antza kyukˈa toj kˈul txuk . Tjoy tajaw il ttxolil , tzeˈn tuˈn tel tikyˈin Jesús tkawbˈil tMan , me mix kubˈe tiˈj . Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , i ul t ‑ angel Dios mojil te Jesús .

text: Now after that John was put in prison , Jesus came into Galilee , preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God ,
text2: Tuˈn jniˈ t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈil Juan , bˈeˈx tzaj tqˈojjo kawil , ex bˈeˈx kux tjpuˈn toj tze . Tkuˈxlinxi Juan toj tze , xiˈ Jesús toj Galiley qˈmal teˈ Tbˈanil Tqanil Tyol Dios .

text: And saying , The time is fulfilled , and the kingdom of God is at hand : repent ye , and believe the gospel .
text2: Chi Jesúsjo kyjaluˈn : Ma tzul kanin tqˈijil , jaˈ tuˈn tkawine Dios kyxola . Tuˈntzintzjo , kybˈinchinku kyibˈa , kytzaqpinkjiˈy jniˈ nya bˈaˈn , ex kyniminxjiˈy Tbˈanil Tqanil .

text: Now as he walked by the sea of Galilee , he saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea : for they were fishers .
text2: Nbˈettaq Jesús ttziyile Nijabˈ te Galiley , teˈ t ‑ xi tkaˈyin Simun tukˈaxjo titzˈin , Andrés . Nxi kyxoˈntaq kypa toj aˈ te tzuybˈil kyiẍ , quˈn kyiẍilqetaq .

text: And Jesus said unto them , Come ye after me , and I will make you to become fishers of men .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye : Chi lipeka wiˈja . Quˈn ayetzin kyeˈ nchi chmoˈn kyiẍ jaˈlin , me kchi xel nxnaqˈtziˈn tzeˈn tten tuˈn tbˈant kychmoˈn xjal , tuˈn kyklet .

text: And straightway they forsook their nets , and followed him .
text2: Tej kybˈinte ikyjo , bˈeˈx kyij kytzaqpiˈn kytzuybˈil kyiẍ , ex i xi lipe tiˈj Jesús .

text: And when he had gone a little further thence , he saw James the son of Zebedee , and John his brother , who also were in the ship mending their nets .
text2: Me noqtaq chˈin otaq txi kybˈetin , teˈ kyxi tkaˈyin kabˈetl ichin , Santyaw ex Juan , kyitzˈin kyibˈ . Ex attaq kytata Zebedey kyukˈa , ex kyukˈa taqˈnil . Iteˈkxtaq toj jun bark ; nchi bˈinchintaq kypa te tzuybˈil kyiẍ .

text: And straightway he called them : and they left their father Zebedee in the ship with the hired servants , and went after him .
text2: Bˈeˈxsin i xi tqˈolbˈin Jesústz , tuˈn kyxiˈ tukˈa , ex noq teˈ kybˈin teˈ ikyjo , bˈeˈx kyij kytzaqpiˈn kytata toj bark kyukˈax taqˈnil , exsin i xiˈtz tukˈa Jesús tzma tojjo jun tnam , Capernaum tbˈi .

text: And they went into Capernaum ; and straightway on the sabbath day he entered into the synagogue , and taught .
text2: Tej kykanin Capernaum , okx Jesús qˈol jun xnaqˈtzbˈil toj jun qˈij te ajlabˈl toj jun muˈẍ ja te kynaˈbˈl Dios aj Judiy .
