text: And he cometh the third time , and saith unto them , Sleep on now , and take your rest : it is enough , the hour is come ; behold , the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners .
text2: Xiˈ juntl majl te tox majin , ex teˈ tmeltzˈaj juntl majl , ex ikyxljo , nchi bˈaj ktantaql . Xi tqˈmaˈn kye : ¿ Ma tzunxsin nchi ktaˈn , ex nchi ajlaˈn ? ¡ Kukxjo jaˈlin ! Ma pon or tuˈn nxi qˈoˈn toj kyqˈobˈ aj il , ayiˈn , a Tkˈwal Ichin .

text: Rise up , let us go ; lo , he that betrayeth me is at hand .
text2: ¡ Kux chi jaw weˈksa ! ¡ Qoqe ! ¡ Quˈn luˈ tzul a kxel kˈayin weˈy !

text: And immediately , while he yet spake , cometh Judas , one of the twelve , and with him a great multitude with swords and staves , from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders .
text2: Tzmataq nyolin Jesús , teˈ tul Judas , a jun t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin . Ex lipcheqektaq txqan xjal tiˈj , qˈimile jniˈ kykxbˈil , a at kyste te bˈiˈybˈil , ex jniˈ kytze te kybˈujbˈil . Aye xjal luˈn otaq chi tzaj kychqˈoˈn kynejil pale , exqetziˈn xnaqˈtzil tiˈjjo ojtxe kawbˈil , ex kyuˈn nejinel kyxol aj Judiy .

text: And he that betrayed him had given them a token , saying , Whomsoever I shall kiss , that same is he ; take him , and lead him away safely .
text2: Otaq bˈaj tqˈmaˈn Judas kye , tzeˈn ttxolil tuˈn tel tnikyˈtzajil : Ankye k ‑ okil nmaˈtzin , atzintzjo . Bˈeˈx kˈaˈ tzˈok kytzyuˈn , tuˈn t ‑ xi kyiˈn , ex tuˈn tkux jpet toj tze .

text: And as soon as he was come , he goeth straightway to him , and saith , Master , master ; and kissed him .
text2: Teˈ tkanin Judas tkˈatz Jesús , ex xi tqˈmaˈn te : ¡ Xnaqˈtzil ! Ex el tmaˈtzin .

text: And they laid their hands on him , and took him .
text2: Noqxsin iteˈkl xjaltz tzyulte , tuˈn tkux kyqˈoˈn toj tze .

text: And one of them that stood by drew a sword , and smote a servant of the high priest , and cut off his ear .
text2: Me attaq jun xjal , teˈ tok tkaˈyin txi qˈiˈn Jesús , bˈeˈx jatz tiˈnku tkxbˈil tuˈn tel tjaspin tẍkyin jun taqˈniljo tnejilxix kypale aj Judiy .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto them , Are ye come out , as against a thief , with swords and with staves to take me ?
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye jniˈ xjal : ¿ Tiquˈn ma chi ula tzaluˈn kyukˈa jniˈ kykxbˈila ex jniˈ kytzeˈy wiˈja nyakuj ileqˈqiˈn toj kywutza ?

text: I was daily with you in the temple teaching , and ye took me not : but the scriptures must be fulfilled .
text2: ¿ Tzeˈn tten tzma jaˈlin ẍin ok kytzyuˈn , ex qa kukx nchin xnaqˈtzinjiˈy tojjo tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios kyxola ? Me nya tiquˈnil , quˈn ikytzin tuˈn tbˈajxjo tzeˈnku ntqˈmaˈn Tyol Dios wiˈja .

text: And they all forsook him , and fled .
text2: Te tok kykaˈyin t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin teˈ ttzyet , bˈeˈx i bˈaj kubˈ toj bˈe , exsin kyij kytzaqpiˈntz tjunalx .

text: And there followed him a certain young man , having a linen cloth cast about his naked body ; and the young men laid hold on him :
text2: Me at jun qˈa ok lipe tiˈj Jesús , noq jun iqbˈil toktaq te ttxoˈw . Ex ikyxjo , ex ajin tzyet kyuˈnxjal ,

text: And he left the linen cloth , and fled from them naked .
text2: me bˈeˈx kyij ttzaqpiˈn iqbˈil , ex kubˈ toj bˈe ẍbˈiˈq .

text: And they led Jesus away to the high priest : and with him were assembled all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes .
text2: Pon qˈiˈn Jesús twutzjo kynejilxix pale . Ex bˈaj pon chmetjo txqantl kynejil kypale aj Judiy , jniˈ nmaq xjal exqetziˈn jniˈ xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil .

text: And Peter followed him afar off , even into the palace of the high priest : and he sat with the servants , and warmed himself at the fire .
text2: Najchaq lipchexitaq Pegr tiˈj Jesús . Atzaj teˈ tkanin tpeˈn tja tnejilxix pale , axsa kyja qeye xqˈnel qˈaqˈ kyxoljo xqˈuqil tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios .

text: And the chief priests and all the council sought for witness against Jesus to put him to death ; and found none .
text2: Ayetziˈn kynejil pale exqetziˈn kawil , tzunx nkyjyoˈntaq til Jesús tzeˈn tten tuˈn tbˈaj , me mix ja njyetetaq tumil kyuˈn .

text: For many bare false witness against him , but their witness agreed not together .
text2: At junjun noq tiˈchaqku bˈaj ja bˈant tuˈn tiˈj , me ayeˈ txqantl , mina nkytziyintaq .

text: And there arose certain , and bare false witness against him , saying ,
text2: At junjun bˈaj jaw kytxˈixpin teˈ tyol Jesús , ex kyqˈma :

text: We heard him say , I will destroy this temple that is made with hands , and within three days I will build another made without hands .
text2: O qbˈintexi qeˈ ntqˈmaˈn kyjaluˈn : Kˈwel nyuchˈinjiˈy tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , a kybˈinchbˈin ichin , exsin toj oxe qˈij kbˈantile juntl wuˈn , me nya kybˈinchbˈin ichin .

text: But neither so did their witness agree together .
text2: Me mix tuˈn ikyjo , mix ja nchi kyijetaq toj wen tiˈjjo kyyol .

text: And the high priest stood up in the midst , and asked Jesus , saying , Answerest thou nothing ? what is it which these witness against thee ?
text2: Atzin kynejilxix pale jaw weˈ kyxoljo jniˈ xjal , ex xi tqanin te Jesús : ¿ Ntiˈxsin chˈin tzaj ttzaqˈwiˈn ? ¿ Tiˈxsin kyqˈmaˈnxjal tiˈja ?

text: But he held his peace , and answered nothing . Again the high priest asked him , and said unto him , Art thou the Christ , the Son of the Blessed ?
text2: Me mix xi ttzaqˈwine Jesús ; noq bˈant mutxe . Xi tqaninxix juntl majljo kynejilxix pale te : ¿ Atzinjiy Crist , a Klol kyeˈ aj Judiy , a tkˈwal Dios kyˈiwlinxix tbˈi ?

text: And Jesus said , I am : and ye shall see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of power , and coming in the clouds of heaven .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : ¡ Ayiˈn ! Ex oktzin kchin kylaˈbˈila ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , aj wok qeˈy ttxlaj Dios , a nimxix tipin , toj tman qˈobˈ , ex ikyxjo aj ntzaja toj muj , aj nmeltzˈaja juntl majl twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: Then the high priest rent his clothes , and saith , What need we any further witnesses ?
text2: Teˈ tqˈmante ikyjo , noqx el kyimjo kynejilxix pale , ex bˈeˈx xi lipin laqil kye t ‑ xbˈalin tuˈn tqˈoj , ex tqˈma : ¿ Tiˈ qe txqantl tstiyil qe ?

text: Ye have heard the blasphemy : what think ye ? And they all condemned him to be guilty of death .
text2: Ma kybˈintejiˈy xoˈj yol tuˈn tiˈj Dios . ¿ Tzeˈn kyeˈ toj kywutz ? Kykyaqilx bˈaj qˈmante qa axtaq at tpaj , ex qa toj tiltaq tuˈn tkubˈ bˈyet .

text: And some began to spit on him , and to cover his face , and to buffet him , and to say unto him , Prophesy : and the servants did strike him with the palms of their hands .
text2: Bˈeˈxsin i bˈaj ok ten tzubˈil tiˈj , bˈaj ok kymaqsiˈn twutz , ex bˈaj ok kytzˈajchin , exsin xi kyqˈmaˈn te : Qa ajiy tkˈwal Dios , kanintziˈn tiˈj alkye s ‑ ok tzˈajchin teˈy , chi chiˈ . Ex ikyqexjo xqˈuqil tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios bˈaj okx kytzˈajchin toj twutz .

text: And as Peter was beneath in the palace , there cometh one of the maids of the high priest :
text2: Attaq Pegr twiˈ peˈn , tjaqˈ ja , teˈ tpon laqˈe jun txin tkˈatz , taqˈnilxjo tnejilxix pale .

text: And when she saw Peter warming himself , she looked upon him , and said , And thou also wast with Jesus of Nazareth .
text2: Nxqˈnentaq Pegr tiˈj qˈaqˈ , teˈ tiwle tuˈn . Ok kyimxix tiˈj Pegr , exsin xi tqˈmaˈn te : ¡ Ex ikyx tejiy ajintaq te nbˈet tukˈa Jesús aj Nazaret ! chiˈ .

text: But he denied , saying , I know not , neither understand I what thou sayest . And he went out into the porch ; and the cock crew .
text2: Me bˈeˈx kubˈ tewin , ex xi tqˈma : Nya wojtzqiˈn weˈ Jesús , ex ntiˈ bˈiˈn wuˈn tiˈ qiˈjil nyoliniych . Ex bˈeˈx etz peˈn , ex n ‑ oqˈku tman ekyˈ .

text: And a maid saw him again , and began to say to them that stood by , This is one of them .
text2: Ok kyim jun majljo txin tiˈj Pegr , ex xi tqˈmaˈn kye txqantl xjal : ¡ Ax juntl teˈ lo ! chiˈ .

text: And he denied it again . And a little after , they that stood by said again to Peter , Surely thou art one of them : for thou art a Galilaean , and thy speech agreeth thereto .
text2: Mina , chi Pegr , ex kubˈ tewin juntl majl . Ikyxjo , teˈ t ‑ xi kyqˈmaˈn txqantl xjal juntl majl te : Ajin teˈ tukˈa Jesús , quˈn aj Galiley te , chi chiˈ .

text: But he began to curse and to swear , saying , I know not this man of whom ye speak .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Pegr kye : ¡ Twutzx Dios kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy ! ¡ Nya wojtzqiˈn wejiˈy ichin , a nchi yoliˈn tiˈj !

text: And the second time the cock crew . And Peter called to mind the word that Jesus said unto him , Before the cock crow twice , thou shalt deny me thrice . And when he thought thereon , he wept .
text2: Teˈ t ‑ xi tqˈmaˈn Pegrjo ikyjo , njawku oqˈ tman ekyˈ te tkabˈ majin . Bˈeˈx ok ten oqˈil , quˈn bˈeˈx ul julkˈaj tyol Jesús toj tkˈuˈj , tej t ‑ xi tqˈmaˈn : Naˈmtaq toqˈ ekyˈ te tkabˈ majin , aj nkubˈ tewiˈn oxe maj .

text: And straightway in the morning the chief priests held a consultation with the elders and scribes and the whole council , and bound Jesus , and carried him away , and delivered him to Pilate .
text2: Atzaj teˈ qsqix , bˈaj ok kychmoˈn kynejil pale kyibˈ kykyaqilx kyukˈa xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil , kyukˈa jniˈ nmaq xjal ex kyukˈa jniˈ nmaq kawil . Xi kyjtzˈoˈn Jesús wen , ex xi qˈiˈn twutz Pilat .

text: And Pilate asked him , Art thou the King of the Jews ? And he answering said unto him , Thou sayest it .
text2: Teˈ tkanin , xi tqanin Pilat te : ¿ Atzinjiy nmaq kawil kye Judiy ? Axa ma qˈmante , chi Jesús .

text: And the chief priests accused him of many things : but he answered nothing .
text2: Ayetzin kynejil pale nimx ja bˈant kyuˈn tiˈj Jesús twutz Pilat .

text: And Pilate asked him again , saying , Answerest thou nothing ? behold how many things they witness against thee .
text2: Xi tqanin juntl majl Pilat te : ¿ Ntiˈxsin chˈin ntqˈmaˈn ? ¡ Bˈinqexsin jniˈxsin nkyqˈmaˈn tiˈja !

text: But Jesus yet answered nothing ; so that Pilate marvelled .
text2: Noq jaw kaˈylaj Pilat , tuˈn mix xi ttzaqˈwine Jesús .

text: Now at that feast he released unto them one prisoner , whomsoever they desired .
text2: Me ante Pilat , a aj kawil , aj tikyˈ junjun Xjan Qˈij , kukx nxi ttzaqpiˈntaq jun xjal , a tkuˈxtaq toj tze . Me nejtaq nxi tqanin alkye kyajxjal tuˈn t ‑ xi tzaqpet .

text: And there was one named Barabbas , which lay bound with them that had made insurrection with him , who had committed murder in the insurrection .
text2: Attaqtzin jun ichin , Barrabás tbˈi , tkuˈxtaq toj tze , kyukˈa jteˈl tukˈa , kybˈiybˈin toj jun qˈoj bˈaj kyiˈj kawil te Rom .

text: And the multitude crying aloud began to desire him to do as he had ever done unto them .
text2: I bˈaj xitzin tiljo jniˈ xjal qˈmalte te Pilat , ex i ok ten qˈmalte te , tuˈn tjatz ttzaqpiˈn jun xjal tzeˈnkuxtaqjo ntene kyuˈn .

text: But Pilate answered them , saying , Will ye that I release unto you the King of the Jews ?
text2: I xi ttzaqˈwin Pilat : ¿ Kyajtziˈn tuˈn t ‑ xi ntzaqpinjiˈy Jesús , a nmaq kawil kye Judiy ?

text: For he knew that the chief priests had delivered him for envy .
text2: Quˈn el tnikyˈ te qa noqtaq tuˈn tloˈchj kykˈuˈjjo kynejil pale otaq txi kyine .

text: But the chief priests moved the people , that he should rather release Barabbas unto them .
text2: I bˈaj ok ten kynejil pale qˈmalte kye jniˈ xjal , tuˈn t ‑ xi kyqanin te Pilat , tuˈn t ‑ xi tzaqpet Barrabás .

text: And Pilate answered and said again unto them , What will ye then that I shall do unto him whom ye call the King of the Jews ?
text2: Xitzin tqanin Pilat kye : ¿ Titzin kyajtza tuˈn tok nbˈinchiˈn tiˈjjo ichin luˈn , a tok tbˈi kyuˈn te nmaq kawil kye Judiy ?

text: And they cried out again , Crucify him .
text2: Jotqex i bˈaj jaw ẍchˈin : ¡ Pejkˈinka twutz cruz tuˈn tkyim ! chi chiˈ .

text: Then Pilate said unto them , Why , what evil hath he done ? And they cried out the more exceedingly , Crucify him .
text2: Xi tqanin juntl majl Pilat : ¿ Tinquˈn ? ¿ Tiˈxsiˈn nya wen ma tbˈinche ? chiˈ . Xi kytzaqˈwin juntl majl kujxix wen . ¡ Pejkˈinka twutz cruz tuˈn tkyim !

text: And so Pilate , willing to content the people , released Barabbas unto them , and delivered Jesus , when he had scourged him , to be crucified .
text2: Tkyˈeˈtaq Pilat tuˈn ttzaj kyqˈoj xjal tukˈa . Tuˈnpetziˈn , bˈeˈx xi ttzaqpiˈn Barrabás , ex bˈeˈx xi tqˈoˈn Jesús kye xqˈuqil te aj Rom , tuˈn tok kypejkˈin twutz cruz tuˈn tkyim .

text: And the soldiers led him away into the hall , called Praetorium ; and they call together the whole band .
text2: Xi kyiˈn xqˈuqil te aj Rom twiˈ tpeˈn kawbˈil , ex bˈaj ok kychmoˈn jniˈ kybˈaj .

text: And they clothed him with purple , and platted a crown of thorns , and put it about his head ,
text2: Ok kyqˈoˈn jun xbˈalin tiˈj , kyaq kaˈyin , tzeˈn t ‑ xbˈalin jun kawil , noq tuˈn tok kyxmayinku . Bˈaj kubˈ kyxpatxˈiˈn tqan txˈiˈx , ex ok kymujbˈin ttxaˈn . Jax kyqˈoˈn toj twiˈ nyakuj jun toj twiˈ nmaq kawil ,

text: And began to salute him , Hail , King of the Jews !
text2: exsin i bˈaj ok tentz ẍchˈil tiˈj : Nimxit tbˈiˈy , ay nmaq kawil kye aj Judiy , chi chiˈ .

text: And they smote him on the head with a reed , and did spit upon him , and bowing their knees worshipped him .
text2: I bˈaj ok ten jemil toj twiˈ Jesús tukˈa tze , bˈaj ok kytzubˈin tiˈj , ex bˈaj kubˈ meje twutz , nyakutlaj nchi kˈulenaj twutz .

text: And when they had mocked him , they took off the purple from him , and put his own clothes on him , and led him out to crucify him .
text2: Kybˈajlinxi xmayin tiˈj , el kyiˈn xbˈalin , a ok kyqˈoˈn , exsin ok kyqˈoˈn a t ‑ xbˈalin toktaq , exsin etz kyiˈn tpeˈn ja te kawbˈil , a jaˈ tuˈn tok kypejkˈin twutz cruz .

text: And they compel one Simon a Cyrenian , who passed by , coming out of the country , the father of Alexander and Rufus , to bear his cross .
text2: Attaq jun ichin aj Cirene , Simun tbˈi , ttata Lejantr ex Ruf , n ‑ ikyˈkutaq antza tzajnin toj tbˈe . Teˈ tok kykˈulbˈin , ok kyqˈoˈn il tiˈj tuˈn t ‑ xi tiqin tcruz Jesús .

text: And they bring him unto the place Golgotha , which is , being interpreted , The place of a skull .
text2: Pon kyin toj jun najbˈil Gólgota tbˈi , atzin tzˈelpine bˈibˈaj ikyjo : Ja taˈ tbˈaqil twiˈ kyimnin .

text: And they gave him to drink wine mingled with myrrh : but he received it not .
text2: Xi kyqˈoˈn vin smaˈnx tukˈa taˈl mir te , tuˈn mina tnaˈyeku kyixkˈoj . Me mix xi tkˈwaˈne .

text: And when they had crucified him , they parted his garments , casting lots upon them , what every man should take .
text2: Bˈeˈxsin jaw kypejkˈiˈn xqˈuqil te Rom twutz cruz , ex bˈaj kubˈ kypaˈn t ‑ xbˈalin Jesús kywutz . Me nej , i bˈaj saqchan tiˈj alkyetaq tuˈn tkanbˈinte , tuˈn t ‑ xi tiˈn .

text: And it was the third hour , and they crucified him .
text2: Bˈeljaj or te qlixje teˈ tjaw kyqˈoˈn Jesús twutz cruz .

text: And the superscription of his accusation was written over , THE KING OF THE JEWS .
text2: Ok kypejkˈin jun tzˈlan tibˈajxi twiˈ , me nej ok kytzˈibˈin twutz kyjaluˈn : Ate Jesúsjo , a Nmaq Kawil kye aj Judiy .

text: And with him they crucify two thieves ; the one on his right hand , and the other on his left .
text2: Junx tukˈa Jesús jaw kyqˈoˈn kabˈe ileqˈ twutz cruz , jun toj tman qˈobˈ ex juntl toj tẍnayaj .

text: And the scripture was fulfilled , which saith , And he was numbered with the transgressors .
text2: Ikytzin japin bˈajjo Tyol Dios tiˈj Jesús , a ntqˈmaˈ : Ok qˈoˈn tzeˈnku jun ileqˈ .

text: And they that passed by railed on him , wagging their heads , and saying , Ah , thou that destroyest the temple , and buildest it in three days ,
text2: Ex jniˈqe xjal nchi bˈaj ikyˈxtaq antza , noqx nchi bˈaj yasintaq tiˈj , ex noqx nja kyyekin tiˈj kywiˈ te kyxmaybˈil tiˈj , ex kyqˈma : ¡ Nyakutzin atejiy nqˈmante tuˈn tjaw tyuchˈiˈn tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , exsin tuˈn tbˈant juntl tuˈn toj oxe qˈij !

text: Save thyself , and come down from the cross .
text2: Klomiltzin tibˈa jaˈlin , ex qˈinkutz tibˈa twutz cruz , chi chiˈ .

text: Likewise also the chief priests mocking said among themselves with the scribes , He saved others ; himself he cannot save .
text2: Ikyx nbˈaj kyqˈmaˈntaqjo jniˈ kynejil pale exqetziˈn jniˈ xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil . Nbˈaj kubˈ kyqˈmaˈntaq kyxolile : ¿ Tzeˈn tten nbˈaj klettaq junjuntl xjal tuˈn , me antetz , mi nbˈant tklonte tibˈ ? chi chiˈ .

text: Let Christ the King of Israel descend now from the cross , that we may see and believe . And they that were crucified with him reviled him .
text2: In tkuˈtz twutz cruz jaˈlin , tuˈn tok qkaˈyin , ex tuˈn t ‑ xi qnimin , qa twutzxix qa a Crist , a Kolil ex nmaq kawil te aj Israel . Ex ikyqexljo yoˈlqekstaq tukˈa twutz cruz , noqx nchi yasin , ex noqx nchi bˈaj xmayintaq tiˈj .

text: And when the sixth hour was come , there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour .
text2: Teˈ tok kabˈlaj qˈij , ex tzmaxi toj oxe or te qale , bˈeˈx ok yupj twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice , saying , Eloi , Eloi , lama sabachthani ? which is , being interpreted , My God , my God , why hast thou forsaken me ?
text2: Ax orjo jaw ẍchˈin Jesús kujxix wen , ex tqˈma : Eloi , Eloi , lama sabactani . Atzin tzˈelpine ikyjo : ¡ NMan Dios ! ¡ NMan Dios ! ¿ Tiˈxsin quˈn ma chin kyij ttzaqpiˈn ?

text: And some of them that stood by , when they heard it , said , Behold , he calleth Elias .
text2: At junjun bˈaj bˈinte , kyxolxjo iteˈxtaq axsa ex bˈaj kyqˈma : Kybˈinxsiˈn , luˈ nqˈolbˈin tiˈj Elías , a yolil Tyol Dios .

text: And one ran and filled a spunge full of vinegar , and put it on a reed , and gave him to drink , saying , Let alone ; let us see whether Elias will come to take him down .
text2: Ex jun paqx el rinin jun jyolte chˈin bˈuˈẍ . Kux tmulin toj vin txˈam , ex ok tkˈloˈn tiˈj twiˈ jun ptzˈan , tuˈn t ‑ xi tkˈwaˈn Jesús . Bˈaj xi kyqˈmaˈn xjal te : ¡ Ax tenkuj ! Jekytzin tzul Elías qˈilte , tuˈn tkuˈtz twutz tcruz .

text: And Jesus cried with a loud voice , and gave up the ghost .
text2: Jaw ẍchˈin Jesús kujxix , ex bˈeˈx el kyim .

text: And the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom .
text2: Atzin xbˈalin tokxtaq tojjo tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , bˈeˈx kubˈ laqj te kabˈe ; tzaj xkye tiˈjjo ttxaˈn jawl , tuˈn tkˈul kanin tiˈjjo juntl ttxaˈn twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: And when the centurion , which stood over against him , saw that he so cried out , and gave up the ghost , he said , Truly this man was the Son of God .
text2: Atzin kynejineljo xqˈuqil te Rom , waˈltaq twutz Jesús , teˈ tok tkaˈyin otaq tzˈel kyim , tqˈma kyjaluˈn : Twutzx tetz Tkˈwal Diostaq teˈ ichin lo .

text: There were also women looking on afar off : among whom was Mary Magdalene , and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses , and Salome ;
text2: Najchaq nchi bˈaj kaˈyintztaq junjun qya ; kyxol atetaq Mariy , aj Xleˈn , ex Salomé , exsin Mariy , tnana jun Santyaw kyitzˈin kyibˈ tukˈa Jse .

text: ( Who also , when he was in Galilee , followed him , and ministered unto him ; ) and many other women which came up with him unto Jerusalem .
text2: Ayetziˈn qya , ayeˈ i bˈaj bˈet tukˈa Jesús teˈ nbˈettaq toj Galiley , ex i mojin tukˈa , me nya oˈkqexjo , ex iteˈxtaq txqantl ncheˈxtaq tukˈa Jerusalén .

text: And now when the even was come , because it was the preparation , that is , the day before the sabbath ,
text2: Atzaj teˈ qok yupj tojjo qˈij anetziˈn , jotxtaq xjal tuˈn tbˈanttaq kyten te junxil qˈij , a qˈij te ajlabˈl , a jaˈ mix aˈltaq tuˈn taqˈnin .

text: Joseph of Arimathaea , and honourable counseller , which also waited for the kingdom of God , came , and went in boldly unto Pilate , and craved the body of Jesus .
text2: Ante Jse aj Arimatey , jun xjal nimxixtaq toklin kyxol kawil ex nyoˈntaq tiˈjjo Tkawbˈil Dios , el tiˈn tchewil tiˈj , exsin xiˈ tukˈa Pilat , a kawil , qanil teˈ t ‑ xmilil Jesús , tuˈn tel tiˈn twutz cruz , ex tuˈn t ‑ xi muqbˈaj toj jul .

text: And Pilate marvelled if he were already dead : and calling unto him the centurion , he asked him whether he had been any while dead .
text2: Teˈ tbˈinte Pilat qa otaq kyim Jesús , bˈeˈx jaw kaˈylaj , exsin xi ttxkoˈn kynejiljo kawil xqˈuqil , tuˈn t ‑ xi tqanin te qa otaq kyim .

text: And when he knew it of the centurion , he gave the body to Joseph .
text2: Teˈ tbˈaj tqˈmaˈn tkyaqil te Pilat , bˈeˈxsin xi ttziyin te Jse , tuˈn tel tiˈn , ex tuˈn tokx tmuquˈn .

text: And he bought fine linen , and took him down , and wrapped him in the linen , and laid him in a sepulchre which was hewn out of a rock , and rolled a stone unto the door of the sepulchre .
text2: Tzaj tlaqˈoˈn Jse jun iqbˈil tbˈanilx wen , kutz tiˈn t ‑ xmilil Jesús twutz cruz , bˈaj tptzoˈn wen tojjo iqbˈil , exsin okx tqˈoˈn toj jun jul , kyij tjpuˈn tukˈa jun ma tij abˈj .

text: And Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses beheld where he was laid .
text2: Ayetzin Mariy , aj Xleˈn , exsin Mariy , tnana Jse , nchi kaˈyintaq jaˈ okxi muquˈn .

text: And when the sabbath was past , Mary Magdalene , and Mary the mother of James , and Salome , had bought sweet spices , that they might come and anoint him .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ qˈij te ajlabˈl , i xiˈ Mariy , aj Xleˈn , exsin Mariy , a tnana Santyaw tukˈax Salomé , laqˈol qˈanbˈil te jupsbˈil teˈ t ‑ xmilil Jesús , tzeˈntaqjo nchi tene kyimnin kyuˈn , tuˈn mi chi tzuwixe .

text: And very early in the morning the first day of the week , they came unto the sepulchre at the rising of the sun .
text2: Qlixje wen , teˈ kyxiˈ , jun tnejil qˈij te seman , jaˈ okx muqet Jesús noqxix njawilku qˈij ,

text: And they said among themselves , Who shall roll us away the stone from the door of the sepulchre ?
text2: ex chˈixtaq kypon ttzi jul , teˈ kyja yolin : ¿ Altzila kye k ‑ elil qˈinte abˈj ttzi jul ? chi chiˈ .

text: And when they looked , they saw that the stone was rolled away : for it was very great .
text2: Me te kypon ttzi jul , nyataqltza tkubˈe a ma tij abˈj ttzi jul , jaˈ okxi , qalaˈ najchaqtaql taˈye .

text: And entering into the sepulchre , they saw a young man sitting on the right side , clothed in a long white garment ; and they were affrighted .
text2: I okx toj jul , me atzaj teˈ kyokpin , kyli jun qˈa qˈuqletaq tok t ‑ xbˈalin sjanin wen kupinin tzma t ‑ xe tqan . Teˈ kylonte , bˈeˈx i xobˈx te .

text: And he saith unto them , Be not affrighted : Ye seek Jesus of Nazareth , which was crucified : he is risen ; he is not here : behold the place where they laid him .
text2: Atzin qˈa bˈeˈx xi yolinku kye : Mina chi xobˈa weˈy . ¿ Atzin nkyjyoˈnjiˈy Jesús aj Nazaret , a ja pejkˈit twutz cruz ? O jaw itzˈje teˈ ; ntiˈl tzaluˈn jaˈlin . Kykaˈyinkutzinjiˈy jaˈ kubˈe qˈoˈne .

text: But go your way , tell his disciples and Peter that he goeth before you into Galilee : there shall ye see him , as he said unto you .
text2: Ku kyxiˈtziˈn kyukˈa t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , exsin kˈaˈ txi kyqˈmaˈn kye ex te Pegr . Chichkujiˈy kye kyjaluˈn : Nej kanin Jesús kywutza tzma Galiley , tuˈntzin tbˈajjo aj kyij tqˈmaˈn kyeˈy .

text: And they went out quickly , and fled from the sepulchre ; for they trembled and were amazed : neither said they any thing to any man ; for they were afraid .
text2: Ayetzintzjo qya , bˈeˈx i etz toj jul , me nchi bˈaj luˈlintaq wen tuˈn kyxobˈil , ex bˈeˈx i aj , me mix alqe xi kyqˈmaˈn tuˈn kyxobˈil .

text: Now when Jesus was risen early the first day of the week , he appeared first to Mary Magdalene , out of whom he had cast seven devils .
text2: Qsqixlinxi te tnejil qˈij te seman , teˈ tjaw itzˈje Jesús . Nej kubˈ tyekˈin tibˈ twutz Mariy , aj Xleˈn , a otaq tzˈetz tlajoˈn wuq taqˈnil tajaw il toj tanmin .

text: And she went and told them that had been with him , as they mourned and wept .
text2: Me ante qya bˈeˈx xiˈku qˈmalte kyeˈ nchi bˈaj bˈisintaq ex nchi bˈaj oqˈtaq tiˈj , quˈn i bˈaj bˈet tukˈa .

text: And they , when they had heard that he was alive , and had been seen of her , believed not .
text2: Atzin teˈ tok kybˈiˈn te qya , qa otaq jatz anqˈin Jesús , ex qa otaq tli , mi xi kynimine .

text: After that he appeared in another form unto two of them , as they walked , and went into the country .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , nchi bˈettaqjo kabˈe t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , teˈ tok tyekˈin tibˈ kywutz , me mikyxiˈ tzeˈn te tok tyekˈin tibˈ te qya .

text: And they went and told it unto the residue : neither believed they them .
text2: Teˈ kykanin kyukˈa txqantl kyukˈa , bˈaj ok ten qˈmalte qa otaq kyli . Me mix xaye kynimineˈ txqantl .

text: Afterward he appeared unto the eleven as they sat at meat , and upbraided them with their unbelief and hardness of heart , because they believed not them which had seen him after he was risen .
text2: Yajxi chˈintl , teˈ tokpin kykˈatz , txolejqetaqjo junlajaj t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin tiˈjjo meẍ toj jun ja . Noqx jniˈ i bˈaj tyisoˈn , quˈn mix xi kynimine ayeˈ i qˈmante qa otaq jaw anqˈin juntl majl ,

text: And he said unto them , Go ye into all the world , and preach the gospel to every creature .
text2: exsin xi tqˈmaˈn kye : Ku kyxiˈy tkyaqil twutz txˈotxˈ qˈmal teˈ Tbˈanil Tqanil kolbˈil kye xjal .

text: He that believeth and is baptized shall be saved ; but he that believeth not shall be damned .
text2: Ankyeˈ xjal kxel niminte ex qa ma kuˈx toj aˈ te jawsbˈil aˈ , ok kletil teˈ . Me atziˈn mina txi tnimin , ok kxeˈl toj najin .

text: And these signs shall follow them that believe ; In my name shall they cast out devils ; they shall speak with new tongues ;
text2: Ayetziˈn chi xel niminte tbˈanilx kbˈantil kyuˈn , tzeˈnku tuˈn kylajoˈn taqˈnil tajaw il toj kyanminxjal , tuˈn kyyolin toj junxil yol ,

text: They shall take up serpents ; and if they drink any deadly thing , it shall not hurt them ; they shall lay hands on the sick , and they shall recover .
text2: ex qa ma chi jaw kytzyuˈn kan , mina chi txˈaˈn kyiˈj ; ex qa ma txi kynikyˈbˈin qˈanbˈil te kyimin , nlay chi kyim tuˈn ; ex aj tkubˈ kyqˈoˈn kyqˈobˈ kyibˈaj yabˈ , bˈeˈx kchi bˈajel weˈ kyuˈn .

text: So then after the Lord had spoken unto them , he was received up into heaven , and sat on the right hand of God .
text2: Teˈ tbˈaj tqˈmaˈn ikyjo , bˈeˈx aj toj kyaˈj . Teˈ tjapin , ok qe ttxlaj Dios toj tman qˈobˈ kawil tukˈa .

text: And they went forth , and preached everywhere , the Lord working with them , and confirming the word with signs following . Amen .
text2: Ayetziˈn t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin bˈeˈx i xiˈku qˈmal teˈ Tyol Dios te kolbˈil kyexjal kyojile jniˈ najbˈil . Tbˈanilx bˈaj bˈant kyuˈn , quˈn ax Dios kubˈ yekˈinte tiˈchaqku tiˈ te yekˈbˈilte qa twutzxtaqjo nbˈaj kyqˈmaˈntaq .

text: Forasmuch as many have taken in hand to set forth in order a declaration of those things which are most surely believed among us ,
text2: Ma kubˈ ntzˈibˈinjiˈy luˈn ay Tyople , kˈuˈjlinxix wuˈn : Ilaˈ o bˈaj tzˈibˈinte tkyaqiljo jniˈ o bˈaj qxol ,

text: Even as they delivered them unto us , which from the beginning were eyewitnesses , and ministers of the word ;
text2: ex tzeˈnkuxjo o bˈaj yekˈin qe kyuˈn i lontexix , ex kyij oqxeninxix kye , tuˈn kyxiˈ qˈmalte tzeˈnxix toke .

text: It seemed good to me also , having had perfect understanding of all things from the very first , to write unto thee in order , most excellent Theophilus ,
text2: Ex ikyxjo weˈ , chebˈexix o bˈaj nqaniˈn tzeˈnxix tzaje xkyeye , tuˈntziˈn kyjel ntzˈibˈiˈn ex kyjel nikˈuˈnxixa tey ,

text: That thou mightest know the certainty of those things , wherein thou hast been instructed .
text2: tuˈntzin telxix tnikyˈa te o bˈaj xnaqˈtzin tey .

text: There was in the days of Herod , the king of Judaea , a certain priest named Zacharias , of the course of Abia : and his wife was of the daughters of Aaron , and her name was Elisabeth .
text2: Teˈ attaq Herodes kawil toj Judey , attaq jun chˈuq pale tzajnin tiˈj tyajiljo jun qtzan pale Abías , ex tojjo chˈuq anetziˈn tokxtaq jun pale , Zakariy tbˈi . Ataqtzin t ‑ xuˈjil Zakariy , Lisabet tbˈi , tzajnin tiˈj tyajiljo qtzan tnejil pale Aarón .

text: And they were both righteous before God , walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blameless .
text2: Kykabˈilx tbˈanil xjalqe ; ntiˈxtaq chˈin bˈaˈn tok qˈmet kyiˈj qa nya wenqe , quˈn noqx niminkutaqjo tkawbˈil Dios kyuˈn .

text: And they had no child , because that Elisabeth was barren , and they both were now well stricken in years .
text2: Noq tij xjalqel , ntiˈx jun kyal otaq tzul , quˈn mitaq n ‑ alinxjo t ‑ xuˈjil .

text: And it came to pass , that while he executed the priest ' s office before God in the order of his course ,
text2: Pon jun qˈij kye chˈuq pale a tzajninqe tiˈjjo qtzan Abías tuˈn kyokx naˈl Dios , ex patil pon tojjo nim ja te naˈbˈl Dios .

text: According to the custom of the priest ' s office , his lot was to burn incense when he went into the temple of the Lord .
text2: Me ataqtziˈn ntene kyuˈn nej nbˈaj kyjyoˈn kyxolx , alkye jun tuˈn tokx tojjo tnejil ja te nabˈl Dios , a jaˈ nkubˈe patittaq pon ; me a Zakariy tzyet tuˈn tokx .

text: And the whole multitude of the people were praying without at the time of incense .
text2: Teˈ tokx Zakariy naˈl Dios ex patil pon , kykyaqiljo jniˈ xjal i bˈaj kyij naˈl Dios peˈn .

text: And there appeared unto him an angel of the Lord standing on the right side of the altar of incense .
text2: Nnaˈntaq Dios , ex npatintaq pon , ntiˈxtaq toj tnabˈl , me atzaj tok tkaˈyin noq waˈl jun t ‑ angel Dios ttxlajjo meẍ , jaˈ nbˈaj kubˈ patittaqjo jniˈ pon .

text: And when Zacharias saw him , he was troubled , and fear fell upon him .
text2: Teˈ tlonte Zakariy angel , noq jaw kaˈylaj , ex bˈeˈx tzaj xobˈ .

text: But the angel said unto him , Fear not , Zacharias : for thy prayer is heard ; and thy wife Elisabeth shall bear thee a son , and thou shalt call his name John .
text2: Me bˈeˈx xi tqˈmaˈn angel te : ¡ Zakariy ! Mina tzaj xobˈa , quˈn atziˈn tnaˈj Diosa , ma tzaj ttzaqˈwin Dios . Atzin t ‑ xuˈjila tzul jun tal , ex atzin tbˈi k ‑ okil tqˈoˈn , Juan .

text: And thou shalt have joy and gladness ; and many shall rejoice at his birth .
text2: Okx ktzalajilxa tiˈj , ex nya oˈkxa ; quˈn nimx txqantl ktzalajil tiˈj , aj tul itzˈje .

text: For he shall be great in the sight of the Lord , and shall drink neither wine nor strong drink ; and he shall be filled with the Holy Ghost , even from his mother ' s womb .
text2: Quˈn nimx k ‑ ajbˈila tkˈwala te Dios . Nya txˈujtinel , ex naˈmxtaq tul itzˈje , noq nojninl tanmin tuˈn Xewbˈaj Xjan .

text: And many of the children of Israel shall he turn to the Lord their God .
text2: Nimx aj Judiy kˈwel kybˈinchin kyten twutz Dios tuˈn .

text: And he shall go before him in the spirit and power of Elias , to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children , and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just ; to make ready a people prepared for the Lord .
text2: A kˈwel nej twutzjo Kolil tukˈa nim tipin ex tukˈa Xewbˈaj Xjan , tzeˈnkuj Elías , a yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe , tuˈn tkubˈ kyxmoxin manbˈaj kyibˈ kyukˈa kˈwalbˈaj , ex ikyqex kˈwalbˈaj kyukˈa manbˈaj ; ex aye xjal , a mina nkubˈ kybˈinchin a taj Dios , tuˈn tel kynikyˈ tiˈj , ikyxjo tzeˈnqeku a nkubˈ kybˈinchin wen , tuˈntzintla noq bˈantnintl kyten aj tul Kolil .

text: And Zacharias said unto the angel , Whereby shall I know this ? for I am an old man , and my wife well stricken in years .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Zakariy te angel : ¿ Tiˈn ktzajil tqˈoˈn weˈy tuˈn t ‑ xi niminjiˈy tyola ? Quˈn noq taˈẍqinla ex ikyx nxuˈjiljiˈy , ¿ Exsin tuˈn tul jun nkˈwala jaˈlin ?

text: And the angel answering said unto him , I am Gabriel , that stand in the presence of God ; and am sent to speak unto thee , and to shew thee these glad tidings .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin angel te : ¡ Ayiˈn Gabriel ! Nchin ajbˈiˈn te Dios . Ma chin tzaj tchqˈoˈn yolil tukˈiy , ex qˈmalte tqaniljo luˈn tey .

text: And , behold , thou shalt be dumb , and not able to speak , until the day that these things shall be performed , because thou believest not my words , which shall be fulfilled in their season .
text2: Me tuˈn mina xi tniminjiy a xi nqˈmaˈn tey , mina bˈantl tyoliˈn jaˈlin , tzmaxi ajxi tjapin tqˈijjo , a ma txi nqˈmaˈn tey .

text: And the people waited for Zacharias , and marvelled that he tarried so long in the temple .
text2: Me ayetziˈn jniˈ xjal nchi bˈaj naˈntaq Dios peˈn otaq chi bˈaj jaw qanlaj kyxolile , quˈn tuˈn nqˈaltex n ‑ etztaq Zakariy toj ja te naˈbˈl Dios .

text: And when he came out , he could not speak unto them : and they perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple : for he beckoned unto them , and remained speechless .
text2: Atzaj teˈ tetz , mix bˈantil tyolin kyukˈa jniˈ xjal , noq tqˈobˈqe i xi tyekin , tuˈn tyekˈinte jun tiˈ . Tuˈntziˈn ikyjo , bˈeˈx el kynikyˈjo jniˈ xjal te , qa attaq jun otaq tli , quˈn kukx xaˈye mix bˈantil tyolin .

text: And it came to pass , that , as soon as the days of his ministration were accomplished , he departed to his own house .
text2: Teˈ kyjapin bˈajjo qˈij tuˈn taqˈnin tojjo nim ja te naˈbˈl Dios , bˈeˈx aj tja .

text: And after those days his wife Elisabeth conceived , and hid herself five months , saying ,
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , n ‑ okku tzˈaq taljo t ‑ xuˈjil . Teˈ tok tzˈaq tal , ex jweˈ xjaw mix etz bˈete toj tja , ex tqˈma :

text: Thus hath the Lord dealt with me in the days wherein he looked on me , to take away my reproach among men .
text2: Ma qˈaqˈin tkˈuˈj Dios wiˈja jaˈlin , tuˈn mina chi yolbˈine xjal wiˈja , tuˈn ntiˈx jun wala otaq tzul , chi Lisabetjo .

text: And in the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God unto a city of Galilee , named Nazareth ,
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ qaq xjaw toklin tzˈaq tal Lisabet , teˈ t ‑ xi tchqˈoˈn Dios angel Gabriel tzma Nazaret , jun tnam toj txˈotxˈ te Galiley ,

text: To a virgin espoused to a man whose name was Joseph , of the house of David ; and the virgin ' s name was Mary .
text2: tuˈn t ‑ xiˈ yolil tukˈa jun txin , a naˈmtaq tlonte jun ichin . Atzin txin , Mariy tbˈi . Otaq ja yolin tuˈn tja meje tukˈa jun ichin , Jse tbˈi , tzajnin tiˈj tyajil qtzan nmaq kawil David .

text: And the angel came in unto her , and said , Hail , thou that art highly favoured , the Lord is with thee : blessed art thou among women .
text2: Teˈ tkanin Gabriel , xi tqˈmaˈn teˈ txin : Ma chin tzaja qˈolbˈil tey , Mariy . Ax Dios tukˈiy ex kyˈiwlinxixa tuˈn .

text: And when she saw him , she was troubled at his saying , and cast in her mind what manner of salutation this should be .
text2: Teˈ tbˈinte tyol angel ikyjo , noq el kyim tuˈn , exsin kubˈ tbˈisin tiquˈnil xi tqˈmaˈn angeljo te ikyjo .

text: And the angel said unto her , Fear not , Mary : for thou hast found favour with God .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn angel te : Mina ja xobˈa Mariy . Ntzalaj Dios tiˈja ,

text: And , behold , thou shalt conceive in thy womb , and bring forth a son , and shalt call his name JESUS .
text2: ex k ‑ okil tzˈaq jun tala jaˈlin . Ex ajtzin tul itzˈje , k ‑ okil tqˈoˈn tbˈi Jesús .

text: He shall be great , and shall be called the Son of the Highest : and the Lord God shall give unto him the throne of his father David :
text2: Tbˈanil ichinx ex k ‑ okil qˈoˈn tbˈi te Tkˈwaljo Dios nimx toklin . Ex ax Dios k ‑ okil qˈonte te kawil , tzeˈnku qtzan t ‑ xeˈchil , a David ,

text: And he shall reign over the house of Jacob for ever ; and of his kingdom there shall be no end .
text2: tuˈn tkawin kyibˈaj aj Judiy te jun majx , quˈn a tkawbˈil nlay bˈajx .

text: Then said Mary unto the angel , How shall this be , seeing I know not a man ?
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Mariy te angel : ¿ Tzeˈn tten tuˈn tok tzˈaq wala , ex bˈajxi chin kubˈ kẍeyiy tukˈa jun ichin ? chiˈ .

text: And the angel answered and said unto her , The Holy Ghost shall come upon thee , and the power of the Highest shall overshadow thee : therefore also that holy thing which shall be born of thee shall be called the Son of God .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn angel te : A t ‑ xlekemil Xewbˈaj Xjan kˈwel tibˈaja tzeˈn t ‑ xlekemil muj , ex noq tuˈn tipin Dios , a nimxix toklin , k ‑ okil tzˈaq tala . Tuˈntziˈn ikyjo , a tala tzul itzˈje xjanxix ex k ‑ okil tbˈi te Tkˈwal Dios .

text: And , behold , thy cousin Elisabeth , she hath also conceived a son in her old age : and this is the sixth month with her , who was called barren .
text2: Ex ikyxjo t ‑ xjalila Lisabet , ntiˈtaql bˈisin tuˈn , tuˈn tul jun tal , quˈn noq tijl . Me atzin jaˈlin , tzul itzˈje jun tal , quˈn o bˈant qaq xjaw toklin tzˈaq ,

text: For with God nothing shall be impossible .
text2: quˈn ntiˈx te Dios nlayit bˈant tuˈn .

text: And Mary said , Behold the handmaid of the Lord ; be it unto me according to thy word . And the angel departed from her .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Mariy : Noq bˈiˈnku we wuˈn tzeˈn taj Dios wukˈiy . Qa ikyjo tzeˈn ma tqˈmay , bˈaˈnla . Ex bˈeˈx xiˈ angel .

text: And Mary arose in those days , and went into the hill country with haste , into a city of Juda ;
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , xi tajqelin Mariy tibˈ , tuˈn t ‑ xiˈ toj jun tnam attaq txol wutz te Judey .

text: And entered into the house of Zacharias , and saluted Elisabeth .
text2: Teˈ tkanin , okx toj tja Zakariy , ex qˈolbˈin te Lisabet .

text: And it came to pass , that , when Elisabeth heard the salutation of Mary , the babe leaped in her womb ; and Elisabeth was filled with the Holy Ghost :
text2: Teˈ tbˈiˈnte Lisabet teˈ tqˈolbˈin Mariy te , atziˈn tal bˈeˈx jaw yekj toj tkˈuˈj . Ex nojnin tanmin Lisabet tuˈn Xewbˈaj Xjan , ex xi tqˈmaˈn kuj wen te Mariy : A te kyˈiwlinxix kyxol jniˈ qya twutz txˈotxˈ , ex ikyxjo tala tzul itzˈje .

text: And whence is this to me , that the mother of my Lord should come to me ?
text2: Ex atzin we noq jun tal qyaqinxiˈy , ¿ Exsin tuˈn wul qˈolbˈaja tuˈn tnana Klol weˈy ?

text: For , lo , as soon as the voice of thy salutation sounded in mine ears , the babe leaped in my womb for joy .
text2: Quˈn noqx teˈ xqˈolbˈin weˈy , bˈeˈx xjaw yekjo wala tuˈn tzaljbˈil toj nkˈuˈja .

text: And blessed is she that believed : for there shall be a performance of those things which were told her from the Lord .
text2: Kyˈiwlinxix te , tuˈn xi tnimiˈn qa tuˈn tbˈajjo jniˈ saj tqˈmaˈn Dios , a tAjaw Tkyaqil , tey .

text: And Mary said , My soul doth magnify the Lord ,
text2: Tqˈma Mariy : Kjawil nnimsiˈn tukˈa tkyaqil wanmiˈn tbˈi wAjawa .

text: And my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour .
text2: Ex tzunx ntzalajx wanmiˈn tiˈj Dios , a Klol weˈy .

text: For he hath regarded the low estate of his handmaiden : for , behold , from henceforth all generations shall call me blessed .
text2: Ntiˈxtaq wokliˈn , me atziˈn jaˈlin , ma chin tzaj tkaˈyiˈn Dios . Oˈkqinxa nimxix wokliˈn kyxoljo jniˈ xjal jaˈlin .

text: For he that is mighty hath done to me great things ; and holy is his name .
text2: Quˈn a Dios nimxix toklin , tbˈanilx ma tzaj tqˈoˈn weˈy . Xjanxixjo tbˈi .

text: And his mercy is on them that fear him from generation to generation .
text2: Atx te Dios tqˈaqˈbˈil tkˈuˈj kyiˈjjo nchi kubˈ niminte .

text: He hath shewed strength with his arm ; he hath scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts .
text2: Tukˈa tkyaqil tipin , nchi el tiˈn nimsil kyibˈ toj kytxˈixew , ex n ‑ ok tyupiˈn kybˈis .

text: He hath put down the mighty from their seats , and exalted them of low degree .
text2: N ‑ el tiˈn kyoklin nmaq kawil , ex nxi tqˈoˈn kye a ntiˈ kyoklin .

text: He hath filled the hungry with good things ; and the rich he hath sent empty away .
text2: Ayetziˈn at waˈyaj kyiˈj , nxi tqˈoˈn kywa . Ex n ‑ el tiˈn kyeˈ a noqx nbˈaj kyyajin .

text: He hath holpen his servant Israel , in remembrance of his mercy ;
text2: Mi ẍi el najjo aj Judiy toj tkˈuˈj . Ma chi tzaj tmojin tukˈa tqˈaqˈbˈil tkˈuˈj .

text: As he spake to our fathers , to Abraham , and to his seed for ever .
text2: Ikytzin tqˈma ojtxe kye qtzan qyajil Abraham ex kye txqantl kchi ul itzˈje .

text: And Mary abode with her about three months , and returned to her own house .
text2: Kyij Mariy oxe xjaw tja Lisabet . Teˈ kybˈajjo oxe xjaw , bˈeˈx aj tja .

text: Now Elisabeth ' s full time came that she should be delivered ; and she brought forth a son .
text2: Teˈ tjapin qˈij tuˈn tkubˈ tzˈaq Lisabet , ul jun kyal qˈa .

text: And her neighbours and her cousins heard how the Lord had shewed great mercy upon her ; and they rejoiced with her .
text2: Teˈ tok kybˈiˈn jniˈ t ‑ xjalil , ex jniˈ xjal , a at iteˈke te , i xtaˈj qˈolbˈilte , quˈn otaq qˈaqˈin tkˈuˈj Dios tiˈj .

text: And it came to pass , that on the eighth day they came to circumcise the child ; and they called him Zacharias , after the name of his father .
text2: Teˈ tbˈaj wajxaq qˈij tulin itzˈje , ul aqˈbˈaj techiljo qˈa , tzeˈn nchi tenetaqjo jniˈ kykˈwal aj Judiy , a qˈaqetaq . Atziˈn teˈ tuˈntaq tok tbˈi , Zakariytaq tbˈi tuˈntaq tok qˈoˈn , tzeˈnkuxjo tbˈi ttata .

text: And his mother answered and said , Not so ; but he shall be called John .
text2: Me mix ttziye tnana , quˈn Juan tbˈi k ‑ okilch .

text: And they said unto her , There is none of thy kindred that is called by this name .
text2: Xi kyqˈmaˈn xjal te : ¿ Tiquˈn ikyjo ? ¿ Ma attzin jun kyeˈ iky tbˈi ? chi chiˈ .

text: And they made signs to his father , how he would have him called .
text2: Xi kyqanin noq tukˈa techil te ttata tiˈtaq tbˈi tuˈn tok .

text: And he asked for a writing table , and wrote , saying , His name is John . And they marvelled all .
text2: Xi tqanin ttata jun tzˈlan , jaˈ tuˈn tkubˈ tzˈibˈite tbˈi . Atzaj teˈ tzaj ttzyuˈn , kubˈ ttzˈibˈin , Juan tbˈi . Teˈ tok kybˈiˈn jniˈ xjal ikyjo , jotx bˈeˈx i bˈaj jaw kaˈylaj .

text: And his mouth was opened immediately , and his tongue loosed , and he spake , and praised God .
text2: Ex tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , bˈeˈx bˈantl tyolin Zakariy , exsin ok ten nimsil tbˈi Dios .

text: And fear came on all that dwelt round about them : and all these sayings were noised abroad throughout all the hill country of Judaea .
text2: Jotxjo jniˈ xjal antza , junx kyukˈa tkyaqiljo najleqe tojjo jniˈ najbˈil kyxol wutz te Judey , i bˈaj jaw kaˈylaj tiˈjjo jniˈ otaq bˈaj .

text: And all they that heard them laid them up in their hearts , saying , What manner of child shall this be ! And the hand of the Lord was with him .
text2: Tkyaqilxjo jniˈ otaq bˈaj bˈinte ikyjo , bˈaj jaw yolin toj kyanmin ex kyqˈma : ¿ Titzila kbˈantil tuˈn kˈwal ? Quˈn nimx toklin ma tzaj tqˈoˈn Dios , a tAjaw Tkyaqil .

text: And his father Zacharias was filled with the Holy Ghost , and prophesied , saying ,
text2: Zakariy , a ttata neˈẍ , noj tanmin tuˈn Xewbˈaj Xjan , ex ok ten yolil tuˈn , ex chiˈ kyjaluˈn :

text: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel ; for he hath visited and redeemed his people ,
text2: Kyˈiwlinxixjo tbˈi Dios te Israel , a tAjaw Tkyaqil , quˈn ma tzul klol teˈ Ttanim .

text: And hath raised up an horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David ;
text2: Ma tzaj tqˈoˈn jun Klolqe , a nimx toklin , tzajnin tiˈj tyajiljo qtzan nmaq kawil David , a kubˈ niminte .

text: As he spake by the mouth of his holy prophets , which have been since the world began :
text2: Atziˈn luˈn a qˈumj ojtxe kyuˈn xjan yolil Tyol Dios , tej kyqˈma :

text: That we should be saved from our enemies , and from the hand of all that hate us ;
text2: A tuˈn tel klonqe kye qajqˈoj ex kye aye kykyˈeˈx qiˈj ;

text: To perform the mercy promised to our fathers , and to remember his holy covenant ;
text2: tuˈn ttzaj qˈaqˈin tkˈuˈj kyiˈjjo qyajil , ex tuˈn mina tzˈel naje toj tkˈuˈj , a tumil xjanxix bˈant tiˈj tuˈn ; tuˈn kykyij Ttanim toj wen tukˈa .

text: The oath which he sware to our father Abraham ,
text2: Ex atziˈn bˈant tiˈj tuˈn , ex tqˈma te Abraham , a qxeˈchil kyjaluˈn ,

text: That he would grant unto us , that we being delivered out of the hand of our enemies might serve him without fear ,
text2: tuˈn qel tkloˈn kye qajqˈoj , ex tuˈn qajbˈin te tukˈa tkyaqil qanmin ;

text: In holiness and righteousness before him , all the days of our life .
text2: tuˈn tkubˈ qbˈinchin qten jikyinxix toj tkyaqil qchwinqil twutz .

text: And thou , child , shalt be called the prophet of the Highest : for thou shalt go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways ;
text2: Atziˈn te , mil : Yolil Tyol Dios teˈ tbˈi k ‑ okil , a Dios nimxix toklin . Quˈn ay kˈwel nej twutzjo Kolil qˈmalte tuˈn tkubˈ kybˈinchinxjal kyibˈ twutz .

text: To give knowledge of salvation unto his people by the remission of their sins ,
text2: Kˈwel tnajsin Dios kyila , ex kchi kletila tuˈn , chkujiy kye .

text: Through the tender mercy of our God ; whereby the dayspring from on high hath visited us ,
text2: Quˈn a Dios tukˈa tqˈaqˈbˈil tkˈuˈj qiˈj , ktzajil tqˈoˈn jun tzaj toj kyaˈj tzeˈnku tqan qˈij ,

text: To give light to them that sit in darkness and in the shadow of death , to guide our feet into the way of peace .
text2: tuˈn tkˈant toj kychwinqiljo ayeˈ nchi bˈet toj najin , ex tuˈn tkubˈ nej qwutz toj tbˈeyil bˈaˈn .

text: And the child grew , and waxed strong in spirit , and was in the deserts till the day of his shewing unto Israel .
text2: Atziˈn kˈwal nchˈiyxixtaq tweˈ ex tnabˈl , exsin najan tojjo najbˈil , jaˈ mixtaq aˈl najle toj , tzmaxi tpon qˈij , jaˈ tuˈn tkubˈ tyekˈine tibˈ kyxol aj Judiy .

text: And it came to pass in those days , that there went out a decree from Caesar Augustus , that all the world should be taxed .
text2: Kyojtziˈn qˈij ayeˈ , tqˈma nmaq kawil toj Rom , Augusto tbˈi , tuˈn tjaw ajlet kybˈajjo jniˈ xjal tkyaqil twutz txˈotxˈ , ex tuˈn kybˈaj tzˈibˈit .

text: ( And this taxing was first made when Cyrenius was governor of Syria . )
text2: Ajo tajlal lo tnejil maj tuˈn tel tqanil jniˈ xjal at twutz txˈotxˈ . Ataq Sirenio toktaq te kawil toj Siria .

text: And all went to be taxed , every one into his own city .
text2: Jotxjo jniˈ xjal ok il kyiˈj tuˈn kyxiˈ tzˈibˈil kybˈi tojjo kytanim .

text: And Joseph also went up from Galilee , out of the city of Nazareth , into Judaea , unto the city of David , which is called Bethlehem ; ( because he was of the house and lineage of David : )
text2: Tuˈntziˈn , bˈeˈx etz Jse tojjo tnam te Nazaret toj ttxˈotxˈ Galiley , tuˈn t ‑ xiˈ tzma Belén toj txˈotxˈ te Judey , jaˈ itzˈje qtzan nmaq kawil David , quˈn tiˈj tyajil David tzajnin .

text: To be taxed with Mary his espoused wife , being great with child .
text2: Xiˈ tzˈibˈil tbˈi junx tukˈa Mariy , a tuˈn tmejetaq tukˈa , ex chˈixtaq tul tal .

text: And so it was , that , while they were there , the days were accomplished that she should be delivered .
text2: Iteˈxtaq Belén , teˈ tjapin kaniˈn qˈij , jaˈ tuˈn tkubˈ tzˈaqe Mariy ,

text: And she brought forth her firstborn son , and wrapped him in swaddling clothes , and laid him in a manger ; because there was no room for them in the inn .
text2: ex antza itzˈje tnejil tal . Teˈ tulku itzˈje , bˈaj tptzoˈn toj tan , exsin kubˈ tkuẍbˈin toj twabˈl chej , quˈn ntiˈtaq jun ja , jaˈ tuˈn tkubˈe tkuẍbˈine .

text: And there were in the same country shepherds abiding in the field , keeping watch over their flock by night .
text2: Me nqayin tkˈatz Belén , iteˈtaq junjun kyikˈlel nchi bˈaj xqˈuqintaq kyiˈj kyrit qnikyˈin .

text: And , lo , the angel of the Lord came upon them , and the glory of the Lord shone round about them : and they were sore afraid .
text2: Ntiˈkux toj kynabˈl , teˈ tkubˈ qoptzˈaj kyiˈjile tuˈn tspikyˈemil tipin Dios , exsin pon jun t ‑ angel Dios kykˈatz . Tuˈn ikyjo , bˈeˈx i xobˈxjo kyikˈlel .

text: And the angel said unto them , Fear not : for , behold , I bring you good tidings of great joy , which shall be to all people .
text2: Me xi tqˈmaˈn angel kye : Mina chi tzaj xobˈa weˈy , quˈn atx jun tqanil ma chin tzaja qˈmalte kyeˈy , me a tbˈanilx wen , ex te tzaljbˈilx te tkyaqilx xjal .

text: For unto you is born this day in the city of David a Saviour , which is Christ the Lord .
text2: Tojjo ttanim David , ma tzˈitzˈje jun Kolil jaˈlin , a Crist , ex a tAjaw Tkyaqil .

text: And this shall be a sign unto you ; Ye shall find the babe wrapped in swaddling clothes , lying in a manger .
text2: Tuˈn tel kynikyˈa te , ok kjyetil jun neˈẍ kyuˈn ptzoˈnkux toj tan ex kuẍleku toj twabˈl chej toj jun kyja aluˈmj .

text: And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God , and saying ,
text2: Tzunxtaq nyolinjo angel , teˈ kyul nimku angel kykˈatz ; nchi bˈaj nimsintaq tbˈi Dios kyjaluˈn :

text: Glory to God in the highest , and on earth peace , good will toward men .
text2: Noqit nkˈant tqoptzˈajiyil Dios toj kyaˈj , ex jun tzaljbˈil kyxolxjal toj tkyaqil twutz txˈotxˈ , a nkubˈ kybˈinchin taj Dios .

text: And it came to pass , as the angels were gone away from them into heaven , the shepherds said one to another , Let us now go even unto Bethlehem , and see this thing which is come to pass , which the Lord hath made known unto us .
text2: Teˈ kyaj angel toj kyaˈj , ayetziˈn kyikˈlel i bˈaj jaw yolin kyxolile ex kyqˈma : Qoˈqe Belén lol teˈ ma bˈaj , a ma tzaj tqˈmaˈn Dios qe .

text: And they came with haste , and found Mary , and Joseph , and the babe lying in a manger .
text2: Bˈeˈxsin i xiˈ . Atzaj teˈ kykanin , attaq Mariy exsin Jse , tukˈa neˈẍ kuẍlekutaq toj twabˈl chej .

text: And when they had seen it , they made known abroad the saying which was told them concerning this child .
text2: Teˈ kylonte , i ok ten qˈmalte tkyaqiljo jniˈ tqˈma angel kye .

text: And all they that heard it wondered at those things which were told them by the shepherds .
text2: Jotqexjo aye nchi bˈaj bˈintaq , bˈeˈx i el kyim tuˈn kyqˈma kyikˈlel .

text: But Mary kept all these things , and pondered them in her heart .
text2: Ante Mariy mix jaw yoline ; noq kubˈ tbˈisin tkyaqiljo nkyqˈmaˈntaq .

text: And the shepherds returned , glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen , as it was told unto them .
text2: Ayetzin kye kyikˈlel , ox chi tzalajx , exsin nchi bˈaj nimsintaq tbˈi Dios teˈ kyajtz , quˈn otaq kybˈi ex kyli a tzaj qˈmaˈn kye .

text: And when eight days were accomplished for the circumcising of the child , his name was called JESUS , which was so named of the angel before he was conceived in the womb .
text2: Atzaj teˈ tbˈaj wajxaq qˈij titzˈjlin neˈẍ , bˈeˈx ul aqˈbˈaj techil tiˈj , tzeˈnkuxtaqjo ntene , exsin tuˈn tok tbˈi . Atziˈn tbˈi ok qˈoˈn Jesús , quˈn ikyxtaq tbˈi tuˈn tok , a xi tqˈmaˈn angel te Mariy , te naˈmxtaq tok tzˈaq tiˈj .

text: And when the days of her purification according to the law of Moses were accomplished , they brought him to Jerusalem , to present him to the Lord ;
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , tjapin kanin qˈij , jaˈ tuˈn kyxiˈye txjol tiˈj nana , tuˈn tsaqix tuˈn titzˈjlin neˈẍ , tzeˈnku ntenetaq toj tkawbˈil Dios . Ex xi kyiˈn neˈẍ tzma Jerusalén , tuˈn t ‑ xi kyqˈoˈn toj tqˈobˈ Dios .

text: ( As it is written in the law of the Lord , Every male that openeth the womb shall be called holy to the Lord ; )
text2: Kubˈ kybˈinchiˈn ikyjo quˈn ikyxtaqjo tzˈibˈin toj tkawbˈil Dios : Tkyaqiljo tnejil kˈwal qa qˈa , il tiˈj tuˈn t ‑ xi kyqˈoˈn toj tqˈobˈ Dios .

text: And to offer a sacrifice according to that which is said in the law of the Lord , A pair of turtledoves , or two young pigeons .
text2: I xtaˈj qˈol chjonte te Dios tukˈa jun oyaj tzeˈnku ntqˈmaˈn tkawbˈil Dios ; jun muj xlukˈekˈ mo kabˈe tal palomj .

text: And , behold , there was a man in Jerusalem , whose name was Simeon ; and the same man was just and devout , waiting for the consolation of Israel : and the Holy Ghost was upon him .
text2: Kyojjo qˈij anetziˈn , najletaq jun ichin Jerusalén , Simeón tbˈi , nnaˈntaq Dios ex nyoˈntaq tiˈjjo Klolkye aj Judiy tuˈn tul , ex attaq Xewbˈaj Xjan tukˈa .

text: And it was revealed unto him by the Holy Ghost , that he should not see death , before he had seen the Lord ' s Christ .
text2: Atziˈn Xewbˈaj Xjan qˈmaˈnte te Simeón , tuˈn tzmaxitaq tuˈn tkyimjo , aj tlon teˈ Kolil , a Crist , a tuˈntaq tul tsmaˈn Dios .

text: And he came by the Spirit into the temple : and when the parents brought in the child Jesus , to do for him after the custom of the law ,
text2: Ax Xewbˈaj Xjan xi qˈinte Simeón tojjo tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , jaˈ iteˈtaq Jse ex Mariy tukˈaxjo kyneˈẍ , tuˈn tjapin kyuˈn a tzˈibˈin toj tkawbˈil Dios .

text: Then took he him up in his arms , and blessed God , and said ,
text2: Tzaj tchleˈn Simeón tal neˈẍ , exsin jaw naˈn Dios :

text: Lord , now lettest thou thy servant depart in peace , according to thy word :
text2: WAjaw , a tzaj tqˈmay ma bˈajx jaˈlin . Bˈaˈn tuˈn nkyim weˈ jaˈlin tukˈa tzaljbˈil , chiˈ .

text: For mine eyes have seen thy salvation ,
text2: Quˈn ma nli wejiˈy Kolil ,

text: Which thou hast prepared before the face of all people ;
text2: a kkolil kyiˈjjo jniˈ xjal chi xel niminte tkyaqil twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: A light to lighten the Gentiles , and the glory of thy people Israel .
text2: Ajo neˈẍ lo jun tzaj kkˈantil toj kychwinqiljo jniˈ xjal , aye mina nxi kynimin Tyola , tuˈn tel kynikyˈ tiˈja . Ex a k ‑ okil te nimsbˈil tbˈiy kyxol tkyaqil aj Israel .

text: And Joseph and his mother marvelled at those things which were spoken of him .
text2: Teˈ kybˈinte Jse ex Mariy a tqˈma Simeón , noq i el kyim ,

text: And Simeon blessed them , and said unto Mary his mother , Behold , this child is set for the fall and rising again of many in Israel ; and for a sign which shall be spoken against ;
text2: exsin i xi tkyˈiwlin Simeón kyoxelx . Xi tqˈmaˈn te tnana Jesús : Atziˈn neˈẍ luˈn ma tzaj tqˈoˈn Dios kyxol aj Judiy , tuˈn tel wen junjun ex junjun mina . A k ‑ ajbˈil te techiljo a taj Dios kyukˈaxjal , me nya tkyaqilx kxel niminte .

text: ( Yea , a sword shall pierce through thy own soul also , ) that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed .
text2: Ex antza k ‑ elile tnikyˈtzajil tbˈis tanmin junjun , quˈn junjun kchi xel lipe tiˈj ex junjun mina . Me te tey , nana , jun kyˈixbˈajil te tanmiˈn tuˈn bˈisbˈajil , aj tok tkaˈyiˈn , aj tel ikyˈin kyuˈnxjal .

text: And there was one Anna , a prophetess , the daughter of Phanuel , of the tribe of Aser : she was of a great age , and had lived with an husband seven years from her virginity ;
text2: Ex attaq jun tal bˈiˈẍ antza , Ana tbˈi , tkˈwaltaq Fanuel tzajnin tiˈj qtzan Aser , nyolintaq tiˈj tbˈi Dios . Txinxtaq wen , teˈ tok meje tukˈa tchmil , ex noq wuq abˈqˈe i ten junx , teˈ tkyij mebˈe , quˈn bˈeˈx kyim tchmil .

text: And she was a widow of about fourscore and four years , which departed not from the temple , but served God with fastings and prayers night and day .
text2: Kyaje toj jweˈ kˈal abˈqˈetaq Ana , ex noqtaq tojjo tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios tokxitaq . Minaxtaq n ‑ etz chˈin qnikyˈin ex qˈijl noqx nnaˈnku Dios , ex nimku maj nkubˈ tpaˈn waˈyaj toj naˈj Dios .

text: And she coming in that instant gave thanks likewise unto the Lord , and spake of him to all them that looked for redemption in Jerusalem .
text2: Ikyxjo teˈ t ‑ xtaˈj aqˈbˈajjo tal neˈẍ Jesús toj nim ja te naˈbˈl Dios , ex bˈeˈx xtaˈj qˈol chjonte te Dios , ex yolil tiˈjjo neˈẍ kye jniˈ xjal aj Jerusalén , ayeˈ nchi bˈaj yontaq tiˈjjo Kolil .

text: And when they had performed all things according to the law of the Lord , they returned into Galilee , to their own city Nazareth .
text2: Teˈ tbˈaj bˈant kyuˈn tzeˈntaqjo ntqˈmaˈn tkawbˈil Dios , bˈeˈx i meltzˈaj juntl majl tojxjo kytanim , a Nazaret te Galiley .

text: And the child grew , and waxed strong in spirit , filled with wisdom : and the grace of God was upon him .
text2: Atziˈn kˈwal nchˈiyxixe tweˈ ex nchˈiyxixe tnabˈl , quˈn nimtaq tqˈaqˈbˈil tkˈuˈj Dios tukˈa .

text: Now his parents went to Jerusalem every year at the feast of the passover .
text2: Ayetziˈn ttata Jesús ncheˈxtaq tkyaqil abˈqˈe Jerusalén ikyˈsil teˈ nintz qˈij , a nkubˈ kyikyˈsintaq aj Judiy , teˈ kyetz toj Egipto .

text: And when he was twelve years old , they went up to Jerusalem after the custom of the feast .
text2: Teˈ tel Jesús kabˈlajaj abˈqˈe , i xtaˈj kykyaqilx Jerusalén tzeˈnxtaq ntene kyuˈn .

text: And when they had fulfilled the days , as they returned , the child Jesus tarried behind in Jerusalem ; and Joseph and his mother knew not of it .
text2: Teˈ kybˈajjo qˈij anetziˈn , bˈeˈx i bˈaj ajtz kyja . Ante Jesús mix iwle kyuˈn ttata , teˈ tkyij Jerusalén .

text: But they , supposing him to have been in the company , went a day ' s journey ; and they sought him among their kinsfolk and acquaintance .
text2: Ikyla te kye qa ajintaq Jesús lipchek kyiˈj kyxoljo jniˈ xjal . Me atzaj teˈ tok kykaˈyin , ex tbˈaj kyjyoˈn kyxoljo jniˈ xjal ex kyxoljo jniˈ aye kyojtzqiˈntaq , ntiˈl ; exsin jun qˈij otaq txi kybˈetin .

text: And when they found him not , they turned back again to Jerusalem , seeking him .
text2: Teˈ mix ja jyete kyuˈn , bˈeˈx i meltzˈaj jyolte tzma Jerusalén .

text: And it came to pass , that after three days they found him in the temple , sitting in the midst of the doctors , both hearing them , and asking them questions .
text2: Otaqxi bˈant oxe qˈij kyjoybˈin tiˈj , teˈ tjyet kyuˈn , tokxtaq tojjo tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , kyxoljo jniˈ xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil nbˈintaq tiˈjjo jniˈ kyyol , ex nbˈaj xi tqanintaq junjun tiˈ kye . Ex ikyqextaqjo xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil ex nbˈaj xi kyqanintaq junjun tiˈ te .

text: And all that heard him were astonished at his understanding and answers .
text2: Ayetziˈn nchi bˈaj bˈintaq tiˈj , noq i bˈajel kyim , quˈn tbˈanilxtaq tumil toj twutz tuˈn ttzaqˈwin a jniˈ nbˈaj xi kyqanintaq nmaq xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil te .

text: And when they saw him , they were amazed : and his mother said unto him , Son , why hast thou thus dealt with us ? behold , thy father and I have sought thee sorrowing .
text2: Teˈ tiwle tuˈn Jse ex Mariy , noq i jaw kaˈylaj tiˈj , ex xi tqˈmaˈn tnana te : ¡ Wal ! ¿ Tiquˈn tuˈn qiˈja ikyjo ? Loqoˈy tzunx nqo bˈisin wen tiˈja tuˈn tjyete .

text: And he said unto them , How is it that ye sought me ? wist ye not that I must be about my Father ' s business ?
text2: I xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús . ¿ Tiquˈn nchi jyon wiˈja ? ¿ Ma nya bˈiˈn kyuˈn qa ilxix tiˈj tuˈn nteˈn toj taqˈin nMaˈn ?

text: And they understood not the saying which he spake unto them .
text2: Me mix oke kybˈiˈne Jse ex Mariyjo ikyjo .

text: And he went down with them , and came to Nazareth , and was subject unto them : but his mother kept all these sayings in her heart .
text2: Bˈeˈx aj kykˈleˈn , ex i kubˈ tnimin . Bˈeˈx xiˈ kyukˈa tzma Nazaret , quˈn antza najleqetaq , ex atziˈn tnana nbˈisintaq tjunalx toj tanmin tiˈjjo ikyjo .

text: And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature , and in favour with God and man .
text2: Me ante Jesús nchˈiyxixe tweˈ ex tnabˈl . Ntzalajtaq Dios tiˈj ex jniˈ xjal .

text: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar , Pontius Pilate being governor of Judaea , and Herod being tetrarch of Galilee , and his brother Philip tetrarch of Ituraea and of the region of Trachonitis , and Lysanias the tetrarch of Abilene ,
text2: Nkawintaq te Poncio Pilat toj txˈotxˈ te Judey tojjo jweˈlajaj abˈqˈe tjaqˈ tkawbˈiljo nmaq kawil toj Rom , Tiberio tbˈi . Atzinte Herodes tzuntaq nkawin teˈ toj Galiley ; atziˈn titzˈin , a Lip tbˈi , tzuntaq nkawin teˈ kyoj txˈotxˈ te Iturey ex toj Traconit . Ex kawiltaq teˈ Lisanias toj Abilinia .

text: Annas and Caiaphas being the high priests , the word of God came unto John the son of Zacharias in the wilderness .
text2: Ayetaqtziˈn kye Anás tukˈa Caifás nmaq paleqetaq kyeˈ kyxol aj Judiy . Tojjo ambˈil anetziˈn ex tojjo jun txˈotxˈ jaˈ ntiˈyetaq kynajbˈilxjal , kubˈ toqxenin Dios Tyol te Juan , a tkˈwal Zakariy .

text: And he came into all the country about Jordan , preaching the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins ;
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , ate Juan ikyˈ teˈ kyojile jniˈ najbˈil , a iteˈtaq nqayin tkˈatzjo nim aˈ Jordán tbˈi , ex tqˈma kyexjal qa iltaq tiˈj tuˈn tajtz tiˈj kyanmin toj tkyaqil nya bˈaˈn toj kychwinqil , ex tuˈn kykuˈx toj aˈ te jawsbˈil aˈ , te jun yekˈbˈil qa otaq najsit kyil tuˈn Dios .

text: As it is written in the book of the words of Esaias the prophet , saying , The voice of one crying in the wilderness , Prepare ye the way of the Lord , make his paths straight .
text2: Iky bˈajjo tzeˈnkuxjo otaq ttzˈibˈe qtzan Isaías , a yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe . Chiˈ kyjaluˈn : Ex bˈijte tqˈajqˈojil twiˈ jun aˈla kujxix wen toj tzqij txˈotxˈ , jaˈ ntiˈ kynajbˈilxjal toj , a xi tqˈmaˈn kyjaluˈn : Kybˈinchim kyteˈn twutz qAjaw ; kyqˈoˈnx kyanmiˈn teˈ jikyinxix wen .

text: Every valley shall be filled , and every mountain and hill shall be brought low ; and the crooked shall be made straight , and the rough ways shall be made smooth ;
text2: Tkyaqiljo a nya bˈaˈn toj kychwinqila , il tiˈj tuˈn ttxˈixpit ; ikyxjo tzeˈnku jun bˈe , a tuˈn tjikyimixjo , a ma txlaẍ taˈye , ex tuˈn tnojsitjo jniˈ jul at toj , ex tuˈn tbˈaj jaw pixkˈitjo ma tij jawnin , aj tul jun nimx toklin . Ikytziˈn , il tiˈj tuˈn qbˈinchinte tkyaqil , tuˈntzin bˈantnin qten , aj tul qAjaw .

text: And all flesh shall see the salvation of God .
text2: Quˈn kykyaqilx kyexjal kchi kaˈyil tiˈjjo tkolbˈil qMan Dios , a ktzajil tsmaˈn .

text: Then said he to the multitude that came forth to be baptized of him , O generation of vipers , who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come ?
text2: Atzaj teˈ kyetzxjal tuˈn kykuˈx toj aˈ te jawsbˈil aˈ tuˈn Juan , xi tqˈmaˈn kye kyjaluˈn : Ntiˈx kyeˈ kyajbˈin , ikyqexjiy tzeˈnku jun chˈuq maˈ kan . ¿ Ma noqtzin tuˈnjo jawsbˈil aˈ , aku chi kleta toj tyabˈ twiˈ Dios kujxix wen , a chˈix tul kanin ?

text: Bring forth therefore fruits worthy of repentance , and begin not to say within yourselves , We have Abraham to our father : for I say unto you , That God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham .
text2: Quˈn ojtzqiˈn kyuˈn kykyaqilxjal , qa axjo kybˈinchbˈiˈn nyekˈinte qa naˈm tajtz tiˈj kyanmiˈn . ¿ Tzeˈntzin tten nkubˈ kyximiˈn kyxola , qa aku chi kleta noq tuˈn Judiyqiˈy , a tyajil qtzan Abraham , ex nya tuˈn tajtz tiˈj kyanmiˈn ? Tunpetziˈn , kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , noqpetzin at kolbˈiltz ikyjo , majqexpetla kyeˈ abˈj luˈn , aku chi ok tqˈoˈn Dios te tyajil Abraham , tuˈn kyklet .

text: And now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees : every tree therefore which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down , and cast into the fire .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , chˈix tul tkawbˈil Dios kujxix kyibˈaj kykyaqiljo , ayeˈ kykyˈeˈ tuˈn tajtz tiˈj kyanmin , ikyxjo tzeˈnku tajaw jun wiˈ tze kjawil ttxˈemin , qa ntiˈ twutz n ‑ el . Ex a tze , a ntiˈ tajbˈin , k ‑ okix toj qˈaqˈ ; ikyxsin kchi tenbˈilajiˈy qa mi s ‑ ajtz tiˈj kyanmiˈn .

text: And the people asked him , saying , What shall we do then ?
text2: Ayetzin kyej xjaltz antza xi kyqanin te kyjaluˈn : ¿ Tiˈtzin aku kubˈ qbˈinchintza ?

text: He answereth and saith unto them , He that hath two coats , let him impart to him that hath none ; and he that hath meat , let him do likewise .
text2: Xitzin ttzaqˈwin Juantz : Ankye teˈ at kabˈe t ‑ xbˈalin , il tiˈj tuˈn t ‑ xi tqˈoˈn jun teˈ a ntiˈ at te ; ex ankye teˈ at twa , il tiˈj tuˈn t ‑ xi tqˈoˈn chˈin teˈ a ntiˈ .

text: Then came also publicans to be baptized , and said unto him , Master , what shall we do ?
text2: Ex i tzaj laqˈe junjun kyej xjal , tuˈn kykuˈx toj aˈ te jawsbˈil aˈ . Ayetzin xjal anetziˈn , a peyil pwaqqetaq toj tkawbˈil Rom . Me nej xi kyqanin te Juan kyjaluˈn : Ay xnaqˈtzil , ¿ Yajtzin qeˈ ? ¿ Tiˈn qeˈ kˈwel qbˈinchin ?

text: And he said unto them , Exact no more than that which is appointed you .
text2: Xitzin ttzaqˈwin Juan : Mi tzˈel kypeyin chˈintla tibˈajjo qˈmaˈntz kyeˈy , chiˈ .

text: And the soldiers likewise demanded of him , saying , And what shall we do ? And he said unto them , Do violence to no man , neither accuse any falsely ; and be content with your wages .
text2: Ex iteˈ junjuntl xoˈl qˈaqˈ i xi qaninte te kyjaluˈn : ¿ Yajtzin qetza ? ¿ Tiˈn qeˈ kˈwel qbˈinchin ? Xi tqˈmaˈn kye kyjaluˈn : Ikyxjo kyeˈ , mina tzˈok kyxobˈtzin jun aˈla , ex mina txi kypatiˈn jun aˈla , a ntiˈ tbˈinchbˈin nya bˈaˈn , ex mina tzˈel kyiˈn jun tiˈ te jun aˈla ; qalaˈ qe kykˈuˈja tiˈjjo twiˈ kykˈuˈja n ‑ etz .

text: And as the people were in expectation , and all men mused in their hearts of John , whether he were the Christ , or not ;
text2: Jotqex kyej xjal tzuntaq chi ayon kyeˈ , ex tzuntaq chi ximin kyeˈ toj kynabˈl , qa ataq te Juan a Crist , a Kolil , a otaq tzaj qˈoˈn toklin tuˈnx Dios .

text: John answered , saying unto them all , I indeed baptize you with water ; but one mightier than I cometh , the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to unloose : he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and with fire :
text2: Me atzin te Juan xi qˈmante kye kyjaluˈn : Me metzin weˈ , nchi kux nqˈoˈn xjol toj aˈ te jawsbˈil aˈ , te jun yekˈbˈil qa ma tzˈajtz tiˈj kyanmin . Me ante tzul wiˈjxiy nya noq oˈkx tuˈn kykuˈxxjal tuˈn toj aˈ , qalaˈ kxel tqˈoˈn Xewbˈaj Xjan toj kyanmin te jun majx te patbˈil jniˈ il toj . Quˈn at nimxixtl tipin tzeˈnku weˈ , ex ntiˈ we woklin nipe tuˈn woka te taqˈnil .

text: Whose fan is in his hand , and he will throughly purge his floor , and will gather the wheat into his garner ; but the chaff he will burn with fire unquenchable .
text2: Quˈn luˈ Kawil kkawil kyibˈaj xjal tzeˈnku jun aj triyil , a qˈiˈn ma nim tze toj tqˈobˈ te xtulbˈil triy . Ex k ‑ elix tpaˈn kykyaqilxjal wen kyxoljo nya wen , ikyxjo tzeˈnku jun xjal , aj t ‑ xtulin triy , ex k ‑ elil tpaˈn paj tiˈj . Ex kchi xel tkˈleˈn nimil toj kyaˈj tzeˈnku tuˈn tkux tkˈuˈn triy toj ttxˈutxˈ . Me ayetzin nya nimil , ikyxjo tzeˈnku paj , ok kchi kˈwel tpatin tukˈa qˈaqˈ , a mixla k ‑ yupjilx .

text: And many other things in his exhortation preached he unto the people .
text2: Nimku tumil bˈaj tqˈmaˈn Juan kyexjal , tej tqˈmetj Tbˈanil Tqanil .

text: But Herod the tetrarch , being reproved by him for Herodias his brother Philip ' s wife , and for all the evils which Herod had done ,
text2: Ex majxpe teˈ aj kawil , Herodes tbˈi , xi tmiyoˈn Juan , a Jawsil Aˈ , quˈn tuˈn otaq tzˈok t ‑ xuˈjlin Herodías , a t ‑ xuˈjil Lip , a titzˈin .

text: Added yet this above all , that he shut up John in prison .
text2: Nya wen ele ikyjo toj twutz Herodes ; bˈeˈx xi tqˈmaˈn tuˈn tkux jpet Juan toj tze . Tuˈntzin ikyjo , bˈeˈx chmet nim til twutz Dios .

text: Now when all the people were baptized , it came to pass , that Jesus also being baptized , and praying , the heaven was opened ,
text2: Ikytzin bˈajjo , tej naˈmxtaq tuˈn tkuˈx Juan toj tze . Tej nchi kuˈxtaq tqˈoˈn Juan xjal toj aˈ te jawsbˈil aˈ , ikyxl te Jesús bˈeˈx kuˈx toj aˈ tuˈn , te jawsbˈil aˈ . Ex tzuntaqtzin nnaˈnxi Jesús Dios , jun paqx xi jaqpajjo kyaˈj ,

text: And the Holy Ghost descended in a bodily shape like a dove upon him , and a voice came from heaven , which said , Thou art my beloved Son ; in thee I am well pleased .
text2: ex atziˈn Xewbˈaj Xjan kˈul kanin tibˈaj , ex iky kaˈyiˈn tzeˈnku jun palom . Ex qˈajqˈojin jun yol toj kyaˈj , ex tqˈma : Axixpen te nkˈwala , kˈuˈjlinxix wuˈn , a o jaw nskˈoˈn .

text: And Jesus himself began to be about thirty years of age , being ( as was supposed ) the son of Joseph , which was the son of Heli ,
text2: Bˈalaqa lajaj toj kaˈwnaq te Jesús tabˈqˈe , tej t ‑ xi t ‑ xikybˈiˈn tkyaqil taqˈin . Qˈumlaj qa kˈwalbˈaj te Jse , tzeˈnkuxtaqjo tqanil kyxolxjal . Atzin te Jse kˈwalbˈajtaqpen teˈ te Elí .

text: Which was the son of Matthat , which was the son of Levi , which was the son of Melchi , which was the son of Janna , which was the son of Joseph ,
text2: Ataqtzin teˈ Elí , kˈwalbˈajtaq teˈ te Matat , a tkˈwaltaq Leví , a tkˈwaltaq Melkí , a tkˈwaltaq Jana , a tkˈwaltaq Jse .

text: Which was the son of Mattathias , which was the son of Amos , which was the son of Naum , which was the son of Esli , which was the son of Nagge ,
text2: Atzin te Jse tkˈwaltaql te Matatías , a tkˈwaltaq Amós , a tkˈwaltaq Nahum , a tkˈwaltaq Esli , a tkˈwaltaq Nagai .

text: Which was the son of Maath , which was the son of Mattathias , which was the son of Semei , which was the son of Joseph , which was the son of Juda ,
text2: Ataqtzin te Nagai kˈwalbˈajtaq teˈ te Maat , a tkˈwaltaq Matatías , a tkˈwaltaq Semei , a tkˈwaltaq Josec , a tkˈwaltaq Judá .

text: Which was the son of Joanna , which was the son of Rhesa , which was the son of Zorobabel , which was the son of Salathiel , which was the son of Neri ,
text2: Ataqtzin te Judá kˈwalbˈajtaq teˈ te Joanán , a tkˈwaltaq Resa , a tkˈwaltaq Zorobabel , a tkˈwaltaq Salatiel , a tkˈwaltaq Neri .

text: Which was the son of Melchi , which was the son of Addi , which was the son of Cosam , which was the son of Elmodam , which was the son of Er ,
text2: Ataqtzin te Neri kˈwalbˈajtaql teˈ te Melkí , a tkˈwaltaq Adi , a tkˈwaltaq Cosam , a tkˈwaltaq Elmadam , a tkˈwaltaq Er .

text: Which was the son of Jose , which was the son of Eliezer , which was the son of Jorim , which was the son of Matthat , which was the son of Levi ,
text2: Ataqtzin te Er kˈwalbˈajtaqtzinl teˈ te Josué , a tkˈwaltaq Eliezer , a tkˈwaltaq Jorim , a tkˈwaltaq Matat ,

text: Which was the son of Simeon , which was the son of Juda , which was the son of Joseph , which was the son of Jonan , which was the son of Eliakim ,
text2: a tkˈwaltaq Leví , a tkˈwaltaq Simeón , a tkˈwaltaq Judá , a tkˈwaltaq Jse , a tkˈwaltaq Jonam , a tkˈwaltaq Eliaquim .

text: Which was the son of Melea , which was the son of Menan , which was the son of Mattatha , which was the son of Nathan , which was the son of David ,
text2: Ataqtzin te Eliaquim kˈwalbˈajtaql teˈ te Melea , a tkˈwaltaq Mena , a tkˈwaltaq Matata , a tkˈwaltaq Natán .

text: Which was the son of Jesse , which was the son of Obed , which was the son of Booz , which was the son of Salmon , which was the son of Naasson ,
text2: Ataqtzin te Natán kˈwalbˈajtaql teˈ te David , a tkˈwaltaq Isaí , a tkˈwaltaq Obed , a tkˈwaltaq Booz , a tkˈwaltaq Sala , a tkˈwaltaq Naasón .

text: Which was the son of Aminadab , which was the son of Aram , which was the son of Esrom , which was the son of Phares , which was the son of Juda ,
text2: Ataqtzin te Naasón kˈwalbˈajtaql teˈ te Aminadab , a tkˈwaltaq Admin , a tkˈwaltaq Arni , a tkˈwaltaq Esrom , a tkˈwaltaq Fares , a tkˈwaltaq Judá .

text: Which was the son of Jacob , which was the son of Isaac , which was the son of Abraham , which was the son of Thara , which was the son of Nachor ,
text2: Ataqtzin te Judá kˈwalbˈajtaqtzin teˈ te Jacob , a tkˈwaltaq Isaac , a tkˈwaltaq Abraham , a tkˈwaltaq Taré , a tkˈwaltaq Nacor ,

text: Which was the son of Saruch , which was the son of Ragau , which was the son of Phalec , which was the son of Heber , which was the son of Sala ,
text2: a tkˈwaltaq Serug , a tkˈwaltaq Ragau , a tkˈwaltaq Peleg , a tkˈwaltaq Heber , a tkˈwaltaq Sala .

text: Which was the son of Cainan , which was the son of Arphaxad , which was the son of Sem , which was the son of Noe , which was the son of Lamech ,
text2: Ataqtzin te Sala kˈwalbˈajtaqtzin teˈ te Cainán , a tkˈwaltaq Arfaxad , a tkˈwaltaq Sem , a tkˈwaltaq Noé , a tkˈwaltaq Lamec ,

text: Which was the son of Mathusala , which was the son of Enoch , which was the son of Jared , which was the son of Maleleel , which was the son of Cainan ,
text2: a tkˈwaltaq Matusalén , a tkˈwaltaq Enoc , a tkˈwaltaq Jared , a tkˈwaltaq Mahalaleel , a tkˈwaltaq Cainán .

text: Which was the son of Enos , which was the son of Seth , which was the son of Adam , which was the son of God .
text2: Ataqtzin te Cainán kˈwalbˈajtaqtzin teˈ te Enós , a tkˈwaltaq Set , a tkˈwaltaq Adán . Ataqtzin te Adán tzajnin te Dios .

text: And Jesus being full of the Holy Ghost returned from Jordan , and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness ,
text2: Nojnintaq tanmin Jesús tuˈn Xewbˈaj Xjan , tej tmeltzˈaj ttzi Nim Aˈ Jordán , exsin xiˈ tuˈn tkujil Xewbˈaj Xjan , tzmax tojjo tzqij txˈotxˈ jaˈ ntiˈye kynajbˈilxjal toj .

text: Being forty days tempted of the devil . And in those days he did eat nothing : and when they were ended , he afterward hungered .
text2: Kaˈwnaq qˈij ten Jesús antza , ex antza oke toj joybˈil tiˈj tuˈn tajaw il , tjoy ttxolil tuˈn tel tikyˈin tkawbˈil tMan . Kyojtziˈn qˈij anetziˈn , ntiˈx chˈin xi twaˈn . Tuˈntziˈn ikyjo , bˈeˈx tzaj waˈyaj tiˈj .

text: And the devil said unto him , If thou be the Son of God , command this stone that it be made bread .
text2: Ante tajaw il xi tqˈmaˈn te kyjaluˈn : Qa kˈwalbˈajxixtza te Dios , qˈmanxa kye abˈj lo , tuˈn kyok te wabˈj , quˈn manyor waˈyajx tiˈja .

text: And Jesus answered him , saying , It is written , That man shall not live by bread alone , but by every word of God .
text2: Me xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Kyij tzˈibˈin toj Tyol Dios , qa nya noq oˈkx tuˈn wabˈj k ‑ anqˈile texjal .

text: And the devil , taking him up into an high mountain , shewed unto him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , bˈeˈx xiˈ Jesús tuˈn tkujil tajaw il twiˈ jun ma tij wutz , ex jun paqx xi tyekˈiˈn kykyaqiljo tnam iteˈkutaq twutz txˈotxˈ ,

text: And the devil said unto him , All this power will I give thee , and the glory of them : for that is delivered unto me ; and to whomsoever I will I give it .
text2: exsin xi tqˈmaˈntz kyjaluˈn : Kxel nqˈoˈn tkyaqiljo kyoklin jniˈ tnam tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , tuˈn tkawiˈn kyibˈaj , junx tukˈa tkyaqil kynimsbˈil kyibˈ . Quˈn weˈy o tzaje qˈoˈneˈ luˈn , ex noq alqe wajiˈy tuˈn t ‑ xi nqˈoˈn .

text: If thou therefore wilt worship me , all shall be thine .
text2: Me qa ma kubˈ mejeˈy kˈulil nwutza , tkyaqil kxel nqˈoˈn tey , chiˈ tajaw il .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto him , Get thee behind me , Satan : for it is written , Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God , and him only shalt thou serve .
text2: Xitzin ttzaqˈwin Jesús kyjaluˈn : Tzˈibˈin taˈ toj Tyol Dios kyjaluˈn : Kˈuliˈn oˈkx twutz qAjaw , a tDiosa , ex noq te , tuˈn tajbˈiniych .

text: And he brought him to Jerusalem , and set him on a pinnacle of the temple , and said unto him , If thou be the Son of God , cast thyself down from hence :
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo ; bˈeˈx xiˈ Jesús juntl majl tuˈn tkujil tajaw il tzma toj tnam te Jerusalén . Jax tkˈleˈn tzmax toj tjuchˈiljo tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , a nimxix tweˈ , exsin xi tqˈmaˈntz te kyjaluˈn : Qa Kˈwalbˈajxixtza te Dios , xoˈnkuxsin tibˈtza , tuˈn tkupiˈn tzmax twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: For it is written , He shall give his angels charge over thee , to keep thee :
text2: Quˈn ikytzin ntqˈmaˈn Tyol Dios kyjaluˈn : Kchi tzajil tsmaˈn Dios t ‑ angel te kloltiy .

text: And in their hands they shall bear thee up , lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone .
text2: Ex kjawil qˈiˈn kyuˈn toj kyqˈobˈ , tuˈntzintla mi kyˈixbˈiy twiˈ abˈj .

text: And Jesus answering said unto him , It is said , Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God .
text2: Me ikyxjo ntqˈmaˈn toj Tyol Dios kyjaluˈn , chi Jesús : Mi tzˈok tqˈonjiy qAjaw , a tDiosa toj joybˈil tiˈjch .

text: And when the devil had ended all the temptation , he departed from him for a season .
text2: Tej mix jyetil tumil tuˈn tajaw il , tuˈn tok tqˈoˈntaq Jesús toj joybˈil tiˈj , bˈeˈxsin el tlaqˈwin jun jteˈbˈin qˈij tibˈtz tiˈj Jesús .

text: And Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee : and there went out a fame of him through all the region round about .
text2: Nojnintaq te Jesús tuˈn tipin Xewbˈaj Xjan , tej tmeltzˈaj toj ttxˈotxˈ Galiley , ex nimxtaq nyolajtz tqanil toj kykyaqiljo tnam iteˈtaq tiˈjileˈ txˈotxˈ anetziˈn .

text: And he taught in their synagogues , being glorified of all .
text2: Xnaqˈtzin te Jesús kyojile muˈẍ ja te kynaˈbˈl Judiy Dios tojile junjun najbˈil , ex tkyaqil xjal i jaw nimsin teˈ tbˈi Jesús .

text: And he came to Nazareth , where he had been brought up : and , as his custom was , he went into the synagogue on the sabbath day , and stood up for to read .
text2: Xiˈ te Jesús tojjo tnam Nazaret , a jaˈ jawe chˈiye . Tzeˈnkuxtaqjo n ‑ oke tuˈn , okx tojjo muˈẍ ja te kynaˈbˈl Judiy Dios toj tqˈijil ajlabˈl , ex jawtzin weˈtz uˈjil teˈ Tyol Dios .

text: And there was delivered unto him the book of the prophet Esaias . And when he had opened the book , he found the place where it was written ,
text2: Xi qˈoˈn tuˈj Isaías te , aj yolil Tyol Dios . Atzaj teˈ tjaw tjqoˈn Jesús , antza jatze jyete jun tnej yol tuˈn , tzˈibˈinku kyjaluˈn :

text: The Spirit of the Lord is upon me , because he hath anointed me to preach the gospel to the poor ; he hath sent me to heal the brokenhearted , to preach deliverance to the captives , and recovering of sight to the blind , to set at liberty them that are bruised ,
text2: Nojninqin weˈ tukˈa Xewbˈaj Xjan , a T ‑ xew tAjaw Tkyaqil . Quˈn ma chin el tpaˈn , tuˈn nxiˈy yolil Tbˈanil Tqanil kye yaj ; ex tuˈn nxiˈy qˈmal teˈ tzaqpibˈl kyeˈ jpunqekux toj tze , a ntiˈ tumil tuˈn kyten antza ; ex tuˈn tqˈanit kywutzjo moẍ , ex tuˈn nxiˈy qˈuqbˈil kykˈuˈjjo a ntiˈ kyipin ;

text: To preach the acceptable year of the Lord .
text2: ex tuˈn tqˈmetjo tqˈijil kolbˈil tuˈn t ‑ xtalbˈil tAjaw Tkyaqil .

text: And he closed the book , and he gave it again to the minister , and sat down . And the eyes of all them that were in the synagogue were fastened on him .
text2: Tbˈajlinxitziˈn ikyjo , bˈeˈx kubˈ tjpuˈn Jesúsjo uˈj , exsin xi tqˈoˈntz teˈ mojil tojjo muˈẍ ja te kynaˈbˈl Judiy Dios , ex bˈeˈx kubˈ qe . Kykyaqilxjo iteˈtaq antza , noqx otaq chi ok kyim tiˈj .

text: And he began to say unto them , This day is this scripture fulfilled in your ears .
text2: Xitzin t ‑ xikybˈintz tuˈn tyolin , ex tqˈma kyjaluˈn : Kywutzxa ex texjo qˈij luˈn , ma japin bˈajjo a xjaw wuˈjiˈn toj Tyol Dios .

text: And all bare him witness , and wondered at the gracious words which proceeded out of his mouth . And they said , Is not this Joseph ' s son ?
text2: Kykyaqilx xjal wentaq nkyyolin tiˈj Jesús , ex nchi jawtaq kaˈylaj , quˈn tbˈanilxtaq t ‑ xiliˈn tumil Tyol . Nchi bˈaj jawtaq qanlaj kyxol kyjaluˈn : ¿ Ma nyatzin tej tkˈwal Jse lo ?

text: And he said unto them , Ye will surely say unto me this proverb , Physician , heal thyself : whatsoever we have heard done in Capernaum , do also here in thy country .
text2: I xitzin ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Tuˈn kyxima ikyjo , bˈalaqa aku tzaj kyqˈmaˈn jun yol weˈy kyjaluˈn : Jun qˈanil aku kubˈ tqˈaˈnin tibˈ jaˈchaqx taˈyitz . Ikytziˈn , akula tzaj kyqˈmaˈn weˈy , tuˈn tkubˈ nbˈinchiˈn tzaluˈn tkyaqiljo techil wipiˈn xbˈant wuˈn tzma toj tnam Capernaum , tuˈn tel kynikyˈa wiˈja .

text: And he said , Verily I say unto you , No prophet is accepted in his own country .
text2: Me xi tqˈmaˈnl Jesús kye : Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , qa mix aˈlx jun yolil Tyol Dios , aku kubˈ wutzlin tojx ttanim .

text: But I tell you of a truth , many widows were in Israel in the days of Elias , when the heaven was shut up three years and six months , when great famine was throughout all the land ;
text2: Quˈn toj kywutza wen xjalqiˈy , noq tuˈn tzajninqiˈy te qtzan Israel . Me twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , kyojjo qˈij , tej tten Elías tzaluˈn toj ttxˈotxˈ Israel , nimxtaq qya otaq bˈaj kyim kychmil exla qa tzajninqetaq te Israel , ikyxjo tzeˈnku te Elías . Oxe abˈqˈe tukˈa nikyˈjin mix tzaje jbˈal . Tuˈntziˈn ikyjo , tkyaqil twutz txˈotxˈ nimx waˈyaj tzaj .

text: But unto none of them was Elias sent , save unto Sarepta , a city of Sidon , unto a woman that was a widow .
text2: Me exla qa nimx waˈyaj tzaj toj txˈotxˈ te Israel , mix xaye tchqˈoˈne Dios Elías qanil twa te jun mebˈe qya tzaluˈn toj Israel , qalaˈ antza xi chqˈoˈnil tukˈa jun qya otaq kyim tchmil , tojjo tnam Sarepta , nqayin taˈtaql teˈ tkˈatzjo tnam Sidón tojjo txˈotxˈ te amaqˈ xjal . ¿ Tiquˈnil ?

text: And many lepers were in Israel in the time of Eliseus the prophet ; and none of them was cleansed , saving Naaman the Syrian .
text2: Ex ikyxjo , ilaˈtaq qxjalil yabˈ tuˈn txˈaˈk , aj noqtaq n ‑ el lemimin , me mix jun kubˈ tqˈaniˈn Elisey , a yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe , qalaˈ oˈkxjo jun bˈetin xjal , Naamán tbˈi , a tzajnintaq toj ttxˈotxˈ Siria . Ex ikyxjo nya qxjalil . Bˈalaqa nya oˈkqox nqo ok tkˈuˈjlin Dios .

text: And all they in the synagogue , when they heard these things , were filled with wrath ,
text2: Tej tbˈij teˈ luˈn kyuˈn xjal iteˈkxtaq tojjo ja te kynaˈbˈl Judiy Dios , nimx i jaw qˈojle .
