text2: Iteˈtaq junjun kyexjal nchi yolintaq tiˈjjo tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , quˈn ponixtaq chi kaˈyin kyuˈn abˈj , a iteˈktaq te bˈinchbˈilte , ex kyuˈn jniˈ oyaj , a xi kyqˈoˈnxjal te pitxbˈilte . Chi Jesúsjo kyjaluˈn :

text: As for these things which ye behold , the days will come , in the which there shall not be left one stone upon another , that shall not be thrown down .
text2: Tzul jun te qˈij , ex tojjo qˈij anetziˈn , jotxjo lo , a n ‑ ok kykaˈyiˈn , tkyaqilx bˈeˈx kˈwel yuchˈin , ex ntiˈx jun te abˈj kyjel tibˈaj juntl , aj tjapin tqˈijil .

text: And they asked him , saying , Master , but when shall these things be ? and what sign will there be when these things shall come to pass ?
text2: Xitzin kyqanin t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin te kyjaluˈn : Ay Xnaqˈtzil , ¿ Jtojtzila bˈaˈn tbˈajjo ikyjo ? ¿ Altzila kye techil , tuˈn tok qkaˈyiˈn , noq tuˈn tel qnikyˈa te , qa chˈixtaq tul kanin tkyaqiljo lo ?

text: And he said , Take heed that ye be not deceived : for many shall come in my name , saying , I am Christ ; and the time draweth near : go ye not therefore after them .
text2: Chi Jesúsjo kyjaluˈn : Kykaˈyink kyibˈa quˈn noq chi kubˈ sbˈuˈn . Quˈn ilaˈx tzul , ex ok k ‑ okil kyqˈoˈn kyibˈ tzeˈnku ayiˈn . Iky ktzajil tqˈmaˈn junjun kyjaluˈn : Ayin weˈ Tkˈwal Diosqiˈn , ex apente qˈijjo ma tzul kanin jaˈlin , tuˈn tjapin bˈaj kykyaqil , chichkulaˈ . Me ayetzin kyeˈ ntiˈx tuˈn kyxi lipey kyiˈj .

text: But when ye shall hear of wars and commotions , be not terrified : for these things must first come to pass ; but the end is not by and by .
text2: Ajtzin t ‑ xi kybˈiˈn kyeˈ tqanil jniˈ qˈoj , ex aj kyjaw tzaqpaj xjal tuˈn kyjyon qˈoj kyxolile , mina chi jaw xobˈa , quˈn tuˈn nej kbˈajiljo jniˈ lo kyxolxjal . Me naˈmtaqx tpon tqˈijil tuˈn tjapin bˈaj tkyaqil .

text: Then said he unto them , Nation shall rise against nation , and kingdom against kingdom :
text2: Ok tenl Jesús qˈmalte kyjaluˈn : Quˈn ilxix tiˈj nej tuˈn kyqˈojin junjun chˈuq xjal tukˈa junjuntl , ex junjun ma tij tnam kqˈojlil tukˈa juntl .

text: And great earthquakes shall be in divers places , and famines , and pestilences ; and fearful sights and great signs shall there be from heaven .
text2: Nimx kyaqnajnabˈ , a kujxix kchi tzajil , junx kyukˈa nimx waˈyaj ex nimx yabˈil , a noq jaˈchaqku . Ex nim techil kylabˈila twutz kyaˈj , a bˈeˈx akux chi tzaj xobˈxa kye .

text: But before all these , they shall lay their hands on you , and persecute you , delivering you up to the synagogues , and into prisons , being brought before kings and rulers for my name ' s sake .
text2: Me naˈmxtaq txi xkyeˈ lo , aye kyeˈ nej kchi okil tzyuˈn kyuˈnxjal , ex ktzyetil kylajchiy . Ok kchi xel qˈiˈn tojjo muˈẍ ja te kynaˈbˈl Dios Judiy , tuˈn kykawita . Ex ok kchi kˈwelix qˈoˈn toj tze , ex ok kchi xel patiˈn kyuˈnxjal kywutz nmaq kawil ex kywutzjo txqantl nejinel noq tuˈn npaja .

text: And it shall turn to you for a testimony .
text2: Me tojjo lo k ‑ ajbˈil te kyeˈy te jun yekˈbˈil qa ojtzqiˈnqiˈn kyuˈn .

text: Settle it therefore in your hearts , not to meditate before what ye shall answer :
text2: Me ntiˈ tuˈn kyok ten bˈisilte jaˈlin , tiˈ tuˈn t ‑ xi kyqˈmaˈn te kolbˈil kyeˈy , aj tpon qˈij anetziˈn .

text: For I will give you a mouth and wisdom , which all your adversaries shall not be able to gainsay nor resist .
text2: Quˈn tuˈn ayin weˈ kchin xel qˈonte kyyola , a nimxixjo kynabˈl , a mix aˈlx jun kyajqˈoja aku tzikyˈx kyuˈn , ex mix aˈlx aku xkye tyolin kyiˈja .

text: And ye shall be betrayed both by parents , and brethren , and kinsfolks , and friends ; and some of you shall they cause to be put to death .
text2: Toj tkyaqiljo lo , atkula maj ayex kytatiy , ex kyitzˈiˈn , mo ayex kyxjalila mo jniˈ kyukˈiy kchi okil meltzˈaj kyiˈja , tuˈn kyxi kˈayita . Iteˈla junjun kyeˈ ok kchi kˈwel bˈyoˈn kyuˈn ,

text: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name ' s sake .
text2: ex ok kchi okil ikyˈiˈn kyuˈn kykyaqilxjal , noq tuˈn tpajjo kynimbˈila wiˈja .

text: But there shall not an hair of your head perish .
text2: Me mixpela jun tal tsmal kywiˈy knajil .

text: In your patience possess ye your souls .
text2: ¡ Chi weˈkuxixa toj kynimbˈila , tuˈntzintla kykleta !

text: And when ye shall see Jerusalem compassed with armies , then know that the desolation thereof is nigh .
text2: Ajtzin t ‑ xi kykaˈyinjiˈy tnam Jerusalén , aj tok kytxolbˈin xoˈl qˈaqˈ kyibˈ tiˈjile , bˈiˈnkutzintz kyuˈn , qa chˈixtaq tkubˈ yuchˈin .

text: Then let them which are in Judaea flee to the mountains ; and let them which are in the midst of it depart out ; and let not them that are in the countries enter thereinto .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , jniˈ xjal , ayeˈ iteˈ toj txˈotxˈ Judey , il tiˈj tuˈn kyex oq toj kˈul . Ex ayetzin kyeˈ , a iteˈ toj tnam te Jerusalén , il tiˈj tuˈn kyetz oq . Ex ayetzin xjal iteˈtaq toj kojbˈil , mi tuˈn kymeltzˈaj toj tnam .

text: For these be the days of vengeance , that all things which are written may be fulfilled .
text2: Quˈn kyojjo qˈij lo , ok kˈwel nimitjo kawbˈil kyibˈajxjal , a kujxix wen , a tzˈibˈin taˈye toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios .

text: But woe unto them that are with child , and to them that give suck , in those days ! for there shall be great distress in the land , and wrath upon this people .
text2: ¡ Ayex kyeˈ tal qya , a chˈixtaq kykubˈ tzˈaq , ex ayeˈ tzmataq nbˈaj miˈẍin kyal , quˈn tuˈn nimx kyixkˈoj tzul tojjo tnam anetziˈn tuˈnjo kawbˈil ktzajil , kujxix wen , kyibˈajjo jniˈ xjal antza !

text: And they shall fall by the edge of the sword , and shall be led away captive into all nations : and Jerusalem shall be trodden down of the Gentiles , until the times of the Gentiles be fulfilled .
text2: Iteˈ junjun kye kkyimil tuˈn kxbˈil , a kabˈe tste . Ex iteˈ junjuntl kchi xel xoˈn toj tze tojile tkyaqil twutz txˈotxˈ . Atzin teˈ tnam Jerusalén , noqx techx kbˈajil waˈbˈin teˈ kyuˈnxjal aj il , ex tzmaxi aj tjapin bˈajjo ambˈil , a xi tqˈmaˈn Dios .

text: And there shall be signs in the sun , and in the moon , and in the stars ; and upon the earth distress of nations , with perplexity ; the sea and the waves roaring ;
text2: Iteˈ techil ok kchi okil tiˈj qˈij ex tiˈj yaye ex kyiˈj cheˈw . Ex atzin teˈ twutz txˈotxˈ noqx kchi jawil najx kyexjal , ex nim kyxobˈil ktzajil , quˈn tuˈn okx ktinilxjo ttxuyil aˈ , aj tok ten puljil .

text: Men ' s hearts failing them for fear , and for looking after those things which are coming on the earth : for the powers of heaven shall be shaken .
text2: Bˈeˈx kchi tzajil numtzˈaj xjal tuˈn kyxobˈil , aj kyok ten bˈisil , tiˈ kkyˈelix tibˈaj tkyaqil twutz txˈotxˈ . Quˈn majqexpe kye kykyaqil nchi qoptzˈaj toj kyaˈj exsin jniˈ iteˈ antza okx kchi luˈlilx .

text: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in a cloud with power and great glory .
text2: Aj tul kanin tkyaqiljo lo , okpetzin kchin iwliltza , a ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , aj ntzaja toj muj twutz kyaˈj tukˈa tkyaqil wipiˈn ex jniˈ nqoptzˈajiyila .

text: And when these things begin to come to pass , then look up , and lift up your heads ; for your redemption draweth nigh .
text2: Aj t ‑ xi xkyeˈ jotxjo lo , qexix kykˈuˈja , ex kybˈinchinku kyibˈa , quˈn chˈixtaqtzin tkanin tqˈijil kolbˈil .

text: And he spake to them a parable ; Behold the fig tree , and all the trees ;
text2: Ex kubˈ tqˈmaˈn Jesúsjo juntl techil lo : Kykaˈyinka jun tqan iw mo qa aˈlchaqx kye juntl tzetz .

text: When they now shoot forth , ye see and know of your own selves that summer is now nigh at hand .
text2: Aj tok kykaˈyin aj ttzaj poqˈle jniˈ t ‑ xaq , oktzin k ‑ elil kynikyˈtza te , qa chˈixtaq tul kanin qˈijil .

text: So likewise ye , when ye see these things come to pass , know ye that the kingdom of God is nigh at hand .
text2: Ikyxsin tteˈn lo , aj tok kykaˈyiˈn aj tjapin bˈajjo jniˈ techil , tzˈelkutzin kynikyˈtza te , qa chˈixtaq tul laqˈeˈ Tkawbˈil qMan Dios kykˈatza .

text: Verily I say unto you , This generation shall not pass away , till all be fulfilled .
text2: Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , a qa tzul kanin jotxjo lo , a naˈmtaq kykyimxjal , a iteˈ tojjo tqˈijil lo .

text: Heaven and earth shall pass away : but my words shall not pass away .
text2: A kyaˈj ex txˈotxˈ ok kchi bˈajil , me mex weˈ nyol nlayx chi kyij xkyeˈ , tuˈn mi chi japin bˈaje .

text: And take heed to yourselves , lest at any time your hearts be overcharged with surfeiting , and drunkenness , and cares of this life , and so that day come upon you unawares .
text2: Kykaˈyink kyeˈ kyibˈ , ex mina txi kychˈuẍsin kyanmiˈn tuˈnjo jniˈ achbˈil at twutz txˈotxˈ tzeˈnkuˈ txˈujtin , ex jniˈ bˈis tojjo kychwinqila jaˈlin , quˈn nyajqa njapinkutaq tqˈijiljo lo , exsin nya bˈinchin kyeˈ kyten , bˈeˈx aku chi naja ,

text: For as a snare shall it come on all them that dwell on the face of the whole earth .
text2: tzeˈnku jun txuk nkyij tjaqˈ jun tzuybˈil txuk . Quˈn kykyaqilxjal , a najleqe toj tkyaqil twutz txˈotxˈ , mi naˈbˈinx kyuˈn , aj kykyij tjaqˈ tkawbˈil Dios , a kujxix wen .

text: Watch ye therefore , and pray always , that ye may be accounted worthy to escape all these things that shall come to pass , and to stand before the Son of man .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , kybˈinchinkutzin kyeˈ kyibˈ , ex chi naˈn Diosa tkyaqil qˈij , tuˈntzintla kytzaqpaja toj tkyaqiljo kbˈajil kyibˈaj txqantl , ex tuˈntzinlta kypon kaniˈn nwutza , a ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , tukˈa tqˈuqbˈil kykˈuˈja .

text: And in the day time he was teaching in the temple ; and at night he went out , and abode in the mount that is called the mount of Olives .
text2: Qˈijl nxnaqˈtzintaq te Jesús tojjo tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios . Atziˈn tzeˈnkuˈ qnikyˈin , antza nkyijetaq twiˈ Wutz Olivos .

text: And all the people came early in the morning to him in the temple , for to hear him .
text2: Ex qlixjexix , nbˈaj xiˈtaqxjal bˈil teˈ tyol tojjo tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios .

text: Now the feast of unleavened bread drew nigh , which is called the Passover .
text2: Chˈixtaq tul kanin nintz qˈij te Waˈj Pan , a jaˈ n ‑ ikyˈsite Xjan Qˈij , tuˈn kywaˈnxjal pan , a ntiˈ txˈamsbˈilte .

text: And the chief priests and scribes sought how they might kill him ; for they feared the people .
text2: Ayeˈ kynejil pale exqetziˈn xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil nchi jyontaq tumil , tzeˈn tten , tuˈn tkyimetaq Jesús kyuˈn , quˈn tuˈn attaq kyxobˈil kyiˈjxjal tuˈn kyxi lipe tiˈj .

text: Then entered Satan into Judas surnamed Iscariot , being of the number of the twelve .
text2: Okxsin tajaw il toj tanmin Judas , a Iscariot tbˈi nqˈolbˈajtz , ex toktaq te tkabˈlajajin t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin Jesús .

text: And he went his way , and communed with the chief priests and captains , how he might betray him unto them .
text2: Xiˈ teˈ xjal lo yolil kyukˈa kynejil pale ex kyukˈa kynejil xqˈuqil teˈ tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , tuˈntzintla kykyij toj wen , tzeˈn tten tuˈn t ‑ xi qˈoˈyit Jesús toj kyqˈobˈjo xjal anetziˈn .

text: And they were glad , and covenanted to give him money .
text2: Nimx i jaw tzalajjo xjal anetziˈn , ex xi kytziyin , tuˈn t ‑ xi kyqˈoˈn pwaq te Judas .

text: And he promised , and sought opportunity to betray him unto them in the absence of the multitude .
text2: Xi ttziyin te Judas ikyjo , ex jun paqx , ok ten jyol tumil tzeˈn tuˈn t ‑ xi qˈoˈyit Jesús toj kyqˈobˈ pale , me atlaˈ toj ewajil , tuˈn mi kylixjal .

text: Then came the day of unleavened bread , when the passover must be killed .
text2: Ultzin kanin qˈij te Waˈj Pan , a jaˈ n ‑ ikyˈsite Xjan Qˈij , tuˈn kywaˈnxjal pan , a ntiˈ txˈamsbˈilte tkuˈx , ex jaˈ tuˈn tkubˈe bˈyete jun tal rit te ikyˈsbˈilte .

text: And he sent Peter and John , saying , Go and prepare us the passover , that we may eat .
text2: I xiˈtzin chqˈoˈn Pegr exsin Juan tuˈn Jesús , ex xi tqˈmaˈn kye kyjaluˈn : Kux cheˈx kyeˈ bˈinchilte wabˈj te Xjan Qˈij .

text: And they said unto him , Where wilt thou that we prepare ?
text2: Ayetzin kyetz xi kyqaniˈn kyjaluˈn : ¿ Jaˈtzin tajiy tuˈn tkubˈ qbˈinchinjiˈy wabˈj ?

text: And he said unto them , Behold , when ye are entered into the city , there shall a man meet you , bearing a pitcher of water ; follow him into the house where he entereth in .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesúsjo kyjaluˈn : Aj kyokxa toj tnam , ok k ‑ okil kykˈulbˈiˈn jun ichin , a qˈiˈn jun ẍoqˈ aˈ tuˈn . Bˈeˈx kˈaˈ chex lipeˈy tiˈj tzma tja , jaˈ k ‑ okixi .

text: And ye shall say unto the goodman of the house , The Master saith unto thee , Where is the guestchamber , where I shall eat the passover with my disciples ?
text2: Ex kˈaˈ txi kyqˈmaˈn te tajaw ja kyjaluˈn : Chitzin Xnaqˈtziljo kyjaluˈn : ¿ Altzin kyeˈ ja ktzajil tqˈoˈn , a jaˈ tuˈn nwaniy junx kyukˈa nxnaqˈtzbˈiˈn tuˈn tikyˈsit Xjan Qˈij quˈn , chichkujiˈy ?

text: And he shall shew you a large upper room furnished : there make ready .
text2: Ktzajil tyekˈin jun ja kyeˈy , chebˈex bˈinchin wen tibˈajxi juntl . Kˈaˈ kubˈ kybˈinchinjiˈy qwa antza .

text: And they went , and found as he had said unto them : and they made ready the passover .
text2: Bˈeˈxsin i xiˈ , ex jyet kyuˈn tzeˈnkuxjo otaq txi qˈmaˈn kye , tuˈn Jesús . Oktzin ten bˈinchil teˈ wabˈj te ikyˈsbˈilte Xjan Qˈij .

text: And when the hour was come , he sat down , and the twelve apostles with him .
text2: Atzaj teˈ tkanin or , oktzin qe Jesús tiˈj meẍ junx kyukˈa t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin .

text: And he said unto them , With desire I have desired to eat this passover with you before I suffer :
text2: Chi Jesús kye kyjaluˈn : Jteˈla majxla o kubˈ nbˈisiˈn tuˈn nwaˈn junx kyukˈiy , tuˈntzintla tkubˈ ikyˈsitjo Xjan Qˈij , a naˈmxtaq nkyima .

text: For I say unto you , I will not any more eat thereof , until it be fulfilled in the kingdom of God .
text2: Quˈn twutzx kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , qa nlay kubˈ wikyˈsiˈn juntl majla tzmaxi chin waˈl juntl majljiˈy tiˈj , aj tjapin bˈaj t ‑ xilin Xjan Qˈij tzma toj kyaˈj .

text: And he took the cup , and gave thanks , and said , Take this , and divide it among yourselves :
text2: Ex jaw ttzyuˈn Jesús jun tkˈwel vin . Atzaj teˈ tbˈaj qˈon chjonte te Dios tiˈj , xi tqˈmaˈ kyjaluˈn : Kytzyunxjiˈy lo , exsin kysipinxa kyxoliliy ;

text: For I say unto you , I will not drink of the fruit of the vine , until the kingdom of God shall come .
text2: quˈn twutzx kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , qa nlay txi nkˈwaˈn juntl majljiˈy kˈwabˈj lo , tzmaxiˈ aj qkˈwan junx kyukˈiy tzma toj Tkawbˈil qMaˈn toj kyaˈj .

text: And he took bread , and gave thanks , and brake it , and gave unto them , saying , This is my body which is given for you : this do in remembrance of me .
text2: Ex jaw ttzyuˈn jun pan . Atzaj teˈ tbˈaj qˈon chjonte te Dios tiˈj , kubˈ tpiẍin , exsin xi tqˈoˈntz kye . Chiˈ kyjaluˈn : Atzin wejiˈy nxmilil lo , a kxel qˈoˈn tuˈn tkyim , noq tuˈn kykleta . Kybˈinchim kyejiˈy lo , noq te naˈbˈl weˈy .

text: Likewise also the cup after supper , saying , This cup is the new testament in my blood , which is shed for you .
text2: Ikyx kubˈ tbˈinchin Jesúsjo tukˈa kˈwabˈj , kybˈajlinxiˈ waˈn . Chiˈ kyjaluˈn : Ajo kˈwabˈj lo , atzin jun akˈaj tumiljo , a bˈantnin tiˈj tuˈn Dios , tuˈn kykyijxjal toj wen tukˈa . Ajo nchkyˈela , a k ‑ elil chitj te kolbˈil kyeˈy , atzin k ‑ okiljo te kujsbˈilte yol anetziˈn .

text: But , behold , the hand of him that betrayeth me is with me on the table .
text2: Me ajo xjal , a kxel kˈayin weˈy , lu qˈuqlik junx wukˈiy tiˈj meẍ .

text: And truly the Son of man goeth , as it was determined : but woe unto that man by whom he is betrayed !
text2: Twutzxix teˈ , qa kchin xel qˈoˈn weˈ , a ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , toj kyqˈobˈxjal , tzeˈnkuxjo tzˈibˈiˈn taˈye toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios ; me bˈisbˈajilxla teˈ ichin , a kxel qˈon weˈy toj kyqˈobˈxjal .

text: And they began to inquire among themselves , which of them it was that should do this thing .
text2: Ayetziˈn t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin bˈeˈx i ok ten qanilte kyxolx , alkyeˈ kxel qˈonte Jesús toj kyqˈobˈxjal .

text: And there was also a strife among them , which of them should be accounted the greatest .
text2: Nim chˈin chˈotjin tzaj kyxoljo t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin Jesús , quˈn kyajtaq tuˈn kybˈinte alkyexix nim toklin kyxol .

text: And he said unto them , The kings of the Gentiles exercise lordship over them ; and they that exercise authority upon them are called benefactors .
text2: Chi Jesúsjo kye kyjaluˈn : Aye nmaq kawil , a nya nimil , toj nmaq tnam , nchi kawin nyakuj tajaw tnamqe , ex n ‑ ok kyqˈoˈn kyibˈ te tbˈanil xjalqe .

text: But ye shall not be so : but he that is greatest among you , let him be as the younger ; and he that is chief , as he that doth serve .
text2: Me ayetzin kyeˈ , mina chi ok kyeˈ ikyjo . Quˈn alkyeˈ nim chˈintl toklin kyxola , il tiˈj tuˈn tok tqˈoˈn tibˈ nyakutlaj jun kuˈxin . Ex alkye teˈ , a ktzajil qˈoˈn toklin te nejinel kyxol txqantl , il tiˈj tuˈn tok tqˈoˈn teˈ tibˈ te aqˈnil .

text: For whether is greater , he that sitteth at meat , or he that serveth ? is not he that sitteth at meat ? but I am among you as he that serveth .
text2: ¿ Me altzila kyeˈ nim chˈintl toklintz ? ¿ Apetzilaˈ a k ‑ okil qe waˈl tiˈj meẍ , mo a nsipin wabˈj ? ¿ Ma nyapetzila a te nim chˈin toklin toj kywutza , a k ‑ okil qe waˈl tiˈj meẍ ? Me metzin weˈ , a te nim tokliˈn a n ‑ ajbˈin kye txqantl tzeˈnku weˈ .

text: Ye are they which have continued with me in my temptations .
text2: Ayetzin kyeˈ kukx o chi ten kyeˈ wukˈiy toj tkyaqiljo yajbˈil , a o tzikyˈx wuˈn .

text: And I appoint unto you a kingdom , as my Father hath appointed unto me ;
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , kxel nqˈoˈn weˈ kyokliˈn toj nkawbˈila , tzeˈnkuxjo ma tzaj qˈoˈn weˈ woklin toj Tkawbˈil nMaˈn .

text: That ye may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom , and sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel .
text2: Ex kxel nqˈoˈn kyokliˈn tuˈn kywaˈn ex tuˈn kykˈwaˈn wukˈiy tojjo Kawbˈil anetziˈn . Ex kchi kˈwel qeˈy toj qˈuqbˈil tuˈntzin kykawiˈn wukˈiy kyibˈajjo kabˈlajaj chˈuq xjal , a tzajnin tiˈj te qtzan qxeˈchil Israel .

text: And the Lord said , Simon , Simon , behold , Satan hath desired to have you , that he may sift you as wheat :
text2: Ex ikyl tqˈma tAjaw Tkyaqiljo kyjaluˈn : Simun , Simun , bˈintza : Ma qanajtz teˈ tuˈn tajaw il , tuˈn tyekajtza wen , tzeˈnkuˈ tuˈn t ‑ xtulit triy .

text: But I have prayed for thee , that thy faith fail not : and when thou art converted , strengthen thy brethren .
text2: Me ayin weˈ ma chin kubˈsin nwutz tiˈja te Dios , tuˈntzintla mina kubˈ numja toj tnimbˈila . Ex ajtzin tmeltzˈaj juntl majla toj tnimbˈila , wetzin mojintltza kyukˈa tukˈiy , tuˈn kyweˈxix wen toj kynimbˈil , chi Jesús te Pegr .

text: And he said unto him , Lord , I am ready to go with thee , both into prison , and to death .
text2: Me atzin te Pegr xi ttzaqˈwin kyjaluˈn : Ay Taa , loqiˈn lo , qˈoˈnx weˈ wibˈ tuˈn nteˈn junx tukˈiy toj tkyaqil , qa toj tze expe qa ma chin kyima tukˈiy .

text: And he said , I tell thee , Peter , the cock shall not crow this day , before that thou shalt thrice deny that thou knowest me .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús kyjaluˈn : Ay Pegr , twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn tey , texjo qnikyˈin lo , a naˈmtaqx toqˈ tman ekyˈ , kchin kˈwel tewiˈn oxe maj kywutzxjal , ex kxel tqˈmaˈn , qa nya ojtzqiˈnqiˈn tuˈn .

text: And he said unto them , When I sent you without purse , and scrip , and shoes , lacked ye any thing ? And they said , Nothing .
text2: Ex xi tqanin Jesús kye kyjaluˈn : ¿ Ma attzin jun tiˈla mix kanine kyeˈy , tej kyxi nsmaˈn jun maj , a ntiˈ kypaˈy , ntiˈ kychˈuˈẍa te tkˈwel kypwaqa ex ntiˈ kyxjabˈa xiˈ ? Mix tiˈ , chi chiˈ , tej t ‑ xi kytzaqˈwin .

text: Then said he unto them , But now , he that hath a purse , let him take it , and likewise his scrip : and he that hath no sword , let him sell his garment , and buy one .
text2: Ex xi tqˈmaˈntl Jesús kyjaluˈn : Me metziˈn jaˈlin , ankye teˈ at tpa , bˈaˈn tuˈn t ‑ xi tiˈn , ex bˈaˈn tuˈn t ‑ xi tiˈn tchˈuˈẍ , qa at . Exsin qa at juntz , a ntiˈ tkxbˈil , a kabˈe tste , bˈaˈn tuˈn t ‑ xi tkˈayin jun tal tkamiẍ , mo jun ttxoˈw , exsin tuˈn ttzaj tlaqˈoˈn juntz .

text: For I say unto you , that this that is written must yet be accomplished in me , And he was reckoned among the transgressors : for the things concerning me have an end .
text2: Quˈn twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , qa il tiˈj tuˈn tjapin bˈaj wiˈja a tzˈibˈin taˈ toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios , a iky ntqˈmaˈn kyjaluˈn : Ex kxel qˈoyit junx kyukˈa a nya wen xjalqe . Oc japin bˈajx teˈ jotxjo jniˈ tzˈibˈin wiˈja .

text: And they said , Lord , behold , here are two swords . And he said unto them , It is enough .
text2: Chi chiljo t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin kyjaluˈn : Taa , loqe kabˈe kxbˈil lo , a kabˈe kyste . Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús kyjaluˈn : Kukxjo jaˈlin , chiˈ .

text: And he came out , and went , as he was wont , to the mount of Olives ; and his disciples also followed him .
text2: Etzin Jesús , exsin xiˈ twiˈ Wutz Olivos , tzeˈnxtaqjo n ‑ oketaq tuˈn ; ex bˈeˈx bˈaj ikyˈ lipeˈ jniˈ t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin tiˈj .

text: And when he was at the place , he said unto them , Pray that ye enter not into temptation .
text2: Atzaj teˈ kykanin , iky xi tqˈmaˈn kye kyjaluˈn : Kux chi naˈnqiˈy Dios , tuˈntzintla mina chi kubˈ tzˈaqa toj tqˈobˈ tajaw il .

text: And he was withdrawn from them about a stone ' s cast , and kneeled down , and prayed ,
text2: Bˈeˈx el tlaqwin te Jesús tibˈ kyiˈj t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , bˈalaqa jun mo kabˈe echj xi laqˈeye . Kubˈ meje , exsin ok tentz naˈl Dios .

text: Saying , Father , if thou be willing , remove this cup from me : nevertheless not my will , but thine , be done .
text2: Chiˈ kyjaluˈn : NMaˈn , chin tklomila teˈ tkyaqil jniˈ kkyˈelix wuˈn ; me noqit nya a tzeˈnku waja , qalaˈ atla tzeˈnkuxjo taja .

text: And there appeared an angel unto him from heaven , strengthening him .
text2: Tzmataq nyolin , jun paqx tzaj jun angel toj kyaˈj qˈolte tipin .

text: And being in an agony he prayed more earnestly : and his sweat was as it were great drops of blood falling down to the ground .
text2: Nimx jaw bˈisin Jesús tuˈn nimxtaqjo kyixkˈoj tuˈn tikyˈx tuˈn . Me tuˈn ikyjo , jaw tiˈnxix tqˈajqˈojil twiˈ tuˈn tnaˈn Dios . Tuˈnpetziˈn , ox txˈuljinx aˈ tiˈj , nchi kubˈik tzˈaq twutz txˈotxˈ , ex ikytaq chi kaˈyin tzeˈnku chikyˈ .

text: And when he rose up from prayer , and was come to his disciples , he found them sleeping for sorrow ,
text2: Tbˈajlinxitzin naˈn Dios , jawtzin weˈkstz , exsin aj meltzˈaj kykˈatzjo t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , me noqtaql nchi ktanl kyeˈ tuˈn bˈisbˈajil , tej kyel jyet .

text: And said unto them , Why sleep ye ? rise and pray , lest ye enter into temptation .
text2: Chi Jesúsjo kye kyjaluˈn : ¿ Tiquˈnil nchi ktaˈn ? Kux chi jaw weˈksa , ex kux chi naˈn Dios , tuˈntzin mina chi kubˈ tzˈaqiˈy toj tqˈobˈ tajaw il .

text: And while he yet spake , behold a multitude , and he that was called Judas , one of the twelve , went before them , and drew near unto Jesus to kiss him .
text2: Tzunxtaq nyolin Jesús kyukˈa t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , tej kypon tilj txqan xjal . Ataq Judas , a attaq toklin kyxol kabˈlajaj t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , nejnin kywutz . Ok laqˈe maˈtzil te Jesús .

text: But Jesus said unto him , Judas , betrayest thou the Son of man with a kiss ?
text2: Me atzin te Jesús iky xi tqˈmaˈn te kyjaluˈn : Ay Judas , ¿ Ma noqtzin tuˈn jun maˈtzj ok chin xele tqˈoˈniy toj kyqˈobˈxjal , a ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin ?

text: When they which were about him saw what would follow , they said unto him , Lord , shall we smite with the sword ?
text2: Ayetaqtzin kyeˈ , a iteˈtaq tukˈa Jesús , tej tok kykaˈyin , ex tok kybˈiˈn a nbˈajtaq , xi kyqanin kyjaluˈn : Taa , ¿ Oktzin kchi okil qtxˈeˈmiˈn tuˈn qkxbˈila , tuˈn tkleta ?

text: And one of them smote the servant of the high priest , and cut off his right ear .
text2: Me at jun te , a mix kubˈ tyoˈne , qalaˈ bˈeˈx xi lipin txˈemil teˈ taqˈnil tnejil pale . Bˈeˈx el tjaspiˈn tẍkyin , a at toj tman qˈobˈ .

text: And Jesus answered and said , Suffer ye thus far . And he touched his ear , and healed him .
text2: Me ante Jesús xi tqˈmaˈn kyjaluˈn : Kukxjo , chi tenku xjaljo . Ok tmekoˈn te Jesús tẍkyinj aqˈnil anetziˈn , ex bˈeˈx qˈanit tej xjal te jun majx .

text: Then Jesus said unto the chief priests , and captains of the temple , and the elders , which were come to him , Be ye come out , as against a thief , with swords and staves ?
text2: Xitzin tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye kynejil pale , kye xqˈuqil tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , ex kye nejinel kyexjal ; aye xjal lo , a ayetaqtziˈn otaq chi ul tzyulte Jesús . Chiˈ kyjaluˈn : ¿ Tiquˈnil ma chi ula tzyul weˈy , qˈimila kykxbˈila ex kytzeˈy , nyakuj iky ma chin ele wejiˈy te kyeˈy tzeˈnku jun ileqˈ ?

text: When I was daily with you in the temple , ye stretched forth no hands against me : but this is your hour , and the power of darkness .
text2: Kykyaqil qˈij o chin ten weˈ kyukˈiy tojjo tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , me mix jun maj ẍin ok kytzyuˈn . Me mapen kanin kyeˈ kyqˈijil , tuˈn tkubˈ kybˈinchinjiˈy a kyaja , quˈn atziˈn tqˈijiljo , tuˈn tkawin tajaw qlolj .

text: Then took they him , and led him , and brought him into the high priest ' s house . And Peter followed afar off .
text2: Ok tzyuˈn Jesús kyuˈn , exsin xi kyiˈntz tzma tja kynejil pale . Atzin te Pegr , najchaq xi lipeye teˈ .

text: And when they had kindled a fire in the midst of the hall , and were set down together , Peter sat down among them .
text2: Atzaj teˈ kykanin , bˈeˈx kubˈ kykchoˈn kyqˈaqˈ nkyˈaj peˈn , exsin i ok txoletz tiˈj . Ex majx te Pegr tokxtaq kyxol .

text: But a certain maid beheld him as he sat by the fire , and earnestly looked upon him , and said , This man was also with him .
text2: Me jun paqx , el tnikyˈtzajil Pegr tuˈn jun txin , a n ‑ aqˈnintaq tojjo ja anetziˈn . Ok kyim wen tiˈj Pegr , tej qˈuqlektaq tiˈj qˈaqˈ , exsin chitzjo kyjaluˈn : Ex majx teˈ luˈn attaq tukˈa Jesúsch .

text: And he denied him , saying , Woman , I know him not .
text2: Me bˈeˈx kubˈ tewin te Pegr . Chiˈ kyjaluˈn : Ay txin , nyax wojtzqiˈn wejiˈy ichin anetziˈn .

text: And after a little while another saw him , and said , Thou art also of them . And Peter said , Man , I am not .
text2: Aˈkxtaqku teˈ ikyjo , tej tiwle juntl majl Pegr tuˈn juntl xjal , a iky tqˈmaˈ kyjaluˈn : Ex majx te at kyxoljo xjal anetziˈn . Me ante Pegr chiˈ kyjaluˈn : Me mina , nyaqin wejiˈy .

text: And about the space of one hour after another confidently affirmed , saying , Of a truth this fellow also was with him : for he is a Galilaean .
text2: Bˈalaqa otaq tzikyˈ jun or ikyjo , tej tjaw tiˈn tibˈ juntl xjal , a chiˈ kyjaluˈn : Twutzxpen teˈ , ajin teˈ xjal lo attaq tukˈa Jesús , quˈn ex aj Galiley te luˈn .

text: And Peter said , Man , I know not what thou sayest . And immediately , while he yet spake , the cock crew .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Pegr kyjaluˈn : ¡ Mina ! Mi wojtzqiˈn weˈ , ex ntiˈx n ‑ el nnikyˈa te , tiˈ qiˈjil nyoliniy . Jun paqx , naˈmtaqxpe tbˈaj yolin te Pegr , tej tjaw oqˈ te tman ekyˈ .

text: And the Lord turned , and looked upon Peter . And Peter remembered the word of the Lord , how he had said unto him , Before the cock crow , thou shalt deny me thrice .
text2: Tzaj meltzˈaj te tAjaw Tkyaqil , exsin xi kyimtz toj twutz Pegr . Bˈeˈxpen i ul julkˈaj tej tyol Jesús toj tkˈuˈj Pegr , aj otaq chex tqˈmaˈn te kyjaluˈn : A naˈmxtaq toqˈ tman ekyˈ , ok kchin kˈwel tewiˈn oxe maj .

text: And Peter went out , and wept bitterly .
text2: Bˈeˈx etz tiˈn te Pegr tibˈ kyxol xjal , exsin ok tentz oqˈil wen .

text: And the men that held Jesus mocked him , and smote him .
text2: Ayetzin kyej xjal , a tzuntaq nchi xqˈuqin tiˈj Jesús , noqxtaq nchi jaw xmayin tiˈj , exsin n ‑ oktaq kybˈyoˈn .

text: And when they had blindfolded him , they struck him on the face , and asked him , saying , Prophesy , who is it that smote thee ?
text2: Ok kymaqsiˈn twutz Jesús , exsin xi kyqanin te kyjaluˈn : Kanintzin tiˈj . ¿ Ankye s ‑ ok bˈyoˈntiych ?

text: And many other things blasphemously spake they against him .
text2: Nimku txqantl yol te xmaybˈil i bˈaj ok ten qˈmalte te .

text: And as soon as it was day , the elders of the people and the chief priests and the scribes came together , and led him into their council , saying ,
text2: Atzaj teˈ qsqix , i ok kychmoˈn kye tnejil Judiy kyibˈ , junx kyukˈa kynejil pale , exqetziˈn jniˈ xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil , exsin xi kyiˈntz Jesús twutz . Atzaj teˈ kykanin , xitzin kyqanintz te kyjaluˈn :

text: Art thou the Christ ? tell us . And he said unto them , If I tell you , ye will not believe :
text2: Qˈmantza qeˈy , ¿ Aj qa ajiy Crist , a at toklin tuˈn Dios ? Chi Jesús kye kyjaluˈn tej t ‑ xi ttzaqˈwin : Qa ayiˈn , qa nchijiˈy , nlay chinx kynimiˈn .

text: And if I also ask you , ye will not answer me , nor let me go .
text2: Ex qatzin ma txi nqanintza jun nxjelbˈitza kyeˈy , nlay chin tzaj kytzaqˈwiˈn .

text: Hereafter shall the Son of man sit on the right hand of the power of God .
text2: Me texjo qˈij lo , toj tman qˈobˈ qMan Dios , a nimxix tipin ; ok kchin kˈwel qeyiˈy kawil tukˈa , a ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin .

text: Then said they all , Art thou then the Son of God ? And he said unto them , Ye say that I am .
text2: Tej kybˈinte ikyjo , kykyaqilx xi qaninte te kyjaluˈn : ¿ Apela tejitza kˈwalbˈaj te Dios ? Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús kye kyjaluˈn : Twutzx teˈ , ayinqin wejiˈy , ikyxjo tzeˈnku ma tzaj kyqˈmaˈn .

text: And they said , What need we any further witness ? for we ourselves have heard of his own mouth .
text2: Chi chiljo kyjaluˈn : ¿ Me tiˈ til txqantl tstiyiltz te qe ? A tojx ttzi ma chi bˈajetza jniˈ xoˈj yol tuˈn tiˈj Dios , a ma chi qbˈi , chi chiˈ .

text: And the whole multitude of them arose , and led him unto Pilate .
text2: I jaw weˈ kykyaqilx , exsin xi kyiˈn Jesús tzmax twutz Pilat .

text: And they began to accuse him , saying , We found this fellow perverting the nation , and forbidding to give tribute to Caesar , saying that he himself is Christ a King .
text2: Twutz Jesús i bˈaj ok ten stzˈimilte jniˈ yol tiˈj . Chi chiˈ kyjaluˈn : Ma tzˈel jyetjo ichin quˈn lo , a tokxix tilil tuˈn , tzeˈn tuˈn kyjawe naje qxjalila . Tok qˈmalte kyexjal , qa nya il tiˈj tuˈn t ‑ xi kychjoˈn kˈaybˈil teˈ nmaq kawil , ex tzunxix ntzaj tqˈmaˈn , qa aku a Crist , a skˈoˈnxix tuˈn Dios , ex qa nmaq kawil .

text: And Pilate asked him , saying , Art thou the King of the Jews ? And he answered him and said , Thou sayest it .
text2: Xitzin tqanin Pilat te Jesús kyjaluˈn : ¿ An tejiy nmaq kawil kye Judiy ? Ayiˈn , ikyxjo tzeˈnku ma tzaj tqˈmaˈn , chi Jesúsjo .

text: Then said Pilate to the chief priests and to the people , I find no fault in this man .
text2: Xitzin tqˈmaˈn Pilat kyeˈ kynejil pale , ex kyeˈ jniˈ xjal , a iteˈtaq antza . Chiˈ kyjaluˈn : Qa oˈkxjo lo , ntiˈ jun teˈ ichin til ma knettz wuˈn , chi Pilatjo .

text: And they were the more fierce , saying , He stirreth up the people , teaching throughout all Jewry , beginning from Galilee to this place .
text2: Me noqx jaw kyinx kyibˈ , tej kybˈin teˈ ikyjo , ex xi kyqˈmaˈn kyjaluˈn : Me noqx ma chi jaw najx kyexjal tojjo tnam lo kyuˈnjo jniˈ t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈil . Antza tzaje xkyeye tuˈn toj txˈotxˈ te Galiley , exsin luˈltz lajoˈn tuˈn tojjo txˈotxˈ lo te Judey .

text: When Pilate heard of Galilee , he asked whether the man were a Galilaean .
text2: Tej tbˈinte Pilatjo yol lo , xitzin tqanintz , qa aj Galileytaq Jesús .

text: And as soon as he knew that he belonged unto Herod ' s jurisdiction , he sent him to Herod , who himself also was at Jerusalem at that time .
text2: Atzaj teˈ t ‑ xi qˈmaˈn te qa te Galileytaq , bˈeˈxsin xi tsmaˈntz Jesús tzma twutz Herodes , a nmaq kawiltaq toj tnam te Galiley , quˈn kyojjo qˈij anetziˈn , ataqtza taˈye Herodes toj tnam te Jerusalén .

text: And when Herod saw Jesus , he was exceeding glad : for he was desirous to see him of a long season , because he had heard many things of him ; and he hoped to have seen some miracle done by him .
text2: Bˈeˈx jaw tzalaj te Herodes , tej tiwle Jesús tuˈn , quˈn ilaˈxi maj tajtaq tuˈn tlonte , quˈn tuˈn nimku tqanil otaq tbˈi tiˈj Jesús , ex tajtaq tuˈn tlonte jun techil tipin .

text: Then he questioned with him in many words ; but he answered him nothing .
text2: Nimx ok ten qanilte te , me atzin te Jesús ntiˈx chˈin teˈ xi ttzaqˈwin .

text: And the chief priests and scribes stood and vehemently accused him .
text2: Ex majqextaq kyeˈ jniˈ kynejil pale , exqetziˈn jniˈ xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawil iteˈtaq antza ; tzunx nchi labˈtextaq wen tuˈn t ‑ xi kypatin Jesús .

text: And Herod with his men of war set him at nought , and mocked him , and arrayed him in a gorgeous robe , and sent him again to Pilate .
text2: Tuˈn ikyjo , bˈeˈx ok xmayin te Jesús tuˈn Herodes , ex kyuˈn xoˈl qˈaqˈ , a iteˈtaq xqˈuqilte . Exsin ok qˈoˈn t ‑ xbˈalin , a tzunxtaq qopinx wen , nyakutlaj nmaq kawil . Kubˈ kybˈinchin ikyjo , noq te kyxmaybˈil tiˈj . Tbˈajlinxitziˈn ikyjo , bˈeˈx tzaj smaˈntl Jesús tuˈn Herodes twutzl Pilat .

text: And the same day Pilate and Herod were made friends together : for before they were at enmity between themselves .
text2: Texjo qˈij anetziˈn bˈeˈx ok tukˈlin Pilat tibˈ tukˈa Herodes , quˈn kyajqˈojtaq kyibˈ .

text: And Pilate , when he had called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people ,
text2: I ok tchmoˈn te Pilat jotqexjo jniˈ kynejil pale , jniˈqe kawil exsin tkyaqil xjal ,

text: Said unto them , Ye have brought this man unto me , as one that perverteth the people : and , behold , I , having examined him before you , have found no fault in this man touching those things whereof ye accuse him :
text2: exsin xi tqˈmaˈn kye kyjaluˈn : Ayiˈy ma chi ul qˈinte ichin lo nwutza , exsin nkyqˈmaˈn , qa ma jaw naj kyxjalila tuˈn . Me kywutza , ma bˈaj nqaniˈn te tiˈjjo ma bˈaj kyqˈmaˈn tiˈj , me ntiˈ jun wetza til ma tzˈel jyet wuˈn ,

text: No , nor yet Herod : for I sent you to him ; and , lo , nothing worthy of death is done unto him .
text2: ex ikyx te Herodesjo , ntiˈ tilx xjyet tuˈn . Quˈn tzeˈn ttentz saj tmeltzˈintl . Kan lo , ntiˈ tetz il ma bˈant tuˈn , a atit kyimin tiˈj .

text: I will therefore chastise him , and release him .
text2: Ok kˈwel nqˈmaˈn tuˈn tjubˈchit tetz , me bˈeˈx kxel ntzaqpiˈn , aj tbˈaj jubˈchit .

text: ( For of necessity he must release one unto them at the feast . )
text2: Toj nintz qˈij , iltaq tiˈj tuˈn t ‑ xi tzaqpet jun xjal , a tkuˈxtaq toj tze .

text: And they cried out all at once , saying , Away with this man , and release unto us Barabbas :
text2: Me kykyaqilx xjal i jaw ẍchˈin junx : ¡ Ntiˈpen teˈ ikyjo ! ¡ A te Barrabás tuˈn t ‑ xi tzaqpet !

text: ( Who for a certain sedition made in the city , and for murder , was cast into prison . )
text2: Atzin te Barrabás otaq kux qˈoˈn teˈ toj tze noq tuˈn tpaj tjoybˈin qˈoj tiˈj kawil , ex tuˈn otaq kubˈ tbˈyoˈn jun xjal .

text: Pilate therefore , willing to release Jesus , spake again to them .
text2: Xi yolinl juntl majl Pilat kye , quˈn tuˈn tajtaq tuˈn t ‑ xi ttzaqpiˈn Jesús .

text: But they cried , saying , Crucify him , crucify him .
text2: Me noqx jaw kyiˈn kyexjal tqˈajqˈojil kywiˈ : ¡ Pejkˈinksa twutz cruz tuˈn tkyim ! ¡ Pejkˈinksa twutz cruz tuˈn tkyim ! chi chiˈ .

text: And he said unto them the third time , Why , what evil hath he done ? I have found no cause of death in him : I will therefore chastise him , and let him go .
text2: Toj tox majin , xi tqˈmaˈn Pilat kye kyjaluˈn : Qalaˈ , ¿ Tiˈxixsin iltz ma bˈant tuˈn ? Ntiˈx wetza til ma jyet wuˈn , a atit kyimin tiˈj . Ok kˈwel jubˈchit tetz , me bˈeˈx kxel ntzaqpiˈn , aj tbˈaj jubˈchit .

text: And they were instant with loud voices , requiring that he might be crucified . And the voices of them and of the chief priests prevailed .
text2: Noq i bˈaj jaw tiljx kyexjal tuˈn kyẍchˈin . Nchi qanlaj tiˈj tuˈn tkubˈ bˈyoˈn Jesús twutz cruz . Nimx i ẍchˈin tzmaxi kubˈ qeˈn , tej ttzaj tziyiˈn a nkyqanintaq .

text: And Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they required .
text2: Xi ttziyinx te Pilatjo , a ntzaj qanin te :

text: And he released unto them him that for sedition and murder was cast into prison , whom they had desired ; but he delivered Jesus to their will .
text2: Jatztzin ttzaqpiˈn Pilatjo Barrabás , a ichin tkuˈxtaq toj tze noq tuˈn tpaj tbˈujbˈin ex tbˈiˈybˈin , ikyxjo tzeˈnku nkyqanintaqxjal , exsin kubˈ tbˈinchin tukˈa Jesús tzeˈnkuxjo nkyqanintaq .

text: And as they led him away , they laid hold upon one Simon , a Cyrenian , coming out of the country , and on him they laid the cross , that he might bear it after Jesus .
text2: Atzaj teˈ t ‑ xi qˈiˈn Jesús tuˈn tjaw pejkˈit twutz cruz , bˈeˈx ok kytzyuˈn jun ichin aj Sirene , Simun tbˈi , tzajnintaqjo ichin anetziˈn toj kojbˈil . Jaw kyqˈoˈn cruz tibˈaj , tuˈntzintla t ‑ xi tiqin , ex tuˈntla tok lipe tiˈj Jesús .

text: And there followed him a great company of people , and of women , which also bewailed and lamented him .
text2: Ma nintz texjal i ok lipe tiˈj Jesús , ex ma nintz teqya ox chi oqˈx , ex ox chi weqinx , tuˈn kybˈisbˈin tiˈj .

text: But Jesus turning unto them said , Daughters of Jerusalem , weep not for me , but weep for yourselves , and for your children .
text2: Xi kaˈyin Jesús kyiˈj , ex xi tqˈmaˈn kye kyjaluˈn : Ayiˈy qya te Jerusalén , mina chi oqˈ kyeˈ wiˈja , qalaˈ chi oqˈx kyeˈ kyiˈjxa , exsin kyiˈj kyala .

text: For , behold , the days are coming , in the which they shall say , Blessed are the barren , and the wombs that never bare , and the paps which never gave suck .
text2: Quˈn tzul kanin te tqˈijil , aj kyqˈumle yol lo : Kyˈiwlinqexix kyeˈ qya , a mibˈin chi alin , ayeˈ ntiˈ jun kyal s ‑ ok , ex ntiˈ jun kˈwal xmiˈẍin kyiˈj .

text: Then shall they begin to say to the mountains , Fall on us ; and to the hills , Cover us .
text2: Tzmaxipetzin kchi okil ten kye xjaljo ẍchˈilte kye wutz kyjaluˈn : Ayiˈy wuutz , kux kytzaj tilje qibˈaja ; ex iky kxel kyqˈmaˈnjo kyeˈ muchˈila wutz kyjaluˈn : Qo tewinx qe .

text: For if they do these things in a green tree , what shall be done in the dry ?
text2: Quˈn qa iky nbˈant kyuˈn xjal wiˈja jaˈlin , a ayiˈn ntiˈ wila , ¿ Yajtzil tetzjo kyiˈj xjal toj Jerusalén jniˈlixla kbˈantile kyuˈn ?

text: And there were also two other , malefactors , led with him to be put to death .
text2: I xi qˈiˈn kabˈetl aj il , tuˈntzintla kyjaw pejkˈin twutz cruz junx tukˈa Jesús .

text: And when they were come to the place , which is called Calvary , there they crucified him , and the malefactors , one on the right hand , and the other on the left .
text2: Atzaj teˈ kykanin twiˈ wutz Tbˈaqil Twiˈ Kyimnin tbˈi , jaw pejkˈin Jesús twutz cruz exqetziˈn kabˈe aj il , jun toj tman qˈobˈ , ex juntl toj tẍnayaj .

text: Then said Jesus , Father , forgive them ; for they know not what they do . And they parted his raiment , and cast lots .
text2: Naˈn Jesús Dios , tej tjaw qˈoˈn twutz cruz , ex chiˈ kyjaluˈn : Ay nMaan , najsima kyil , quˈn tuˈn mina n ‑ el kynikyˈ tiˈjjo nkubˈ kybˈinchin . Ayetzin kyej xjal a xoˈl qˈaqˈqetaq i bˈaj saqchan kyxol tzeˈn tuˈn tsipe teˈ t ‑ xbˈalin Jesús kyxolile .

text: And the people stood beholding . And the rulers also with them derided him , saying , He saved others ; let him save himself , if he be Christ , the chosen of God .
text2: Tzuntaq nchi kaˈyin kyexjal tiˈtaqjo nbˈaj ; ayetzin kyej kawilqetaq , noq nchi jaw xmayintaq kyeˈ tiˈj Jesús . Chi chiˈ kyjaluˈn : Qa ilaˈ xjal o klet tuˈn ; klomtzin tibˈtza tilx tibˈa jaˈlin , a qa twutzx , qa Kolila , a Crist , a skˈoˈnxix tuˈn Dios .

text: And the soldiers also mocked him , coming to him , and offering him vinegar ,
text2: Majqexpe kyeˈ xoˈl qˈaqˈ i ok ten xmayil tiˈj Jesús . Nchex laqˈetaq tkˈatz , exsin nxitaq kyqˈoˈn txˈam vin te tkˈwaˈ .

text: And saying , If thou be the king of the Jews , save thyself .
text2: Chi chiˈ kyjaluˈn : A qa axixtza nmaq kawil kyibˈaj xjal Judiy , klomtzin tibˈtza tilx tibˈa .

text: And a superscription also was written over him in letters of Greek , and Latin , and Hebrew , THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS .
text2: Ex attaq jun yol tzˈibˈink tibˈajxi twiˈ , a ikytaq ntqˈmaˈn kyjaluˈn : Ate Jesúsjo , a Nmaq Kawil kye aj Judiy .

text: And one of the malefactors which were hanged railed on him , saying , If thou be Christ , save thyself and us .
text2: Atzin teˈ jun bˈinchil il , a yoˈbˈinkstaq twutz cruz , tzuntaq nxmayintaq teˈ tiˈj Jesús kyjaluˈn : A qa axixjiy Crist , a Kolil , a skˈoˈnxix tuˈn Dios , klomtzin tibˈtza tilx tibˈa , ex majqoxpe qeˈ , qo tkloma .

text: But the other answering rebuked him , saying , Dost not thou fear God , seeing thou art in the same condemnation ?
text2: Tzajtzin ttzaqˈwin teˈ juntl aj il te tukˈa kyjaluˈn : ¿ Ma ntiˈxsin chˈin tchewil Dios ntzaj tiˈja ? ¿ Ma minatzin nkubˈ tnabˈlin , qa ikyx kawbˈiljo ma kubˈ qˈoˈn tey , tzeˈnkuˈ te xjal lo ?

text: And we indeed justly ; for we receive the due reward of our deeds : but this man hath done nothing amiss .
text2: Bˈape qetz , nqqaninku qe quˈn luqin qchjoˈn tiˈj tkyaqiljo nya bˈaˈn o bˈant quˈn . Qalatzin teˈ ichin lo ntiˈ teˈ il ma bˈant tuˈn .

text: And he said unto Jesus , Lord , remember me when thou comest into thy kingdom .
text2: Tzaj tqˈmaˈnljo xjal kabˈel tyol kyjaluˈn : Ay wAjaw , wexsin chin tzaj tnaˈn chˈin we , aj t ‑ xi xkyeˈ Tkawbˈila .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Verily I say unto thee , To day shalt thou be with me in paradise .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús kyjaluˈn : Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn tey , qa bˈeˈxku jaˈlin ok ktenbˈila wukˈiy toj kyaˈj .

text: And it was about the sixth hour , and there was a darkness over all the earth until the ninth hour .
text2: Teˈ tok kabˈlaj qˈij , ex tzmaxi toj oxe or te qale , bˈeˈx ok yupj twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: And the sun was darkened , and the veil of the temple was rent in the midst .
text2: Mix qopinil te qˈij , ex bˈeˈx kubˈ laqjjo ma tij xbˈalin toj nikyˈjin , a tokxtaq te paˈbˈl toj tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios .

text: And when Jesus had cried with a loud voice , he said , Father , into thy hands I commend my spirit : and having said thus , he gave up the ghost .
text2: Jaw tiˈnxix te Jesús tqˈajqˈojil twiˈ . Chiˈ kyjaluˈn : Ay Taa , toj tqˈobˈa kxel woqxenin weˈ wanim . Tej tbˈaj tqˈmaˈn tyol ikyjo , bˈeˈx el kyim .

text: Now when the centurion saw what was done , he glorified God , saying , Certainly this was a righteous man .
text2: Atzaj teˈ tlonte kawil kyxol xoˈl qˈaqˈ aj Rom tkyaqiljo otaq bˈaj , jaw tnimsin tbˈi Dios , ex chiˈ kyjaluˈn : Twutzxpentetz , ntiˈtaq teˈ ichin til lo .

text: And all the people that came together to that sight , beholding the things which were done , smote their breasts , and returned .
text2: Jotxjo jniˈ xjal iteˈtaq antza , a kyli jniˈ otaq bˈaj , ox tzˈok kyqˈajtzin ttzi kykˈuˈj te bˈisbˈajil , tej kyajtz .

text: And all his acquaintance , and the women that followed him from Galilee , stood afar off , beholding these things .
text2: Me ayetzin kye xjal , a ojtzqiˈntaq Jesús kyuˈn , exqetziˈn jniˈ qya , a i tzaj lipe tiˈj tzmax toj txˈotxˈ te Galiley , najchaq chˈintl i kyije tene kyeˈ kaˈyil tiˈjjo jniˈ nbˈajtaq antza .

text: And , behold , there was a man named Joseph , a counseller ; and he was a good man , and a just :
text2: Toj tnam te Arimatey te txˈotxˈ te Judey , attaq jun tbˈanil ichin , Jse tbˈi . Tzˈaqlexixtaqjo xjal anetziˈn , exsin toktaq te tajlaljo jun chˈuq kykawil aj Judiy . Tkyˈeˈtaq te Jse tiˈjjo nbˈanttaq kyuˈn jniˈ tukˈa , quˈn tuˈn tzuntaq nyon tiˈj Tkawbˈil Dios .

text: This man went unto Pilate , and begged the body of Jesus .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , xiˈ jyolte Pilat , exsin xi tqanintz t ‑ xmilil Jesús .

text: And he took it down , and wrapped it in linen , and laid it in a sepulchre that was hewn in stone , wherein never man before was laid .
text2: Atzaj teˈ tkuˈtz t ‑ xmilil Jesús twutz cruz , kux tbˈalqˈin toj jun iqbˈil tbˈanilx wen , exsin okx tqˈoˈntz toj jun tjulil kyimnin , a likuˈnkxtaq twutz piky , a ntiˈtaq kyimnin otaq tzˈokx toj .

text: And that day was the preparation , and the sabbath drew on .
text2: Tkyaqiljo lo kubˈ tbˈinchin Jse liwey , quˈn ntiˈtaql ambˈil , quˈn chˈixtaq tok qaq or te qale . Quˈn tojjo or anetziˈn , iltaq tiˈj tuˈn t ‑ xi tzaqpet aqˈuntl , tuˈn t ‑ xi xkyejo qˈij te ajlabˈl .

text: And the women also , which came with him from Galilee , followed after , and beheld the sepulchre , and how his body was laid .
text2: Ayetzin kyej qya , a otaq chi tzaj lipe tiˈj Jesús tzmax Galiley , i pon kanin tzmax ttzi jul , ex ok kykaˈyin tzeˈn oke t ‑ xmilil Jesús , tej tkyij muquˈn .

text: And they returned , and prepared spices and ointments ; and rested the sabbath day according to the commandment .
text2: Atzaj teˈ kypon kanin kyja , i ok ten bˈinchil teˈ jniˈ qˈanbˈil , a n ‑ ajbˈin te kˈokˈjsbˈil t ‑ xmilil jun kyimnin , exsin qˈanbˈil , a tuˈn tok suˈyit tiˈj , tuˈn mi tzuwixe . Me bˈeˈx i ajlantz tojjo qˈij te ajlabˈl , tzeˈnxjo nqˈumlajtz toj Tyol Dios .

text: Now upon the first day of the week , very early in the morning , they came unto the sepulchre , bringing the spices which they had prepared , and certain others with them .
text2: Toj tnejil qˈij te seman , qlixjexix wen , i ul kanin kyej qya ttzi jul . Tzaj kyiˈn jniˈ qˈanbˈil te kˈokˈjsbˈil , a otaq bˈaj kybˈinchin .

text: And they found the stone rolled away from the sepulchre .
text2: Atzaj teˈ kyul kanin , txulinx kywutz tiˈj , qa otaq txi yekˈj tej abˈj , a kyij qˈoˈn te jupbˈilte ttzi jul .

text: And they entered in , and found not the body of the Lord Jesus .
text2: I okx toj jul , me ntiˈ t ‑ xmilil qAjaw Jesús jyet kyuˈn .

text: And it came to pass , as they were much perplexed thereabout , behold , two men stood by them in shining garments :
text2: Bˈeˈx i jaw xobˈ , ex ntiˈ tumil jyet kyuˈn tiˈtaqjo tuˈn tkubˈ kybˈinchinl . Ex jun paqx , kyli kabˈe ichin , a waˈlqetaq kykˈatz , a tzunxtaq tilkˈajjo kyxbˈalin .

text: And as they were afraid , and bowed down their faces to the earth , they said unto them , Why seek ye the living among the dead ?
text2: Bˈeˈx tzaj txqan kyxobˈil , ex i kubˈ mukˈe tzmax twiˈ txˈotxˈ . Me ayetzin kyej ichin , a waˈlqetaq antza , iky tzaj kyqˈmaˈn kyjaluˈn : ¿ Titzin quˈn nchi jyoˈn kyxol kyimnin tiˈjjo a itzˈ ?

text: He is not here , but is risen : remember how he spake unto you when he was yet in Galilee ,
text2: Nyatza taˈye tzaluˈn , qalaˈ ma jaw anqˈin juntl majl . Kynaˈntzinjiˈy jniˈ yol xbˈaj tqˈmaˈn kyeˈy tiˈjjo lo , tej atxtaq toj txˈotxˈ te Galiley :

text: Saying , The Son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men , and be crucified , and the third day rise again .
text2: Qa iltaq tiˈj tuˈn t ‑ xi qˈoˈn Jesús , a Tkˈwal Ichin , toj kyqˈobˈ bˈinchil il , ex tuˈn tjaw pejkˈin twutz tcruz ; me toj toxin qˈij , iltaq tiˈj tuˈn tjatz anqˈin juntl majl .

text: And they remembered his words ,
text2: Bˈeˈxpetziˈn , i ul julkˈajjo tyol Jesús toj kykˈuˈj .

text: And returned from the sepulchre , and told all these things unto the eleven , and to all the rest .
text2: Ex atzaj teˈ kyaj meltzˈaj ttzi jul , bˈeˈx i ok ten qˈmalte jniˈxjo otaq kybˈi , exsin otaq kyli kyeˈ junlajaj t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin Jesús , ex kye kykyaqil xjal .

text: It was Mary Magdalene , and Joanna , and Mary the mother of James , and other women that were with them , which told these things unto the apostles .
text2: Ate Mariy , aj Xleˈn ; Juana ; Mariy , a tnana Santyaw ; exqetzintljo txqantl qya , ayetzin i xi qˈinte tqaniljo kyeˈ t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin Jesús .

text: And their words seemed to them as idle tales , and they believed them not .
text2: Me kykyˈeˈtaq kye t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin tuˈn t ‑ xi kynimin , quˈn toj kynabˈl nyakuj noq toj kywiˈtaqjo qya otaq tzˈokx .

text: Then arose Peter , and ran unto the sepulchre ; and stooping down , he beheld the linen clothes laid by themselves , and departed , wondering in himself at that which was come to pass .
text2: Me atzin te Pegr , bˈeˈxkux tzaj rinin teˈ , tuˈn tul kanin tzma ttzi jul . Atziˈn teˈ tokx tkaˈyin , oˈkqexjo iqbˈil iteˈkutaq . Bˈeˈxsin aj meltzˈajtz tja , ex noqx jaw kaˈylaj tiˈj tkyaqilj lo .

text: And , behold , two of them went that same day to a village called Emmaus , which was from Jerusalem about threescore furlongs .
text2: Tojxjo qˈij anetziˈn , iteˈtaq kabˈe nimil tiˈj Jesús kyjaˈtaq kyxiˈ toj jun tnam , Emaús tbˈi , bˈalaqa chˈime oxe ajlabˈtaq taˈye tkˈatz tnam te Jerusalén .

text: And they talked together of all these things which had happened .
text2: Tzuntaq nchi yolin tiˈj tkyaqiljo otaq bˈaj .

text: And it came to pass , that , while they communed together and reasoned , Jesus himself drew near , and went with them .
text2: Toktaq kyyol , ex tzuntaq nchi chˈotj kyxolx , atzin te Jesús chebˈe ok laqˈe teˈ kykˈatz , ex xi lipe kytxlaj .

text: But their eyes were holden that they should not know him .
text2: Me exla qa iwle Jesús kyuˈn , me atla jun tiˈ , a mix taqˈe tuˈn tel kynikyˈ te , alkyetaqjo nbˈettaq kytxlaj .

text: And he said unto them , What manner of communications are these that ye have one to another , as ye walk , and are sad ?
text2: Xitzin tqanin Jesús kye : ¿ Tiˈtzin kyeˈ nkubˈ kyyolin toj bˈe ? ¿ Ex tiˈtzin quˈnil nchi bˈisin kyeˈ ?

text: And the one of them , whose name was Cleopas , answering said unto him , Art thou only a stranger in Jerusalem , and hast not known the things which are come to pass therein these days ?
text2: Tzajtzin ttzaqˈwin teˈ jun , a Cleofas tbˈi : Bˈalaqa oˈkx chˈin te kyxoljo bˈetin xjal toj tnam te Jerusalén , a nya bˈiˈn tuˈn tiˈchaqjo ma bˈaj tojjo tnam anetziˈn .

text: And he said unto them , What things ? And they said unto him , Concerning Jesus of Nazareth , which was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people :
text2: Xitzin tqanin Jesús : ¿ Tiˈchaqtzin ma bˈajtz ? Chi chiˈ kyjaluˈn : At jun te ma bˈaj tiˈj jun aj Nazaret , a Jesús tbˈi . Nimxtaq tipin tbˈinchbˈin exqetziˈn jniˈ tyol twutz Dios ex twutz tkyaqil xjal .

text: And how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him to be condemned to death , and have crucified him .
text2: Me aye kynejil pale exqetziˈn jniˈ kawil ẍi qˈmante tuˈn tjaw pejkˈit twutz cruz , exsin tuˈn tkubˈ bˈyettz .

text: But we trusted that it had been he which should have redeemed Israel : and beside all this , to day is the third day since these things were done .
text2: Qˈuqlexixtaq qeˈ qkˈuˈj , qapetzin ataq tetz , tuˈn tkolin kyiˈjjo aj Israel . Me ma bˈant ‑ xi oxe qˈij teˈ lo tbˈajlin , exsin ntiˈltz ma qliˈy .

text: Yea , and certain women also of our company made us astonished , which were early at the sepulchre ;
text2: Ex mape qo jaw xobˈ qe jaˈlin kyuˈn junjun qya , a iteˈ qukˈiy . Chi txaˈj qlixjexix ttzi jul , a jaˈ okxi muqet .

text: And when they found not his body , they came , saying , that they had also seen a vision of angels , which said that he was alive .
text2: Ex bˈeˈx ẍi ajtz meltzˈaj , quˈn tuˈn ntiˈ t ‑ xmilil xknet kyuˈn . Me atzin jaˈlin , tzun nchi yolin tiˈj , qa ma chi iwle kabˈe t ‑ angel Dios kyuˈn , ex ma tzaj qˈmaˈn kye , qa itzˈ te Jesús .

text: And certain of them which were with us went to the sepulchre , and found it even so as the women had said : but him they saw not .
text2: Ex iteˈ junjuntl qeˈ qukˈa , a chi txaˈj ttzi jul anetziˈn , ex ikyx s ‑ iwle kyuˈn , tzeˈnku otaq bˈaj qˈmaˈn kye kyuˈn qya . Ex ikyxjo mina s ‑ iwle Jesús kyuˈn .

text: Then he said unto them , O fools , and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken :
text2: Chitzin Jesús kye kyjaluˈn : Ntiˈxla kyeˈ kynabˈl , ex yajx nxi kyniminjiˈy tkyaqiljo , a xbˈaj kyqˈmaˈn yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe .

text: Ought not Christ to have suffered these things , and to enter into his glory ?
text2: ¿ Ma nyatzin iltaq tiˈj tuˈn tikyˈx tuˈn Kolil , a Crist nej , a naˈmxtaq tjaw nimsin ?

text: And beginning at Moses and all the prophets , he expounded unto them in all the scriptures the things concerning himself .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , oktzin ten Jesús chikyˈbˈilte kye jotxjo jniˈ ntqˈmaˈn toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios , ayeˈ jniˈ yol , a nchi yolin tiˈjjo tchwinqil ; tzajx xkye tuˈn kyojjo tuˈj Moisés , exsin toj kyuˈjjo jniˈ txqantl yolil Tyol Dios .

text: And they drew nigh unto the village , whither they went : and he made as though he would have gone further .
text2: Atzaj teˈ kykanin tojjo tnam , a jaˈ tuˈntaq kyxiˈye , majx tqanku xiˈl te Jesús , nyakutzintlaj najchaq chˈintl tuˈn tpone .

text: But they constrained him , saying , Abide with us : for it is toward evening , and the day is far spent . And he went in to tarry with them .
text2: Me ayetzin kyej xjal , ox chi labˈtex tuˈn tkyij Jesús kyukˈa . Chi chiˈ kyjaluˈn : Ku tkyija qukˈiy , quˈn tuˈn ma qoqix jaˈlin ; noq kyja qok yupjte . Bˈeˈxsin okx Jesús tuja , tuˈn tkyij kyukˈa .

text: And it came to pass , as he sat at meat with them , he took bread , and blessed it , and brake , and gave to them .
text2: Tetziˈn kyok qetz tiˈj meẍ , jawtzin ttzyuˈn Jesús jun wabˈj , exsin xi tqˈoˈn chjonte te Dios tiˈj . Bˈeˈx kubˈ tpiẍin , exsin xi tqˈoˈntz kye .

text: And their eyes were opened , and they knew him ; and he vanished out of their sight .
text2: Tzmaxipetzin jqet kywutzjo tuˈn tel kynikyˈ tiˈj Jesús , me texjo paq anetziˈn , bˈeˈx kubˈ naj te Jesús kywutz .

text: And they said one to another , Did not our heart burn within us , while he talked with us by the way , and while he opened to us the scriptures ?
text2: Ex i jaw yolin kyxolx : ¿ Ma nyatzin twutzx , qa ma qnaˈ jun nim tzaljbˈil toj bˈe , tej s ‑ ok ten chikyˈbˈil teˈ t ‑ xilin yol , a nyolajtz tiˈj toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios ?

text: And they rose up the same hour , and returned to Jerusalem , and found the eleven gathered together , and them that were with them ,
text2: Ntiˈ chˈin kubˈ kyayoˈn . Bˈeˈxkux kubˈ bˈe kyuˈn , tuˈn kymeltzˈajl toj Jerusalén . Ex antza chˈuqleqetaqjo junlajaj t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin Jesús , junx kyukˈa txqantl kyukˈa .

text: Saying , The Lord is risen indeed , and hath appeared to Simon .
text2: Xi kyqˈmaˈn kye kyjaluˈn : Twutzxix tetz qa ma jatz anqˈin juntl majl te qAjaw , ex qa ma tzˈok tyekˈin tibˈ te Simun .

text: And they told what things were done in the way , and how he was known of them in breaking of bread .
text2: Kykaˈbˈiltzintz i ok ten txolbˈilte tiˈjtaqjo otaq tzikyˈ kyiˈj toj bˈe , ex kyqˈma tzeˈn tten el kynikyˈ te Jesús , tzmaxiˈ teˈ tkubˈ tpiẍinj wabˈj .

text: And as they thus spake , Jesus himself stood in the midst of them , and saith unto them , Peace be unto you .
text2: Tzunxtaq nchi yolin tiˈjjo otaq tzikyˈ kyiˈj , tej tkubˈ weˈ Jesús kyxol , exsin qˈolbˈin kye . Chiˈ kyjaluˈn : Qexit kykˈuˈja , ex tzalajxit kyanmiˈn , chiˈ .

text: But they were terrified and affrighted , and supposed that they had seen a spirit .
text2: Me ayetzin kyetz nimx kyxobˈil tzaj , quˈn kubˈ kybˈisin qa noq jun klelin otaq kyli .

text: And he said unto them , Why are ye troubled ? and why do thoughts arise in your hearts ?
text2: Me atzin te Jesús iky xi tqˈmaˈn kye kyjaluˈn : ¿ Titzin quˈn ma chi jaw xobˈa ? ¿ Ex tiˈtzin quˈn ma jaw kaˈmin kyanmiˈn ?

text: Behold my hands and my feet , that it is I myself : handle me , and see ; for a spirit hath not flesh and bones , as ye see me have .
text2: Kykaˈyintziˈn nqˈobˈa ex kykaˈyinkuy nqaˈn . Ayinqinx wejiˈy . Chin kytzyuˈnka ex chin kykaˈyinka , quˈn jun klelin ntiˈ teˈ tchibˈjil ex tbˈaqil , tzeˈnku ma kyliˈy wiˈja .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he shewed them his hands and his feet .
text2: Tej tbˈaj tqˈmaˈn ikyjo , bˈeˈxsin i xi tyekˈintzjo tqˈobˈ exqetziˈn tqan .

text: And while they yet believed not for joy , and wondered , he said unto them , Have ye here any meat ?
text2: Nimx i jaw kaˈylaj , ex nimx tzeˈjbˈil kynaˈ . Tuˈn ikyjo , mix jaˈ nxi kynimine tkyaqil , qa ataq Jesúsjo . Tuˈnpetziˈn , chi Jesúsjo kye kyjaluˈn : ¿ Ntiˈtzin chˈin wabˈj kyukˈiy tzaluˈn te nwaˈy ?

text: And they gave him a piece of a broiled fish , and of an honeycomb .
text2: Xitzin qˈoˈn chˈin kyiẍ te , a tzqˈajsin toj qˈaqˈ ,

text: And he took it , and did eat before them .
text2: ex xi ttzyuˈn , exsin xi tchyoˈntz kywutz .

text: And he said unto them , These are the words which I spake unto you , while I was yet with you , that all things must be fulfilled , which were written in the law of Moses , and in the prophets , and in the psalms , concerning me .
text2: Xitzin tqˈmaˈnl kyjaluˈn : Atziˈn ma tzikyˈ toj nchwinqila jaˈlin , atzaj bˈaj nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy tej intintaqxa kyukˈiy : Qa iltaq tiˈj tuˈn tbˈajjo jniˈ tzˈibˈin wiˈja toj tkawbˈil Moisés , kyoj kyuˈj yolil Tyol Dios , ex kyojjo jniˈ Uˈj te Bˈitz .

text: Then opened he their understanding , that they might understand the scriptures ,
text2: Kubˈsin tyolin Jesúsjo lo , tuˈntzintla tel kynikyˈjo t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin tiˈjjo jniˈ tzˈibˈin toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios

text: And said unto them , Thus it is written , and thus it behoved Christ to suffer , and to rise from the dead the third day :
text2: Chiˈ kyjaluˈn : Tzˈibˈin taˈ teˈ , qa iltaq tiˈj tuˈn nkyima , ayiˈn Crist , me toj toxin qˈij , iltaq tiˈj tuˈn njatz anqˈiˈn juntl majl kyxol kyimnin .

text: And that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name among all nations , beginning at Jerusalem .
text2: Ex qa toj tumil nbˈiˈy , il tiˈj tuˈn t ‑ xi yolit kyeˈ jniˈ xjal , a iteˈ toj tkyaqil twutz txˈotxˈ , qa il tiˈj tuˈn tajtz tiˈj kyanminxjal tukˈa Dios , tuˈntzintla tkubˈ nnajsiˈn jniˈ kyil . Antza tuˈn ttzaj xkye tqˈumle yol lo toj txˈotxˈ te Jerusalén .

text: And ye are witnesses of these things .
text2: Aye kyeˈ aku chi ok te kujsil teˈ tkyaqiljo lo .

text: And , behold , I send the promise of my Father upon you : but tarry ye in the city of Jerusalem , until ye be endued with power from on high .
text2: Ayinku weˈ aku chin tzaj smaˈn teˈ a saj tziyin kyeˈy tuˈn nMaˈn . Me il tiˈj , tuˈn kykyija tzaluˈn tojjo tnam te Jerusalén , ex tzmaxi aku chi exjiˈy , aj kykˈmoˈntejiˈy tipin , a ktzajil toj kyaˈj .

text: And he led them out as far as to Bethany , and he lifted up his hands , and blessed them .
text2: Tbˈajlinxitziˈn lo , i tzaj tkleˈn Jesús najchaq chˈintl tkˈatz tnam , tzmax toj Betania . I jawtzin tiˈn Jesús tqˈobˈ twutz kyaˈj , exsin i kubˈ tkyˈiwliˈntz .

text: And it came to pass , while he blessed them , he was parted from them , and carried up into heaven .
text2: Ex tzmataq nkyˈiwlin , bˈeˈxsin el tpaˈn tibˈtz kyiˈj , ex texjo paq anetziˈn , bˈeˈx xi qˈiˈn toj kyaˈj .

text: And they worshipped him , and returned to Jerusalem with great joy :
text2: Tej kybˈaj kˈulin twutz , bˈeˈxsin i meltzˈajtz toj tnam te Jerusalén , me ox chi tzalajx wen .

text: And were continually in the temple , praising and blessing God . Amen .
text2: Axsintza , i kubˈe tene tkyaqil qˈij toj tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , ex nimx i qˈoˈn chjonte te .

text: In the beginning was the Word , and the Word was with God , and the Word was God .
text2: Te tnejil , teˈ naˈmxtaq tkubˈ bˈinchit tkyaqil , noql attaqjo Tkˈwal Dios , ax tbˈi , a Yol . Atziˈn Yol lo junx ate tukˈa Dios , ex ax Diosjo .

text: The same was in the beginning with God .
text2: Atzin Yol lo at junx tukˈa Dios te tnejil .

text: All things were made by him ; and without him was not any thing made that was made .
text2: Noq tuˈn teˈ Yol bˈante tuˈn Dios tkyaqil . Noqit nya Yol bˈinchin teˈ tkyaqil , ntiˈtla te at .

text: In him was life ; and the life was the light of men .
text2: Tuˈn teˈ Yol at tkyaqil chwinqil , ex atziˈn chwinqil n ‑ el spikyˈe te jun yekˈbˈil tiˈj Dios toj kynabˈlxjal .

text: And the light shineth in darkness ; and the darkness comprehended it not .
text2: Ex tzunx nqoptzˈajxjo spikyˈin toj kyanminxjal , a o noj tuˈn qxopin tuˈn il , me atzin qxopin nlay yupjxjo spikyˈin tuˈn .

text: There was a man sent from God , whose name was John .
text2: At jun ichin tzaj chqˈoˈn tuˈn Dios , atzin tbˈi Juan .

text: The same came for a witness , to bear witness of the Light , that all men through him might believe .
text2: Atziˈn ichin ul qˈmal tqanil Jesús , ex nkubˈ tyolin kywutzxjal qa ax Jesúsjo a spikyˈin , ex qa il tiˈj tuˈn kyxi lipe tiˈj .

text: He was not that Light , but was sent to bear witness of that Light .
text2: Nya ate Juan spikyˈin , noq ul chikyˈbˈil teˈ tqanil .

text: That was the true Light , which lighteth every man that cometh into the world .
text2: Ataqtziˈn spikyˈin lo a twutzxix , a chˈix tkubˈ tyekˈin tibˈ tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , qˈol teˈ tspikyˈimil Dios kye kykyaqil xjal .

text: He was in the world , and the world was made by him , and the world knew him not .
text2: Ataqtziˈn Yol atx teˈ ojtxe , quˈn a kubˈ bˈinchin teˈ tkyaqil twutz txˈotxˈ . Me mix ele kynikyˈxjal te .

text: He came unto his own , and his own received him not .
text2: Atzin tAjaw tkyaqiljo twutz txˈotxˈ , quˈn a Bˈinchilte . Me atzaj teˈ tul , mix kubˈe nimin kyuˈn t ‑ xjalil , aye aj Judiy .

text: But as many as received him , to them gave he power to become the sons of God , even to them that believe on his name :
text2: Me ayetzinl kyeˈ , a i xi niminte , bˈeˈx ok tqˈoˈnku kyoklin te tkˈwal Dios .

text: Which were born , not of blood , nor of the will of the flesh , nor of the will of man , but of God .
text2: Quˈn bˈeˈx i itzˈje juntl majl tuˈn Dios , ex nya kyuˈn xjal mo noq tuˈn t ‑ xim jun ichin .

text: And the Word was made flesh , and dwelt among us , ( and we beheld his glory , the glory as of the only begotten of the Father , ) full of grace and truth .
text2: Atziˈn Yol ok te xjal , najan qxol , ex awoqoxixa o lonte nim t ‑ xilin toklin ; a toklin akuxixjo Tkˈwal qMan Dios , nimxix t ‑ xtalbˈil ex twutzxtaqjo Tyol .

text: John bare witness of him , and cried , saying , This was he of whom I spake , He that cometh after me is preferred before me : for he was before me .
text2: Kubˈ tyolin Juan , a Jawsil Aˈ , tiˈj Jesús kywutz xjal , ex iky tqˈmaˈ kyjaluˈn : Ayetziˈn , a tzuntaq chi bˈiˈn wiˈja , tej tbˈaj nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy : Aj lipchetz wiˈja , nimx teˈ toklin nwutza , quˈn noql at teˈ , tej naˈmtaq wul itzˈjiˈy , nchijiˈy kyeˈy .

text: And of his fulness have all we received , and grace for grace .
text2: Quˈn tuˈn qkyaqilx ma qo kˈmonte nimx tkyˈiwbˈil qAjaw , noq tuˈn nim t ‑ xtalbˈil qiˈj .

text: For the law was given by Moses , but grace and truth came by Jesus Christ .
text2: Atziˈn ojtxe tkawbˈil Dios , a ul qˈoˈn te Moisés , a nlay bˈant tuˈn tjapin quˈn . Me atzin jaˈlin , ma tzaj tqˈoˈn Jesucrist Tqanil twutzxix tiˈj jun najsbˈil qil ex tiˈj jniˈ t ‑ xtalbˈil qMan .

text: No man hath seen God at any time ; the only begotten Son , which is in the bosom of the Father , he hath declared him .
text2: Mix aˈlx o tli jun maj twutz Dios , me ma tzaj tchqˈoˈn Tkˈwal , tuˈn tyekˈin te qe , tzeˈn t ‑ xilin tten , quˈn ax Diosjo .

text: And this is the record of John , when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him , Who art thou ?
text2: Ayetaqtziˈn xjal Judiy iteˈ toj tnam Jerusalén , i tzaj kychqˈoˈn junjun pale ex junjun aj Leví , xjelilte ankyetaqjo Juan .

text: And he confessed , and denied not ; but confessed , I am not the Christ .
text2: I xitzin ttzaqˈwin ; ntiˈx kubˈ tewin , ex twutzxix xi tqˈmaˈn : Nyaqin wejiˈy a Crist , a at toklin tuˈn Dios .

text: And they asked him , What then ? Art thou Elias ? And he saith , I am not . Art thou that prophet ? And he answered , No .
text2: Nxiku kyqanin juntl majl te : ¿ Tzeˈntzin ttentz ? ¿ Me qa atejiy Elías ? I xi ttzaqˈwin Juan . Nyaqin wejiˈy . ¿ Me qa atejiy Tsan Dios , a attaq tulil ? Ex xi tqˈmaˈnl Juan : Mina .

text: Then said they unto him , Who art thou ? that we may give an answer to them that sent us . What sayest thou of thyself ?
text2: Xitzin kyqaniltz te : ¿ Me ankye tetza ? Qˈmantza qeˈy , tuˈntzin t ‑ xi qiˈn tqanil kyeˈ a saj chqˈoˈn qeˈy . ¿ Ankye tetza toj twutza ?

text: He said , I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness , Make straight the way of the Lord , as said the prophet Esaias .
text2: I xitzin ttzaqˈwin Juan : Ayin wejiˈy tqˈajqˈojil wibˈaj , a kyij ttzˈibˈin Isaías , a yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe , tej tqˈma : Ex bˈijte tqˈajqˈojil twiˈ jun aˈla kujxix wen tojjo tzqij txˈotxˈ , jaˈ ntiˈye kynajbˈilxjal toj , a chiˈ kyjaluˈn : Kybˈinchim kyteˈn twutz qAjaw , quˈn chˈix tul tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: And they which were sent were of the Pharisees .
text2: Ex ayetziˈn i xi chqˈoˈn kyuˈn Parisey tuˈn kyyolin tukˈa Juan xi kyqanin te :

text: And they asked him , and said unto him , Why baptizest thou then , if thou be not that Christ , nor Elias , neither that prophet ?
text2: Qa nya tejiy Crist mo Elías mo jun yolil Tyol Dios , ¿ Ankye saj qˈonte tokliˈn tuˈn kykux tqˈoˈnxjal toj aˈ , te jawsbˈil aˈ ?

text: John answered them , saying , I baptize with water : but there standeth one among you , whom ye know not ;
text2: I xi ttzaqˈwin Juan : Ma chi kuˈxxjal toj aˈ wuˈn , te jawsbˈil aˈ , me at juntl kyxola , a mi ojtzqiˈn kyuˈn ,

text: He it is , who coming after me is preferred before me , whose shoe ' s latchet I am not worthy to unloose .
text2: a lipchetz wiˈja , a nimxix toklin . Ntiˈ wokliˈn nixpe tuˈn woka te taqˈnil .

text: These things were done in Bethabara beyond Jordan , where John was baptizing .
text2: Tkyaqiljo ikyjo ; bˈaj tojjo txˈotxˈ Betania , a at tjlajxiˈ Nim Aˈ Jordán , jaˈ nchi kuxe tqˈoˈn Juan xjal toj aˈ te jawsbˈil aˈ .

text: The next day John seeth Jesus coming unto him , and saith , Behold the Lamb of God , which taketh away the sin of the world .
text2: Toj junxil qˈij , xi tkaˈyin Juan Jesús kyjataq ttzaj laqˈe tkˈatz , ex xi tqˈmaˈn Juan kyexjal : Kykaˈyinxa . Kyja tzaj laqˈeˈ tal Tal Trit Dios , a k ‑ elil qˈinte kyilxjal toj tkyaqil twutz txˈotxˈ , tzeˈnqeku tal tal rit , a kubˈ kybˈyoˈnxjal , atxix ojtxe te chojbˈil kyil .

text: This is he of whom I said , After me cometh a man which is preferred before me : for he was before me .
text2: Quˈn atzin o txi nqˈmaˈnjiˈy kyeˈy , qa at juntl , a iltaq tiˈj tuˈn tul , ex qa attaql teˈ nim toklin nwutza , quˈn noql at teˈ , tej naˈmtaq wul itzˈjiˈy , nchijiˈy kyeˈy .

text: And I knew him not : but that he should be made manifest to Israel , therefore am I come baptizing with water .
text2: Ex nya wojtzqiˈnl weˈ twutz , me nchi kux nqˈoˈn xjal toj aˈ te jawsbˈil aˈ , tuˈntzin tel kynikyˈ aj Israel te , tzeˈnku tzaluˈn :

text: And John bare record , saying , I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove , and it abode upon him .
text2: Quˈn nliˈy Xewbˈaj Xjan , tej tkuˈtz toj kyaˈj tzeˈnku jun palom , ex kubˈ weˈ tibˈaj Jesús .

text: And I knew him not : but he that sent me to baptize with water , the same said unto me , Upon whom thou shalt see the Spirit descending , and remaining on him , the same is he which baptizeth with the Holy Ghost .
text2: Naˈmx tel nnikyˈa te ankye te Crist , me akux Dios , a tzaj chqˈoˈn we , tuˈn kykuˈxxjal toj aˈ , te jawsbˈil aˈ , o tzaj tqˈmaˈn wey nej : Qa ma tlijiy Xewbˈaj Xjan tuˈn tkuˈtz , ex tuˈn tkubˈ ten tibˈaj jun xjal , axixsinte xjaljo at toklin tuˈn tkux qˈoˈnte Xewbˈaj Xjan toj kyanminxjal te jun majx .

text: And I saw , and bare record that this is the Son of God .
text2: Ma nliˈy , ex ayinkuxixa ẍin lonte qa a Jesúsjo Tkˈwal Dios .

text: Again the next day after John stood , and two of his disciples ;
text2: Toj junxil qˈij , attaq Juan kyukˈa kabˈe t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin .

text: And looking upon Jesus as he walked , he saith , Behold the Lamb of God !
text2: Tej t ‑ xi kykaˈyin nbˈet Jesús , xi tqˈmaˈn Juan kye : Kykaˈyinxa atzin ichin chiˈ , atzin tal Tal Trit Diosjo .

text: And the two disciples heard him speak , and they followed Jesus .
text2: Tej kybˈinte t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin Juan yol ikyjo , bˈeˈx i xi lipe tiˈj Jesús .

text: Then Jesus turned , and saw them following , and saith unto them , What seek ye ? They said unto him , Rabbi , ( which is to say , being interpreted , Master , ) where dwellest thou ?
text2: Ajtz meltzˈaj Jesús kaˈyil tiˈjxi , xi tkaˈyin lipcheqe tiˈj , ex xi tqanin kye : ¿ Tiˈtzin nkyjyoˈnch ? Jun paqx xi kytzaqˈwin : Ay Xnaqˈtzil . ¿ Jaˈtzin taˈ te tja ?

text: He saith unto them , Come and see . They came and saw where he dwelt , and abode with him that day : for it was about the tenth hour .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye : Ku kytzaja loltech . Ex bˈeˈx i xi lipe kaˈyilte jaˈ najle Jesús . Ex tej kykanin , bˈeˈx i kyij ten tukˈa tzmaxi tex qˈij , quˈn otaq qoqix kye ; quˈn otaq tzˈok kyaje or te qale .

text: One of the two which heard John speak , and followed him , was Andrew , Simon Peter ' s brother .
text2: Kyxoljo kabˈe ichin anetziˈn , a Andrésjo jun , a titzˈin Simun .

text: He first findeth his own brother Simon , and saith unto him , We have found the Messias , which is , being interpreted , the Christ .
text2: Jun paqx , xiˈ Andrés jyolte Simun . Tetziˈn tknet tuˈn , xi tqˈmaˈn te : Ma jyet Crist quˈn , a skˈoˈnxix tuˈn Dios .

text: And he brought him to Jesus . And when Jesus beheld him , he said , Thou art Simon the son of Jona : thou shalt be called Cephas , which is by interpretation , A stone .
text2: Bˈeˈxsin xi kˈleˈn Simun tuˈn Andrés tkˈatz Jesús . Tetziˈn tok kaˈyin teˈ tuˈn Jesús , xi tqˈmaˈn te : Simun , ay tkˈwal Jonás . Me atzin jaˈlin k ‑ okil nqˈoˈn juntl tbˈiy , a Cefas , a ntqˈmaˈ , abˈj toj qyol , mo Pegr .

text: The day following Jesus would go forth into Galilee , and findeth Philip , and saith unto him , Follow me .
text2: Toj junxil qˈij , kubˈ t ‑ ximin Jesús tuˈn t ‑ xiˈ toj txˈotxˈ te Galiley . Antza oke tkˈulbˈin Lip , ex xi tqˈmaˈn te : Lipeka wiˈjach .

text: Now Philip was of Bethsaida , the city of Andrew and Peter .
text2: Antza najle te Lip toj Betsaida , axjo ttanim Andrés tukˈa Pegr .

text: Philip findeth Nathanael , and saith unto him , We have found him , of whom Moses in the law , and the prophets , did write , Jesus of Nazareth , the son of Joseph .
text2: Ex xiˈ te Lip jyol Natanael . Tej tel jyet tuˈn , xi tqˈmaˈn te : O jyet qeˈ Crist quˈn , aj tzeˈnku kyij ttzˈibˈin Moisés exqetziˈn jniˈ yolil Tyol Dios toj Tuˈjil Tyol : Jesús aj Nazaret tbˈi , a tkˈwal Jse .

text: And Nathanael said unto him , Can there any good thing come out of Nazareth ? Philip saith unto him , Come and see .
text2: Bˈeˈx xi tqˈmaˈn Natanael te Lip : ¿ Ma akupela tzˈetz jun nmaq xjal tojjo muchˈ tnam Nazaret ? Ex xi ttzaqˈwin Lip : Ku tzaja wukˈiy ; k ‑ elil tnikyˈa te .

text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him , and saith of him , Behold an Israelite indeed , in whom is no guile !
text2: Tej t ‑ xi tkaˈyin Jesús chˈixtaq tpon Natanael tkˈatz , ex ok tqˈmaˈn tiˈj : Lu jun xjal lo , jun aj Israel tukˈa tkyaqil tanmin , mina njawje tkˈuˈj .

text: Nathanael saith unto him , Whence knowest thou me ? Jesus answered and said unto him , Before that Philip called thee , when thou wast under the fig tree , I saw thee .
text2: Tej tbˈinte Natanael ikyjo , xi tqanin te Jesús kyjaluˈn : ¿ Tzeˈntzin tten el tnikyˈa wiˈja ? Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús te : Quˈn ma nliˈy tokxtaqa t ‑ xe tqan iw , tej naˈmtaq tok kˈulbˈin tuˈn Lip .

text: Nathanael answered and saith unto him , Rabbi , thou art the Son of God ; thou art the King of Israel .
text2: Xitzin ttzaqˈwin Natanael te Jesús : Ay Xnaqˈtzil , Tkˈwal Dios te , ex Nmaq Kawil kye aj Israel .

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , Because I said unto thee , I saw thee under the fig tree , believest thou ? thou shalt see greater things than these .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : ¿ Ma man txi tnimiˈn noq tuˈn t ‑ xi nqˈmaˈn tey , qa o tzˈiwliy wuˈn t ‑ xe tqan iw ? Me tzaluˈn ok tlaˈbˈila txqantl tiˈ , a nimixixtl tzeˈnku lo .

text: And he saith unto him , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Hereafter ye shall see heaven open , and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of man .
text2: Me twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn tey : Tkyaqil t ‑ xilin kyaˈj ktzajil nyekˈin teˈy , nyakuj aye t ‑ angel Dios nchi jax ex nchi kuˈtz nkˈatza , ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , noq tuˈn tkujsit nyola .

text: And the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee ; and the mother of Jesus was there :
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ oxe qˈij , bˈaj jun mejebˈlin toj tnam Caná , toj ttxˈotxˈ Galiley , ex antza taˈyetaqjo tnana Jesús .

text: And both Jesus was called , and his disciples , to the marriage .
text2: Ex ikyx te Jesúsjo kyukˈa t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin i tzaj txkoˈn toj mejebˈlin .

text: And when they wanted wine , the mother of Jesus saith unto him , They have no wine .
text2: Ex tej tel bˈajjo vin , xitzin tqˈmaˈn tnana Jesús te : Ma tzˈel bˈaj tej vinch .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Woman , what have I to do with thee ? mine hour is not yet come .
text2: Me xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Ay qya , ¿ Tiˈ qaj tiˈjjo lo ? Quˈn naˈmx tpoˈn ambˈil tuˈn t ‑ xi xkye waqˈiˈn .

text: His mother saith unto the servants , Whatsoever he saith unto you , do it .
text2: Me bˈeˈx xi tqˈmaˈn tnana kyeˈ nchi sipintaq : Kybˈinchinkuy tkyaqil a tzeˈnkuxjo ktzajil tqˈmaˈn kyeˈy .

text: And there were set there six waterpots of stone , after the manner of the purifying of the Jews , containing two or three firkins apiece .
text2: Ex attaq qaq ma tij ẍoqˈ tkubˈil aˈ , abˈj julsinqe , ex nchi ajbˈin te kytxˈajbˈil xjal Judiy , tzeˈnkuxtaqjo ojtxe tumil kyuˈn . Teyile junjun nkux bˈaj junjun winqin ẍoqˈ aˈ toj .

text: Jesus saith unto them , Fill the waterpots with water . And they filled them up to the brim .
text2: Bˈeˈx xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kyeˈ nchi sipintaq : Kynojsinqekuxjiˈy ẍoqˈ tukˈa aˈ . Ex i bˈaj noj kyuˈn wen .

text: And he saith unto them , Draw out now , and bear unto the governor of the feast . And they bare it .
text2: Ex xi tqˈmaˈnl kye : Kypluˈnktz chˈin , ex kyinxa te tnejil nukˈil . Ex kubˈ kybˈinchin ikyjo .

text: When the ruler of the feast had tasted the water that was made wine , and knew not whence it was : ( but the servants which drew the water knew ; ) the governor of the feast called the bridegroom ,
text2: Ex atzin teˈ tnejil nukˈil kubˈ nikyˈbˈin teˈ aˈ , a otaq tzˈok te vin , ntiˈ bˈiˈn tuˈn jaˈ otaq tzaje , me ayetzin kye sipil bˈintaql kye kyuˈn , quˈn o kyli kyeˈ jaˈ otaq chi meltzˈaje kyeˈ qˈaˈyil . Ex atzinj tnejil nukˈil te mejebˈlin , tzaj ttxkoˈn chmilbˈaj , a tzmataq njaw meje ,

text: And saith unto him , Every man at the beginning doth set forth good wine ; and when men have well drunk , then that which is worse : but thou hast kept the good wine until now .
text2: ex xi tqˈmaˈn te : Kykyaqil xjal nxi kysipin nej a tbˈanilx vin ; ex ajtzin kybˈaj kˈwaˈn txokenj toj jun mejebˈlin , nxi kysipin vin , a nya wiyil , tuˈntzin mi kynaˈye ttxutxjil . Me atzin te , ma kubˈ tkˈuˈn tejiy vin tbˈanilxix , tuˈn tokin tzmax tzaluˈn .

text: This beginning of miracles did Jesus in Cana of Galilee , and manifested forth his glory ; and his disciples believed on him .
text2: Atzin lo tnejil techil tipin Jesúsjo bˈant toj najbˈil Caná toj ttxˈotxˈ Galiley , ex tuˈnjo lo xi tyekˈineˈ nim toklin kyeˈ t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin . Ex tuˈn ikyjo , bˈeˈx xi kynimin qa Tkˈwal Dios .

text: After this he went down to Capernaum , he , and his mother , and his brethren , and his disciples : and they continued there not many days .
text2: Tbˈajlinxitziˈn ikyjo , bˈeˈx xiˈ Jesús tojjo tnam Capernaum , tukˈa tnana , kyukˈa titzˈin ex t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin . Antza i tene jun jteˈbˈin qˈij .

text: And the Jews ' passover was at hand , and Jesus went up to Jerusalem ,
text2: Tej chˈixtaq tkˈul kaniˈn nintz qˈij te Waˈj Pan kye Judiy , jax Jesús tojjo tnam Jerusalén .

text: And found in the temple those that sold oxen and sheep and doves , and the changers of money sitting :
text2: Ex okx tojjo tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , jaˈ ate junjun sbˈul nchi bˈaj kˈayin aluˈmj te chojbˈil kyilxjal , tzeˈnku wakx , rit ex palom . Ex ikyxjo , ok tkaˈyin aye xjal nya wen qˈuqejqe txˈexbˈil pwaq .

text: And when he had made a scourge of small cords , he drove them all out of the temple , and the sheep , and the oxen ; and poured out the changers ' money , and overthrew the tables ;
text2: Tej tok tkaˈyiˈn tkyaqiljo ikyjo ; kubˈ tbˈinchin jun asyal te poqˈchbˈil , ex i bˈajetz tlajoˈn xjal iteˈ toj tja Dios , tukˈa jniˈ kykˈaẍjil , kywakix ex kyrit . Ex ja ttolpin kymeẍjo txˈexbˈil pwaq , ex bˈaj kubˈ chitjjo pwaq twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: And said unto them that sold doves , Take these things hence ; make not my Father ' s house an house of merchandise .
text2: Ex xi tqˈmaˈn kyeˈ nchi bˈaj kˈayin palom : Kyimetza kykyaqiljo lo tzma peˈn . ¿ Ma mitzin nchi txˈixweˈy tuˈn ma tzˈok kyqˈoˈn tja nMaˈn te jun kˈaybˈil ?

text: And his disciples remembered that it was written , The zeal of thine house hath eaten me up .
text2: Bˈeˈxsin tzaj kynaˈntz t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , aj tzˈibˈin toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios : Ay , Dios , Nimxix nchin xkyˈaqiˈn tiˈj Tjaych .

text: Then answered the Jews and said unto him , What sign shewest thou unto us , seeing that thou doest these things ?
text2: Bˈeˈxsin xi kyqˈmaˈn Judiy te : ¿ Tiˈtzin jun yekˈbˈil kˈwel tqˈoˈn qwutza , qa at tokliˈn tuˈn tkubˈ tbˈinchinjiˈy lo ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , Destroy this temple , and in three days I will raise it up .
text2: I xi ttzaqˈwin : Kyyuchˈinkutzinjiˈy tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios lo , ex toj oxe qˈij otaq japin bˈantl wuˈn .

text: Then said the Jews , Forty and six years was this temple in building , and wilt thou rear it up in three days ?
text2: Xi kyqˈmaˈn Judiy te : Taj qaq toj ox kˈal abˈqˈe tuˈn tjapin bˈajjo ja lo . ¿ Ma akutzin japinte tuˈn , toj oxe qˈij ?

text: But he spake of the temple of his body .
text2: Mix ele kynikyˈ tiˈj t ‑ xilin tyol , quˈn mi nyolin tiˈj jun ja twutz txˈotxˈ ; qalaˈ tiˈjjo t ‑ xmilil .

text: When therefore he was risen from the dead , his disciples remembered that he had said this unto them ; and they believed the scripture , and the word which Jesus had said .
text2: Me yajxi , tej tjaw anqˈin Jesús juntl majl kyxol kyimnin , ul julkˈaj toj qkˈuˈja , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , tiˈjjo yol lo , a otaq tzaj tqˈmaˈn qeˈy . Ex tuˈn ikyjo , xi qnimiˈn a Tuˈjil Tyol Dios ex tkyaqil tyol Jesús .

text: Now when he was in Jerusalem at the passover , in the feast day , many believed in his name , when they saw the miracles which he did .
text2: Kyojjo qˈij te Waˈj Pan lo , kubˈ tbˈinchin Jesús nim techil tipin , ex nimxjal i nimin tiˈj .

text: But Jesus did not commit himself unto them , because he knew all men ,
text2: Me mix oke qe tkˈuˈj kyiˈj , quˈn el tnikyˈ tiˈj kynabˈl kykyaqilx .

text: And needed not that any should testify of man : for he knew what was in man .
text2: Nya il tiˈj tuˈn t ‑ xi tqˈmaˈn jun aˈla te , tzeˈn tten jun xjal , quˈn ojtzqiˈn tuˈn , tzeˈn t ‑ xilin kyxim toj kyanmin .

text: There was a man of the Pharisees , named Nicodemus , a ruler of the Jews :
text2: At jun ichin , Nicodem tbˈi , jun Parisey nejinel kyxol aj Judiy .

text: The same came to Jesus by night , and said unto him , Rabbi , we know that thou art a teacher come from God : for no man can do these miracles that thou doest , except God be with him .
text2: Kanin Nicodem tkˈatz Jesús toj qnikyˈin , ex xi tqˈmaˈn te : Xnaqˈtzil , bˈinqe quˈn qa a Dios saj chqˈoˈntiˈy te xnaqˈtzil qeˈy ; quˈn mix aˈl jun xjal aku tzaj yekˈinte tipin tukˈa nim techil tzeˈnku nbˈant tuˈn , qa nya qMan tukˈa .

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , Verily , verily , I say unto thee , Except a man be born again , he cannot see the kingdom of God .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn teˈy : Ankye teˈ mi tzˈitzˈje juntl majl , nlayx tzˈel tnikyˈ tiˈjjo Tkawbˈil Dios .

text: Nicodemus saith unto him , How can a man be born when he is old ? can he enter the second time into his mother ' s womb , and be born ?
text2: Bˈeˈx xi tqaninku Nicodem te : ¿ Tzeˈntzin tten ikyjo ; jun xjal ma tijin tuˈn titzˈje juntl majl ? ¿ Ma akutzin tzˈokx toj tkˈuˈj ttxu , tuˈntzintla titzˈje tkabˈ majin ?

text: Jesus answered , Verily , verily , I say unto thee , Except a man be born of water and of the Spirit , he cannot enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús te : Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn tey , qa nlayx tzˈokx jun xjal toj Tkawbˈil Dios , qa mina s ‑ itzˈje te twutz txˈotxˈ ex tuˈn Xewbˈaj Xjan .

text: That which is born of the flesh is flesh ; and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit .
