text2: Ankye teˈ ma tzˈitzˈje kyuˈn manbˈaj , at tchwinqil te twutz txˈotxˈ . Ex ankye te ma tzˈitzˈje tkabˈ majin tuˈn Xewbˈaj Xjan , at chwinqil te jun majx .

text: Marvel not that I said unto thee , Ye must be born again .
text2: Mi jaw kaˈmin tkˈuˈja tiˈjjo ma txi nqˈmaˈn tey : Tkyaqilx tetz il tiˈj tuˈn tjaw itzˈje tkabˈ majin .

text: The wind bloweth where it listeth , and thou hearest the sound thereof , but canst not tell whence it cometh , and whither it goeth : so is every one that is born of the Spirit .
text2: Quˈn ikyxjo tzeˈnku te kyqˈiqˈ njumin wen , me mina nqloˈn jaˈ ntzaje ex tzeˈn txiˈ , ex ikyqetzin kyeˈ aye nchi itzˈje tuˈn Xewbˈaj Xjan .

text: Nicodemus answered and said unto him , How can these things be ?
text2: Xi tqanin juntl majl te Jesús : ¿ Tzeˈntzin ttxoliljo ikyjo ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , Art thou a master of Israel , and knowest not these things ?
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Ay Nicodem , jun tnejil xnaqˈtzila kyxol aj Israel , exsin ¿ Mi n ‑ el tnikyˈa tiˈjjo lo ?

text: Verily , verily , I say unto thee , We speak that we do know , and testify that we have seen ; and ye receive not our witness .
text2: Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn tey , anqejiˈy nqyolin , a bˈiˈn quˈn . Ex anqejiˈy nkubˈ qchikyˈbˈin a o qliˈy . Me ayetzin kye mi nxi kyniminjiˈy a nxi qqˈmaˈn .

text: If I have told you earthly things , and ye believe not , how shall ye believe , if I tell you of heavenly things ?
text2: Ex qa mina xi tniminjiy a xbˈaj nqˈmaˈn tey tiˈjjo kyqˈiqˈ te twutz txˈotxˈ , ¿ Tzeˈntzin ttentz tuˈn t ‑ xi tniminjiˈy , a kxel nqˈmaˈn tiˈjjo te toj kyaˈj ?

text: And no man hath ascended up to heaven , but he that came down from heaven , even the Son of man which is in heaven .
text2: Quˈn mix aˈl jun tetz o jax toj kyaˈj qˈil tqanil ; qalaˈ oˈkqinx we , a ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , ẍin kuˈtz tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , quˈn toj kyaˈj intinetaqa ojtxe .

text: And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness , even so must the Son of man be lifted up :
text2: Quˈn ikytziˈn tzeˈnku te Moisés jax tyobˈin toj tzqij txˈotxˈ jun twutzbˈiyil kan tiˈj jun tze , te jun qˈanbˈil kyexjal ; ikytzin wejiˈy , a ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , kchin jawil yobˈiˈn twutz jun cruz ,

text: That whosoever believeth in him should not perish , but have eternal life .
text2: tuˈntzin tkyaqiljo kchi nimil wiˈja mi chi naj ; qalaˈ ktenbˈil kychwinqil te jun majx .

text: For God so loved the world , that he gave his only begotten Son , that whosoever believeth in him should not perish , but have everlasting life .
text2: Quˈn nimxix tqˈaqˈbˈil tkˈuˈj Dios kyiˈjxjal tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , ma chin tzaj tchqˈoˈn , a ayiˈn Tkˈwal junchˈin , tuˈntzin kykyaqiljo a kchi nimil wiˈja nlay chi naj , qalaˈ ktenbˈil kychwinqil te jun majx .

text: For God sent not his Son into the world to condemn the world ; but that the world through him might be saved .
text2: Quˈn atzin t ‑ xim Diosjo lo , nya tuˈn nkawiˈn kujxix wen kyibˈajxjal ; qalaˈ tuˈn kyklet tkyaqilxjal wuˈn .

text: He that believeth on him is not condemned : but he that believeth not is condemned already , because he hath not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God .
text2: Quˈn ankye teˈ knimil wiˈja , nlay naj teˈ . Me ankye teˈ tkyˈeˈ tuˈn tnimin , at tkawbˈil Dios tibˈaj , a kujxix wen , noq tuˈn ma chin el tiˈjliˈn , ex tuˈn mi xi lipe wiˈja , a ayiˈn Tkˈwal Dios , a oˈkxjo junchˈin .

text: And this is the condemnation , that light is come into the world , and men loved darkness rather than light , because their deeds were evil .
text2: Axixsin t ‑ xilin tkyaqiljo lo : Ma chin kanin tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ te jun spikyˈin kyexjal . Me ayetzin xjal kykyˈeˈ tiˈjjo spikyˈin ; qalaˈ tok tilil kyuˈn tuˈn kykyij toj qxopin , quˈn nya wenjo kybˈinchbˈin .

text: For every one that doeth evil hateth the light , neither cometh to the light , lest his deeds should be reproved .
text2: Quˈn tkyaqilxjo nchi bˈinchin nya wen , n ‑ el kyiˈjlin spikyˈin , ex kykyˈeˈ tuˈn kytzaj laqˈe tkˈatz , tuˈntzin mi tzˈele tnikyˈtzajiljo kybˈinchbˈin nya wen .

text: But he that doeth truth cometh to the light , that his deeds may be made manifest , that they are wrought in God .
text2: Me ayetzin kye nchi bˈet tojjo Yol twutzxix , nchi tzaj laqˈe tkˈatz spikyˈin , tuˈntzin tel tnikyˈtzajil qa a Dios at kyukˈa toj tkyaqil .

text: After these things came Jesus and his disciples into the land of Judaea ; and there he tarried with them , and baptized .
text2: Tbˈajlinxitzin yolin ikyjo , bˈeˈx xiˈ Jesús qukˈiy , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , toj txˈotxˈ Judey . Kubˈ ten qukˈiy antza , ex i kuˈxxjal tuˈn toj aˈ te jawsbˈil aˈ .

text: And John also was baptizing in Aenon near to Salim , because there was much water there : and they came , and were baptized .
text2: Ex ikyx te Juan n ‑ aqˈnin toj junxil txˈotxˈ , Enón tbˈi , nqayin tkˈatzjo tnam Salim . Nchi kux tqˈoˈn teˈ xjal toj aˈ te jawsbˈil aˈ , quˈn nim aˈ attaq antza .

text: For John was not yet cast into prison .
text2: O bˈajjo ikyjo , a teˈ naˈmx tkuˈx Juan toj tze .

text: Then there arose a question between some of John ' s disciples and the Jews about purifying .
text2: Jawtzin anqˈin jun yol kyxol t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin Juan , a Jawsil Aˈ , kyukˈa junjun kyxol aj Judiy , kyiˈjjo a nbˈant kyuˈn ojtxe , tuˈn kyel wen twutz Dios .

text: And they came unto John , and said unto him , Rabbi , he that was with thee beyond Jordan , to whom thou barest witness , behold , the same baptizeth , and all men come to him .
text2: I ul t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin Juan tukˈa , ex xi kyqˈmaˈn te : ¡ Xnaqˈtzil , kaˈyinxa ! A xjal at tukˈiy jlajxi Nim Aˈ Jordán , aj tqˈmay qeˈy qa wen ; nimxjal nchi kuˈx tqˈoˈn toj aˈ te jawsbˈil aˈ , ex tkyaqilxjal ma cheˈx lipe tiˈj . Ajo lo nya wen toj qwutza .

text: John answered and said , A man can receive nothing , except it be given him from heaven .
text2: Me i tzaj ttzaqˈwin Juan : Mix aˈl junte at toklin tuˈnx tibˈx ; qalaˈ oˈkx Dios ntzaj qˈon teˈ toklin .

text: Ye yourselves bear me witness , that I said , I am not the Christ , but that I am sent before him .
text2: Quˈn ayeku kyeˈ i bˈinte , tej t ‑ xi nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , qa nyaqin wejiˈy a Crist ; qalaˈ noq jun taqˈnil ul nej twutz .

text: He that hath the bride is the bridegroom : but the friend of the bridegroom , which standeth and heareth him , rejoiceth greatly because of the bridegroom ' s voice : this my joy therefore is fulfilled .
text2: Te weˈy , ikyxjo lo tzeˈnku jun mojil tukˈa chmilbˈaj toj jun mejebˈlin : Tkyaqil xjal ma chi ok tzeˈnku jun xuˈjbˈaj . Nchin tzalaja , aj t ‑ xi lipexjal tiˈj Jesús , tzeˈnkujo mojil ntzalaj aj t ‑ xi lipe xuˈjlbˈaj tiˈj tchmil . Tuˈnpetziˈn , tzunx nchin tzalaja tuˈn nxi nbˈiˈn tqanil , qa tkyaqilxjal ma txi lipe tiˈj Jesús .

text: He must increase , but I must decrease .
text2: Quˈn te weˈy , tbˈanilx tuˈn tchˈiy toklin Jesús , exla qa kyja tkubˈ bˈaj we woklin .

text: He that cometh from above is above all : he that is of the earth is earthly , and speaketh of the earth : he that cometh from heaven is above all .
text2: A Jesús tzaj toj kyaˈj , ex at toklin tibˈaj tkyaqil ; ayintzin weˈ te twutz txˈotxˈ , ex oˈkx nchin yoliˈn tiˈjjo te twutz txˈotxˈ . Qalaˈ atzin teˈ a ntzaj toj kyaˈj at te toklin tibˈaj tkyaqil .

text: And what he hath seen and heard , that he testifieth ; and no man receiveth his testimony .
text2: Quˈn ate Jesús tzaj tiˈn tqanil tiˈjjo tkyaqil a o tli ex o tbˈi toj kyaˈj , me mix aˈlx jun nxi niminte .

text: He that hath received his testimony hath set to his seal that God is true .
text2: Me qa at jun xi tnimin , a ntkujsin qa twutzxixjo Tyol Dios .

text: For he whom God hath sent speaketh the words of God : for God giveth not the Spirit by measure unto him .
text2: Quˈn atzin a tzaj chqˈoˈn tuˈn Dios oˈkxtza nyoline Tyol qMan , quˈn ax Dios saj tqˈoˈn T ‑ xew tibˈaj te jun majx .

text: The Father loveth the Son , and hath given all things into his hand .
text2: Nimxix nqˈaqˈin tkˈuˈj qMan Dios tiˈj Tkˈwal , ex o tzaj tqˈoˈn toklin tibˈaj tkyaqil .

text: He that believeth on the Son hath everlasting life : and he that believeth not the Son shall not see life ; but the wrath of God abideth on him .
text2: Ankye te kxel nimin teˈ Tkˈwal Dios , at jun tchwinqil te jun majx ; me atziˈnl te , a tkyˈeˈ txi tnimin , ntiˈ teˈ toklin tiˈjjo chwinqil anetziˈn , qalaˈ ktzajil tqˈoˈn Dios tkawbˈil kujxix tibˈaj , a nlay bˈaj .

text: When therefore the Lord knew how the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John ,
text2: Pon tqanil kyukˈa Parisey , qa nimxtaql te Jesús xjal lipchek tiˈj , ex nimxtaql xjal nchi kuˈx toj aˈ tuˈn , te jawsbˈil aˈ , tzeˈnku te Juan .

text: ( Though Jesus himself baptized not , but his disciples , )
text2: Me nya aku te Jesús kuˈx qˈoˈn kyexjal toj aˈ , qalaˈ awo keˈ , a t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin .

text: He left Judaea , and departed again into Galilee .
text2: Tej tbˈinte Jesús tqanil ikyjo , bˈeˈx etz toj ttxˈotxˈ Judey , ex bˈeˈx xiˈ majl Galiley .

text: And he must needs go through Samaria .
text2: Me ilx tiˈj nej tuˈn tikyˈ toj ttxˈotxˈ Samaria .

text: Then cometh he to a city of Samaria , which is called Sychar , near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph .
text2: Pon kanin Jesús toj tnam Sicar toj ttxˈotxˈ Samaria , nqayin tkˈatzjo txˈotxˈ , a o kyij tqˈoˈn qtzan Jacob ojtxe te Jse , a tkˈwal .

text: Now Jacob ' s well was there . Jesus therefore , being wearied with his journey , sat thus on the well : and it was about the sixth hour .
text2: Antza taˈyetaq jun xoch , a toktaq tbˈi : T ‑ xoch Jacob . Ex tzajnin Jesús toj tbˈe , otaq sikyte . Kubˈ qe ajlal ttzi xoch ; bˈalaqa otaq tzˈok kabˈlaj .

text: There cometh a woman of Samaria to draw water : Jesus saith unto her , Give me to drink .
text2: Ntiˈqotaqa awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin antza , quˈn otaq qoˈxa toj tnam laqˈol chˈin qwaˈy . Ex ultzin jun qya aj Samaria qˈaˈyil toj xoch , ex xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús te : Qˈontza chˈin nkˈwaˈy cheˈwe .

text: Then saith the woman of Samaria unto him , How is it that thou , being a Jew , askest drink of me , which am a woman of Samaria ? for the Jews have no dealings with the Samaritans .
text2: Me atzin teˈ qya xi tqˈmaˈn te : ¿ Tiˈtzin quˈn ntzaj tqaniˈn tkˈwaˈy cheˈwe weˈy ? Quˈn aj Judiy te , ex ayintzin weˈ jun qya aj Samaria ( quˈn kyojjo qˈij anetziˈn nimxtaq qˈoj at kyxol aj Judiy ex aj Samaria ) .

text: Jesus answered and said unto her , If thou knewest the gift of God , and who it is that saith to thee , Give me to drink ; thou wouldest have asked of him , and he would have given thee living water .
text2: Ex xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Noqit o tzˈel tnikyˈa tiˈjjo a tzaj tqˈoˈn Dios , ex noqit aku tzˈel tnikyˈa wiˈja , a nxi nqaniˈn nkˈwaˈy cheˈwe tey , atla te saj qanin te weˈy , ex matla txi nqˈoˈn weˈ cheˈwe itzˈ tey .

text: The woman saith unto him , Sir , thou hast nothing to draw with , and the well is deep : from whence then hast thou that living water ?
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin teˈ qya : Ay Tata , noqittzin at pulbˈilte tuˈn , quˈn ma tij te xoch t ‑ xe . ¿ Jaˈtzin ktzajile cheˈwe tuˈn , a itzˈ , tuˈn tzaj tqˈoˈn weˈy ?

text: Art thou greater than our father Jacob , which gave us the well , and drank thereof himself , and his children , and his cattle ?
text2: ¿ Ankyenaj te ? ¿ Ma nimxixnajtzinl te toklin tzeˈnku qtzan qxjalil Jacob , a xkyij qˈon teˈ xoch lo , jaˈ xkˈwaˈne kyukˈa jniˈ tkˈwal majqexjo talin ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto her , Whosoever drinketh of this water shall thirst again :
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwiˈn Jesús : Kykyaqiljo nchi bˈaj kˈwan tiˈjjo cheˈwe lo , ktzajil majl kˈwaj kyiˈj .

text: But whosoever drinketh of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst ; but the water that I shall give him shall be in him a well of water springing up into everlasting life .
text2: Me ankye teˈ kxel kˈwan teˈ cheˈwe kxel nqˈoˈn , nlaypen tzaj jun majl teˈ kˈwaj tiˈj . Quˈn atziˈn cheˈwe kxel nqˈoˈn te , kpuljil toj tanmin , tzeˈnkuˈ xlokˈ aˈ , tuˈn tten tchwinqil te jun majx .

text: The woman saith unto him , Sir , give me this water , that I thirst not , neither come hither to draw .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , xi tqˈmaˈntljo qya te : Ay Tata , qˈoˈntzinjiy cheˈwe weˈy , tuˈntzintla mina tzajitl kˈwaj wiˈja , ex tuˈntzintla mi chin tzajitla qˈaˈyil tzmax tzaluˈn .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Go , call thy husband , and come hither .
text2: Ex xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús te : Ku txiˈy qˈolbˈil teˈ tchmila ; ex ku kytzaja tzaluˈn .

text: The woman answered and said , I have no husband . Jesus said unto her , Thou hast well said , I have no husband :
text2: Tzajtzin ttzaqˈwin qya : Ntiˈ weˈ nchmil . Ex xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús te : Twutzx te ma tzaj tqˈmaˈn qa ntiˈ tchmila .

text: For thou hast had five husbands ; and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband : in that saidst thou truly .
text2: Quˈn jweˈ tchmila o tzikyˈ , ex atziˈn mujle tukˈiy jaˈlin nya tchmilkuy . Twutzx te ma tzaj tqˈmaˈn .

text: The woman saith unto him , Sir , I perceive that thou art a prophet .
text2: Tej tbˈinte qya ikyjo , xi tqˈma : Ay Tata , ma tzˈel we nnikyˈ te , qa atejiy jun yolil Tyol Dios , tzeˈnku ojtxe .

text: Our fathers worshipped in this mountain ; and ye say , that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship .
text2: Qa ikyjo , at jun nxjela teˈy : Ayetziˈn qxeˈchila aj Samaria i kˈulin te Dios twiˈ wutz lo ; me ayetzin kyeˈ aj Judiy nkyqˈmaˈn qa noq oˈkx toj Jerusalén aku qo kˈuline .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Woman , believe me , the hour cometh , when ye shall neither in this mountain , nor yet at Jerusalem , worship the Father .
text2: Xitzin tqˈmaˈn Jesús te : Ay qya , noqit aku chinx tnimiˈn , quˈn tzul kanin jun qˈij , jaˈ tuˈn kykˈuliniy twutz qMan Dios , nya noq oˈkx twiˈ wutz lo , ex nya noq toj Jerusalén ; qalaˈ toj tkyaqil twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: Ye worship ye know not what : we know what we worship : for salvation is of the Jews .
text2: Ayetzin kyeˈ aj Samaria , mi n ‑ el kynikyˈa te alqe nchi kˈuliniy . Me metzin qeˈ , a awoˈy aj Judiy , ma tzˈel qe qnikyˈ te alqe nqo kˈuliniy , quˈn antza tzajnin teˈ tkolbˈil qMan noqx kyuˈn aj Judiy .

text: But the hour cometh , and now is , when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth : for the Father seeketh such to worship him .
text2: Me ma pon kanin jun qˈij , ex atzin qˈijjo jaˈlin , ex ayetziˈn a kxel kyqˈoˈn kyibˈ twutz qMan tukˈa tkyaqil kyanmin , ayexixsin kye kchi kˈuliljo tukˈa tumil , exla qa noq jaˈchaqku iteˈye , quˈn ikytzin te Diosjo taj .

text: God is a Spirit : and they that worship him must worship him in spirit and in truth .
text2: Quˈn ate Dios nya qˈanchaˈl teˈ , exla at toj tkyaqil tchˈiˈysbˈin . ¿ Ma akutzin qo kˈulin twutz noq tukˈa qtzi ? Qalaˈ tukˈa tkyaqil qanmin , ex tukˈa jun qnimbˈil twutzxix .

text: The woman saith unto him , I know that Messias cometh , which is called Christ : when he is come , he will tell us all things .
text2: Xitzin tqˈmaˈn qya te : Bˈiˈn weˈ wuˈn qa tzul Kolil , a Crist . Ex aj tul , okla ktzajil tchikyˈbˈin tkyaqil .

text: Jesus saith unto her , I that speak unto thee am he .
text2: Xitzin tqˈmaˈn Jesús te : Ayin wejiˈy Crist , a nchin yoliˈn tukˈiy .

text: And upon this came his disciples , and marvelled that he talked with the woman : yet no man said , What seekest thou ? or , Why talkest thou with her ?
text2: Tzmataq nyolin , tej qmeltzˈaja . Bˈeˈx o jaw kaˈylaja tuˈn nyolin Jesús tukˈa jun qya . Me mix aˈl jun qeˈ ten tipin tuˈn t ‑ xi qaninte te , tiˈ taj , mo tiquˈn nyolin tukˈa .

text: The woman then left her waterpot , and went her way into the city , and saith to the men ,
text2: Ex jun paqx kyij ttzaqpiˈn tej qya tẍoqˈ , ex bˈeˈx xi rinin tzmax toj tnam qˈmalte kyexjal .

text: Come , see a man , which told me all things that ever I did : is not this the Christ ?
text2: Tej tkanin , xi tqˈmaˈn kye : Ku kytzaja lolte jun xjal , a ma bˈaj tqˈmaˈn tkyaqiljo nya wen o bˈant wuˈn ojtxe . ¿ Nyapela Cristjo , a at tulil ?

text: Then they went out of the city , and came unto him .
text2: Ex jun paqx i bˈajetzxjal toj tnam , ex i xiˈ jaˈ taˈye Jesús .

text: In the mean while his disciples prayed him , saying , Master , eat .
text2: Tzmataq nchi bˈaj ulxjal , awotzin qeˈ t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , o kubˈsin qwutza te : Xnaqˈtzil , ku tzaja waˈl jun twaˈy nej , qo chijiˈy .

text: But he said unto them , I have meat to eat that ye know not of .
text2: Me ante Jesús tzaj tqˈmaˈn qeˈy : At jun weˈ nwa , a mi ojtzqiˈn kyuˈn .

text: Therefore said the disciples one to another , Hath any man brought him ought to eat ?
text2: Awotzin qeˈ o ok teˈn qanilte qxolilixa : ¿ Ma atpela jun aˈla ma tzaj qˈinte twa ?

text: Jesus saith unto them , My meat is to do the will of him that sent me , and to finish his work .
text2: Atzin te Jesús tzaj tqˈmaˈn qeˈy : Axixsin wejiˈy nwa , noq tuˈn tkubˈ nbˈinchiˈn tajbˈiljo a saj chqˈoˈn weˈy , ex tuˈn tjapin bˈajjo taqˈin wuˈn .

text: Say not ye , There are yet four months , and then cometh harvest ? behold , I say unto you , Lift up your eyes , and look on the fields ; for they are white already to harvest .
text2: Xi qkaˈyiˈn kumnix kyjaˈ tzaje laqˈe txqan xjal tokx kyxbˈalin sjanin wen , ex tzaj tqˈmaˈn Jesús qeˈy : ¿ Ma nyapela kyaje xjaw tuˈn tjaw awal ? Me kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy : Kykaˈyinxa kumnix , quˈn ma kubˈ sjaneˈ awal jaˈlin tuˈn tjaw chmet .

text: And he that reapeth receiveth wages , and gathereth fruit unto life eternal : that both he that soweth and he that reapeth may rejoice together .
text2: Mi nchin yolin weˈ tiˈjjo awal te twutz txˈotxˈ , qalaˈ kyiˈjjo xjal tuˈn kynimin , ex tuˈn tten kychwinqil te jun majx . Ayetzin kye , a nchi aqˈniˈn tiˈjjo aqˈuntl lo , ktzajil kytzyuˈn kye twiˈ kykˈuˈj , junx kyukˈa a ẍi ex xikyˈbˈinte aqˈuntl .

text: And herein is that saying true , One soweth , and another reapeth .
text2: Quˈn twutzxixjo jun yol nkyqˈmaˈnxjal kyjaluˈn : Junxilte nkux awante , ex junxilte njaw chmon teˈ twutz , me junx twiˈ kykˈuˈj ktzajil kytzyuˈn tiˈj .

text: I sent you to reap that whereon ye bestowed no labour : other men laboured , and ye are entered into their labours .
text2: Ma chex nchqˈoˈn kye tuˈn kyxiˈy chmol twutz awal kyxolxjal , a jaˈ mi ẍi aqˈniniˈy tiˈj , quˈn junxilte xkux awante Tyol Dios kye . Me tzunx nchi tzalaj kyeˈ tiˈjjo kyaqˈnbˈin , quˈn noqit ntiˈ kjol ex awal , ntiˈtla kyeˈ tuˈn tja kychmoˈn .

text: And many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him for the saying of the woman , which testified , He told me all that ever I did .
text2: Nim aj Samaria i nimin tiˈj Jesús , noq tuˈn tyoljo qya , tej t ‑ xi tqˈmaˈn kye , qa o bˈaj tqˈmaˈn Jesús tkyaqiljo nya wen o bˈant tuˈn ojtxe .

text: So when the Samaritans were come unto him , they besought him that he would tarry with them : and he abode there two days .
text2: Atziˈn tej kyul aj Samaria tkˈatz Jesús , i ok ten kubˈsil kywutz te , tuˈn tkyij ten kyukˈa . Ex axsa kyije ten kabˈe qˈij kyxol .

text: And many more believed because of his own word ;
text2: Ex nimxjal i nimin , tej kybˈin teˈ Tyol .

text: And said unto the woman , Now we believe , not because of thy saying : for we have heard him ourselves , and know that this is indeed the Christ , the Saviour of the world .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , xi kyqˈmaˈn te qya : Atzin jaˈlin mapen txi qniminx qe nya noq tuˈn saj tqˈmaˈn qeˈy ; qalaˈ awokuxix qe ma qo ok bˈinte te , ex ma tzˈel qnikyˈa te , qa twutzxix ate Cristjo , a Kolil te tkyaqilxjal twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: Now after two days he departed thence , and went into Galilee .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ kabˈe qˈij , etz Jesús toj ttxˈotxˈ Samaria , ex xiˈ toj ttxˈotxˈ Galiley .

text: For Jesus himself testified , that a prophet hath no honour in his own country .
text2: Me aku Jesús tzaj qˈmaˈnte qeˈy , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , qa jun yolil Tyol Dios nlay tzˈok kˈuˈjlin kyuˈn t ‑ xjalil .

text: Then when he was come into Galilee , the Galilaeans received him , having seen all the things that he did at Jerusalem at the feast : for they also went unto the feast .
text2: Me tej tponl Jesús toj Galiley , kubˈ kywutzliˈn aye najleqe antza , quˈn otaq kyli tbˈinchbˈin tipin tzma Jerusalén toj nintz qˈij te Waˈj Pan , quˈn ajinqetaq iteˈ antza .

text: So Jesus came again into Cana of Galilee , where he made the water wine . And there was a certain nobleman , whose son was sick at Capernaum .
text2: Ul meltzˈaj jun majl Jesús toj tnam Caná , toj ttxˈotxˈ Galiley , jaˈ o txˈixpit aˈ te vin tuˈn . Ex tkˈatz Caná at juntl tnam , Capernaum tbˈi . Antza taˈye jun xjal nim toklin , te taqˈnil nmaq kawil , ex at jun tkˈwal iltaq taˈ tuˈn yabˈil .

text: When he heard that Jesus was come out of Judaea into Galilee , he went unto him , and besought him that he would come down , and heal his son : for he was at the point of death .
text2: Atzin te tok tbˈiˈn teˈ aqˈnil qa o tzˈajtz Jesús Judey , tuˈn tpon kanin toj Galiley , bˈeˈx xiˈ lolte , ex kubˈsin twutz te , tuˈn t ‑ xiˈ qˈanil teˈ tkˈwal tzma tja , quˈn chˈixtaq tkyim .

text: Then said Jesus unto him , Except ye see signs and wonders , ye will not believe .
text2: Atzin te Jesús xi tqˈmaˈn te : Nlayx txi kynimin kye , qa ntiˈ jun techil wipiˈn tuˈn tbˈant .

text: The nobleman saith unto him , Sir , come down ere my child die .
text2: Me atzin tej aqˈnil jun paqx xi tqˈmaˈn te : Ay Tata , ku tzaja jaˈlinxix ; chˈix tkyim weˈ nkˈwal .

text: Jesus saith unto him , Go thy way ; thy son liveth . And the man believed the word that Jesus had spoken unto him , and he went his way .
text2: Xitzin tqˈmaˈn Jesús te : Kux tzˈaja tjaˈy . Lu te tkˈwal itzˈ . Ma tzul Dios te . Ex bˈeˈx xi tnimin tej ichin tyol Jesús , ex bˈeˈx aj .

text: And as he was now going down , his servants met him , and told him , saying , Thy son liveth .
text2: Ex chˈixtaq tkanin tja , i etzjo taqˈnil kˈlulte , ex xi kyqˈmaˈn te : Lu tej tkˈwala ; ma tzul Dios te .

text: Then inquired he of them the hour when he began to amend . And they said unto him , Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him .
text2: Atzin teˈ ichin xi tqanin kyeˈ taqˈnil jniˈ or tchewx kyaq tiˈj . Ewe tikyˈlinxi kabˈlaj , chi chiˈ .

text: So the father knew that it was at the same hour , in the which Jesus said unto him , Thy son liveth : and himself believed , and his whole house .
text2: Bˈeˈxsin pon kanin toj tnabˈljo ttataˈ kˈwal , qa ax orjo ttzaj tqˈmaˈn Jesús te , qa ma tzul Dios te tkˈwal . Tuˈn ikyjo , bˈeˈx xi tnimin tej ichin kyukˈa kykyaqil najleqe toj tja .

text: This is again the second miracle that Jesus did , when he was come out of Judaea into Galilee .
text2: Atzin lo tkabˈ techil tipin bˈant tuˈn Jesús , tej tajtz Judey , ex pon kaninl Galiley .

text: After this there was a feast of the Jews ; and Jesus went up to Jerusalem .
text2: Tbˈajlinxitziˈn ikyjo , tzmataq nchi ikyˈsin aj Judiy jun nintz qˈij toj Jerusalén , aj meltzˈaj Jesús antza .

text: Now there is at Jerusalem by the sheep market a pool , which is called in the Hebrew tongue Bethesda , having five porches .
text2: Toj Jerusalén , at jun tkubˈil aˈ ma tij , tkubˈ tkˈatz jun ma tij tjpel ja , Tjpel Tja Rit tbˈi . Ajo aˈ tok tbˈi : Betzata toj kyyol aj Judiy . Attaq jweˈ tqan ja anetziˈn .

text: In these lay a great multitude of impotent folk , of blind , halt , withered , waiting for the moving of the water .
text2: Antza kuẍejqe txqan yabˈ : Moẍ , kox , ex junjun noq o tzˈel kyim t ‑ xmilil . Nchi ayoˈn tiˈj , tuˈn tja yekj aˈ toj tkubˈil .

text: For an angel went down at a certain season into the pool , and troubled the water : whosoever then first after the troubling of the water stepped in was made whole of whatsoever disease he had .
text2: Quˈn chitzin qa attaq jun t ‑ angel Dios nkˈuˈltaq ttzi tkubˈil aˈ junjun maj , te yekilte . Noq aj t ‑ xi yekjjo aˈ , ankye te nxi t ‑ xoˈn tibˈ tnejil , bˈeˈx tzul Dios te aˈlchaqx kye yabˈiltz tiˈj .

text: And a certain man was there , which had an infirmity thirty and eight years .
text2: At jun ichin ttzi tkubˈil aˈ , o bˈant ‑ xi wajxaqlajaj toj kaˈwnaq abˈqˈe tyabˈtlin .

text: When Jesus saw him lie , and knew that he had been now a long time in that case , he saith unto him , Wilt thou be made whole ?
text2: Tej tiwle tuˈn Jesús kuẍle , ex el tnikyˈ te qa ojtxe tkubˈlin yabˈte , xi tqanin te : ¿ Tajtzin tuˈn tqˈanita ?

text: The impotent man answered him , Sir , I have no man , when the water is troubled , to put me into the pool : but while I am coming , another steppeth down before me .
text2: Tzajtzin ttzaqˈwiˈn yabˈ : Ay Tata , mix aˈl jun mojil weˈ , tuˈn nkuˈxa toj tkubˈil aˈ , aj tjaw yekj . Ajtzin tjaw yekjjo aˈ , waja tuˈn t ‑ xi nxoˈn wibˈa toj , me junxil nxi t ‑ xoˈn tibˈ nej .

text: Jesus saith unto him , Rise , take up thy bed , and walk .
text2: Ante Jesús xi tqˈmaˈn te : Kux jaw weˈksa , qˈinqeksjiy tkuẍila , ex kux bˈeta .

text: And immediately the man was made whole , and took up his bed , and walked : and on the same day was the sabbath .
text2: Texjo paq , ex ul Dios te ichin ; jaw tiˈn tkuẍil , ex bˈeˈx ok ten bˈetil . Ataqtziˈn qˈij ikyjo , te ajlabˈl .

text: The Jews therefore said unto him that was cured , It is the sabbath day : it is not lawful for thee to carry thy bed .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , xi kyqˈmaˈn Judiy te ichin otaq qˈanit : Qˈij te ajlabˈl te jaˈlin . Nya wen teˈ toj kawbˈil , tuˈn tkubˈ qbˈinchin jun tiˈ , ex tuˈn tjaw tiqiˈn tkuẍila .

text: He answered them , He that made me whole , the same said unto me , Take up thy bed , and walk .
text2: I xi ttzaqˈwiˈn ichin : Ajo xjal , a xkubˈ qˈanin weˈy , saj qˈmante weˈy , tuˈn t ‑ xi wiqiˈn nkuẍila , ex tuˈn nbˈeta .

text: Then asked they him , What man is that which said unto thee , Take up thy bed , and walk ?
text2: Ayetzin kyeˈ Judiy xi kyqanin te : ¿ Ankye xqˈmante teˈy , tuˈn t ‑ xi tiqin tkuẍila , ex tuˈn tbˈeta ?

text: And he that was healed wist not who it was : for Jesus had conveyed himself away , a multitude being in that place .
text2: Me ante ichin mi bˈiˈn tuˈn ankye o kubˈ qˈaninte , tuˈn nimx txqan xjal at , ex otaq tzikyˈ Jesús antza .

text: Afterward Jesus findeth him in the temple , and said unto him , Behold , thou art made whole : sin no more , lest a worse thing come unto thee .
text2: Yajxi , el jyetjo ichin tuˈn Jesús tojjo tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , ex xi tqˈmaˈn te : Kaˈyinktziˈn . Ma tzul Dios teˈy . Mitzin bˈinchintla il , tuˈntzin mi tzaje juntl tiˈ tiˈja kujxix wen .

text: The man departed , and told the Jews that it was Jesus , which had made him whole .
text2: Ex antza ele tnikyˈ te , qa a Jesús otaq qˈaninte , ex xi tqˈmaˈn tqanil kye aj Judiy .

text: And therefore did the Jews persecute Jesus , and sought to slay him , because he had done these things on the sabbath day .
text2: Tuˈntzin ikyjo , tzaj kyqˈoj tiˈj Jesús , ex kyajtaq tuˈn tkubˈ kybˈyoˈn , quˈn tuˈn nchi kubˈ tqˈanin xjal toj qˈij te ajlabˈl .

text: But Jesus answered them , My Father worketh hitherto , and I work .
text2: Tuˈntziˈn ikyjo , xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye : Te nMaˈn kukx o tzˈaqˈnin teˈ tzmax tzaluˈn , ex ikyx wejiˈy nchin aqˈniˈn , exla qa qˈij te ajlabˈl mo minaj .

text: Therefore the Jews sought the more to kill him , because he not only had broken the sabbath , but said also that God was his Father , making himself equal with God .
text2: Tuˈntzin tpajjo ikyjo , nimx tzaj kyqˈojxjal tiˈj , tuˈn tkubˈ kybˈyoˈn , nya noq tuˈn tkubˈ tqˈanin jun xjal toj qˈij te ajlabˈl , qalaˈ tuˈn tyol , ok tqˈon tibˈ te Dios , teˈ t ‑ xi tqˈmaˈn qa aku Dios te ttata .

text: Then answered Jesus and said unto them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , The Son can do nothing of himself , but what he seeth the Father do : for what things soever he doeth , these also doeth the Son likewise .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye : Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , qa ayiˈn Tkˈwal Dios , nlay bˈant tuˈn nbˈinchiˈn jun tiˈ noq wuˈnx wibˈxa ; qalaˈ oˈkx nkubˈ nbˈinchinjiˈy a n ‑ ok nkaˈyiˈn te nMaˈn . Quˈn tkyaqilxjo nbˈant tuˈn nMaˈn , ex ikyxjo nbˈant wuˈn , ayiˈn Tkˈwal .

text: For the Father loveth the Son , and sheweth him all things that himself doeth : and he will shew him greater works than these , that ye may marvel .
text2: Nimxix nchin ok tkˈuˈjliˈn tuˈn nMan Dios , quˈn ayin weˈ Tkˈwal ; ex ntzaj tyekˈin weˈy tkyaqiljo nbˈant tuˈn . Ex okpe ktzajil tyekˈin nimxixtl techil wipiˈn , tzeˈnku xbˈant wuˈn tiˈjjo kox lo , noqx tuˈn kyjaw kaˈylaja tiˈj .

text: For as the Father raiseth up the dead , and quickeneth them ; even so the Son quickeneth whom he will .
text2: Quˈn ikyjo tzeˈnkuˈ te Dios , nchi jaw anqˈin kyimnin tuˈn , tuˈn t ‑ xi tqˈoˈn kychwinqil , exsin ikyx wejiˈy , a ayiˈn Tkˈwal Dios , aku txi nqˈoˈn chwinqil noq alqe wajiˈy tuˈn t ‑ xi nqˈoˈn .

text: For the Father judgeth no man , but hath committed all judgment unto the Son :
text2: Ex nya te Dios tuˈn tkawin toj qˈij te paˈbˈin ; qalaˈ tzaj tqˈoˈn Dios wokliˈn tuˈn nkawiˈn tibˈaj tkyaqil .

text: That all men should honour the Son , even as they honour the Father . He that honoureth not the Son honoureth not the Father which hath sent him .
text2: Kubˈ tbˈinchin Dios ikyjo , tuˈntzintla tjaw nimsiˈn nbˈiˈy kyuˈnxjal , ikyxjo tzeˈnkuxjo njaw nimsin tbˈi qMan kyuˈn . Quˈn ankye te mi xjaw nimsin te tbˈi Kˈwalbˈaj , ex mina xja tnimsin tbˈi qMan , a tzaj chqˈoˈn weˈy .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that heareth my word , and believeth on him that sent me , hath everlasting life , and shall not come into condemnation ; but is passed from death unto life .
text2: Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy : Ankye teˈ nkubˈ tbˈin nyola tukˈa tkyaqil tanmin , ex kˈwel tnimin a saj chqˈon weˈy , atpen teˈ tchwinqil te jun majx . Ex nlay txi qˈoˈn toj najin , quˈn o txˈixpit tanmin te kyime tuˈn tok te chwinqil .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , The hour is coming , and now is , when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God : and they that hear shall live .
text2: Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , ma pon kanin jun qˈij ex atzin qˈijjo jaˈlin , tuˈn kybˈinte a kyimninqe toj kyanmin tqˈajqˈojil nwiˈy , ayiˈn Tkˈwal Dios . Ex ayetziˈn kchi kˈwel niminte nyola , okpin kchi anqˈil kyeˈ .

text: For as the Father hath life in himself ; so hath he given to the Son to have life in himself ;
text2: Quˈn atzin qMan Dios , at teˈ tchwinqil tuˈnx tibˈx , ex aku ttxuyil chwinqil . Ex ikyxjo , o tzaj tqˈoˈn wokliˈn , a ayiˈn Tkˈwal , tuˈn tten nchwinqila wuˈnx wibˈxa .

text: And hath given him authority to execute judgment also , because he is the Son of man .
text2: Ex nya noq oˈkx Tkˈwal Diosqiˈn ; qalaˈ Tkˈwal Ichin . Ex tuˈn ikyjo , ma tzaj tqˈoˈn wokliˈn tuˈn nkawiˈn tibˈaj tkyaqil .

text: Marvel not at this : for the hour is coming , in the which all that are in the graves shall hear his voice ,
text2: Mi chi jaw kaˈylaja tiˈj tkyaqiljo lo , quˈn pon kanin jun qˈij nimxixtl tzeˈnku lo , aj kybˈinte tkyaqil kyimnin muquˈnqekux toj txˈotxˈ , tqˈajqˈojil nwiˈy ,

text: And shall come forth ; they that have done good , unto the resurrection of life ; and they that have done evil , unto the resurrection of damnation .
text2: ex kchi jaw anqˈintl . Ayeˈ wen kybˈinchbˈin , kchi jawil anqˈin , tuˈn tten kychwinqil te jun majx . Ex ayetziˈn nya wen kybˈinchbˈin , ex kchi jawil anqˈin kye , tuˈn kyxiˈ toj najin te jun majx .

text: I can of mine own self do nothing : as I hear , I judge : and my judgment is just ; because I seek not mine own will , but the will of the Father which hath sent me .
text2: Ex nlay bˈant jun weˈ tiˈ wuˈn wuˈnx wibˈxa . Ex aj nkawiˈn , mi chin kawin weˈ wuˈnx wibˈxa . Quˈn nkyˈeˈy tuˈn tkubˈ nbˈinchiˈn tzeˈnkuxjo waja , qalaˈ tzeˈnkuxjo taj qMan , a tzaj chqˈoˈn weˈy . Tuˈnpetziˈn , aj nkawiˈn , tzˈaqlexix weˈ nkawbˈil .

text: If I bear witness of myself , my witness is not true .
text2: Quˈn qa ma chin kujsiˈn nyola wiˈjxa , ntiˈla tajbˈin nyola tuˈn tok te kujsil weˈy .

text: There is another that beareth witness of me ; and I know that the witness which he witnesseth of me is true .
text2: Me at juntl nkujsinte tyol wiˈja , a Juan Jawsil Aˈ . Ex bˈiˈn we wuˈn a ntqˈmaˈn wiˈja twutzxix , ex at tajbˈin te kujsil weˈy .

text: Ye sent unto John , and he bare witness unto the truth .
text2: Ex ayekuy i xtaˈj qanilte te Juan qa wenqe nyola ; ex atziˈn tzaj ttzaqˈwin kyeˈy qa twutzxix teˈ .

text: But I receive not testimony from man : but these things I say , that ye might be saved .
text2: O yolin Juan bˈaˈn wiˈja , quˈn ate Juan tzeˈnku jun tzaj , a nqoptzˈaj tukˈa jun yol twutzxix wiˈja kywutzxjal . Ex ma chi tzalaja jun jteˈbˈin qˈij tiˈjjo tyol . Qˈuqle kykˈuˈja tiˈjjo t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈil Juan , ex ntzaj nnaˈn kyeˈy , noq tuˈn kykleta . Me mi qˈuqle nkˈuˈja tiˈjjo jun xjal , exla qa Juan , nyakuj qa il tiˈj tuˈn tkujsitjo nyola tuˈn jun xjal .

text: But I have greater witness than that of John : for the works which the Father hath given me to finish , the same works that I do , bear witness of me , that the Father hath sent me .
text2: Quˈn at jun weˈ kujsilwe nimxixtl toklin tzeˈnku te Juan , quˈn tkyaqiljo techil wipiˈn a nbˈant wuˈn , ikyxjo tzeˈnku tzaj toqxenin qMan weˈy ; atziˈn nkujsin teˈ qa a Dios saj chqˈoˈn weˈy .

text: And the Father himself , which hath sent me , hath borne witness of me . Ye have neither heard his voice at any time , nor seen his shape .
text2: Ex ikyx te qMan Diosjo , a tzaj chqˈon weˈy , ntzaj tqˈoˈn kujsil weˈy qa twutzxix nyola , me naˈmx kybˈintiˈy nipela jun maj tqˈajqˈojil twiˈ , ex naˈm kylontiy tzeˈn iky kaˈyin .

text: And ye have not his word abiding in you : for whom he hath sent , him ye believe not .
text2: Ex naˈmx tkyijjo Tyol toj kyanmiˈn , quˈn naˈmx kynimiˈn wiˈja , a ayinkuy ẍin tzaj tchqˈoˈn Dios .

text: Search the scriptures ; for in them ye think ye have eternal life : and they are they which testify of me .
text2: Quˈn chebˈex nkux kyxpichˈinjiˈy Tyol Dios , quˈn toj kywutza antza kknetila kychwinqila te jun majx , me mi n ‑ el kynikyˈa te , qa antza nyolineˈ Tyol Dios wiˈja .

text: And ye will not come to me , that ye might have life .
text2: Quˈn ayetzin kye kykyˈeˈy tuˈn kyxi lipeˈy wiˈja , tuˈn kyten kychwinqila te jun majx .

text: I receive not honour from men .
text2: Nlay kubˈ nwutzlinjiˈy nimsbˈil weˈy ntzaj kyuˈnxjal ,

text: But I know you , that ye have not the love of God in you .
text2: quˈn ojtzqiˈnqiˈy wuˈn , ex ojtzqiˈn wuˈn qa nya kˈuˈjlin Dios kyuˈn .

text: I am come in my Father ' s name , and ye receive me not : if another shall come in his own name , him ye will receive .
text2: Ma chin tzaj chqˈoˈn weˈ tuˈn nMaˈn , me mi ẍin kubˈ kywutzliˈn ; qatzin ma pon kanin juntl kyxola tuˈnx tibˈx ex nya chqˈoˈn tuˈn Dios , atzin kyejiˈy nkubˈ kywutzlin .

text: How can ye believe , which receive honour one of another , and seek not the honour that cometh from God only ?
text2: ¿ Ma attzin tumil tuˈn kykleta , qa noq kyaja tuˈn kyela wen kywutzxjal , ex nya twutz qMan Dios , a junchˈin ?

text: Do not think that I will accuse you to the Father : there is one that accuseth you , even Moses , in whom ye trust .
text2: Ma qe kykˈuˈja tiˈjjo t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈil Moisés tuˈn kykleta , quˈn toj kywutza qa ayiˈn weˈ nchinx patin kyeˈy twutz Dios . Me mina , quˈn atzin kpatil kyeˈ toj paˈbˈin twutz Dios , aku Moisés , quˈn mi njapin bˈajjo t ‑ xilin t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈil kyuˈn .

text: For had ye believed Moses , ye would have believed me : for he wrote of me .
text2: Quˈn noqit ma txi kynimin kyeˈ tkyaqiljo kubˈ ttzˈibˈin Moisés , matla txi kynimin kye nyola , quˈn wiˈjxa xyoline Moisés .

text: But if ye believe not his writings , how shall ye believe my words ?
text2: Me mi nxi kyniminjiˈy a xkyij ttzˈibˈiˈn Moisés . ¿ Tzeˈntzin ttentz tuˈn t ‑ xi kynimiˈn a xi nqˈmaˈn ?

text: After these things Jesus went over the sea of Galilee , which is the sea of Tiberias .
text2: Tbˈajlinxitziˈn ikyjo ; bˈeˈx ikyˈx Jesús tjlajxi Nijabˈ te Galiley , ex axjo Tiberias tbˈi .

text: And a great multitude followed him , because they saw his miracles which he did on them that were diseased .
text2: Nimku xjal lipchex tiˈj , quˈn o bˈaj kykaˈyiˈn yekˈbˈil teˈ tipin o bˈant , tej kybˈaj qˈanj yabˈ tuˈn .

text: And Jesus went up into a mountain , and there he sat with his disciples .
text2: Ex bˈeˈx jax twiˈ wutz , ex antza kubˈe qe qukˈiy , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin .

text: And the passover , a feast of the Jews , was nigh .
text2: Chˈixtaq tul kaniˈn nintz qˈij te Xjan Qˈij , a n ‑ ikyˈ kyuˈn aj Judiy , te naˈbˈlte kyelintz ojtxe toj Egipto .

text: When Jesus then lifted up his eyes , and saw a great company come unto him , he saith unto Philip , Whence shall we buy bread , that these may eat ?
text2: Atzaj teˈ t ‑ xi tkaˈyin Jesús , nimxtaqxjal o tzˈok lipe tiˈj , xi tqˈmaˈn te Lip : ¿ Jaˈtzin ktzajile qlaqˈon kywa txqan xjal lo ?

text: And this he said to prove him : for he himself knew what he would do .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús ikyjo , noq tuˈn tnikyˈbˈajtz Lip tiˈ ktqˈmaˈ tiˈjjo lo , quˈn bˈintaql te Jesús tuˈn , tiˈ tuˈn tkubˈ tbˈinchin .

text: Philip answered him , Two hundred pennyworth of bread is not sufficient for them , that every one of them may take a little .
text2: Xitzin ttzaqˈwin Lip : ¿ Ma attzin qpwaq tuˈn t ‑ xi loqˈbˈaj txqan wabˈj , tuˈn txiˈ tal kyinchaqjo kye ?

text: One of his disciples , Andrew , Simon Peter ' s brother , saith unto him ,
text2: Xitzin tqˈmaˈnljo junl t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , Andrés tbˈi , a titzˈin Simun Pegr :

text: There is a lad here , which hath five barley loaves , and two small fishes : but what are they among so many ?
text2: Lu jun qˈa lo , qˈin jweˈ wabˈj tuˈn , junxte nmaq triy , ex qˈiˈn kabˈe tal netzˈ kyiẍ tuˈn , me ¿ Ma akutzin kanin kyxoljo txqan xjal lo ?

text: And Jesus said , Make the men sit down . Now there was much grass in the place . So the men sat down , in number about five thousand .
text2: Tzaj ttzaqˈwin Jesús qeˈy , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin : Kyqˈmaˈnxa kyeˈ , tuˈn kybˈaj kubˈ qe kykyaqil , quˈn attaq tal kˈul antza . Bˈeˈxsin i kubˈ qeˈ xjal , bˈalaqa jun jweˈ mil ichin .

text: And Jesus took the loaves ; and when he had given thanks , he distributed to the disciples , and the disciples to them that were set down ; and likewise of the fishes as much as they would .
text2: I jaw ttzyuˈn Jesúsjo wabˈj , ex xi tqˈoˈn chjonte te Dios tiˈj . Tbˈajlinxi naˈn Dios , tzaj tqˈoˈn qeˈy , ex xi qsipiˈn kyxoljo a qˈuqejqetaq . Ex ikyx kubˈ tbˈinchin kyukˈa tal kyiẍ ; ex tzaj tqˈoˈn qeˈy tuˈn t ‑ xi qsipiˈn , noq jniˈ tuˈn tbˈaj kyuˈn .

text: When they were filled , he said unto his disciples , Gather up the fragments that remain , that nothing be lost .
text2: Atzaj teˈ kybˈaj noj wen , tzaj tqˈmaˈn Jesús qeˈy : Kychmoˈnksjiˈy tbˈuchil , a ma kyij , tuˈntzin ntiˈx chˈin tuˈn tkubˈ naj .

text: Therefore they gathered them together , and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves , which remained over and above unto them that had eaten .
text2: Atzaj teˈ tjaw bˈaj quˈn , i noj kabˈlajaj chiˈl tiˈjjo tbˈuchil jweˈ wabˈj kybˈajlin xi waˈn kykyaqil xjal .

text: Then those men , when they had seen the miracle that Jesus did , said , This is of a truth that prophet that should come into the world .
text2: Tej tok kykaˈyin tkyaqil xjal techil tipin Jesús , xi kyqˈmaˈn : Twutzxpentetz qa a ichin lo , a yolil Tyol Dios , a iltaq tiˈj tuˈn tul klolqe .

text: When Jesus therefore perceived that they would come and take him by force , to make him a king , he departed again into a mountain himself alone .
text2: Me liwey el tnikyˈ Jesús tiˈj kyximxjal , qa kyajtaq tuˈn tok kyqˈoˈn te nmaq kawil kyibˈaj te jun majx . Tuˈntziˈn ikyjo , bˈeˈx el tpaˈn tibˈ Jesús kyiˈj , ex bˈeˈx jax twiˈ wutz tjunalx .

text: And when even was now come , his disciples went down unto the sea ,
text2: Atzaj teˈ qok yupj , bˈeˈx o kuˈxa , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , ttzi nijabˈ ,

text: And entered into a ship , and went over the sea toward Capernaum . And it was now dark , and Jesus was not come to them .
text2: ex antza o okxa qeˈy toj jun bark , tuˈn qpon kaniˈn jlajxi tzma toj tnam Capernaum . Ex otaq qo ok qxopexix wen , ex naˈmtaq tmeltzˈaj Jesús .

text: And the sea arose by reason of a great wind that blew .
text2: Bˈeˈx tzaj jun nim kyqˈiqˈ xupil te aˈ , tuˈn tja pulj tiˈj bark .

text: So when they had rowed about five and twenty or thirty furlongs , they see Jesus walking on the sea , and drawing nigh unto the ship : and they were afraid .
text2: Tzmataq jun ajlabˈ tukˈa nikyˈjin qxilin bˈeta tibˈaj nijabˈ , tej t ‑ xi qkaˈyiˈn Jesús , nbˈettaq tibˈaj aˈ , tuˈn tpon kanin tkˈatz bark ; ex bˈeˈx o jaw xobˈa te , quˈn mix ele qnikyˈa tiˈj .

text: But he saith unto them , It is I ; be not afraid .
text2: Tzaj tqˈmaˈn Jesús qeˈy : Mina chi jaw xobˈa . Ayin wejiˈy .

text: Then they willingly received him into the ship : and immediately the ship was at the land whither they went .
text2: Ex bˈeˈx tzaj qkˈmoˈn Jesús tukˈa tzaljbˈil tuˈn tokx toj bark , ex jun paqx o poˈn tjlajxi aˈ , jaˈ iltaq tiˈj tuˈn qpon kaniˈn .

text: The day following , when the people which stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was none other boat there , save that one whereinto his disciples were entered , and that Jesus went not with his disciples into the boat , but that his disciples were gone away alone ;
text2: Toj junxil qˈij , ayetzin xjal otaq chi kyij tjlajxi nijabˈ , tzaj kynaˈnl qa noq junchˈin bark attaq qnikyˈin iqil kyexjal , a jaˈ o xiyiy , ex nyajin Jesús okx qukˈiy .

text: ( Howbeit there came other boats from Tiberias nigh unto the place where they did eat bread , after that the Lord had given thanks : )
text2: Ex ax qˈijjo i kanin junjun bark , a tzajninqe toj tnam Tiberias , nchi pon kanin ttzi txˈotxˈ , nqayin jaˈ o qo bˈaj waˈniˈy , tej t ‑ xi tqˈoˈn Jesús chjonte kyiˈj wabˈj .

text: When the people therefore saw that Jesus was not there , neither his disciples , they also took shipping , and came to Capernaum , seeking for Jesus .
text2: Tej tbˈaj kykaˈyin qa ntiˈtaq Jesús , ex ntiˈqotaqla , bˈeˈx i okxkux kyoj bark tuˈn kypon kanin jyolte toj tnam Capernaum .

text: And when they had found him on the other side of the sea , they said unto him , Rabbi , when camest thou hither ?
text2: Tej kyjlajinxjo xjal , jyet Jesús kyuˈn , ex xi kyqˈmaˈn te : ¿ Xnaqˈtzil , jtojetzin tkanliˈn tzaluˈn ?

text: Jesus answered them and said , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Ye seek me , not because ye saw the miracles , but because ye did eat of the loaves , and were filled .
text2: I xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , qa nchi jyoˈn wiˈja noq tuˈn noj kykˈuˈja wuˈn , ex nya tuˈn ma tzˈel kynikyˈa tiˈjjo t ‑ xilin techil wipiˈn .

text: Labour not for the meat which perisheth , but for that meat which endureth unto everlasting life , which the Son of man shall give unto you : for him hath God the Father sealed .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , mi tzˈok tilil kyuˈn tiˈjjo wabˈj te twutz txˈotxˈ , a kbˈajil ; qalaˈ tzˈokx tilil kyuˈn tiˈjjo wabˈj te kyanmiˈn , a kolbˈil te jun majx . Quˈn a Dios saj smaˈn weˈy , a ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , tuˈn nqˈoˈn chwinqil kyeˈy , tzeˈnku jun oyaj te jun majx . Quˈn noq tuˈn techil wipiˈn , nyekˈine qa ayiˈn Tkˈwal Dios .

text: Then said they unto him , What shall we do , that we might work the works of God ?
text2: Xi kyqanin xjal te : ¿ Tiˈtzin tuˈn tkubˈ qbˈinchiˈn tuˈn ttzalaj Dios qiˈja , ex tuˈn tzaj tqˈoˈnjo oyaj anetziˈn ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , This is the work of God , that ye believe on him whom he hath sent .
text2: Ex i xi ttzaqˈwin : Atziˈn taj Diosjo tuˈn tkubˈ kybˈinchiˈn , noq tuˈn kynimiˈn wiˈja , a ayiˈn ẍin tzaj smaˈn tuˈn .

text: They said therefore unto him , What sign shewest thou then , that we may see , and believe thee ? what dost thou work ?
text2: Xitzin kyqˈmaˈntz te Jesús : Qa twutzxix qa ma tzaj smaˈn tuˈn Dios , ¿ Tiˈtzin jun techiltz ktzajil tyekˈiˈn qeˈy , noq tuˈn qlontiˈy , ex tuˈn t ‑ xi qnimintza ? ¿ Tiˈtzin chˈin ma bˈanttz tuˈn ?

text: Our fathers did eat manna in the desert ; as it is written , He gave them bread from heaven to eat .
text2: Qalatziˈn kye qtzan qtaˈẍ ojtxe i waˈn tiˈjjo wabˈj , a maná , a xiˈ tqˈoˈn Moisés tojjo tzqij txˈotxˈ , ikyxtaqjo tzeˈnkuˈ ntqˈmaˈn Tuˈjil Tyol Dios : Xi tqˈoˈn kywa , aj kuˈtz toj kyaˈj .

text: Then Jesus said unto them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Moses gave you not that bread from heaven ; but my Father giveth you the true bread from heaven .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús kye : Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , nya te Moisés saj qˈoˈnte wabˈj te toj kyaˈj , qalaˈ aku te nMaˈn . Ikytzin wejiˈy , ma chin tzaj tchqˈoˈn weˈ te jun wabˈj , a twutzxix te toj kyaˈj .

text: For the bread of God is he which cometh down from heaven , and giveth life unto the world .
text2: Quˈn atziˈn wabˈj , a maná , xi tqˈoˈn chwinqil kye xjal aj Judiy ojtxe , noq te jteˈbˈin qˈij ; me anteˈ saj smaˈn tuˈn Dios , apente wabˈjjo , a ayiˈn , a ktzajil tqˈoˈn chwinqil te jun majx .

text: Then said they unto him , Lord , evermore give us this bread .
text2: Xitzin kyqanintz te Jesús : Ay Tata , qˈontzjiy wabˈj qeˈy junjun qˈij , a xkuˈtz toj kyaˈj .

text: And Jesus said unto them , I am the bread of life : he that cometh to me shall never hunger ; and he that believeth on me shall never thirst .
text2: Bˈeˈx xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye : Ayin wejiˈy a Wabˈj , a qˈolte chwinqil . Ankye teˈ ma tzaj lipey wiˈja nlayxpen tzaj te waˈyaj tiˈj ; ex ankye teˈ knimil wiˈja , ex nlayxpen tzaj te kˈwaj tiˈj .

text: But I said unto you , That ye also have seen me , and believe not .
text2: Me ma txi nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , me mi nchinx kynimiˈn , exla qa ma chin kyliˈy .

text: All that the Father giveth me shall come to me ; and him that cometh to me I will in no wise cast out .
text2: Quˈn tkyaqiljo o tzaj tqˈoˈn qMan Dios weˈy , ktzajil lipe wiˈja ; ex ajo ktzajil lipe wiˈja , nlayx chi ex nlajoˈn .

text: For I came down from heaven , not to do mine own will , but the will of him that sent me .
text2: Quˈn nya ma chin tzaj weˈ toj kyaˈj , tuˈn tkubˈ nbˈinchiˈn noqx alkye waja ; qalaˈ oˈkx tuˈn tkubˈ nbˈinchiˈn a tajjo Dios , a saj smaˈn weˈy .

text: And this is the Father ' s will which hath sent me , that of all which he hath given me I should lose nothing , but should raise it up again at the last day .
text2: Ex atziˈn taj nManjiˈy , a saj smaˈn weˈy , tuˈn mi naje jun xjal , ayeˈ ma chi tzaj tqˈoˈn weˈy ; qalaˈ tuˈn kyjaw anqˈin wuˈn , aj tjapin bˈaj tqˈijil tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: And this is the will of him that sent me , that every one which seeth the Son , and believeth on him , may have everlasting life : and I will raise him up at the last day .
text2: Quˈn atzin taj nManjiˈy , tuˈn kykyaqilxjo ma chi tzaj lipe wiˈja , ayiˈn Tkˈwal Dios , ex nqe kykˈuˈj wiˈja toj tkyaqil , atpen kye kychwinqil te jun majx , ex kchi jawil anqˈin wuˈn , aj tjapin bˈaj tqˈijil tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: The Jews then murmured at him , because he said , I am the bread which came down from heaven .
text2: Junjun aj Judiy i ok ten yolbˈil tiˈj Jesús , tuˈn otaq tqˈma qa aku wabˈj ma kuˈtz toj kyaˈj .

text: And they said , Is not this Jesus , the son of Joseph , whose father and mother we know ? how is it then that he saith , I came down from heaven ?
text2: Exsin i ok tentz yolbˈilte kyxolile : ¿ Nyapela a Jesúsjo lo , aj tkˈwal Jse ? Ex ojtzqiˈn ttata quˈn , tukˈaxjo tnana . ¿ Tzeˈntzin ttentz ntqˈmaˈn qa toj kyaˈj ma kuˈtze ?

text: Jesus therefore answered and said unto them , Murmur not among yourselves .
text2: Bˈeˈxsin i xi ttzaqˈwiˈn Jesús : Kytzaqpinxa tuˈn kyyolbˈiˈn .

text: No man can come to me , except the Father which hath sent me draw him : and I will raise him up at the last day .
text2: Mix aˈl jun aku tzaj lipe wiˈja , qa nya nMaˈn saj qˈmante . Ex qa ma qe kykˈuˈj wiˈja , kchi jawil anqˈin wuˈn , aj tjapin bˈaj tqˈijil tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: It is written in the prophets , And they shall be all taught of God . Every man therefore that hath heard , and hath learned of the Father , cometh unto me .
text2: Quˈn kyojjo uˈj kyij kytzˈibˈiˈn yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe , ntqˈmaˈn kyjaluˈn : Chi xel t ‑ xnaqˈtzin Dios kykyaqilch . Tuˈnpetziˈn , kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy qa kykyaqiljo ma tzaj xnaqˈtzin tuˈn Dios , ex qa ma kubˈ kybˈiˈn tukˈa tkyaqil kyanmin , okpin kchi tzajil lipe kyeˈ wiˈja .

text: Not that any man hath seen the Father , save he which is of God , he hath seen the Father .
text2: Mix aˈl jun o tli twutz qMan Dios , qalaˈ oˈkqinxa , ayiˈn , a ẍin tzaj tsmaˈn .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that believeth on me hath everlasting life .
text2: Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , ankye kxel nimin weˈy , atpen te chwinqil te jun majx .

text: I am that bread of life .
text2: Ayin wejiˈy a wabˈj , a qˈol teˈ chwinqil anetziˈn .

text: Your fathers did eat manna in the wilderness , and are dead .
text2: Ayetziˈn qtzan kytaˈẍa ojtxe , i bˈaj waˈn tiˈjjo wabˈj , a maná , a tzaj smaˈn tuˈn Dios toj tzqij txˈotxˈ te qˈol chwinqil te twutz txˈotxˈ ; me kykyaqilx bˈeˈx i bˈaj kyim .

text: This is the bread which cometh down from heaven , that a man may eat thereof , and not die .
text2: Me metzin weˈ , ayin wejiˈy , a wabˈj xkuˈtz toj kyaˈj . Ankye qe kchi waˈl tiˈj , nlayxpin chi kyim kyeˈ .

text: I am the living bread which came down from heaven : if any man eat of this bread , he shall live for ever : and the bread that I will give is my flesh , which I will give for the life of the world .
text2: Ayin wejiˈy wabˈj itzˈ , a kuˈtz toj kyaˈj te qˈol te kychwinqilxjal . Ankye teˈ kxel waˈnte , k ‑ anqˈil teˈ te jun majx . Atzin wabˈj kxel nqˈoˈn , aku nchibˈjila , a kxel nqˈoˈn te qˈol chwinqil tkyaqilxjal twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: The Jews therefore strove among themselves , saying , How can this man give us his flesh to eat ?
text2: Me junjun kyxol aj Judiy i ok ten yolbˈilte kyxolile : ¿ Tzeˈntzin tten tuˈn t ‑ xi tqˈoˈn xjal lo tchibˈjil tuˈn t ‑ xi qwaˈn ?

text: Then Jesus said unto them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Except ye eat the flesh of the Son of man , and drink his blood , ye have no life in you .
text2: Atzin te Jesús xi tqˈmaˈn kye : Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , qa mi xi kywaˈnjiˈy nchibˈjila , a ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , ex qa mi xi kykˈwaˈnjiˈy nchkyˈela , ntiˈ t ‑ xilin kychwinqila tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , ex ntiˈ kyokliˈn tiˈjjo chwinqil te jun majx toj kyaˈj .

text: Whoso eateth my flesh , and drinketh my blood , hath eternal life ; and I will raise him up at the last day .
text2: Ikytziˈn , alkye te kxel waˈn teˈ nchibˈjila ex kxel kˈwan teˈ nchkyˈela , at teˈ tbˈanil tchwinqil te jun majx ; ex kjawil anqˈintl wuˈn , aj tjapin bˈaj tqˈijil tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: For my flesh is meat indeed , and my blood is drink indeed .
text2: Quˈn ajo nchibˈjila , ante wabˈjjo , a twutzxix , ex ajo nchkyˈela , ex ikyxjo , ante kˈwabˈjjo , a twutzxix .

text: He that eateth my flesh , and drinketh my blood , dwelleth in me , and I in him .
text2: Ankye te kxel waˈn teˈ nchibˈjila , ex kxel kˈwaˈn teˈ nchkyˈela , ante ma tzˈok tmujbˈin tibˈjo wukˈiy , ex ayiˈn ma tzˈok nmujbˈin wibˈa tukˈa .

text: As the living Father hath sent me , and I live by the Father : so he that eateth me , even he shall live by me .
text2: Quˈn ajo wipiˈn ex ajo nchwinqila tzajninqe tuˈn qMan Dios itzˈ , a saj smaˈn weˈy . Ikytzin wejiˈy , alkye teˈ kwaˈl wiˈja , at chwinqil te jun majx wuˈn .

text: This is that bread which came down from heaven : not as your fathers did eat manna , and are dead : he that eateth of this bread shall live for ever .
text2: Ayin wejiˈy wabˈj , a twutzxix , a kuˈtz toj kyaˈj te qˈol chwinqil te jun majx . Mikyxiˈ tzeˈnku te maná , a qˈol chwinqil te twutz txˈotxˈ , a xi kywaˈn qtzan qtaˈẍ . Quˈn ayetzin qtaˈẍ , exla qa i waˈn tiˈj , me bˈeˈx i bˈaj kyim . Me ankye te kwaˈl tiˈjjo wabˈj lo , atpen teˈ chwinqil te jun majx .

text: These things said he in the synagogue , as he taught in Capernaum .
text2: Tkyaqilxjo lo bˈaj tqˈmaˈn Jesús , tej tbˈaj xnaqˈtzin tojjo ja te naˈbˈl Dios toj tnam Capernaum .

text: Many therefore of his disciples , when they had heard this , said , This is an hard saying ; who can hear it ?
text2: Atzin tej qbˈintejiˈy xnaqˈtzbˈil lo , ilaˈku lipcheqetaq tiˈj xi kyqˈmaˈn : Kujxix teˈ yol luˈn , tuˈn t ‑ xi qnimin . ¿ Ma atpela jun aku txi bˈinte ?

text: When Jesus knew in himself that his disciples murmured at it , he said unto them , Doth this offend you ?
text2: Ex liwey el tnikyˈ Jesús , qa ayex o chi ok ten chˈotjil tiˈj , ex xi tqanin kye : ¿ Nyapela wenjo nxnaqˈtzbˈila toj kywutza ?

text: What and if ye shall see the Son of man ascend up where he was before ?
text2: Bˈalaqa tuˈn n ‑ ok kykaˈyiˈn nyakuj jun xjalqiˈn te twutz txˈotxˈ . ¿ Me tiˈtzila kyqˈmaˈy , aj nxi kykaˈyiˈn , aj njaxa toj kyaˈj , ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , qˈuqleqinkxa toj nqˈuqbˈila , a jaˈ intinetaqa te tnejil ? ¿ Akupela txi kyqˈmaˈn qa nya wenjo nxnaqˈtzbˈila ?

text: It is the spirit that quickeneth ; the flesh profiteth nothing : the words that I speak unto you , they are spirit , and they are life .
text2: Ajo Xewbˈaj Xjan ntzaj tqˈon teˈ chwinqil te jun majx ; atzin teˈ qxmilil te twutz txˈotxˈ teˈ , ex ntiˈ tajbˈin tiˈjjo chwinqil anetziˈn . Ex ikyxjo , ayejo nxnaqˈtzbˈila twutzxix , quˈn tzajninqe tiˈjjo Xewbˈaj Xjan . Qa ma qe kykˈuˈja kyiˈj , at kychwinqila te jun majx .

text: But there are some of you that believe not . For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were that believed not , and who should betray him .
text2: Me at junjun kyxola , a mi nxi kynimin . Xi tqˈmaˈn ikyjo , quˈn ojtzqiˈntaq tuˈn atxix teˈ tzaj xkye taqˈin , alkye mi chex niminte , ex alkye tuˈn t ‑ xi kˈayinte toj kyqˈobˈ tajqˈoj .

text: And he said , Therefore said I unto you , that no man can come unto me , except it were given unto him of my Father .
text2: Ex xi tqˈmaˈnl : Tuˈnpetziˈn , o txi nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , qa mix aˈl jun aku tzaj lipe wiˈja , qa nya nMaˈn saj qˈmante .

text: From that time many of his disciples went back , and walked no more with him .
text2: Ex tej tbˈaj tqˈmaˈn Jesús tkyaqiljo ikyjo , ilaˈku lipcheqetaq tiˈj el kypaˈn kyibˈ tiˈj .

text: Then said Jesus unto the twelve , Will ye also go away ?
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , tzaj tqanin Jesús qeˈy , a awoˈy kabˈlajaj t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin : ¿ Yajtziˈn kyeˈ , majqexpela kye kchi xel lipe kyiˈj ?

text: Then Simon Peter answered him , Lord , to whom shall we go ? thou hast the words of eternal life .
text2: Me ante Pegr xi ttzaqˈwin : Tata , ¿ Altzin qiˈj qo xela lipeˈy ? Quˈn noq oˈkx te at t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈil , a ntzaj tqˈoˈn qchwinqila te jun majx .

text: And we believe and are sure that thou art that Christ , the Son of the living God .
text2: Ex ma txi qnimiˈn , ex ma tzˈel qnikyˈa te , qa a tejiy Crist , a xjanxix , a Tkˈwal Dios itzˈ .

text: Jesus answered them , Have not I chosen you twelve , and one of you is a devil ?
text2: Tzaj ttzaqˈwin Jesús : ¿ Ma nyatzin ayiˈn o chin jaw skˈoˈnte kabˈlajaj kybˈaja ? Me atziˈn jaˈlin , at jun kyeˈ ma txi tqˈoˈn ambˈil te tajaw il , tuˈn tokx toj tanmin tuˈn tbˈinchin il wiˈja .

text: He spake of Judas Iscariot the son of Simon : for he it was that should betray him , being one of the twelve .
text2: Tqˈma Jesúsjo ikyjo , quˈn ataqtza nyoline tiˈj Judas Iscariot , a tkˈwal Simun , quˈn ataq Judas tuˈn t ‑ xi kˈayinte Jesús toj kyqˈobˈ tajqˈoj , exla qa attaq toklin qxola , a awoˈy kabˈlajaj t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin .

text: After these things Jesus walked in Galilee : for he would not walk in Jewry , because the Jews sought to kill him .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ tkyaqiljo ikyjo , nbˈettaq Jesús toj ttxˈotxˈ Galiley ; quˈn tkyˈeˈtaq tuˈn tkyij ten toj ttxˈotxˈ Judey , quˈn at junjun kyxol aj Judiy kyajtaq tuˈn tkubˈ kybˈyoˈn .

text: Now the Jews ' feast of tabernacles was at hand .
text2: Chˈixtaq tul kanin nintz qˈij kye aj Judiy , a jaˈ nchi najan toj tal pach toj kˈul , noq te jun naˈbˈl tiˈjjo tej kyten qtzan qtaˈẍ toj tzqij txˈotxˈ ojtxe .

text: His brethren therefore said unto him , Depart hence , and go into Judaea , that thy disciples also may see the works that thou doest .
text2: Antza toj Galiley , bˈeˈx i jaw xmayin titzˈin Jesús tiˈj , ex xi kyqˈmaˈn kyjaluˈn : Mi kyij ten te tzaluˈn ; qalaˈ ku txiˈy toj ttxˈotxˈ Judey , tuˈntzin tok kykaˈyin a lipcheqek tiˈja tkyaqiljo nbˈant tuˈn .

text: For there is no man that doeth any thing in secret , and he himself seeketh to be known openly . If thou do these things , shew thyself to the world .
text2: Quˈn qa taja tuˈn tok kaˈyin tuˈn kykyaqilxjal tiˈjjo nbˈant tuˈn , mi kubˈ tewin tibˈa tzaluˈn toj Galiley ; qalaˈ qˈimix tibˈa , ex yekˈinkuy kywutz kykyaqilxjal .

text: For neither did his brethren believe in him .
text2: Xitzin kyqˈmaˈn titzˈin te ikyjo , quˈn naˈmxtaq txi kynimiˈn t ‑ xilin t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈil .

text: Then Jesus said unto them , My time is not yet come : but your time is alway ready .
text2: Atzin te Jesús xi tqˈmaˈn kye : Naˈmx tpon kanin weˈ ambˈil we . Me metzin kyeˈ , tkyaqil qˈij wen te kyeˈy tuˈn kyxiˈy .

text: The world cannot hate you ; but me it hateth , because I testify of it , that the works thereof are evil .
text2: Quˈn nlay chi el ikyˈin kyeˈ kyuˈnxjal . Me metzin weˈ , nchin el ikyˈin kyuˈn , quˈn nxi nqˈmaˈnjiˈy kykyaqil kybˈinchbˈin nya wen .

text: Go ye up unto this feast : I go not up yet unto this feast ; for my time is not yet full come .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , kux cheˈx kyeˈ toj nintz qˈij . Mina weˈ , quˈn naˈm tjapin bˈaj tqˈijil ambˈil te weˈy .

text: When he had said these words unto them , he abode still in Galilee .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ tqˈmaˈn Jesús ikyjo ; axsa kubˈe tene toj ttxˈotxˈ Galiley .

text: But when his brethren were gone up , then went he also up unto the feast , not openly , but as it were in secret .
text2: Kyjawlinxitzin bˈaj titzˈin tzma toj nintz qˈij , ex ikyx te Jesúsjo bˈeˈx xiˈ , me nya kywutzxjal , qalaˈ toj ewajil .

text: Then the Jews sought him at the feast , and said , Where is he ?
text2: Ex i ok ten aj Judiy jyolte Jesús toj nintz qˈij , ex xi kyqˈmaˈn : ¿ Jaˈtzila taˈ tej ichin ?

text: And there was much murmuring among the people concerning him : for some said , He is a good man : others said , Nay ; but he deceiveth the people .
text2: Ex kykyaqil xjal antza i ok ten yolil tiˈj ; attaq junjun nqˈmante : Ajo ichin wen , chi chiˈ . Ex attaq junjuntl nqˈmante : ¡ Mina ! Quˈn nya wen teˈ ichin a , quˈn noq tok sbˈul kyexjalch .

text: Howbeit no man spake openly of him for fear of the Jews .
text2: Me mix aˈl jun xi tkujsin tyol tiˈj kywutzxjal , noq tuˈn kyxobˈil kye kynejil aj Judiy .

text: Now about the midst of the feast Jesus went up into the temple , and taught .
text2: Tzmataq nikyˈjin nintz qˈij , teˈ tokx Jesús toj tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , ex ok ten xnaqˈtzil .

text: And the Jews marvelled , saying , How knoweth this man letters , having never learned ?
text2: Ex nimx aj Judiy jaw kaˈylaj tiˈj t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈil , ex kyqˈma : ¿ Tzeˈntzin tten nimx tumil toj tnabˈl ichin lo , ex ntiˈ o tzˈokx toj xnaqˈtzbˈil ?

text: Jesus answered them , and said , My doctrine is not mine , but his that sent me .
text2: I xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Ajo xnaqˈtzbˈil ma txi nqˈoˈn , nya wekuy ; qalaˈ te Dios , a tzaj chqˈoˈn weˈy .

text: If any man will do his will , he shall know of the doctrine , whether it be of God , or whether I speak of myself .
text2: Alkye te taj tuˈn tkubˈ tbˈinchin a taj Dios , atzin te k ‑ elil tnikyˈjo tiˈj , qa te Dios nxnaqˈtzbˈila , mo qa ayinxa nchin kubˈ ximinte .

text: He that speaketh of himself seeketh his own glory : but he that seeketh his glory that sent him , the same is true , and no unrighteousness is in him .
text2: Alkye jun xjal nyolin tuˈnx tibˈ , ntjyoˈn tuˈn tjaw nimsin kyuˈnxjal . Me anteˈ xjal taj tuˈn tjaw nimsin toklin tuˈn a saj chqˈonte , ante twutzxix tyoljo , ex nya sbˈul .

text: Did not Moses give you the law , and yet none of you keepeth the law ? Why go ye about to kill me ?
text2: Qalatzin kyeˈ nchi yolin tiˈj , tuˈn tjapin bˈaj tkawbˈil Moisés kyuˈn , me mix aˈl jun kyeˈ ma japin tuˈn . Quˈn noqit ma japin kyuˈn , mitla n ‑ ok tilil kyuˈn tuˈn nkubˈ kybˈyoˈntza .

text: The people answered and said , Thou hast a devil : who goeth about to kill thee ?
text2: Xitzin kytzaqˈwinxjal : ¿ Qape yabˈ te ? ¿ Ankye taj tuˈn tkubˈ bˈyontiy ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , I have done one work , and ye all marvel .
text2: Ex xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye : ¿ Ma noq tuˈn tqˈanit jun xjal wuˈn toj qˈij te ajlabˈl , ma chi jaw labˈtey tiˈj ?

text: Moses therefore gave unto you circumcision ; ( not because it is of Moses , but of the fathers ; ) and ye on the sabbath day circumcise a man .
text2: Kxel nyekˈiˈn jun tiˈ kyeˈy : Ate Moisés kyij qˈmante kyeˈy tuˈn tok qitit kyechiljo tal qˈa toj twajxaqin qˈij titzˈjlin . Ex qa toj qˈij te ajlabˈl xjapine ikyjo , me nkubˈ kybˈinchiˈn , noq tuˈn tjapin tkawbˈil Moisés kyuˈn ( me nya tuˈn Moisés tzajniˈn tumil lo , qalaˈ tuˈn Abraham exqetziˈn txqantl qtzan qtaˈẍ ) .

text: If a man on the sabbath day receive circumcision , that the law of Moses should not be broken ; are ye angry at me , because I have made a man every whit whole on the sabbath day ?
text2: Me atziˈn jaˈlin , qa nchi aqˈniˈn toj jun qˈij te ajlabˈl noq tuˈn tjapin bˈaj tkawbˈil Moisés tiˈjjo tuˈn tqitit tal netzˈ techil tiˈjjo t ‑ xmilil jun tal qˈa , ¿ Tiquˈntzin nchi qˈojleˈy wiˈja , noq tuˈn xqˈanit tkyaqil t ‑ xmilil jun xjal wuˈn toj qˈij te ajlabˈl ?

text: Judge not according to the appearance , but judge righteous judgment .
text2: Mi chi kawiˈn wibˈaja noq tuˈn n ‑ ok kykaˈyiˈn ; qalaˈ chi kawiˈn tukˈa jun tumil tzˈaqlexix .

text: Then said some of them of Jerusalem , Is not this he , whom they seek to kill ?
text2: Attaq junjun xjal najleqe tojx Jerusalén i ok ten qanilte kyxol : ¿ Nyapetzilaˈ ichin lo a nchi jyoˈnxjal tiˈj , tuˈn tkubˈ kybˈyoˈn ?

text: But , lo , he speaketh boldly , and they say nothing unto him . Do the rulers know indeed that this is the very Christ ?
text2: Luˈtzin nyolin kywutzxjal kykyaqil , exsin ntiˈ chˈin nxi kyqˈmaˈn te . ¿ Nyapela ma txi kynimin aj kawil qa axix Cristjo lo , a at toklin tuˈn Dios ?

text: Howbeit we know this man whence he is : but when Christ cometh , no man knoweth whence he is .
text2: Me metziˈn qeˈ bˈiˈn quˈn jaˈ tzajnin ichin lo ; me aj tul teˈ Crist , chitzin qa mix aˈl teˈ bˈilte jaˈ tumil ktzajila , chi chiˈ .

text: Then cried Jesus in the temple as he taught , saying , Ye both know me , and ye know whence I am : and I am not come of myself , but he that sent me is true , whom ye know not .
text2: Atzaj teˈ tbˈinte Jesús ikyjo tzmataq nxnaqˈtzin tojjo tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , xi tqˈmaˈn tukˈa tqˈajqˈojil twiˈ kujxix wen : Bˈalaqa ojtzqiˈnqiˈn kyuˈn , ex bˈiˈn kyuˈn jaˈ ẍin tzajiˈy . Me nya wuˈnx wibˈ weˈ ẍin saj ; qalaˈ ma chin tzaj chqˈoˈn weˈ tuˈn jun , a mi ojtzqiˈn kyuˈn , a twutzxix Tyol .

text: But I know him : for I am from him , and he hath sent me .
text2: Noq oˈkqinx we ojtzqilte , quˈn atzin intinetaqa tukˈa toj kyaˈj , ex atziˈn jaˈlin ma chin tzaj chqˈon tuˈn , tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: Then they sought to take him : but no man laid hands on him , because his hour was not yet come .
text2: Tuˈntziˈn tyol Jesús ikyjo , kyajtaq tuˈn tok kytzyuˈn , ex tuˈn tkux kyqˈoˈn toj tze ; me mix aˈl jun aqˈpin tqˈobˈ tiˈj , quˈn naˈmx tpon kanin tqˈijil , tuˈn tkyim .

text: And many of the people believed on him , and said , When Christ cometh , will he do more miracles than these which this man hath done ?
text2: Me nimxxjal i nimin tiˈj , ex kyqˈma : Ax twutz ate Cristjo . ¿ Ma akupela bˈant nim techil tipin juntl , tzeˈnku teˈ ichin lo ?

text: The Pharisees heard that the people murmured such things concerning him ; and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to take him .
text2: Atzaj teˈ kybˈinte Parisey kyyolxjal nkyqˈmaˈn tiˈj Jesús , i jaw labˈte tiˈj , ex i kyij toj wen kyukˈa kynejil pale , tuˈn tkux kyjpuˈn toj tze . Bˈaj xi kychqˈoˈn xqˈuqil teˈ tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , tuˈn tok kytzyuˈn .

text: Then said Jesus unto them , Yet a little while am I with you , and then I go unto him that sent me .
text2: Me tzunxtaq yolin te Jesús , ex tqˈma : Noq jun jteˈbˈin qˈij kchin tenbˈiltla kyxola , quˈn kchin ajil meltzˈaja tkˈatzjo a saj chqˈon weˈy .

text: Ye shall seek me , and shall not find me : and where I am , thither ye cannot come .
text2: Ok chi jyola wiˈja , me nlay chin kneta kyuˈn , quˈn nlay cheˈxa jaˈ kchin tenbˈiliy .

text: Then said the Jews among themselves , Whither will he go , that we shall not find him ? will he go unto the dispersed among the Gentiles , and teach the Gentiles ?
text2: Tuˈntzin ikyjo , i ok ten Judiy qanilte kyxolx : ¿ Jaˈtzila kxela qa nlay knet quˈn ? ¿ Mej qa antza kanin kyxol aj Judiy , noq jaˈchaqku najleqe kyojile tnam kyxol amaqˈ xjal , moj qa ma txiˈ xnaqˈtzil kye xjal nya Judiy ?

text: What manner of saying is this that he said , Ye shall seek me , and shall not find me : and where I am , thither ye cannot come ?
text2: ¿ Tzeˈntzila t ‑ xilin tyol , a saj tqˈmaˈn qe , qa kqo jyol tiˈj , ex nlay knet quˈn , ex qa nlay qox jaˈ ktenbˈile ?

text: In the last day , that great day of the feast , Jesus stood and cried , saying , If any man thirst , let him come unto me , and drink .
text2: Toj bˈajsbˈil qˈij , atzin qˈijjo nimxixtaq toklin toj nintz qˈij , jaw weˈ Jesús , ex xi tqˈmaˈn tukˈa tqˈajqˈojil twiˈ kujxix wen : Qa iteˈ junjun at kˈwaj kyiˈj toj kyanmin , ku kytzaja wukˈiy , ex chi kˈwaˈn .

text: He that believeth on me , as the scripture hath said , out of his belly shall flow rivers of living water .
text2: Alkyejo knimil wiˈja , k ‑ anqˈil jun xlokˈ aˈ itzˈ tojxi tanmin , ikyxjo tzeˈnku nyolin toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios .

text: ( But this spake he of the Spirit , which they that believe on him should receive : for the Holy Ghost was not yet given ; because that Jesus was not yet glorified . )
text2: Atzin tzˈelpineˈ tyol Jesús ikyjo : Ayetziˈn kchi xel niminte , iltaq tiˈj tuˈn t ‑ xi kykˈmoˈn Xewbˈaj Xjan toj kyanmin , tzeˈnku jun xlokˈ aˈ te chewsbˈilkye . Quˈn naˈmtaq tul Xewbˈaj Xjan , quˈn naˈmxtaq taj Jesús toj tqoptzˈajiyil kyaˈj .

text: Many of the people therefore , when they heard this saying , said , Of a truth this is the Prophet .
text2: Tej tbˈaj kybˈiˈn tyol , attaq junjun kyxol xjal kyqˈma : Twutzxix qa ajo ichin lo atzin yolil Tyol Dios , a iltaq tiˈj tuˈn tul .

text: Others said , This is the Christ . But some said , Shall Christ come out of Galilee ?
text2: Me attaq junjuntl nqˈmante kyjaluˈn : Mina . Qalaˈ aku te Cristjo , a skˈoˈnxix tuˈn Dios te Klolqe . Me attaq junjuntl nqˈmante : ¿ Tzeˈntzin tten ikyjo , quˈn aj Galiley te xjal lo ? ¿ Ma tojtzin txˈotxˈ Galiley ktzajile te Crist ?

text: Hath not the scripture said , That Christ cometh of the seed of David , and out of the town of Bethlehem , where David was ?
text2: Quˈn ntqˈmaˈn toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios , qa t ‑ xeˈchil David te Crist , ex qa iltaq tiˈj tuˈn titzˈje tojxjo tnam Belén , a ttanim David .

text: So there was a division among the people because of him .
text2: Tuˈntziˈn ikyjo , bˈeˈx bˈaj kubˈ kypaˈnxjal kyibˈ noq tuˈn tpaj Jesús .

text: And some of them would have taken him ; but no man laid hands on him .
text2: Attaq junjun a kyaj tuˈn t ‑ xi kyiˈn toj tze , me mix aˈl jun ok tzyunte .

text: Then came the officers to the chief priests and Pharisees ; and they said unto them , Why have ye not brought him ?
text2: Ayetzin xqˈuqil te tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , i meltzˈaj jaˈ iteˈyetaq Parisey exqetziˈn kynejil pale , ex xi kyqanin kyeˈ . ¿ Tiquˈn mi saj kyinjiˈy ichin , a xi qqˈmaˈn kyeˈy ?

text: The officers answered , Never man spake like this man .
text2: Xitzin kytzaqˈwin xqˈuqil : Quˈn tuˈn bˈajxi qbˈiˈy txqan yol tbˈanilqex tzeˈnku tyoljo xjal lo .

text: Then answered them the Pharisees , Are ye also deceived ?
text2: Ayetzin kye Parisey xi kytzaqˈwin : ¿ Majqex kye ma txi kyqˈoˈn kyibˈ tuˈn kykubˈ sbˈuˈn tuˈn ?

text: Have any of the rulers or of the Pharisees believed on him ?
text2: ¿ Ma attzin jun qnejil mo jun Parisey o nimin tiˈj ?

text: But this people who knoweth not the law are cursed .
text2: Me oˈkqexjo maˈ xjal , a mi n ‑ el kynikyˈ te Tuˈjil Tyol Dios ; bˈaˈn tuˈn kyxiˈ toj najin te jun majx .

text: Nicodemus saith unto them , ( he that came to Jesus by night , being one of them , )
text2: Me attaq jun Parisey , Nicodem tbˈi , a xtaˈj yolil tukˈa Jesús toj qnikyˈin , ex xi tqˈmaˈn :

text: Doth our law judge any man , before it hear him , and know what he doeth ?
text2: ¿ Ma nyatzin ntqˈmaˈn toj qkawbˈil nlay txi qqˈmaˈn tiˈj jun xjal qa nya wen , a naˈmxtaq qbˈinte nej tiˈtzin t ‑ xilin t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈil ?

text: They answered and said unto him , Art thou also of Galilee ? Search , and look : for out of Galilee ariseth no prophet .
text2: I jaw yasin tiˈj Nicodem , ex xi kyqˈmaˈn : ¿ Mej qa aj Galiley teja ? Kaˈyinkuxa toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios , ex k ‑ elil tnikyˈa te qa mix tiˈx jun yolil Tyol Dios k ‑ elitz antza toj txˈotxˈ Galiley .

text: And every man went unto his own house .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo ; bˈeˈx i bˈaj aj junjun kyja .

text: Jesus went unto the mount of Olives .
text2: Ex ikyxjo te Jesús bˈeˈx xiˈ twiˈ wutz Olivos .

text: And early in the morning he came again into the temple , and all the people came unto him ; and he sat down , and taught them .
text2: Tej qel sqix toj junxil qˈij , meltzˈaj jun majl tojjo tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios . Bˈaj pon chmetlxjal tkˈatz , kubˈ qe kyxol , ex ok ten majl xnaqˈtzilkye .

text: And the scribes and Pharisees brought unto him a woman taken in adultery ; and when they had set her in the midst ,
text2: Ayetziˈn xnaqˈtzil tiˈj ojtxe kawbˈil exqetziˈn Parisey xi kyiˈn jun qya , a knet kyuˈn tzmataq nchi kyˈaˈjin . Kubˈ kywaˈbˈin kyxol tkyaqilxjal , ayeˈ iteˈtaq antza ,

text: They say unto him , Master , this woman was taken in adultery , in the very act .
text2: exsin xi kyqˈmaˈn te Jesús : Ay Aj xnaqˈtzil , anteˈ qya lo tzmataq n ‑ ok tilil kyˈaˈjin tuˈn , tej s ‑ el qkˈulbˈiˈn .

text: Now Moses in the law commanded us , that such should be stoned : but what sayest thou ?
text2: Tojjo tkawbˈil Moisés ntqˈmaˈn qe tuˈn tok xoyit tuˈn abˈj tuˈn tkyim jun qya tzeˈnku lo . ¿ Yajtzin te ? ¿ Tiˈn teˈ ktqˈmabˈil tiˈj ?

text: This they said , tempting him , that they might have to accuse him . But Jesus stooped down , and with his finger wrote on the ground , as though he heard them not .
text2: O txi kyqˈmaˈn ikyjo , noq tuˈn tkubˈ tzˈaq toj jun til kyuˈn . Me bˈeˈx kubˈ mukˈe Jesús twutz txˈotxˈ , ex ok ten tzˈibˈil tukˈa twiˈ tqˈobˈ toj quq .

text: So when they continued asking him , he lifted up himself , and said unto them , He that is without sin among you , let him first cast a stone at her .
text2: Me noq tuˈn tzunx nchi labˈte tiˈj Jesús , jaw weˈks , ex xi tqˈmaˈn kye : Ankye jun kyeˈ a ntiˈx jun til , bˈaˈn tuˈn tok t ‑ xoˈn tnejil abˈj tiˈjjo qya lo .

text: And again he stooped down , and wrote on the ground .
text2: Ex kubˈ mukˈe juntl majl , ex ok tenl tzˈibˈil toj quq .

text: And they which heard it , being convicted by their own conscience , went out one by one , beginning at the eldest , even unto the last : and Jesus was left alone , and the woman standing in the midst .
text2: Atzaj teˈ tok kybˈiˈn ikyjo , bˈeˈx kynaˈn toj kyanmin qa aj ilqe , ex junjunku i bˈajeˈtz ; nejxix i bˈajeˈtzjo xjal o chi tijin , ex bˈajeˈtz lipe kykyaqil . Atzaj teˈ kybˈajeˈtz kykyaqil , tjunalx Jesús kyij ten tukˈa qya .

text: When Jesus had lifted up himself , and saw none but the woman , he said unto her , Woman , where are those thine accusers ? hath no man condemned thee ?
text2: Jaw weˈks Jesús , ex mix aˈl jun xjal attaq , qalaˈ oˈkxtaqjo tal qya otaq kyij weˈ . Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús te : Qya , ¿ Nteˈtziˈn a kyajtaq tuˈn tkubˈ bˈyoˈn kyuˈn ? ¿ Ma ntiˈtzin jun xkubˈ bˈyontiy ?

text: She said , No man , Lord . And Jesus said unto her , Neither do I condemn thee : go , and sin no more .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin tej qya : Mina , Tata ; mix aˈl jun . Tuˈntziˈn , xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús te : Ex ikyqinx wejiˈy . Nlay txi nqˈmaˈn tuˈn tkyima . Qalaˈ , kux txiˈy . Mi kubˈ tbˈinchin jun majljiy il lo .

text: Then spake Jesus again unto them , saying , I am the light of the world : he that followeth me shall not walk in darkness , but shall have the light of life .
text2: Yajxi chˈintl , yolin Jesús kyxolxjal , ex xi tqˈmaˈn : Ayin wejiˈy Tzaj te tkyaqil xjal twutz txˈotxˈ . Ankye teˈ k ‑ okil lipe wiˈja , atpen te tzaj toj tchwinqil , ex nlayx bˈet toj qxopin .

text: The Pharisees therefore said unto him , Thou bearest record of thyself ; thy record is not true .
text2: Atzaj teˈ kybˈinte Parisey tyol ikyjo , xi kyqˈmaˈn te : Axa ma kujsinte tyola tiˈjxa . ¿ Nyapela noq nlaˈjiˈn ? Tuˈnpetziˈn , nlayx txi qbˈiˈn tyola .

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , Though I bear record of myself , yet my record is true : for I know whence I came , and whither I go ; but ye cannot tell whence I come , and whither I go .
text2: I xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Ax twutz weˈ nyol , exla qa ayinxa ma chin kujsinte wiˈjxa . Quˈn toj kyaˈj ẍin tzaja weˈ , ex axsa kchin ajiliˈy . ¿ Ma akutzin chi kubˈ sbˈuˈn tuˈn jun te toj kyaˈj ? Qalatzin kyeˈ ¿ Ma bˈinajtzin kye kyuˈn ikyjo ?

text: Ye judge after the flesh ; I judge no man .
text2: Nchi kawiˈn wiˈja tukˈa jun tumil noq te twutz txˈotxˈ . Me metzin weˈ , mina kubˈ nbˈinchiˈn ikyjo .

text: And yet if I judge , my judgment is true : for I am not alone , but I and the Father that sent me .
text2: Qalaˈ kchin kawila tukˈa t ‑ xilin tumil tzˈaqlexix , a tzajnin te nMaˈn . Quˈn nya njunalx weˈ kchin kawil ; qalaˈ ajin nMaˈn wukˈiy , a tzaj chqˈoˈn weˈy .

text: It is also written in your law , that the testimony of two men is true .
text2: Quˈn tzˈibˈin toj kawbˈil , a nimin kyuˈn , qa il tiˈj kabˈe xjal tuˈn tmeje kyyol noq tuˈn tkujsinte jun tiˈ .

text: I am one that bear witness of myself , and the Father that sent me beareth witness of me .
text2: Ikytziˈn , kabˈe qe qbˈaj : Ayinx wejiˈy jun kujsilte wiˈjxa , ex atzin juntl , a nMaˈn , a tzaj chqˈoˈn weˈy .

text: Then said they unto him , Where is thy Father ? Jesus answered , Ye neither know me , nor my Father : if ye had known me , ye should have known my Father also .
text2: Xi kyqanin te : ¿ Jaˈtzin taˈye tMantza ? I xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Mipe n ‑ el kyetza kynikyˈ wiˈja . ¿ Yajtzilaˈ te nMaˈn ? Noqit aku tzˈel kynikyˈa wiˈja , ex matla tzˈel kynikyˈa te nMaˈn .

text: These words spake Jesus in the treasury , as he taught in the temple : and no man laid hands on him ; for his hour was not yet come .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús tkyaqiljo lo , a tzmataq nxnaqˈtzin tojjo tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , nqayin tkˈatzjo kˈuˈbˈl pwaq te oyaj . Mix aˈl jun aqˈpin tqˈobˈ tiˈj , quˈn naˈmxtaq tpon kanin tqˈijil tuˈn tkyim .

text: Then said Jesus again unto them , I go my way , and ye shall seek me , and shall die in your sins : whither I go , ye cannot come .
text2: Yajxi chˈintl , xi tqˈmaˈntl Jesús kye : Kchin ajil weˈ ; ex kchi jyola wiˈja , me mi chin kneta kyuˈn , quˈn jaˈ ma chinkiy , ntiˈx tumil tuˈn kyxiˈy : Qalaˈ axsa kchi kyimila kyeˈ tjaqˈ tqanbˈil kyila .

text: Then said the Jews , Will he kill himself ? because he saith , Whither I go , ye cannot come .
text2: Ayetzin kye Judiy xi kyqˈmaˈn kyxolx : ¿ Ma okpetzila kˈwel tbˈyoˈn tibˈ tuˈnx tibˈx , tuˈn tqˈmaˈn qa nlay qox , jaˈ tumil kxele ?

text: And he said unto them , Ye are from beneath ; I am from above : ye are of this world ; I am not of this world .
text2: Xitzin tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye : Ayetzin kyeˈ te kumnixqe kyeˈ , te twutz txˈotxˈ ; me metzin weˈ te jawnixqin weˈ , a toj kyaˈj . Ikytzin te twutz txˈotxˈ kyokliˈn ; qalatzin weˈ , nya te twutz txˈotxˈqin weˈ .

text: I said therefore unto you , that ye shall die in your sins : for if ye believe not that I am he , ye shall die in your sins .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , kxel nqˈmaˈn , qa mina ẍinx kynimiˈn qa ayinjiˈy , a xi nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , kchi kyimila tjaqˈ tqanbˈil kyila .

text: Then said they unto him , Who art thou ? And Jesus saith unto them , Even the same that I said unto you from the beginning .
text2: Bˈeˈxsin xi kyqanin te : ¿ Ankyenaj tetza ? Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : ¿ Ma nyatzin o txi nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy te tnejil ?

text: I have many things to say and to judge of you : but he that sent me is true ; and I speak to the world those things which I have heard of him .
text2: At nimku tuˈn nkawiˈn tiˈj . Ex twutzxix nyola , quˈn oˈkx nyolinjiˈy tzeˈnku tzaj tqˈmaˈn nMaˈn , a tzaj chqˈoˈn weˈy , tuˈn t ‑ xi nqˈmaˈn Tyol te tkyaqil xjal twutz txˈotxˈ , quˈn tekuxix s ‑ ok nbˈiniˈy .

text: They understood not that he spake to them of the Father .
text2: Me mix ele kynikyˈ te , qa nyolintaq Jesús tiˈj qMan Dios .

text: Then said Jesus unto them , When ye have lifted up the Son of man , then shall ye know that I am he , and that I do nothing of myself ; but as my Father hath taught me , I speak these things .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye : Ajtzin njaw kyyoˈbˈiˈn a ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin twutz kyaˈj , tzmaxitzin k ‑ elil kynikyˈjiˈy te , qa ayin wejiˈy , a tzeˈnkuxjo xi nqˈmaˈn , ex qa oˈkx nkubˈ nbˈinchinjiˈy tzeˈnku tzaj t ‑ xnaqˈtzin nMaˈn weˈy .

text: And he that sent me is with me : the Father hath not left me alone ; for I do always those things that please him .
text2: Quˈn a tzaj chqˈon weˈy , kukx atjo wukˈiy . Mi ma chin kyij ttzaqpiˈn njunalxa , quˈn kukx nkubˈ nbˈinchinjiˈy a ntzalaj tiˈj .

text: As he spake these words , many believed on him .
text2: Tej tbˈaj tqˈmaˈn Jesúsjo ikyjo , nimxjal i nimin tiˈj .

text: Then said Jesus to those Jews which believed on him , If ye continue in my word , then are ye my disciples indeed ;
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kyeˈ Judiy , aye otaq chi ok lipe tiˈj : Qa ma chi weˈxixa toj tkyaqiljo o txi nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , okpin kchi okil kye twutzxix te nxnaqˈtzbˈiˈn .

text: And ye shall know the truth , and the truth shall make you free .
text2: Ex k ‑ elilxix kynikyˈa tiˈjjo a twutzxix , ex atzin twutzxix ktzaqpil kyeˈy .

text: They answered him , We be Abraham ' s seed , and were never in bondage to any man : how sayest thou , Ye shall be made free ?
text2: Xitzin kytzaqˈwin kyjaluˈn : Tyajil Abrahamqo qe . Bˈajx txaye qkˈayinqe qibˈ te taqˈnil jun aˈla . ¿ Tzeˈntzin toke tyola ikyjo tuˈn qtzaqpeta ?

text: Jesus answered them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Whosoever committeth sin is the servant of sin .
text2: Xitzin tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye : Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy : Kykyaqilxjo nchi bˈinchin il , ma txi kykˈayin kye kyibˈ tuˈn kyok te taqˈnil il .

text: And the servant abideth not in the house for ever : but the Son abideth ever .
text2: Jun aqˈnil ntiˈ toklin tuˈn tok tajlal jun chˈuq xjal toj kyja . Me metzin te kˈwalbˈaj at teˈ toklin toj ja te jun majx .

text: If the Son therefore shall make you free , ye shall be free indeed .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , qa ma chi tzaqpeta tuˈn kˈwalbˈaj , twutzxix ma chi tzaqpeta te jun majx , quˈn at te kˈwalbˈaj toklin tuˈn kytzaqpet ‑ xjal tuˈn .

text: I know that ye are Abraham ' s seed ; but ye seek to kill me , because my word hath no place in you .
text2: Bˈiˈn weˈ wuˈn qa tyajil Abrahamqe kyeˈ , me ¿ Tiquˈniltz n ‑ ok tilil kyuˈn tuˈn nkubˈ kybˈyoˈn ? ¿ Tinquˈn mi nxi kyniminjiˈy nyola ?

text: I speak that which I have seen with my Father : and ye do that which ye have seen with your father .
text2: Ma chin yoliˈn tiˈjjo ma tzaj tyekˈin nMaˈn weˈy . Me metzin kye , atzin kubˈ kybˈinchinjiˈy a tzeˈnku ntzaj tqˈmaˈn kymaˈn kyeˈy .

text: They answered and said unto him , Abraham is our father . Jesus saith unto them , If ye were Abraham ' s children , ye would do the works of Abraham .
text2: Xitzin kyqˈmaˈn Judiy te : A qejiˈy qman , a Abraham . Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús kye : Noqit ax twutz qa tkˈwal Abrahamqe kyeˈ , tzuntla nkubˈ kybˈinchiˈn a tzeˈnkuˈ xbˈant tuˈn .

text: But now ye seek to kill me , a man that hath told you the truth , which I have heard of God : this did not Abraham .
