text2: Qalatzin weˈ , ma txi nqˈmaˈn wejiˈy a twutzxix kyeˈy , a tzaj t ‑ xnaqˈtzin Dios weˈy . ¿ Tiquˈn kyajtza tuˈn nkubˈ kybˈyoˈn ? Quˈn te Abraham ntiˈx chˈin teˈ xkubˈ tbˈinchin ikyjo .

text: Ye do the deeds of your father . Then said they to him , We be not born of fornication ; we have one Father , even God .
text2: Qalatzin kyeˈ ayejiˈy nkubˈ kybˈinchin tzeˈnku nkubˈ tbˈinchin kymaˈn . Tuˈnpetziˈn xi kyqˈmaˈn te : Nya sikyˈaj kˈwalqo qe tzeˈnku te . Junchˈin qe qMan at , a aku Dios .

text: Jesus said unto them , If God were your Father , ye would love me : for I proceeded forth and came from God ; neither came I of myself , but he sent me .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye : Noqit twutzxix kyeˈy qa tkˈwal Diosqiˈy , matla chin ok kykˈuˈjlintza , quˈn tkˈatz Dios ẍin tzajiˈy . Quˈn mi ẍin ula wunx wibˈa tzaluˈn , qalaˈ a Dios saj chqˈoˈn weˈy .

text: Why do ye not understand my speech ? even because ye cannot hear my word .
text2: ¿ Tiquˈn mi npon nyola toj kynabˈla ? Quˈn mi nxi kybˈinjiˈy tkyaqiljo nxi nqˈmaˈn .

text: Ye are of your father the devil , and the lusts of your father ye will do . He was a murderer from the beginning , and abode not in the truth , because there is no truth in him . When he speaketh a lie , he speaketh of his own : for he is a liar , and the father of it .
text2: Atzin kyejiˈy kytata a tajaw il . Tuˈnpetziˈn , ma chi oka te te , ex noq oˈkx kyaja tuˈn tkubˈ kybˈinchiˈn tzeˈnkuxjo taj . Quˈn ate tajaw il o tzˈok bˈyol chwinqil atxix te tnejil . Mi n ‑ ok lipe tiˈjjo twutzxix , quˈn ntiˈ jun yol twutzxix tukˈa . Quˈn noqx nikyˈin yol , quˈn aku tajaw il o tzˈok te ttxuyiljo jniˈ sbˈubˈl .

text: And because I tell you the truth , ye believe me not .
text2: Me metzin weˈ nxi nqˈmanjiˈy a twutzxix , me mi nxi kynimiˈn .

text: Which of you convinceth me of sin ? And if I say the truth , why do ye not believe me ?
text2: ¿ Ankye jun kye aku tzaj qˈmante , qa at jun il o bˈant wuˈn ? Qatzin twutzxjo nyola , ¿ Tiˈ quˈntz mi nxi kynimintza ?

text: He that is of God heareth God ' s words : ye therefore hear them not , because ye are not of God .
text2: Quˈn ayetzin kye xjal te Diosqe , nkubˈ kybˈiˈn kyeˈ Tyol ; me ayetzin kyeˈ nya te Diosqiˈy . Tuˈntziˈn , kykyˈeˈy tuˈn tkubˈ kybˈiˈn Tyol , chi Jesúsjo kye .

text: Then answered the Jews , and said unto him , Say we not well that thou art a Samaritan , and hast a devil ?
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , xi kyqˈmaˈn Judiy te : Twutzxla qe qyol , a nxi qqˈmaˈn tey , qa sikyˈaja , exsin qa tokx jun taqˈnil tajaw il toj tanmiˈn .

text: Jesus answered , I have not a devil ; but I honour my Father , and ye do dishonour me .
text2: I xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Ntiˈ jun taqˈnil tajaw il toj wanmiˈn ; qalaˈ oˈkx waja tuˈn tkubˈ nbˈinchiˈn tuˈn tjaw nimsin tbˈi nMaˈn . Me metzin kye , oˈkx kyajiˈy tuˈn wel kyiˈjliˈn .

text: And I seek not mine own glory : there is one that seeketh and judgeth .
text2: Me mi ẍin ula noq tuˈn njaw kynimsiˈn ; me metzin te Dios , taj teˈ tuˈn njaw nimsita . Ex aku kkawil kyibˈaja , ayiˈy nchi el iˈjlin weˈy .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , If a man keep my saying , he shall never see death .
text2: Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , ankye te kˈwel nimin weˈy , nlayxpen kyim teˈ .

text: Then said the Jews unto him , Now we know that thou hast a devil . Abraham is dead , and the prophets ; and thou sayest , If a man keep my saying , he shall never taste of death .
text2: Xi kytzaqˈwin Judiy : Tzmaxpin jaˈlin , kxel qnimiˈn qa at jun taqˈnil tajaw il toj tanmiˈn . Quˈn ate Abraham exqetziˈn nimku yolil Tyol Dios , a nimxix kyoklin ojtxe , bˈeˈx i kyim . Anajtzin te ntqˈmaˈn , ankye teˈ kˈwel nimin weˈy nlayx chi kyim , chijiˈy .

text: Art thou greater than our father Abraham , which is dead ? and the prophets are dead : whom makest thou thyself ?
text2: ¿ Ma nimxixnajtzintl te toklin tzeˈnku qtzan qtaˈẍa Abraham junx kyukˈa jniˈ yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe , a o chi kyim ? ¿ Ankyenaj tetza toj twutza ?

text: Jesus answered , If I honour myself , my honour is nothing : it is my Father that honoureth me ; of whom ye say , that he is your God :
text2: I xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Qa ma jaw nimsin wibˈa wuˈnx wibˈxa , ntiˈla tajbˈin nyola . Me an wejiˈy ma jaw nimsinwe a nMaˈn , a axjo nkyqˈmaˈn qa kyDiosa .

text: Yet ye have not known him ; but I know him : and if I should say , I know him not , I shall be a liar like unto you : but I know him , and keep his saying .
text2: Me nya ojtzqiˈn kyuˈn . Me metzin weˈ wojtzqiˈn weˈ . Qa ma txi nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy qa mi wojtzqiˈn , jun nikyˈil yolqintlaˈy tzeˈnku kyeˈ . Me twutzxix wojtzqiˈn weˈ ex nkubˈ nbˈinjiˈy Tyol .

text: Your father Abraham rejoiced to see my day : and he saw it , and was glad .
text2: Me ante Abraham , a qtzan kytaˈẍa , nimx o jaw tzalaj tuˈn tlontetaq wulila . Ex o tli noq tuˈnjo tnimbˈil , ex o noj tukˈa tzaljbˈil .

text: Then said the Jews unto him , Thou art not yet fifty years old , and hast thou seen Abraham ?
text2: Xi kyqˈmaˈn Judiy te : Naˈmx tjapin te lajaj toj ox kˈal abˈqˈe , exsin ¿ Tqˈmaˈnnaja qa o tliˈy Abraham ?

text: Jesus said unto them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Before Abraham was , I am .
text2: I xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy : Tej naˈmxtaq tul itzˈje Abraham , ayin weˈ intintaq .

text: Then took they up stones to cast at him : but Jesus hid himself , and went out of the temple , going through the midst of them , and so passed by .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , bˈaj jaw kytzyuˈn abˈj , tuˈn tok kyxoˈn tiˈj Jesús , me bˈeˈx ewin , ex etz toj tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios .

text: And as Jesus passed by , he saw a man which was blind from his birth .
text2: Tej kyjaˈtaq tikyˈx Jesús toj jun bˈe , xi tkaˈyin jun ichin moẍ toj titzˈjlin .

text: And his disciples asked him , saying , Master , who did sin , this man , or his parents , that he was born blind ?
text2: Xi qqaniˈn , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin : Ay Aj Xnaqˈtzil , ¿ Tiˈtzila quˈnil s ‑ itzˈje ichin moẍ lo ; tuˈnpela kyiljo ttata , mo qa tuˈnx til ?

text: Jesus answered , Neither hath this man sinned , nor his parents : but that the works of God should be made manifest in him .
text2: O tzaj ttzaqˈwiˈn Jesús : Nya tuˈn kyil ttata , ex nya tuˈnxjo til ; qalaˈ ma tzˈitzˈje moẍ , noq tuˈn tyekˈiˈn tipin qMan Dios tiˈj .

text: I must work the works of him that sent me , while it is day : the night cometh , when no man can work .
text2: A naˈmx tex qˈij , ilx tiˈj tuˈn tkubˈ qbˈinchin taqˈin a tzaj chqˈon weˈy , quˈn tzul kanin qnikyˈin , aj nkyima , a jaˈ mix aˈl jun aku bˈant taqˈnin .

text: As long as I am in the world , I am the light of the world .
text2: Loqin intiˈnx tzaluˈn , ayin weˈ tzaj kye kykyaqil xjal twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: When he had thus spoken , he spat on the ground , and made clay of the spittle , and he anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay ,
text2: Atzaj teˈ tbˈaj tqˈmaˈn ikyjo , kubˈ ttzubˈin twutz txˈotxˈ , ex kubˈ tbˈinchin chˈin xoqˈl tuˈn taˈl ttzi , ex ok tsuˈn kyiˈj twutzjo moẍ ,

text: And said unto him , Go , wash in the pool of Siloam , ( which is by interpretation , Sent . ) He went his way therefore , and washed , and came seeing .
text2: ex xi tqˈmaˈn te : Kux txiˈy txjol kye twutza tojjo tkubˈil aˈ , Siloé tbˈi ( atzin tzˈelpineˈ : Chqˈoˈn ) . Ex bˈeˈxsin xiˈ moẍ txjol twutz . Atzaj teˈ tmeltzˈaj , otaq bˈant tkaˈyin .

text: The neighbours therefore , and they which before had seen him that he was blind , said , Is not this he that sat and begged ?
text2: Ayetziˈn t ‑ xjalil najleqetaq nqayin tkˈatz tja exqetziˈn jniˈ ojtzqilte , tej nmoˈntaq , i jaw yolin kyxolx : ¿ Ma nyapetzilaˈ xjal lo a moẍtaq , a nkubˈ qe qanil tmobˈitz ?

text: Some said , This is he : others said , He is like him : but he said , I am he .
text2: Attaq junjun nkyqˈmante : Atziˈn . Ex junjuntl nkyqˈmaˈntaq : Nya teˈ , bˈaˈnxi chˈime ikyx kaˈyiˈn . Me axjo ichin nqˈmante : Ikytziˈn . Ayin wejiˈy .

text: Therefore said they unto him , How were thine eyes opened ?
text2: Bˈeˈxsin xi kyqanin te : Tzeˈntzin tten ma bˈant tkaˈyiˈn , chi chiˈ .

text: He answered and said , A man that is called Jesus made clay , and anointed mine eyes , and said unto me , Go to the pool of Siloam , and wash : and I went and washed , and I received sight .
text2: Exsin i xi ttzaqˈwin kye : Atzin ichin , a Jesús tbˈi , xkubˈ tbˈinchin chˈin xoqˈl , exsin s ‑ ok tsuˈn kyiˈj nwutza , ex tzaj tqˈmaˈn weˈy : Ku t ‑ xiˈy ttzi tkubˈil aˈ , Siloé tbˈi , ex txjomil twutzach . Kutzin , nchijiˈy . Ẍinka . Atzaj teˈ s ‑ el ntxjon nwutza , bˈeˈx bˈant nkaˈyiˈn .

text: Then said they unto him , Where is he ? He said , I know not .
text2: Bˈeˈxsin xi kyqanin te : ¿ Jaˈtzin taˈye ichin anetziˈn ? Ex xi tqˈmaˈn kye : Mi bˈiˈn wuˈnch .

text: They brought to the Pharisees him that aforetime was blind .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , bˈeˈx xi kyiˈn kywutzjo Parisey ajo ichin , a moẍtaq ,

text: And it was the sabbath day when Jesus made the clay , and opened his eyes .
text2: quˈn toj jun qˈij te ajlabˈl , kubˈ tbˈinchin Jesúsjo xoqˈl , ex kubˈ tqˈaniˈn moẍ .

text: Then again the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight . He said unto them , He put clay upon mine eyes , and I washed , and do see .
text2: Ayetzin Parisey ok tentl qanilte teˈ ichin : ¿ Tzeˈn tten otaq chi kaˈyin twutz ? Ante ichin xi tqˈmaˈn : Ok tsuˈn xoqˈl kyiˈj nwutza , ex el ntxjoˈn . Atziˈn jaˈlin , ma bˈant nkaˈyiˈnch .

text: Therefore said some of the Pharisees , This man is not of God , because he keepeth not the sabbath day . Others said , How can a man that is a sinner do such miracles ? And there was a division among them .
text2: At junjun Parisey xi kyqˈma : Ajo ichin kubˈ tbˈinchin ikyjo , nya te Dios teˈ , quˈn mina nkubˈ tnimin qˈij te ajlabˈl . Me attaq junjunltl xi kyqˈmaˈn : ¿ Tzeˈntzin tten ikyjo ? ¿ Akupela bˈant tbˈinchin jun yekˈbˈil tipin nimx kyoklin , qa aj il ? Tuˈntzin ikyjo , mix mejeye kyyol , ex bˈeˈx bˈaj kubˈ kypaˈn kyibˈ .

text: They say unto the blind man again , What sayest thou of him , that he hath opened thine eyes ? He said , He is a prophet .
text2: Bˈeˈx xi kyqanin majl teˈ moẍtaq : ¿ Yajtzin te ? ¿ Tiˈtzin te ntqˈmaˈn tiˈjjo ichin , ax jqonte twutza ? I xi ttzaqˈwin tej ichin : Bˈa we wuˈn jun yolil Tyol Dios teˈ .

text: But the Jews did not believe concerning him , that he had been blind , and received his sight , until they called the parents of him that had received his sight .
text2: Me ayetzin kye Judiy kykyˈeˈtaq tuˈn txi kynimiˈn , qa ataqjo a moẍtaq otaq bˈant tkaˈyin , tzmaxix xi kyniminxjo , teˈ kytzaj kytxkoˈn ttataˈ a moẍtaq .

text: And they asked them , saying , Is this your son , who ye say was born blind ? how then doth he now see ?
text2: Xi kyqanin kye : ¿ Atzin kykˈwaljiˈy lo , a nkyqˈmaˈn qa moẍtaq te titzˈje ? ¿ Tzeˈntzin ttentz ma bˈant tkaˈyin ?

text: His parents answered them and said , We know that this is our son , and that he was born blind :
text2: Me atzin kye ttata xi kytzaqˈwin : Ojtzqiˈn qe quˈn , qa a qkˈwaljiˈy , a moẍ te titzˈje .

text: But by what means he now seeth , we know not ; or who hath opened his eyes , we know not : he is of age ; ask him : he shall speak for himself .
text2: Me mi bˈiˈn qe quˈn tzeˈn tten ẍi jqet twutz , ex alkye xkubˈ qˈaninte . Kyqaninxa te ; quˈn ma bˈet tabˈqˈe , ex ax kqˈolte tqanil .

text: These words spake his parents , because they feared the Jews : for the Jews had agreed already , that if any man did confess that he was Christ , he should be put out of the synagogue .
text2: Xi kyqˈmaˈn ttata ikyjo noq tuˈn kyxobˈil kye aj Judiy , quˈn bˈiˈntaq kyuˈn , qa otaq chi kyij aj Judiy toj wen , tuˈn tex lajet jun aˈla toj ja te naˈbˈl Dios , qa ma txi kyqˈmaˈn qa axix Jesúsjo a Crist .

text: Therefore said his parents , He is of age ; ask him .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , xi kyqˈmaˈn ttata : Kyqaninxa te ; quˈn ma bˈet tabˈqˈe , ex ax kqˈolte tqanil .

text: Then again called they the man that was blind , and said unto him , Give God the praise : we know that this man is a sinner .
text2: Ayetziˈn Judiy tzaj kytxkoˈn juntl majljo ichin moẍtaq , ex xi kyqˈmaˈn te : Qˈmantza qeˈy twutz Dios . ¿ Tiˈn bˈaj tiˈja ? Quˈn bˈiˈn qe quˈn qa ajo ichin anetziˈn aj il teˈ .

text: He answered and said , Whether he be a sinner or no , I know not : one thing I know , that , whereas I was blind , now I see .
text2: Ante ichin xi ttzaqˈwin : Qa aj il mo qa minaj ; oˈkx wejiˈy bˈiˈn wuˈn qa moẍqintaqa . Atziˈn jaˈlin ma bˈant nkaˈyiˈn .

text: Then said they to him again , What did he to thee ? how opened he thine eyes ?
text2: Xi kyqanin majljo Parisey te : ¿ Tzeˈntzin s ‑ okiy tuˈn ? ¿ Tiˈtzin xbˈant tuˈn , tuˈn tjqet twutza ?

text: He answered them , I have told you already , and ye did not hear : wherefore would ye hear it again ? will ye also be his disciples ?
text2: I xi ttzaqˈwin : Ma txi nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy ilaˈ maj , me mi n ‑ okx toj kywiˈy . ¿ Tiquˈn kyaja tuˈn t ‑ xi nqˈmaˈntla juntl majl ? ¿ Bˈalaqa kyaja tuˈn kyok lipey tiˈj ?

text: Then they reviled him , and said , Thou art his disciple ; but we are Moses ' disciples .
text2: Bˈeˈxsin i bˈaj ok tentz yisolte , ex xi kyqˈmaˈn te : Ma txi lipey tiˈjjo maˈ ichin anetziˈn ; me metzin qe , axsa qo xela lipe qe tiˈjjo t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈil Moisés .

text: We know that God spake unto Moses : as for this fellow , we know not from whence he is .
text2: Quˈn bˈiˈn qe quˈn , aku te Dios o yolin tukˈa Moisés ; me ante ichin anetziˈn , ntiˈx chˈin bˈiˈn quˈn jaˈ tzajnin .

text: The man answered and said unto them , Why herein is a marvellous thing , that ye know not from whence he is , and yet he hath opened mine eyes .
text2: Me atzin teˈ ichin xi ttzaqˈwin kye : ¿ Tzeˈnxsin tteˈn ikyjo ? Mi bˈin kyuˈn jaˈ tzajnin ichin , ex ma jqet nwutza tuˈn .

text: Now we know that God heareth not sinners : but if any man be a worshipper of God , and doeth his will , him he heareth .
text2: ¿ Nyapela bˈin kyuˈn , qa mi nchi tzaj tbˈin Diosjo aj il ? Qalaˈ nchi tzaj tbˈiˈn aye nchi kˈulin te , exqetziˈn nkubˈ kybˈinchin a taj .

text: Since the world began was it not heard that any man opened the eyes of one that was born blind .
text2: Quˈn bˈajx qbˈiye tqanil tzmax tzaluˈn tiˈj jun xjal , tuˈn tjqet twutz jun xjal tuˈn , a moẍ teˈ titzˈje .

text: If this man were not of God , he could do nothing .
text2: Qa nya te Diosjo ichin lo , ¿ Ma akupetla tzul Dios weˈy tuˈn ?

text: They answered and said unto him , Thou wast altogether born in sins , and dost thou teach us ? And they cast him out .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn xi kytzaqˈwin te : Ntiˈ te tajbˈiˈn tuˈn tyolin qukˈiy ikyjo , quˈn manyor aj ilx te atxix teˈ titzˈjiy . ¿ Ex tajnaja tuˈn qkubˈ t ‑ xnaqˈtziˈn ? Ex bˈeˈx etz kylajoˈn toj ja te naˈbˈl Dios .

text: Jesus heard that they had cast him out ; and when he had found him , he said unto him , Dost thou believe on the Son of God ?
text2: Atzaj teˈ tbˈinte Jesús , qa otaq tzˈex lajoˈn tej ichin toj ja te naˈbˈl Dios , el tkˈulbˈin tibˈ tukˈa , ex xi tqanin te : ¿ Niminxsiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin tuˈn ?

text: He answered and said , Who is he , Lord , that I might believe on him ?
text2: Atzin te ichin xi tqˈmaˈn te : Tata , qˈmaˈntza weˈy ankye , tuˈntzintla nnimiˈn tiˈj .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Thou hast both seen him , and it is he that talketh with thee .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús te : O tlixiy , ex ayintzinjiˈy , a nchin yoliˈn tukˈiy .

text: And he said , Lord , I believe . And he worshipped him .
text2: Bˈeˈxsin kubˈ meje ichin twutz Jesús , ex xi tqˈmaˈn te : Ma txi nnimiˈn , wAjaw .

text: And Jesus said , For judgment I am come into this world , that they which see not might see ; and that they which see might be made blind .
text2: Bˈeˈx xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús : Ma chin ula tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , tuˈn nkawiˈn tukˈa tumil , tuˈntzintla ayejo moẍqe toj kyanmin , tuˈn tbˈant kykaˈyin ; ex ayetziˈn njaw kynimsin kyibˈ , tuˈn kyok moẍ toj kyanmin .

text: And some of the Pharisees which were with him heard these words , and said unto him , Are we blind also ?
text2: Ayetziˈn junjun Parisey iteˈtaq tukˈa Jesús . Tej kybˈinte ikyjo , xi kyqanin te : ¿ Mej qa majqox qe moẍqo toj twutza ?

text: Jesus said unto them , If ye were blind , ye should have no sin : but now ye say , We see ; therefore your sin remaineth .
text2: I xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Noqpetzin ma tzˈel kyetz kynikyˈ tiˈj qa moẍqiˈy toj kyanmiˈn , matla kubˈ najsit kyetza kyil . Me tuˈn njaw kynimsin kyibˈa , ex noq tuˈn kyqˈmaˈn qa n ‑ el kynikyˈa te tkyaqil , at kye kypaj tuˈn kyila .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that entereth not by the door into the sheepfold , but climbeth up some other way , the same is a thief and a robber .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye : Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , alkye jun mi tzˈokx toj tjpel chˈlaj kye rit , ex qa noq s ‑ okx tlimoˈn tibˈ toj jun plaj , ileqˈ teˈ , mo jun bˈyol xjal tuˈn telqˈin .

text: But he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep .
text2: Me atzin teˈ n ‑ okx toj tjpel chˈlaj kye rit , atzin te bˈaˈn kyikˈleljo , ex nchi ok tkaˈyin trit .

text: To him the porter openeth ; and the sheep hear his voice : and he calleth his own sheep by name , and leadeth them out .
text2: Atzin teˈ xqˈuqil chˈlaj n ‑ okx tjqoˈn tjpel , tuˈntzin tokxjo kyikˈlel , tuˈn kytzaj ttxkoˈn trit . Kxel kybˈiˈn tqˈajqˈojil twiˈ , ex chi tzajil tqˈolbˈin tukˈa kybˈi , ex kchi elitz tiˈn toj chˈlaj .

text: And when he putteth forth his own sheep , he goeth before them , and the sheep follow him : for they know his voice .
text2: Ajtzin kyetz bˈaj tuˈn , kˈwel nej kywutz , exsin kchi okil lipe rit tiˈj , quˈn n ‑ el kynikyˈ te tqˈajqˈojil twiˈ .

text: And a stranger will they not follow , but will flee from him : for they know not the voice of strangers .
text2: Me nlayx chi ok lipe tiˈj juntl , a nya kyikˈlel ; qalaˈ bˈeˈx kchi elil oq , quˈn nya ojtzqiˈn tqˈajqˈojil twiˈ juntl , a nya kyikˈlel .

text: This parable spake Jesus unto them : but they understood not what things they were which he spake unto them .
text2: Kubˈ tqˈoˈn Jesúsjo techil lo kywutzxjal , me mix ele kynikyˈ te , tiˈtaq tzˈelpineˈ tyol ikyjo .

text: Then said Jesus unto them again , Verily , verily , I say unto you , I am the door of the sheep .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , xi tqˈmaˈntl Jesús kye : Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , ayin wejiˈy Tjpel Chˈlaj , a jaˈ nchi okxi rit .

text: All that ever came before me are thieves and robbers : but the sheep did not hear them .
text2: Kykyaqilxjo ẍi ul nej nwutza ileqˈqe kyeˈ , mo bˈyol xjalqe tuˈn kyelqˈin ; me ayetzin kye rit mix ẍi kybˈiˈn .

text: I am the door : by me if any man enter in , he shall be saved , and shall go in and out , and find pasture .
text2: Me metzin weˈ , ayin weˈ tjpel chˈlaj . Noq wuˈn , aku chi okxixjal toj kolbˈil , tzeˈnku kye rit a nchi okx ex nchi etz wuˈn , exsin njyet kywa .

text: The thief cometh not , but for to steal , and to kill , and to destroy : I am come that they might have life , and that they might have it more abundantly .
text2: Me anteˈ ileqˈ noq n ‑ ul teˈ tuˈn telqˈin , ex bˈiyil , ex yuchˈil . Me metzin weˈ , ma chin ula tuˈn tten kychwinqilxjal toj tzaljbˈil tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ ex toj kyaˈj te jun majx .

text: I am the good shepherd : the good shepherd giveth his life for the sheep .
text2: Ayin weˈ Tbˈanil Kyikˈlel . Jun kyikˈlel tbˈanil kxel tqˈoˈn teˈ tchwinqil tuˈn tkyim , noq tuˈn kykletjo trit .

text: But he that is an hireling , and not the shepherd , whose own the sheep are not , seeth the wolf coming , and leaveth the sheep , and fleeth : and the wolf catcheth them , and scattereth the sheep .
text2: Me anteˈ a n ‑ aqˈnin noq tuˈn tchjet twiˈ tkˈuˈj , ajtzin t ‑ xi tkaˈyin aj ttzaj xoˈj , bˈeˈx chi kyjel ttzaqpiˈn rit , ex bˈeˈx k ‑ elil oq , quˈn nya te kyikˈleljo , ex nya teqeku rit . Tuˈnpetziˈn , xi tqˈoˈn ambˈil te xoˈj tuˈn tokx kyxol rit , tuˈn kybˈaj junjun , ex tuˈn tbˈajel tiljjo txqantl .

text: The hireling fleeth , because he is an hireling , and careth not for the sheep .
text2: Quˈn anteˈ ichin bˈeˈx k ‑ elil oq , quˈn noq oˈkx nkubˈ t ‑ ximiˈn twiˈ tkˈuˈj , ex nya tuˈn kykletjo rit tuˈn .

text: I am the good shepherd , and know my sheep , and am known of mine .
text2: Ayin weˈ Tbˈanil Kyikˈlel . Ikytziˈn tzeˈnku te nMaˈn ojtzqiˈnqiˈn tuˈn , ex ojtzqiˈn nMaˈn wuˈn ; ikytzin wejiˈy ojtzqiˈnqe we nrit , ex ojtzqiˈnqiˈn kyuˈn . Ok kxel nqˈoˈn weˈ nchwinqil noq tuˈn kypaj .

text: And other sheep I have , which are not of this fold : them also I must bring , and they shall hear my voice ; and there shall be one fold , and one shepherd .
text2: Ex iteˈ txqantl weˈ nrit , a nya iteˈ tojjo chˈlaj lo . Me ilxix tiˈj tuˈn kytzaj wiˈn , ex kchin kˈwel nimin kyuˈn . Junx chˈuq rit k ‑ elile , ex junchˈin kyikˈlel .

text: Therefore doth my Father love me , because I lay down my life , that I might take it again .
text2: Nimx tqˈaqˈbˈil tkˈuˈj nMan wiˈja , quˈn kxel nqˈoˈn we nchwinqil tuˈn tkyim , exsin tuˈn tjaw anqˈin juntl majl kyxol kyimnin .

text: No man taketh it from me , but I lay it down of myself . I have power to lay it down , and I have power to take it again . This commandment have I received of my Father .
text2: Mix aˈl jun aku tzˈel qˈinte nchwinqila ; qalaˈ ayinx weˈ kchin xel qˈoˈnte wibˈa wunx wibˈxa . Quˈn at we woklin tuˈn t ‑ xi nqˈoˈn wibˈa tuˈn nkyima , ex tuˈn njaw anqˈintla wuˈnx wibˈa . Quˈn atzin ma tzaj tqˈmaˈn nManjiˈy weˈy .

text: There was a division therefore again among the Jews for these sayings .
text2: Atzaj teˈ kybˈinte Judiy jniˈ yol ikyjo , mix mejeye kyyol tiˈj .

text: And many of them said , He hath a devil , and is mad ; why hear ye him ?
text2: At junjun qˈmante : ¿ Tiquˈn nxi kybˈinjiˈy xjal lo ? ¿ Nyapela at jun taqˈnil tajaw il tokx toj tanmin , mo qa ma tzˈel txˈuˈj twiˈ ?

text: Others said , These are not the words of him that hath a devil . Can a devil open the eyes of the blind ?
text2: Me junjuntl qˈmante : Mina , quˈn ¿ Ma akutzin yolin jun xjal , a at jun taqˈnil tajaw il toj tanmin ikyjo ? ¿ Akutzin bˈant kykaˈyin moẍ tuˈn jun taqˈnil tajaw il ?

text: And it was at Jerusalem the feast of the dedication , and it was winter .
text2: Jbˈalilkutaq antza , ex toj Jerusalén n ‑ ikyˈsittaq jun nintz qˈij tuˈn tzaj kynaˈn tbˈantliˈn tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios .

text: And Jesus walked in the temple in Solomon ' s porch .
text2: Nbˈettaq Jesús twutzjo ja anetziˈn , a nim telimitz , a tok tbˈi : Te Salomón .

text: Then came the Jews round about him , and said unto him , How long dost thou make us to doubt ? If thou be the Christ , tell us plainly .
text2: Ok kychmoˈn junjun aj Judiy kyibˈ tiˈjile , ex xi kyqanin te : ¿ Ma kukxsin ktenbˈiljiy qxola tuˈn tja kaˈmin qkˈuˈja tiˈja ? Qa axixjiˈy Crist , a tuˈntaq tul te Kolil , qˈmantza qeˈy te jun majx jaˈlin .

text: Jesus answered them , I told you , and ye believed not : the works that I do in my Father ' s name , they bear witness of me .
text2: I xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : ¿ Ma nyatzin o txi nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy ? Me mi nchinx kynimiˈn . Tkyaqilxjo nbˈant wuˈn noq tuˈn tipin nMan , atzin nyekˈin teˈ qa ayinjiˈy .

text: But ye believe not , because ye are not of my sheep , as I said unto you .
text2: Me mi nxi kynimiˈn , quˈn naˈm kyoka te nrita , tzeˈnkuxjo xi nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy te tnejil .

text: My sheep hear my voice , and I know them , and they follow me :
text2: Quˈn noqit o chi oka te nrita , matla txi kybˈiˈn tqˈajqˈojil nwiˈy . Quˈn wojtzqiˈnqejiˈy weˈ , ex nchi ok lipe wiˈja toj tkyaqil .

text: And I give unto them eternal life ; and they shall never perish , neither shall any man pluck them out of my hand .
text2: Ex kxel nqˈoˈn kychwinqil te jun majx , ex nlayx chi kyij naj . Ex mix aˈlx aku tzˈel qˈinkye toj nqˈobˈa .

text: My Father , which gave them me , is greater than all ; and no man is able to pluck them out of my Father ' s hand .
text2: Ma chi tzaj tqˈoˈn nMaˈn weˈy , a nimxix toklin tibˈaj tkyaqil . Quˈn tkyaqiljo a ma tzaj lipe wiˈja teqe nMaˈn , ex mix aˈlx aku tzˈel qˈinkye toj tqˈobˈ .

text: I and my Father are one .
text2: Quˈn junxchˈin qeˈ qteˈn tukˈa nMaˈn .

text: Then the Jews took up stones again to stone him .
text2: Tuˈntzin ikyjo , bˈeˈx bˈaj jaw kyiˈn Judiy abˈj tuˈn tkubˈ kybˈyoˈn .

text: Jesus answered them , Many good works have I shewed you from my Father ; for which of those works do ye stone me ?
text2: Me ante Jesús xi tqˈmaˈn kye : Nimku techil tbˈanilxix ma kubˈ nbˈinchiˈn kywutza , noq tuˈn tipin nMaˈn . Kyxol tkyaqiljo luˈn , ¿ Ankye jun nya wen toj kywutza , tuˈn wok kyxoˈn tuˈn abˈj ?

text: The Jews answered him , saying , For a good work we stone thee not ; but for blasphemy ; and because that thou , being a man , makest thyself God .
text2: Xi kytzaqˈwin Judiy te : Nlay tzˈok qxoˈn te tuˈn abˈj noq tuˈn wen nbˈant tuˈn ; qalaˈ noq tuˈn nxoˈn yol tiˈj Dios tuˈn tyola , a noq jun tal ichin tzeˈnku qeˈ . ¿ Me ma tzˈok tqˈoˈnnaj tibˈa te Dios ?

text: Jesus answered them , Is it not written in your law , I said , Ye are gods ?
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye : ¿ Ma miˈtzin nkux kyuˈjiˈn toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios , a jaˈ tzˈibˈine kyiˈj junjun xjal , tej t ‑ xi tqˈmaˈn Dios kye , qa diosqe ?

text: If he called them gods , unto whom the word of God came , and the scripture cannot be broken ;
text2: Atziˈn jaˈlin , bˈiˈn quˈn , a tzˈibˈiˈn toj Tuˈjil qMan , tzˈaqlexix ex ntiˈ tkyˈi . Quˈn qa ax Dios ok qˈoˈnte kybˈi te diosqe , a ayeˈ i xiˈ kˈmoˈnte Tyol ojtxe ,

text: Say ye of him , whom the Father hath sanctified , and sent into the world , Thou blasphemest ; because I said , I am the Son of God ?
text2: ¿ Tiˈtzin quˈntz ma tzaj kyqˈmaˈn weˈy , qa nchin xoˈn yol tiˈj Dios , noq tuˈn xi nqˈmaˈn qa ayiˈn Tkˈwal Dios ? Quˈn ax Dios el paˈn weˈy tuˈn ntzaj tchqˈoˈn tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: If I do not the works of my Father , believe me not .
text2: Qa mi xkubˈ nbˈinchiˈn tkyaqil techil wipiˈn tzeˈnkuxjo nbˈant tuˈn nMaˈn , nlayx chinx kynimiˈn .

text: But if I do , though ye believe not me , believe the works : that ye may know , and believe , that the Father is in me , and I in him .
text2: Me exla qa mi ẍinx kynimiˈn , me antza k ‑ elile kynikyˈa te te jun majx , noq kyuˈn jniˈ nbˈinchbˈiˈn bˈaˈn , qa a qMan Dios mujle tibˈ wukˈiy , ex qa ayiˈn mujleqin tukˈa .

text: Therefore they sought again to take him : but he escaped out of their hand ,
text2: Antza tuˈn toketaq kytzyuˈn juntl majl , me chebˈe el tzaqpaj toj kyqˈobˈ .

text: And went away again beyond Jordan into the place where John at first baptized ; and there he abode .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , meltzˈaj Jesús tjlajxi Nim Aˈ Jordán . Antza kyije ten tojjo txˈotxˈ , a jaˈ nchi kuxa tqˈoˈntaq Juan xjal toj aˈ te jawsbˈil aˈ .

text: And many resorted unto him , and said , John did no miracle : but all things that John spake of this man were true .
text2: Nimku xjal i xtaˈj lolte Jesús , ex kyqˈma : Exla qa ntiˈ te Juan techil xbˈant tuˈn a nim tipin , me tkyaqilxjo o tqˈma tiˈjjo ichin lo twutzxix .

text: And many believed on him there .
text2: Nimx xjal i nimin tiˈj Jesús tojjo txˈotxˈ anetziˈn .

text: Now a certain man was sick , named Lazarus , of Bethany , the town of Mary and her sister Martha .
text2: Attaq jun ichin aj Betania , Lázaro tbˈi , yabˈtaq . Junxtaq iteˈ kyukˈa tanebˈ , Mariy tukˈax titzˈin Mart .

text: ( It was that Mary which anointed the Lord with ointment , and wiped his feet with her hair , whose brother Lazarus was sick . )
text2: Anteˈ Mariy luˈn , a kubˈ qˈoˈnte jupsbˈil kyibˈaj tqan qAjaw , ex ok ttzqijsin tukˈa tsmal twiˈ .

text: Therefore his sisters sent unto him , saying , Lord , behold , he whom thou lovest is sick .
text2: Ayetziˈn kabˈe qya lo xi kysmaˈn tqanil te Jesús : Tata , ajo tukˈiy Lázaro , a kˈuˈjlin tuˈn , ma yabˈte , chi chiˈ .

text: When Jesus heard that , he said , This sickness is not unto death , but for the glory of God , that the Son of God might be glorified thereby .
text2: Tej tbˈinte Jesús ikyjo , tzaj tqˈmaˈn : Ajo yabˈil anetziˈn nlay japin bˈaj teˈ te kyimin ; qalaˈ noq tuˈn tyekˈiˈn tipin tqoptzˈajiyil Dios , ex tuˈn tjaw nimsit nbˈiˈy , ayiˈn Tkˈwal .

text: Now Jesus loved Martha , and her sister , and Lazarus .
text2: Exla qa kˈuˈjlinxix Mart kyukˈax ttziky ,

text: When he had heard therefore that he was sick , he abode two days still in the same place where he was .
text2: me tej tbˈinte Jesús , qa yabˈtaq Lázaro , axsa kyije tenl kabˈe qˈij , a jaˈ taˈyetaq .

text: Then after that saith he to his disciples , Let us go into Judaea again .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , tzaj tqˈmaˈn qeˈy , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin : Qo meltzˈaj majl toj ttxˈotxˈ Judey .

text: His disciples say unto him , Master , the Jews of late sought to stone thee ; and goest thou thither again ?
text2: Awotzin qeˈ xi qqˈmaˈn te : Xnaqˈtzil , ¿ Ma nyatzin itzqeyin qajlintz antza , ex kyajtaqxjal tuˈn tkubˈ bˈyoˈn kyuˈn tukˈa abˈj ? ¿ Tiquˈnil taja tuˈn tmeltzˈaja antza ?

text: Jesus answered , Are there not twelve hours in the day ? If any man walk in the day , he stumbleth not , because he seeth the light of this world .
text2: Tzaj tqˈmaˈn Jesús qeˈy : Ajo tspikyˈin qˈij oˈkx nweˈ te kabˈlajaj or . Qa nqo bˈet tqan qˈijil , nlay qo jaw takpaj , quˈn nqo kaˈyin toj tqan qˈij , a nkˈant twutzjo txˈotxˈ .

text: But if a man walk in the night , he stumbleth , because there is no light in him .
text2: Me qa nqo bˈet toj qnikyˈin , qo jawil takpaj , quˈn nya qˈanchaˈljo qbˈe . Tuˈnpetziˈn qa nqo bˈinchin tzeˈnku taj qMan , ntiˈ aku tzˈok bˈajqe .

text: These things said he : and after that he saith unto them , Our friend Lazarus sleepeth ; but I go , that I may awake him out of sleep .
text2: Tbˈajlinxitzin tyolin ikyjo , tzaj tqˈmaˈnl qeˈy : Ajo qukˈa Lázaro , a kˈuˈjlin quˈn , ma ktan . Me ma chiˈn kˈasilte .

text: Then said his disciples , Lord , if he sleep , he shall do well .
text2: Awotzin qeˈ xi qqˈmaˈn te : Tata , qa ma ktan , bˈalaqa ma chewx yabˈil tiˈj .

text: Howbeit Jesus spake of his death : but they thought that he had spoken of taking of rest in sleep .
text2: Me atzin tzˈelpineˈ tyol Jesús ikyjo , qa otaq kyim . Me awotzin qe , kubˈ qximiˈn qa nyolintaq tiˈjjo watl te qxmilil .

text: Then said Jesus unto them plainly , Lazarus is dead .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , tzajxix tqˈmaˈn Jesús qeˈy : Ma kyim te Lázaroch .

text: And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there , to the intent ye may believe ; nevertheless let us go unto him .
text2: Nim ma chin jaw tzalaja tuˈn ntiˈqintaqa antza , quˈn wenxix te kyeˈy , tuˈn nxi kynimiˈn tukˈa tkyaqil kyanmiˈn . Me qoqe lolte .

text: Then said Thomas , which is called Didymus , unto his fellowdisciples , Let us also go , that we may die with him .
text2: Ante Tmas , a Kwaˈch tbˈi tok , tzaj tqˈmaˈn qeˈy : Qoqe qkyaqilx , tuˈntla qkyim junx tukˈa .

text: Then when Jesus came , he found that he had lain in the grave four days already .
text2: Atzaj teˈ qkaniˈn , pon qkˈulbˈiˈn qa otaq bˈant kyaje qˈij tkubˈlinx muqet Lázaro .

text: Now Bethany was nigh unto Jerusalem , about fifteen furlongs off :
text2: Ajo tnam Betania nqayin taˈ tkˈatz Jerusalén , bˈalaqa noq nikyˈjin ajlabˈ .

text: And many of the Jews came to Martha and Mary , to comfort them concerning their brother .
text2: Tuˈn nqayin taˈ , nim xjal Judiy otaq kanin qˈolbˈilkye Mart tukˈa Mariy , tuˈn tchewsit kyanmin tiˈjjo tkyimlin kyxibˈin .

text: Then Martha , as soon as she heard that Jesus was coming , went and met him : but Mary sat still in the house .
text2: Tej tbˈinte Mart , qa chˈixtaq tpon kanin Jesús kyja , bˈeˈx etz kˈlelte ; me atzin te Mariy kyij ten tuja .

text: Then said Martha unto Jesus , Lord , if thou hadst been here , my brother had not died .
text2: Tej tkanin tkˈatz Jesús , xi tqˈmaˈn Mart te : Tata , noqit attaqa tzaluˈn , mitla xkyim weˈ nxibˈin ,

text: But I know , that even now , whatsoever thou wilt ask of God , God will give it thee .
text2: quˈn bˈiˈn weˈ wuˈn qa ntzaj tqˈoˈn Diosjo tkyaqilx nxi tqaniˈn te .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Thy brother shall rise again .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús te : Kjawil anqˈintl te t ‑ xibˈinch .

text: Martha saith unto him , I know that he shall rise again in the resurrection at the last day .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Mart te : Ikytziˈn . Bˈiˈn weˈ wuˈn qa ok kjawil anqˈintl tojjo tqˈijil , a jaˈ tuˈn kyjaw anqˈintl kyimnin , aj tjapin bˈaj tkyaqil tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: Jesus said unto her , I am the resurrection , and the life : he that believeth in me , though he were dead , yet shall he live :
text2: Bˈeˈx xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús te : Ayiˈn weˈ Qˈol chwinqil , ex wuˈn weˈ kchi jawil anqˈinxjal kyxol kyimnin . Ankye teˈ knimil wiˈja , exla qa ma kyim t ‑ xmilil , me kjawil anqˈintl wuˈn , tuˈn tten jun chwinqil a nlay bˈaj .

text: And whosoever liveth and believeth in me shall never die . Believest thou this ?
text2: Quˈn kykyaqilxjo nchi nimin wiˈja , ex nchi bˈet tzeˈnku waja , nlayxpe chi najx kye te jun majx . ¿ Yajtziˈn te , Mart ? ¿ Man txi tniminjiˈy luˈn ?

text: She saith unto him , Yea , Lord : I believe that thou art the Christ , the Son of God , which should come into the world .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Mart te : Ikytziˈn Tata , ma txi nnimin weˈ , a tejiy Crist , a Tkˈwal qMan Dios , a iltaq tiˈj tuˈn tul tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: And when she had so said , she went her way , and called Mary her sister secretly , saying , The Master is come , and calleth for thee .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ tyolin ikyjo , bˈeˈx aj Mart qˈolbˈil te Mariy , ex xi tjaskˈin te : Lu Xnaqˈtzil at tzaluˈn , ex luy ntxokle tuˈn .

text: As soon as she heard that , she arose quickly , and came unto him .
text2: Atzaj teˈ tbˈinte Mariy , jun paqx jaw weˈ , ex xiˈ ajqelin lolte Jesús ,

text: Now Jesus was not yet come into the town , but was in that place where Martha met him .
text2: quˈn naˈmxtaq tokx Jesús toj tnam . Axtaqtza taˈye ttxaˈn tnam , jaˈ oke tkˈulbˈin Mart .

text: The Jews then which were with her in the house , and comforted her , when they saw Mary , that she rose up hastily and went out , followed her , saying , She goeth unto the grave to weep there .
text2: Atzaj teˈ tok kaˈyin Mariy kyuˈn qˈuqbˈil kykˈuˈj iteˈtaq tuja , tej tex ajqelin , bˈeˈx bˈaj xi lipe tiˈj , quˈn kubˈ kyximin qa tuˈntaq t ‑ xiˈ oqˈil tibˈajjo muqbˈin te Lázaro .

text: Then when Mary was come where Jesus was , and saw him , she fell down at his feet , saying unto him , Lord , if thou hadst been here , my brother had not died .
text2: Atzaj teˈ tkanin Mariy tkˈatz Jesús , bˈeˈx kubˈ meje t ‑ xe tqan , ex xi tqˈmaˈn : Tata , noqit attaqa tzaluˈn , mitla xkyim weˈ nxibˈin .

text: When Jesus therefore saw her weeping , and the Jews also weeping which came with her , he groaned in the spirit , and was troubled ,
text2: Atzin te Jesús , tej tok tkaˈyin n ‑ oqˈ Mariy kyukˈaxjo jniˈ Judiy , a otaq chi kanin tukˈa , bˈeˈx tzaj tbˈis , ex tzaj chyoˈn tanmin ,

text: And said , Where have ye laid him ? They said unto him , Lord , come and see .
text2: ex xi tqanin kye : Jaˈtzin xkuxa kymuquˈnch . Xi kyqˈmaˈn te : Tata , ku tzaja lolte .

text: Jesus wept .
text2: Ex jaw oqˈ Jesús .

text: Then said the Jews , Behold how he loved him !
text2: Xi kyqˈmaˈn Judiy kyxolile : Kykaˈyinktziˈn . Chebˈex kˈuˈjlintaq Lázaro tuˈn .

text: And some of them said , Could not this man , which opened the eyes of the blind , have caused that even this man should not have died ?
text2: Me at junjuntl nkyqˈmaˈntaq : A ma jqet kywutz moẍ tuˈnx xjal lo , ¿ Ma mipetla xbˈant jun tiˈ tuˈn , tuˈn mi kyime Lázaro ?

text: Jesus therefore again groaning in himself cometh to the grave . It was a cave , and a stone lay upon it .
text2: Atzin te Jesús , bˈeˈx tzaj chyoˈn juntl majl tanmin , ex bˈeˈx tzaj laqˈe ttzi jul , a jaˈ tokxitaq kyimnin , jpuˈntaq tukˈa jun ma tij abˈj .

text: Jesus said , Take ye away the stone . Martha , the sister of him that was dead , saith unto him , Lord , by this time he stinketh : for he hath been dead four days .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kyexjal : Kyimiljiˈy abˈj . Atzin te Mart ; a tanebˈjo kyimnin , xi tqˈmaˈn te : Tata , mala tzuwix , quˈn ma bˈant kyaje qˈij tkyimlin .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Said I not unto thee , that , if thou wouldest believe , thou shouldest see the glory of God ?
text2: Me ante Jesús xi tqˈmaˈn te : ¿ Ma nyatzin ma txi nqˈmaˈn teˈy , qa ma txi tnimiˈn , okpin ktlabˈil te nimxix tipin Dios ?

text: Then they took away the stone from the place where the dead was laid . And Jesus lifted up his eyes , and said , Father , I thank thee that thou hast heard me .
text2: Eltzin qˈiˈn abˈj , ex ante Jesús jax tkaˈyiˈn tzmax toj kyaˈj , ex tqˈma : Tata , nxi nqˈoˈn chjonte teˈy , tuˈn ma chin tzaj tbˈiˈn .

text: And I knew that thou hearest me always : but because of the people which stand by I said it , that they may believe that thou hast sent me .
text2: Bˈiˈn we wuˈn , qa kukx nchin tzaj tbˈinjiˈy , me ma txi nqˈmanjiˈy luˈn teˈy , noq tuˈn kypajjo xjal txolcheqek wiˈja , tuˈntzin txi kynimin qa ate ma tzaj chqˈoˈn weˈy .

text: And when he thus had spoken , he cried with a loud voice , Lazarus , come forth .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ tqˈmaˈn ikyjo , xi tqˈolbˈin tukˈa tqˈajqˈojil twiˈ kujxix wen : Lázaro , ku tetza antza .

text: And he that was dead came forth , bound hand and foot with graveclothes : and his face was bound about with a napkin . Jesus saith unto them , Loose him , and let him go .
text2: Ex atzin tej kyimnin bˈeˈx etz , bˈaltzˈinqektaqjo tqˈobˈ kyukˈa tqan toj t ‑ xbˈalin kyimnin , ex ptzoˈntaq twutz tukˈa suˈtj . Bˈeˈx xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye : Kypoqˈimila , ex kytzaqpinxa .

text: Then many of the Jews which came to Mary , and had seen the things which Jesus did , believed on him .
text2: Tuˈntziˈn ikyjo , nimx Judiy , ayej o chex lipe tiˈj Mariy , ex ok kykaˈyiˈn bˈant tuˈn Jesús , i nimin tiˈj .

text: But some of them went their ways to the Pharisees , and told them what things Jesus had done .
text2: Me attaq junjuntl kyxol bˈeˈx i xiˈ qˈmalte kye Parisey tiˈ otaq kubˈ tbˈinchin Jesús tukˈa Lázaro .

text: Then gathered the chief priests and the Pharisees a council , and said , What do we ? for this man doeth many miracles .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , aye Parisey exqetziˈn kynejinel pale , bˈeˈx ok kychmoˈn kyibˈ kyukˈa jniˈ Judiy aj kawil . I ok ten yolil kyxol : ¿ Tiˈtzin kbˈantil quˈn tiˈjjo maˈ xjal lo ? Nimku techil nbˈant tuˈn , tuˈn kykaˈylajxjal tiˈj .

text: If we let him thus alone , all men will believe on him : and the Romans shall come and take away both our place and nation .
text2: Qa ma kyij qqˈoˈn kukxjo , tkyaqilxlaxjal knimil tiˈj . Ex ayetziˈn aj kawil toj Rom , kchi tzajil qibˈaj qˈil qoklin toj tja Dios , ex tuˈn tkubˈ kyyuchˈin qtanim .

text: And one of them , named Caiaphas , being the high priest that same year , said unto them , Ye know nothing at all ,
text2: Me attaq jun kyxol , a Caifás tbˈi , toktaq te kynejilxix pale tojjo abˈqˈe anetziˈn , ex xi tqˈmaˈn kye : Ntiˈx kye kynabˈl .

text: Nor consider that it is expedient for us , that one man should die for the people , and that the whole nation perish not .
text2: ¿ Ma mixsin n ‑ el kynikyˈa tiˈj , qa wenxitla te qe , tuˈn tkyim jun ichin te qxel , tzeˈnku tuˈn tkubˈ yuchˈj kykyaqil qtanim ?

text: And this spake he not of himself : but being high priest that year , he prophesied that Jesus should die for that nation ;
text2: Me ante Caifás nya tuˈnx tibˈxtaq nyolin ; qalaˈ tuˈn Dios . Quˈn tuˈn toktaq te tnejilxix pale , tzaj tqˈoˈn Dios tqanil te , qa iltaq tiˈj tuˈn tkyim Jesús te kyxel xjal aj Judiy ,

text: And not for that nation only , but that also he should gather together in one the children of God that were scattered abroad .
text2: junx kyukˈaˈ a kchi nimil tiˈj toj tkyaqil twutz txˈotxˈ , tuˈn kymujbˈin te kyibˈ toj kynimbˈil .

text: Then from that day forth they took counsel together for to put him to death .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , ax qˈijjo anetziˈn , bˈeˈx i kyij aj kawil toj wen , tuˈn tkubˈ kybˈyoˈn Jesús .

text: Jesus therefore walked no more openly among the Jews ; but went thence unto a country near to the wilderness , into a city called Ephraim , and there continued with his disciples .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , mix tenil Jesús kyxol Judiy ; qalaˈ bˈeˈx etz tojjo ttxˈotxˈ Judey , ex bˈeˈx xiˈ ttxaˈn tzqij txˈotxˈ toj jun tnam , Efraín tbˈi . Axsa kyije tene junx qukˈiy , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin .

text: And the Jews ' passover was nigh at hand : and many went out of the country up to Jerusalem before the passover , to purify themselves .
text2: Nyataq ilaˈ qˈij tuˈn tul kanin Xjan Qˈij kye Judiy . Tuˈnpetziˈn , nimku xjal aj Judiy bˈeˈx i xiˈ toj Jerusalén , tuˈn kybˈinchin kyten tzeˈnkuxtaqjo nbˈant kyuˈn .

text: Then sought they for Jesus , and spake among themselves , as they stood in the temple , What think ye , that he will not come to the feast ?
text2: Tkyaqilxjal nchi jyoˈntaq tiˈj Jesús toj tnejil ja te naˈbˈl Dios , ex nxi kyqanintaq kyxolx : ¿ Tzeˈntzin kye toj kywutz ? ¿ Jawilpela toj nintz qˈij mo minaj ?

text: Now both the chief priests and the Pharisees had given a commandment , that , if any man knew where he were , he should shew it , that they might take him .
text2: Quˈn ayetziˈn Parisey exqetziˈn kynejinel pale otaq kubˈ kyqˈoˈn jun kykawbˈil , qa attaq jun xbˈinte jaˈ taˈtaq Jesús , ilx tiˈj tuˈn tzaj kyiˈn tqanil , tuˈntzintla tok kytzyuˈn , tuˈn tkuˈx toj tze .

text: Then Jesus six days before the passover came to Bethany , where Lazarus was which had been dead , whom he raised from the dead .
text2: Noq qaq qˈijtaq tuˈn tpon kanin nintz qˈij te Xjan Qˈij . Bˈeˈx xiˈ Jesús toj kojbˈil Betania , a jaˈ najletaq Lázaro , a otaq jaw anqˈintl tuˈn Jesús toj kyime .

text: There they made him a supper ; and Martha served : but Lazarus was one of them that sat at the table with him .
text2: Antza kubˈe kybˈinchin jun wabˈj te aqˈbˈil chjonte te Jesús . Ate Mart nsipintaq wabˈj , ex ajin te Lázaro qˈuqlektaq waˈl kyukˈa tiˈj meẍ .

text: Then took Mary a pound of ointment of spikenard , very costly , and anointed the feet of Jesus , and wiped his feet with her hair : and the house was filled with the odour of the ointment .
text2: Ante Mariy tzaj tiˈn jun tkˈwel qˈanbˈil , nardo tbˈi , a jun wiq jupsbˈil tbˈanilxix wen ex wiyilxix . Ex kubˈ tqˈoˈn tkyaqil kyibˈajjo tqan Jesús , ex jun paqx ok tzqijsin tukˈa tsmal twiˈ . Ex tkyaqil toj ja kubˈ juptzˈaj tuˈn tbˈanil tkˈokˈjil .

text: Then saith one of his disciples , Judas Iscariot , Simon ' s son , which should betray him ,
text2: Me attaq jun t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin Jesús antza , a Judas Iscariot tbˈi , a tuˈntaq t ‑ xi kˈayinte toj kyqˈobˈ tajqˈoj . Xi tqˈmaˈn te Jesús :

text: Why was not this ointment sold for three hundred pence , and given to the poor ?
text2: ¿ Tiquˈnil mi xi kˈayitjo jupsbˈil lo , a wiyilxix wen , tuˈn kyxi qmojin tal yajqe ?

text: This he said , not that he cared for the poor ; but because he was a thief , and had the bag , and bare what was put therein .
text2: Me ante Judas nya nbˈinsintaq kyiˈjjo yaj , qalaˈ kubˈ tqˈmaˈn ikyjo quˈn ileqˈtaq . Quˈn ate Judas toktaq toklin te chmol pwaq qxola , ex tzuntaq jatz telqˈin chˈin tiˈjjo a chmoˈntaq tuˈn .

text: Then said Jesus , Let her alone : against the day of my burying hath she kept this .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús te : Tenkuj . Quˈn ma kubˈ tkˈuˈn luˈn tzmax jaˈlin , tuˈn tbˈant nteˈn te muqbˈil weˈy .

text: For the poor always ye have with you ; but me ye have not always .
text2: Quˈn atzin kye yaj , axsi kchi kˈwele ten kyxola , ex bˈaˈn tuˈn kyxi kymojiˈn noq tiˈ qˈijil . Qalatziˈn weˈ , nya kukx kchin kˈwel ten wejiˈy kyxola .

text: Much people of the Jews therefore knew that he was there : and they came not for Jesus ' sake only , but that they might see Lazarus also , whom he had raised from the dead .
text2: Nimx Judiy i bˈinte qa antza taˈye Jesús toj tnam Betania , ex bˈeˈx i bˈaj xiˈ antza lolte Jesús tukˈax Lázaro , a otaq jaw anqˈintl tuˈn Jesús kyxol kyimnin .

text: But the chief priests consulted that they might put Lazarus also to death ;
text2: Ayetziˈn kynejinel pale bˈeˈx i kyij toj wen tuˈn tkubˈ bˈyet Jesús majx Lázaro tukˈa ,

text: Because that by reason of him many of the Jews went away , and believed on Jesus .
text2: quˈn noq tuˈn tpaj Lázaro , nimx Judiy otaq tzˈel kypaˈn kyibˈ kyiˈj , noq tuˈn kyxi lipe tiˈj Jesús .

text: On the next day much people that were come to the feast , when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem ,
text2: Nimkutaq xjal otaq txiˈ ikyˈsil Xjan Qˈij toj Jerusalén . Toj junxil qˈij , ok kybˈin qa tuˈntaq tkanin Jesús antza .

text: Took branches of palm trees , and went forth to meet him , and cried , Hosanna : Blessed is the King of Israel that cometh in the name of the Lord .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , i ok ten txˈemil txqan t ‑ xaq tze , palma tbˈi , exsin i bˈajetz kˈlelte Jesús , ex i bˈaj ẍchˈin kyjaluˈn : Nimxit tbˈi qMan Dios . Kyˈiwlinxitjo a tzul kanin toj Tbˈi qAjaw . Kyˈiwlinxitjo a nmaq kawil tibˈaj Israel .

text: And Jesus , when he had found a young ass , sat thereon ; as it is written ,
text2: El jyet jun tal bur tuˈn Jesús , ex bˈeˈx jax qe tibˈaj , tzeˈnkuxtaqjo ntqˈmaˈn toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios :

text: Fear not , daughter of Sion : behold , thy King cometh , sitting on an ass ' s colt .
text2: Mi chi jaw xobˈa , ayiˈy najleqe toj tnam Sion . ¡ Kykaˈyinxa ! Luˈ kyNmaq Kawila tzul qˈuqlekx chejil tibˈaj jun tal bur .

text: These things understood not his disciples at the first : but when Jesus was glorified , then remembered they that these things were written of him , and that they had done these things unto him .
text2: Te tnejil , mix ele qnikyˈa tiˈj tkyaqiljo lo , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin ; me yajxi , tej tjax Jesús toj kyaˈj , bˈeˈx bˈaj ul julkˈaj toj qkˈuˈja tkyaqiljo tzˈibˈintaq tiˈj toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios , ex ikyxixsin otaq bˈajjo .

text: The people therefore that was with him when he called Lazarus out of his grave , and raised him from the dead , bare record .
text2: Me ayeqetziˈn xjal iteˈtaq tukˈa Jesús , tej ttzaj tqˈolbˈin Lázaro toj jul , ex tej tjaw anqˈintl tuˈn , tzunx nchi yolintaq tiˈj kyukˈa txqantl .

text: For this cause the people also met him , for that they heard that he had done this miracle .
text2: Tuˈntziˈn ikyjo , i bˈajetz xjal toj tnam kˈlelte Jesús , quˈn otaq tzˈok kybˈiˈn techil tipin tbˈanilxix tiˈj Lázaro .

text: The Pharisees therefore said among themselves , Perceive ye how ye prevail nothing ? behold , the world is gone after him .
text2: Ex mix ele wenjo luˈn toj kywutz Parisey . Bˈaj kubˈ kyyolin kyxolx : ¡ Kaˈn ! Ntiˈx jun aku bˈant quˈn tiˈj , quˈn kykaˈyinxsiˈn ; kykyaqilxjal ma txi lipe tiˈj .

text: And there were certain Greeks among them that came up to worship at the feast :
text2: Kyxoljo xjal a otaq chi kanin ikyˈsil nintz qˈij toj Jerusalén , attaq junjun xjal aj Grecia .

text: The same came therefore to Philip , which was of Bethsaida of Galilee , and desired him , saying , Sir , we would see Jesus .
text2: Ex attaq jun qukˈiy , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin Jesús , Lip tbˈi , tzajnin toj tnam Betsaida toj ttxˈotxˈ Galiley . Aye aj Grecia i tzaj laqˈe tkˈatz Lip , ex i kubˈsin kywutz te : Tata , noq same , qajatlaˈy tuˈn qyoliˈn tukˈa Jesús .

text: Philip cometh and telleth Andrew : and again Andrew and Philip tell Jesus .
text2: Bˈeˈxsin xiˈ Lip , ex xi tqˈmaˈn te Andrés , ex kykabˈilx i xiˈ qˈmalte te Jesús .

text: And Jesus answered them , saying , The hour is come , that the Son of man should be glorified .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye : Chˈix tul kanin nqˈijila , ayiˈn , a Tkˈwal Ichin , tuˈn nkyima , tuˈn njaw anqˈiˈn , ex tuˈn njaxa toj kyaˈj tukˈa tkyaqil nqoptzˈajiyila .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , Except a corn of wheat fall into the ground and die , it abideth alone : but if it die , it bringeth forth much fruit .
text2: Quˈn twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , ikytzin wejiˈy tzeˈnku jun twutz triy . Qa mix xkux miqet toj txˈotxˈ , nlay chˈiy , qalaˈ oˈkxjo tal junchˈin ex ntiˈ tajbˈin . Me qa ma kux miqet toj txˈotxˈ tuˈn tkyim , ok chmetil txqantl twutz .

text: He that loveth his life shall lose it ; and he that hateth his life in this world shall keep it unto life eternal .
text2: Ankye teˈ taj noq tuˈn tok tkˈuˈjlin tchwinqil tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , ok kˈwel najsin tkyaqil . Me ankye teˈ kxel qˈonte tibˈ toj tqˈobˈ Dios , ex mi n ‑ ok tilil tuˈn tiˈjjo tchwinqil tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , apente kkanbˈil jun tchwinqiljo , a nlay bˈaj .

text: If any man serve me , let him follow me ; and where I am , there shall also my servant be : if any man serve me , him will my Father honour .
text2: Ex ankye jun n ‑ ok tilil tuˈn , tuˈn tajbˈin weˈy , bˈaˈn tuˈn tok lipe wiˈja , tuˈn tten junx wukˈiy toj tkyaqil . Ex ankye te n ‑ ajbˈin weˈy , apente kjawil nimsiˈn tuˈn nMaˈn .

text: Now is my soul troubled ; and what shall I say ? Father , save me from this hour : but for this cause came I unto this hour .
text2: Atziˈn jaˈlin , nimx nchyoˈn wanmiˈn tuˈn nbˈisa . ¿ Tiˈtzila kxel nqˈmaˈn ? ¿ Ma okpela kxel nqˈmaˈn : Tata , chin tkloma , tuˈn mi tzˈikyxe wuˈn tkyaqilxjo kbˈajil wiˈja ? ¡ Mina ! Quˈn tuˈnpen teˈ luˈn ẍin uliy . Qalaˈ kxel nqˈmaˈn :

text: Father , glorify thy name . Then came there a voice from heaven , saying , I have both glorified it , and will glorify it again .
text2: Tata , nimsinks tbˈiy wiˈja . Tekuxjo xi tqˈmaˈn yol anetziˈn , bˈijte jun tqˈajqˈojil wibˈaj toj kyaˈj , a tqˈma : O jaw nnimsiˈn nbˈiy , ex kjawil nnimsiˈn juntl majla .

text: The people therefore , that stood by , and heard it , said that it thundered : others said , An angel spake to him .
text2: Ayetziˈn xjal iteˈtaq tkˈatz , te kybˈinte yol luˈn , xi kyqˈmaˈn kyxolile , qa noq jun qˈankyaq jaw tinin . Me junjuntl qˈmante qa jun angel tzaj yolin tukˈa .

text: Jesus answered and said , This voice came not because of me , but for your sakes .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye : Nya noq te qˈuqbˈil nkˈuˈja saje yolin teˈ tqˈajqˈojil wiˈbˈaj ; qalaˈ te qˈuqbˈil kykˈuˈja wiˈja .

text: Now is the judgment of this world : now shall the prince of this world be cast out .
text2: Quˈn atzin jaˈlin , chˈixxix tul kanin tqˈijil te kykyaqil xjal twutz txˈotxˈ , tuˈn kyok toj paˈbˈin twutz Dios , ex ilxix tiˈj tuˈn tex lajet tajaw il , quˈn twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , qa kˈwel tiˈj wuˈn te jun majx .

text: And I , if I be lifted up from the earth , will draw all men unto me .
text2: Quˈn ajtzin njaw qˈoˈn twutz tze tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , ktzajil nchmoˈn kykyaqil xjal wuˈnx wibˈxa .

text: This he said , signifying what death he should die .
text2: Tukˈa yol anetziˈn ; nyekˈin Jesús tzeˈn tumil tuˈn tkyime .

text: The people answered him , We have heard out of the law that Christ abideth for ever : and how sayest thou , The Son of man must be lifted up ? who is this Son of man ?
text2: Xi kytzaqˈwin xjal : ¿ Ma nyatzin tzun ntqˈmaˈn toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios , qa ate Crist il tiˈj tuˈn tten te jun majx ? ¿ Tzeˈntzin ttentz ntqˈmaˈntza , qa ajo Tkˈwal Ichin il tiˈj tuˈn tjaw twutz cruz tuˈn tkyim ? ¿ Tzeˈntzin tzˈelpineˈ Tkˈwal Ichin ?

text: Then Jesus said unto them , Yet a little while is the light with you . Walk while ye have the light , lest darkness come upon you : for he that walketh in darkness knoweth not whither he goeth .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús kye : Ayin weˈ spikyˈin loqiˈn intiˈnx kyxola . Me noq te jun paql intiˈn kyukˈiy . Tuˈnpetziˈn , chi lipeka tiˈjjo spikyˈin , tuˈntzin mi chi kyijiˈy toj qxopin . Quˈn ankye teˈ nbˈet toj qxopin , ntiˈ bˈiˈn tuˈn jaˈtzin t ‑ xiye .

text: While ye have light , believe in the light , that ye may be the children of light . These things spake Jesus , and departed , and did hide himself from them .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , kyniminxjiˈy spikyˈin , a luˈ atx chˈintl kyukˈiy , tuˈntzin kyoka te jun xjal aj spikyˈin . Tbˈajlinxiˈ tqˈmaˈn Jesús ikyjo , bˈeˈx el tewin tibˈ kywutz .

text: But though he had done so many miracles before them , yet they believed not on him :
text2: Mix tuˈn nimx techil tipin Jesús o bˈant tuˈn kywutzxjal , me mix i niminix tiˈj .

text: That the saying of Esaias the prophet might be fulfilled , which he spake , Lord , who hath believed our report ? and to whom hath the arm of the Lord been revealed ?
text2: Tukˈajo lo , japin bˈajjo tyol Isaías , a yolil Tyol Dios ojtxe , tej tkubˈ ttzˈibˈin : Tata , ¿ Ankye ma txi niminte Tbˈanil Tqanil tiˈja , a ma txi qqˈmaˈn ? ¿ Altzila qe xaye tyekˈin tAjaw Tkyaqil toklin Tkawbˈil kyibˈaj ?

text: Therefore they could not believe , because that Esaias said again ,
text2: Exla qa ikyjo , nlayx txi kynimin , quˈn atx juntl yol kyij ttzˈibˈin Isaías kyjaluˈn :

text: He hath blinded their eyes , and hardened their heart ; that they should not see with their eyes , nor understand with their heart , and be converted , and I should heal them .
text2: Quˈn ax Dios s ‑ ok moẍsinte kywutz , ex s ‑ ok chˈuẍsinte kyanmin , tuˈntzin mi tzˈele kynikyˈ te tuˈn kywutz . Ex tuˈn mi kybˈiye tuˈn kyanmin . Ex ntiˈx ma chi meltzˈaj wukˈiy , tuˈn kykubˈ nqˈaniˈn .

text: These things said Esaias , when he saw his glory , and spake of him .
text2: Kyij ttzˈibˈin Isaías ikyjo , quˈn otaq tli nimx toklin Jesús , exsin nyolintaq tiˈj , a naˈmtaq tul kanin Jesús twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: Nevertheless among the chief rulers also many believed on him ; but because of the Pharisees they did not confess him , lest they should be put out of the synagogue :
text2: Me kyxol tkyaqiljo luˈn , attaq junjun Judiy i nimin tiˈj Jesús , ex majxpe junjun nejinel kyxol . Me mix kubˈe kychikybˈin kywutzxjal noq tuˈnjo kyxobˈil kye Parisey , tuˈn mi chi exe lajoˈn tiˈjjo kyoklin tojjo ja te kynaˈbˈl Dios aj Judiy .

text: For they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God .
text2: Quˈn wenxixtaq toj kywutz , tuˈn kyja nimsin kyuˈnxjal tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , tzeˈnku tuˈn kyja nimsin tuˈn Dios toj kyaˈj .

text: Jesus cried and said , He that believeth on me , believeth not on me , but on him that sent me .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús tukˈa tqˈajqˈojil twiˈ : Ankye te knimil wiˈja , nya oˈkqinxa kchin xel tnimin ; qalaˈ aku nMaˈn , a tzaj chqˈon weˈy .

text: And he that seeth me seeth him that sent me .
text2: Ex ankye te ma chin tliˈy , ex ma tli Dios , a tzaj chqˈon weˈy .

text: I am come a light into the world , that whosoever believeth on me should not abide in darkness .
text2: Quˈn ayin wejiˈy tspikyˈin Dios , a ma tzul tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , tuˈntzin alkye knimil wiˈja nlayxpen kyijx teˈ toj qxopin .

text: And if any man hear my words , and believe not , I judge him not : for I came not to judge the world , but to save the world .
text2: Me qa at jun ma bˈinte nyola , ex mi xi tnimin , ok najil teˈ ; me nya npaja , quˈn nya ma chin ula tuˈn nkawiˈn kyibˈaj kykyaqil xjal , qalaˈ noq tuˈn kyklet wuˈn .

text: He that rejecteth me , and receiveth not my words , hath one that judgeth him : the word that I have spoken , the same shall judge him in the last day .
text2: Ex ankye k ‑ elil ikyˈin weˈy , ex mi xi tbˈin nyola , at jun kkawil tibˈaj ; ayexjo yol , a o cheˈx nqˈmaˈn . Ex ayexsin kchi kawiljo tiˈj toj paˈbˈin twutz Dios , aj tjapin bˈaj tqˈijil tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: For I have not spoken of myself ; but the Father which sent me , he gave me a commandment , what I should say , and what I should speak .
text2: Quˈn ayejo nyola ex tkyaqil nxnaqˈtzbˈila nya weqekuy ; qalaˈ te nMaˈn , a tzaj chqˈoˈn weˈy .

text: And I know that his commandment is life everlasting : whatsoever I speak therefore , even as the Father said unto me , so I speak .
text2: Bˈiˈn weˈ wuˈn qa ayejo Tyol Dios ma chi tzaj tqˈmaˈn , ayetzin ttxuyil chwinqiljo te jun majx . Tuˈnpetziˈn , oˈkx nxi nqˈmaˈnjiˈy tzeˈnkuxjo ma tzaj nikˈuˈn weˈy tuˈn nMaˈn .

text: Now before the feast of the passover , when Jesus knew that his hour was come that he should depart out of this world unto the Father , having loved his own which were in the world , he loved them unto the end .
text2: Atzin teˈ tjapin kanin tqˈijil nintz qˈij te Waˈj Pan , bˈiˈntaq tuˈn Jesús , qa iltaq tiˈj tuˈn tkyim , ex tuˈn taj tukˈa tMan toj kyaˈj . Kukx nkˈuˈjlintaqjo kyiˈjjo aye otaq chi ok lipe tiˈj tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ . Me atzin jaˈlin , tajtaq tuˈn t ‑ xi tyekˈin tkyaqil t ‑ xilin tqˈaqˈbˈil tkˈuˈj .

text: And supper being ended , the devil having now put into the heart of Judas Iscariot , Simon ' s son , to betray him ;
text2: Ex kyjaˈtaq qxiˈy waˈl , otaq kuˈx tajaw il toj tanmin Judas , tkˈwal jun xjal , Simun tbˈi , tuˈn t ‑ xiˈ kˈayilte Jesús toj kyqˈobˈ tajqˈoj .

text: Jesus knowing that the Father had given all things into his hands , and that he was come from God , and went to God ;
text2: Me bˈintaql te Jesús tuˈn , qa tukˈa Dios otaq tzaje , ex iltaq tiˈj tuˈn taj tukˈa juntl majl , ex ax Dios o tzaj qˈonte toklin tibˈaj tkyaqil .

text: He riseth from supper , and laid aside his garments ; and took a towel , and girded himself .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , a tzmataq nqo waˈn , ja weˈks tiˈj meẍ , el tiˈn ttxoˈw , ex ok tbˈaltzˈin jun bˈuˈẍ tiˈj tkˈuˈj ,

text: After that he poureth water into a bason , and began to wash the disciples ' feet , and to wipe them with the towel wherewith he was girded .
text2: ex kux tqoˈn aˈ toj jun txˈajbˈil , ex ok ten txjol qqaˈn , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin , ex i el ttzqijsin tuˈn bˈuˈẍ , a otaq tzˈok tbˈaltzˈin tiˈj tkˈuˈj .

text: Then cometh he to Simon Peter : and Peter saith unto him , Lord , dost thou wash my feet ?
text2: Me atzaj teˈ tpon kanin tuˈn kyel txjet tqan Simun Pegr , xi tqˈmaˈn Pegr te : WAjaw , ¿ Ma attzin we woklin tuˈn tel ttxjoˈn nqaˈn ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , What I do thou knowest not now ; but thou shalt know hereafter .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús te : Nlay tzˈel tnikyˈa tiˈjjo nbˈant wuˈn jaˈlin , me yajxi , k ‑ elil tnikyˈa te .

text: Peter saith unto him , Thou shalt never wash my feet . Jesus answered him , If I wash thee not , thou hast no part with me .
text2: Me ante Pegr xi tqˈmaˈn : Nlayx ntziyiˈy jun maj tuˈn tel ttxjoˈn nqaˈn . Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Qa mi s ‑ el ntxjoˈn tqan , ntiˈxpen toklintza wukˈiy .

text: Simon Peter saith unto him , Lord , not my feet only , but also my hands and my head .
text2: Xitzin tqˈmaˈn Pegr te : WAjaw , qa ikytzjo , nya noq oˈkqex nqaˈn , qalaˈ txjonqemila nqˈobˈa majx tukˈa nwiˈy , tuˈntzintla at ‑ xix woklintza tukˈiy .

text: Jesus saith to him , He that is washed needeth not save to wash his feet , but is clean every whit : and ye are clean , but not all .
text2: Me ante Jesús xi tqˈmaˈn te : Ankye te tzmax bˈaj txjet , nya il tiˈj tuˈn tel txjet juntl majl , qalaˈ oˈkqexjo tqan , tuˈntzin tsaqix tkyaqil . Me tzeˈnku kyeˈ ma chi saqix kyeˈ , exla qa nya kykyaqilxa .

text: For he knew who should betray him ; therefore said he , Ye are not all clean .
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn ikyjo : Nya kykyaqilxa ma chi saqixa , quˈn bˈiˈntaq tuˈn , alkye tuˈn t ‑ xi kˈayinte toj kyqˈobˈ aj il .

text: So after he had washed their feet , and had taken his garments , and was set down again , he said unto them , Know ye what I have done to you ?
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ttxjoˈn qqaˈn , ok tqˈoˈn Jesús ttxoˈw , ex ok qe juntl majl tiˈj meẍ , ex tzaj tqˈmaˈn qeˈy : ¿ Man tzˈel kynikyˈa tiˈjjo xbˈant wuˈn kyxola ?

text: Ye call me Master and Lord : and ye say well ; for so I am .
text2: Quˈn n ‑ ok kyqˈoˈn nbˈiˈy te Xnaqˈtzil ex te kyAjawa . Twutzx kye kyuˈn , quˈn ayintzinjiˈy .

text: If I then , your Lord and Master , have washed your feet ; ye also ought to wash one another ' s feet .
text2: Exsin qa ayinjiˈy Xnaqˈtzil ex kyAjawa , a ma tzˈel ntxjoˈn kyqaˈn , ikyqexsin kyejiˈy , bˈaˈntla tuˈn tel kytxjoˈn kyqaˈn jun tukˈa juntl .

text: For I have given you an example , that ye should do as I have done to you .
text2: Ma kubˈ nqˈoˈn jun yekˈbˈil , tuˈntzin tkubˈ kybˈinchiˈn tzeˈnkuxjo ma kubˈ nbˈinchiˈn kywutza .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , The servant is not greater than his lord ; neither he that is sent greater than he that sent him .
text2: Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , mix aˈl junte aqˈnil nimxtl toklin tzeˈnku te tajaw aqˈuntl ; ex mix aˈl junte , a chqˈoˈn nimxtl toklin tzeˈnku saj chqˈonte .

text: If ye know these things , happy are ye if ye do them .
text2: Qa ma tzˈel kynikyˈa te tkyaqiljo lo , ex qa ma kubˈ kybˈinchiˈn ikyjo , at tkyˈiwbˈil Dios kyibˈaja te jun majx .

text: I speak not of you all : I know whom I have chosen : but that the scripture may be fulfilled , He that eateth bread with me hath lifted up his heel against me .
text2: Mi nchin yoliˈn kyiˈja kykyaqila . Quˈn ojtzqiˈn wuˈn ankye qe o chi jaw nskˈoˈn . Me ilxix tiˈj tuˈn tbˈajjo tzeˈnku ntqˈmaˈn toj Tuˈjil Tyol Dios : Ankye jun nwaˈn wukˈiy , kjawil meltzˈaj wiˈja .

text: Now I tell you before it come , that , when it is come to pass , ye may believe that I am he .
text2: Nxi nqˈmanjiˈy luˈn kyeˈy , a naˈmxtaq tbˈaj , tuˈntzin aj tbˈajjo ikyjo , kxel kynimin qa ayin wejiˈy junx nteˈn tukˈa nMaˈn , a loqin nchin yoliˈn kyukˈiy .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that receiveth whomsoever I send receiveth me ; and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me .
text2: Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy : Ankye te kxel kˈmoˈn teˈ a kxel nchqˈoˈn , ayiˈn chin xel tkˈmoˈn . Ex ankye te kxel kˈmoˈn weˈy , a nMaˈn kxel tkˈmoˈn , a tzaj chqˈoˈn weˈy .

text: When Jesus had thus said , he was troubled in spirit , and testified , and said , Verily , verily , I say unto you , that one of you shall betray me .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ tqˈmaˈn Jesús tkyaqiljo lo , tzaj chyoˈn tanmin tuˈn tbˈis , ex tzaj tqˈmaˈn qeˈy : Twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy . At jun kyeˈ k ‑ okil meltzˈaj wiˈja .

text: Then the disciples looked one on another , doubting of whom he spake .
text2: Me awotzin qeˈ , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin noqx o jaw kaˈylaja toj qwutza , ex mix ele qnikyˈa te alqiˈj nyolinetaq .

text: Now there was leaning on Jesus ' bosom one of his disciples , whom Jesus loved .
text2: Me ayintaq weˈ intiˈn antza , nchin waˈntaqa ttxlaj Jesús . Nimx tqˈaqˈbˈil tkˈuˈj wiˈja .

text: Simon Peter therefore beckoned to him , that he should ask who it should be of whom he spake .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , xi tyekˈin Simun Pegr tqˈobˈ te jun techil , tuˈn t ‑ xi nqaniˈn te Jesús alqiˈj nyolineˈtaq .

text: He then lying on Jesus ' breast saith unto him , Lord , who is it ?
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , in xi laqˈexixa tkˈatz , ex xi nqaniˈn te : WAjaw , ¿ Altzila kye ?

text: Jesus answered , He it is , to whom I shall give a sop , when I have dipped it . And when he had dipped the sop , he gave it to Judas Iscariot , the son of Simon .
text2: Tzaj ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Kˈwelix wakˈsin chˈin pan , ex anqe kxel nqˈoniˈy , atziˈn . Ikytziˈn , kux takˈsin jun piẍ pan toj laq , exsin xi tqˈoˈn te Judas Iscariot , a tkˈwal Simun .

text: And after the sop Satan entered into him . Then said Jesus unto him , That thou doest , do quickly .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ twaˈn Judas , bˈeˈx okx tajaw il toj tanmin . Tuˈnpetziˈn , xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús te : Atzin tuˈn tkubˈ tbˈinchiˈn , bˈinchinkutziˈn jaˈlinxix .

text: Now no man at the table knew for what intent he spake this unto him .
text2: Me nipe tuˈn ikyjo , mix ele qnikyˈa te , tiquˈn xi tqˈmaˈn ikyjo .

text: For some of them thought , because Judas had the bag , that Jesus had said unto him , Buy those things that we have need of against the feast ; or , that he should give something to the poor .
text2: Quˈn ataq Judas qˈilte chˈuˈẍ tkˈwel pwaq , at junjunqe kubˈ ximinte , qa xi tqˈmaˈn tuˈntaq txiˈ Judas laqˈolte chˈin qwaˈy tuˈn tajbˈin toj nintz qˈij , moj qa tuˈn t ‑ xiˈ qˈol chˈin pwaq kye tal yaj .

text: He then having received the sop went immediately out : and it was night .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ twaˈn Judas pan , bˈeˈx ex toj qnikyˈin .

text: Therefore , when he was gone out , Jesus said , Now is the Son of man glorified , and God is glorified in him .
text2: Telintzxi Judas , tzaj tqˈmaˈnl Jesús qeˈy , awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin : Chˈix nkyim weˈ jaˈlin , a ayiˈn Tkˈwal Ichin , tuˈntzin tnimsit tbˈi nMan Dios .

text: If God be glorified in him , God shall also glorify him in himself , and shall straightway glorify him .
text2: Ma japin bˈaj tajbˈil nMaˈn wuˈn tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , noq tuˈn tnimsit tbˈi . Tuˈnpetziˈn , ktzajil tqˈoˈn wokliˈn liwey , tuˈn nteˈn tukˈa toj kyaˈj tukˈa tkyaqil nqoptzˈajiyila .

text: Little children , yet a little while I am with you . Ye shall seek me : and as I said unto the Jews , Whither I go , ye cannot come ; so now I say to you .
text2: Nimxix tqˈaqˈbˈil nkˈuˈja kyiˈja . Nya nim tqan chin tenbˈiltla kyukˈiy jaˈlin . Ok chi jyola wiˈja , me ikytziˈn tzeˈnku xi nqˈmaˈn kye aj Judiy , ex kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy jaˈlin , nlayx cheˈxa jaˈ kchin xeliy .

text: A new commandment I give unto you , That ye love one another ; as I have loved you , that ye also love one another .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , kxel nqˈoˈn jun akˈaj nukˈbˈil kyeˈy : Tuˈn kykˈuˈjlin te kyibˈa jun tukˈa juntl , ikytziˈn tzeˈnku ma chi ok nkˈuˈjliˈn . Ikytzin kyejiˈy , kykˈuˈjlink kyibˈa kyxolxa .

text: By this shall all men know that ye are my disciples , if ye have love one to another .
text2: Qa ma tzˈok kykˈuˈjliˈn kyibˈa kyxolxa , kykyaqilx xjal k ‑ elil kynikyˈ kyiˈja , qa nxnaqˈtzbˈinqiˈy .

text: Simon Peter said unto him , Lord , whither goest thou ? Jesus answered him , Whither I go , thou canst not follow me now ; but thou shalt follow me afterwards .
text2: Xi tqanin Simun Pegr te Jesús : WAjaw , ¿ Jaˈtzin kxela te ? Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : A jaˈ kchin xeliˈy , nlayx txi lipey wiˈja jaˈlinxix , me ok kxel lipey wiˈja yajxi chˈintl .

text: Peter said unto him , Lord , why cannot I follow thee now ? I will lay down my life for thy sake .
text2: Me ante Pegr xi tqˈmaˈn : WAjaw , ¿ Tiquˈnil nlay chinx lipeˈy tiˈja jaˈlin ? ¿ Ma nyatzin ma bˈant weˈ nteˈn tuˈn t ‑ xi nqˈoˈn nchwinqila , tuˈn nkyima tuˈn tpaja ?

text: Jesus answered him , Wilt thou lay down thy life for my sake ? Verily , verily , I say unto thee , The cock shall not crow , till thou hast denied me thrice .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : ¿ Ma ax twutz , ma bˈant te tteˈn tuˈn tkyima tuˈn npaja ? Me twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn tey , qa naˈmxtaq toqˈ tman ekyˈ , kchin kˈwel tewiˈn oxe maj kywutzxjal , ex kxel tqˈmaˈn , qa nya ojtzqiˈnqiˈn tuˈn .

text: Let not your heart be troubled : ye believe in God , believe also in me .
text2: Mina chi jaw bˈisiˈn . Qe kykˈuˈja tiˈj Dios , ex qe kykˈuˈja wiˈja .

text: In my Father ' s house are many mansions : if it were not so , I would have told you . I go to prepare a place for you .
text2: Quˈn toj tja nMaˈn at nimku najbˈil , jaˈ tuˈn qnajane ; noqit ntiˈ , matla txi nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy . Tuˈnpetziˈn , ma chinka bˈinchil jun kynajbˈila .

text: And if I go and prepare a place for you , I will come again , and receive you unto myself ; that where I am , there ye may be also .
text2: Ex nya noq oˈkx tuˈn ma chinka bˈinchilte kynajbˈila ; qalaˈ ok chin ula juntl majl kˈlel kyeˈy , tuˈntzin kyteˈn junx wukˈiy te jun majx toj kyaˈj .

text: And whither I go ye know , and the way ye know .
text2: Ex ojtzqiˈn bˈe kyuˈn , jaˈ kchin xeliˈy .

text: Thomas saith unto him , Lord , we know not whither thou goest ; and how can we know the way ?
text2: Xi tqˈmaˈn Tmas te Jesús : Ay wAjaw , mi bˈiˈn qe quˈn jaˈ kxeliy , ¿ Tzeˈntzin ttentz tuˈn tel qnikyˈa tiˈjjo bˈe ?

text: Jesus saith unto him , I am the way , the truth , and the life : no man cometh unto the Father , but by me .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Ayin wejiˈy Bˈe , ex ayin wejiˈy Twutzxix , ex ayiˈn wejiˈy Chwinqil . Quˈn noq wuˈn aku chi kaninxjal tkˈatz nMaˈn .

text: If ye had known me , ye should have known my Father also : and from henceforth ye know him , and have seen him .
text2: Qa ma tzˈel kynikyˈa wiˈja , ex ok k ‑ elil kynikyˈa tiˈj nMaˈn . Ex ma tzˈel kynikyˈa tiˈj jaˈlin , quˈn kukx nchin ok kykaˈyinjiˈy .

text: Philip saith unto him , Lord , shew us the Father , and it sufficeth us .
text2: Tuˈnpetziˈn , xi tqˈmaˈn Lip : Ay wAjaw ; yekˈintzin Manbˈaj qeˈy . Tukˈaxjo lo , bˈeˈxpen k ‑ elil qnikyˈtza te .

text: Jesus saith unto him , Have I been so long time with you , and yet hast thou not known me , Philip ? he that hath seen me hath seen the Father ; and how sayest thou then , Shew us the Father ?
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Ay Lip , ¿ Jtojetziˈn nkubˈlin ten kyukˈiy , ex naˈmx tel tnikyˈa weˈy ? Quˈn alkye ma tzˈok kaˈyin weˈy , ma tzˈok tkaˈyin nMaˈn . Tuˈnpetziˈn , ¿ Tiquˈn tzaj tqaniˈn weˈy , tuˈn t ‑ xi nyekˈiˈn Manbˈaj teˈy ?

text: Believest thou not that I am in the Father , and the Father in me ? the words that I speak unto you I speak not of myself : but the Father that dwelleth in me , he doeth the works .
text2: ¿ Ma miˈtzin nxi tnimiˈn , qa mujleqiˈn tukˈa nMaˈn , ex mujle nMaˈn wukˈiy ? Tuˈnpetziˈn , tkyaqiljo jniˈ yol nxi nqˈmaˈn , nya wekuy , qalaˈ te nMaˈn , a najle wukˈiy , ex aku n ‑ aqˈnin wukˈiy tuˈn tbˈantjo jniˈ tajbˈil .

text: Believe me that I am in the Father , and the Father in me : or else believe me for the very works ' sake .
text2: Kyniminkuy qa ayiˈn intin tukˈa nMaˈn , ex a nMaˈn najle wukˈiy . Exsin qa minatz , ¿ Ma nlayxsiˈn txi kynimiˈn tuˈn tkyaqilxjo nbˈant wuˈn ?

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that believeth on me , the works that I do shall he do also ; and greater works than these shall he do ; because I go unto my Father .
text2: Ex twutzxix kxel nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy , ankye te knimil wiˈja ok kbˈantil tkyaqil tuˈn , tzeˈnku nbˈant wuˈn , ex okpela kbˈantil nimxixtl tuˈn , tzeˈnku nbˈant jaˈlin , quˈn ma chinka tukˈa nMaˈn toj kyaˈj .

text: And whatsoever ye shall ask in my name , that will I do , that the Father may be glorified in the Son .
text2: Ikytziˈn , tkyaqiljo kxel kyqaniˈn tiˈj tumil nbˈiˈy , ok kbˈantil wuˈn , tuˈntzin t ‑ xi nyekˈiˈn qa nimxix tbˈi nMaˈn .

text: If ye shall ask any thing in my name , I will do it .
text2: Kˈwel nbˈinchiˈn tiˈchaqx txi kyqanintza tiˈj tumil nbˈiˈy .

text: If ye love me , keep my commandments .
text2: Ex xi tqˈmaˈnl Jesús : Qa ma chin ok kykˈuˈjliˈn , kyniminkutzinjiˈy jniˈ nnukˈbˈila .

text: And I will pray the Father , and he shall give you another Comforter , that he may abide with you for ever ;
text2: Ex kchin kubˈsin nwutza te qMan , tuˈn ttzaj tchqˈoˈn juntl Onil kyeˈy , ex Qˈuqbˈil kykˈuˈja , a Xewbˈaj Xjan , a twutzxix , tuˈn tten kyukˈiy te jun majx .

text: Even the Spirit of truth ; whom the world cannot receive , because it seeth him not , neither knoweth him : but ye know him ; for he dwelleth with you , and shall be in you .
text2: Ayetzin xjal te twutz txˈotxˈ nlay txi kykˈmoˈn , quˈn mi nchi jyoˈn tiˈj , ex mi n ‑ el kynikyˈ te . Me metzin kye , ma tzˈel kye kynikyˈ tiˈj , quˈn loqin intin kyxola jaˈlin , ex ktzajil tqˈoˈn Dios toj kyanmiˈn , tuˈn tten te jun majx .

text: I will not leave you comfortless : I will come to you .
text2: Nlay chi kyij ntzaqpiˈn kye ; qalaˈ kchin ul meltzˈaj weˈ , tuˈn nteˈn kyukˈiy te jun majx , noq tuˈn Xewbˈaj Xjan .

text: Yet a little while , and the world seeth me no more ; but ye see me : because I live , ye shall live also .
text2: Nya ilaˈ qˈijl tuˈn nkyima . Mi chin ok kykaˈyintl xjala , me metzin kye , kchin okil kykaˈyintla , aj ul nmeltzˈaja kyukˈiy , a otaq chin jaw anqˈintla juntl majl kyxol kyimnin . Ex noq tuˈn akˈaj nchwinqila , ktenbˈil kye kychwinqil a nlay bˈaj , quˈn itzˈqin weˈ te jun majx .

text: At that day ye shall know that I am in my Father , and ye in me , and I in you .
text2: Aj tjapin kaniˈn qˈij anetziˈn , apentza k ‑ elile kye kynikyˈ te qa twutzxixjo nyola , qa mujleqiˈn tukˈa nMaˈn , ex qa mujleqiˈy wukˈiy , ex ayiˈn kyukˈiy .

text: He that hath my commandments , and keepeth them , he it is that loveth me : and he that loveth me shall be loved of my Father , and I will love him , and will manifest myself to him .
text2: Ankye teˈ ma tzˈel tnikyˈ te , ex kˈwel tnimin jniˈ nnukˈbˈila , antza k ‑ elile tnikyˈtzajil , qa twutzxix tzun nchin ok tkˈuˈjliˈn . Ex ankye te nchin ok tkˈuˈjliˈn , ex ate nMaˈn k ‑ okil kˈuˈjlinte , ex ikyx wejiˈy kxel nyekˈin teˈ tkyaqil wajbˈila .

text: Judas saith unto him , not Iscariot , Lord , how is it that thou wilt manifest thyself unto us , and not unto the world ?
text2: Tej t ‑ xi tqˈmaˈn Jesús ikyjo , xi tqanin Judas te ( a junxil Judas , nya Iscariot ) : Tata , ¿ Tiquˈn noq te qekuy ktzajil tyekˈin tibˈa , ex nya te kykyaqil xjal ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , If a man love me , he will keep my words : and my Father will love him , and we will come unto him , and make our abode with him .
text2: Xi ttzaqˈwin Jesús : Ankye te nkˈuˈjlin weˈy , ex nkubˈ tbˈiˈn tkyaqiljo xi nqˈmaˈn , okpen k ‑ okil kˈuˈjlin teˈ tuˈn nMaˈn , ex ayin weˈ tukˈax nMaˈn qo ul qeˈ najal tukˈa te jun majx .

text: He that loveth me not keepeth not my sayings : and the word which ye hear is not mine , but the Father ' s which sent me .
text2: Ex ankye teˈ mi n ‑ ok kˈuˈjlin weˈy , ex mi nkubˈ tbˈiˈn jniˈ nnukˈbˈila , a xi nqˈmaˈn . Ex kykyaqiljo yol ncheˈx nqˈmaˈn , nya wekuy , qalaˈ te nMaˈn , a tzaj chqˈoˈn weˈy .

text: These things have I spoken unto you , being yet present with you .
text2: Nxi nqˈmaˈn tkyaqiljo lo a loqiˈn intinx kyukˈiy tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ .

text: But the Comforter , which is the Holy Ghost , whom the Father will send in my name , he shall teach you all things , and bring all things to your remembrance , whatsoever I have said unto you .
text2: Me atzin Xewbˈaj Xjan , a ktzajil tchqˈoˈn nMaˈn toj tumil nbˈiˈy te Onil kyeˈy ex te Qˈuqbˈil kykˈuˈja , ok ktzajil t ‑ xnaqˈtzin tkyaqil , ex ktzajil tnaˈn kyeˈy tkyaqiljo o bˈaj nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy .

text: Peace I leave with you , my peace I give unto you : not as the world giveth , give I unto you . Let not your heart be troubled , neither let it be afraid .
text2: Kyjel nqˈoˈn jun etzbˈil kyeˈy , a nnukˈbˈila toj kyanmiˈn . Me nya ikyjo tzeˈnku nukˈbˈil te twutz txˈotxˈ , a njapin bˈaj liwey . Ikytziˈn , mi jaw tukˈpaj kyanmiˈn , ex mi chi tzaj xobˈa .

text: Ye have heard how I said unto you , I go away , and come again unto you . If ye loved me , ye would rejoice , because I said , I go unto the Father : for my Father is greater than I .
text2: Ma tzˈok kybˈiˈn weˈy , tej t ‑ xi nqˈmaˈn , qa ma chinka , ex kchin ul meltzˈaja tuˈn nteˈn kyukˈiy juntl majl . Noqit qa twutzx kˈuˈjlinqiˈn kyuˈn , matla chi jaw tzalaja , aj kybˈintiˈy qa ma chiˈn tukˈa nMaˈn , quˈn ate nimxixtl toklin nwutza .

text: And now I have told you before it come to pass , that , when it is come to pass , ye might believe .
text2: Ma txi nnejsinjiˈy tqanil kyeˈy lo , quˈn tuˈntzin aj tjapin , okpin kxel kynimintza qa twutzxjo o bˈaj nqˈmaˈn kyeˈy .

text: Hereafter I will not talk much with you : for the prince of this world cometh , and hath nothing in me .
text2: Nya nimtl tqan tuˈn nyoliˈn kyukˈiy , quˈn chˈix tul kanin tajaw il , a kawil tzaluˈn twutz txˈotxˈ , bˈinchil tajbˈil wiˈja , exla qa ntiˈ toklin tuˈn tkubˈ wiˈja tuˈn .

text: But that the world may know that I love the Father ; and as the Father gave me commandment , even so I do . Arise , let us go hence .
text2: Me ok kbˈajiljo ikyjo tuˈn nkyima , tuˈn tel kynikyˈxjal te , qa kˈuˈjlin nMaˈn wuˈn , ex nkubˈ nbˈinchiˈn tkyaqiljo ntzaj tqˈmaˈn weˈy . ¡ Kujqexa ! ¡ Qo ikyˈ tzaluˈn !

text: I am the true vine , and my Father is the husbandman .
text2: Tbˈajlinxiˈ ikyjo , tzaj tqˈmaˈn Jesús qeˈy , a awoˈy t ‑ xnaqˈtzbˈin : Ayin weˈ tzeˈnku jun tqan uv twutzxix , ex atzin nMaˈn tzeˈnku jun aqˈnil tiˈj .

text: Every branch in me that beareth not fruit he taketh away : and every branch that beareth fruit , he purgeth it , that it may bring forth more fruit .
text2: N ‑ el ttxˈemin tkyaqiljo tqˈobˈ , a ntiˈ twutz n ‑ el . Ex tkyaqiljo tqˈobˈ , a at twutz n ‑ el , k ‑ elitz ttxˈemin jniˈ ttzqijlin kyxolile , tuˈntzin twutzin nimxix .

text: Now ye are clean through the word which I have spoken unto you .
text2: Me atzin kye ma chi saqixa tuˈn nxnaqˈtzbˈila ẍi ex nqˈoˈn , ikyxjo tzeˈnku jun tqˈobˈ lobˈj ma tzˈel bˈaj tzqijlin .

text: Abide in me , and I in you . As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself , except it abide in the vine ; no more can ye , except ye abide in me .
text2: Ikytzin kyejiˈy , kukx kymujbˈin kyibˈjiˈy wukˈiy tzeˈnku weˈ kukx nmujbˈin wibˈjiˈy kyukˈiy . Quˈn jun tqˈobˈ tze , nlay tzˈel twutz tuˈnx tibˈx , a qa nya mujlek tiˈjjo tqan . Ikytzin kyejiˈy , nlayx tzˈelx kye kywutz toj kychwinqila , qa nya mujleqeka wukˈiy .

text: I am the vine , ye are the branches : He that abideth in me , and I in him , the same bringeth forth much fruit : for without me ye can do nothing .
text2: Ayin weˈ tqan uv ; ayetzin kye tqˈobˈ . Ankye te mujlek wiˈja , ex mujleqinka tukˈa , nimxpen teˈ twutz n ‑ el . Quˈn ntiˈx kye aku bˈant kyuˈn kyjunalxa .

text: If a man abide not in me , he is cast forth as a branch , and is withered ; and men gather them , and cast them into the fire , and they are burned .
text2: Ankye te tkyˈeˈ tuˈn tok tmujbˈin tibˈ wukˈiy , okpin k ‑ elix xoyit teˈ , tuˈn ttzqij kyukˈa txqantl tqˈobˈ tze , a tzqij tuˈn kyxi chmet , ex tuˈn kytzˈeˈy tuˈn qˈaqˈ te jun majx .

text: If ye abide in me , and my words abide in you , ye shall ask what ye will , and it shall be done unto you .
text2: Qa kukx kymujbˈin kyibˈjiˈy wukˈiy , ex qa mi s ‑ el najjo nxnaqˈtzbˈiˈn toj kykˈuˈja , kyqanintza noq alkye kyaja , ex ok ktzajil qˈoˈn .

text: Herein is my Father glorified , that ye bear much fruit ; so shall ye be my disciples .
text2: Qa nimxix kywutza s ‑ el te nimsbˈil tbˈi nMaˈn , antza k ‑ elile tnikyˈtzajil qa twutzxix nxnaqˈtzbˈinqiˈy .

text: As the Father hath loved me , so have I loved you : continue ye in my love .
text2: Tzun nchi ok nkˈuˈjlin kyeˈ , ikytziˈn tzeˈnku te nMaˈn nchin ok tkˈuˈjliˈn . Kukx chi lipekjiˈy tiˈjjo tqˈaqˈbˈil nkˈuˈja , a at kyiˈja .

text: If ye keep my commandments , ye shall abide in my love ; even as I have kept my Father ' s commandments , and abide in his love .
text2: Qa ma kubˈ kyniminjiˈy jniˈ nnukˈbˈila , okpin kchi okil lipetza tiˈjjo tqˈaqˈbˈil nkˈuˈja , a at kyiˈja , ikytziˈn tzeˈnku weˈ nkubˈ nniminjiˈy tnukˈbˈil nMaˈn , ex loqin lipcheqink tiˈjjo tqˈaqˈbˈil tkˈuˈj , a at wiˈja .

text: These things have I spoken unto you , that my joy might remain in you , and that your joy might be full .
text2: Nxi nyoliˈn ikyjo , tuˈntzin kyjaw tzalaja wukˈiy , ex tuˈntzin kynoja tuˈn ntzaljbˈila .

text: This is my commandment , That ye love one another , as I have loved you .
text2: Atzin nnukˈbˈiljiˈy lo , tuˈn kykˈuˈjlin te kyibˈa kyxolxa , tzeˈnku we nchi ok nkˈuˈjliˈn .

text: Greater love hath no man than this , that a man lay down his life for his friends .
text2: Ex ante qkˈuˈjbˈiljo nimxix toklin , tuˈn t ‑ xi qqˈoˈn qchwinqil noq tuˈn tpaj qukˈa .

text: Ye are my friends , if ye do whatsoever I command you .
text2: Me ayetzin kye ma chi oka te wukˈiy , qa ma kubˈ kybˈinchiˈn tzeˈnkuxjo ma txi nqˈmaˈn .

text: Henceforth I call you not servants ; for the servant knoweth not what his lord doeth : but I have called you friends ; for all things that I have heard of my Father I have made known unto you .
text2: Mi chi ok nqˈoˈnl kye jaˈlin te waqˈnila , quˈn mi bˈinte aqˈnil tuˈn , tiˈ kˈwel tbˈinchin tajaw aqˈuntl . Qalaˈ kchi okil nqˈolbˈin kye te wukˈiy , quˈn ma txi nyekˈiˈn kyeˈy kykyaqiljo ma tzaj tqˈmaˈn nMaˈn weˈy .

text: Ye have not chosen me , but I have chosen you , and ordained you , that ye should go and bring forth fruit , and that your fruit should remain : that whatsoever ye shall ask of the Father in my name , he may give it you .
text2: Quˈn nyaqe kyeˈ ẍi jaw skˈoˈn weˈy ; qalaˈ ayin weˈ ẍin jaw skˈoˈn kyeˈy . Tuˈnpetziˈn , kxel woqxenin kyeˈy , tuˈn kyxiˈy , ex tuˈn tel kywutza nimxix toj kychwinqila , ex atzin kywutza , tuˈn tten te jun majx . Ikytziˈn , ktzajile tqˈoˈn nManjiˈy tkyaqiljo kxel kyqaniˈn toj tumil nbˈiˈy .

text: These things I command you , that ye love one another .
text2: Atzin kxel nqˈmanjiˈy juntl majl kyeˈy , tuˈn kykˈuˈjlin te kyibˈa kyxolxa .

text: If the world hate you , ye know that it hated me before it hated you .
